I had no pain when Skyla was placed and it seemed to have no effect on my cycles, I was extremely regular and there was maybe a slight decrease in the flow. I chose an IUD because I was moving out of the country and didn't want to have to deal with pills while traveling. But after a year and a half of Skyla I am now pregnant. I found a great hospital that removed the IUD from next to the baby without any problems and am now 18 weeks pregnant as a student in a foreign country. Not an ideal situation but I'm kind of excited about it now so I guess not all bad.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This was terrible for me. It didn’t help with anything. My doctor had told me I'm not longer allowed to use my pill form of birth control due to side effects after 2 years and she told me the IUD is a great option. I got the Kyleena and it has been nothing but trouble. Severe cramping constantly, to the point I'm curled up crying, heavy bleeding and constant random spotting, I never got cramps before my IUD, and now I get them constantly and they’re extremely painful. I've had to go to the ER for them because I couldn’t move from the amount of pain. No pain relievers will work for me, I’ve tried everything. Heat doesn’t even help me. The insertion was the worst pain in my life and I truly suffered for the following month. I’ve had to miss work because I couldn’t get out of bed from pain. I never know when it’s actually my period until the heavy bleeding because I'm always spotting. It has made my life so hard and I've had it for less than a year

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was so excited to get an IUD because I've heard such amazing things about them. Unfortunately, it didn't work for me. The pain of insertion was excruciating by far the worst pain I've ever felt. I had it in for about 6 months and the pains/cramps I got during insertion never went away. They got slightly better but I was in so much pain I couldn't work out or have sex or even walk some days. Additionally, my body was under such duress that I got cystic acne for the first time in my life. I never got an ultrasound to make sure that it was in the right place because where I live that wasn't an option and I was in so much pain that I just wanted it out. Just because and IUD didn't work for me doesn't mean it won't work for you. Everyone's body is different and it's worth a shot. I wish that it worked for me. I have a feeling my body rejected it because I have a retroverted uterus but that's just a guess.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I wanted to take a moment to add to the minority of POSITIVE reviews bc I wish more people would take the time to write them. I was so scared that I almost burst into tears when the doctor came in the room, all because of horror stories I had read. I got my kyleena placed yesterday and it was so easy compared to everything I read!! I was told to come in on my cycle because your cervix is softer/more open then. I was also given 2 cytotec pills to dissolve in my cheeks 2 hours before the appointment, and told to take 800 mg of ibuprofen one hour before. The worst of it felt like a deep menstrual cramp and it lasted literally seconds! The entire procedure took maybe 5-7 mins. No fainting, no dizziness, no intense pain. With the waiting time, papers to fill out, urine test, and ultrasound, I think my whole appointment lasted 30 mins, and I drove myself home right after. I had mild but persistent cramps the rest of the day and hung out with a heat pad and took more ibuprofen at night. Worth it!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Had Kyleena put in about 5 weeks ago. The insertion was very bad for me. I was told all it would be was mild cramping but I ended passing out, throwing up (I almost backed out in the middle of the procedure) and had to stay in the room for 30 minutes. They really don’t warn you… I had rough cramps for 7 days straight and since then I have not stopped bleeding. The last week I have been feeling very depressed which is extremely unlike me and have absolutely no sex drive. I also have been breaking out which I normally don’t. I’m personally not willing to wait for my body to adjust - I don’t care, it’s not worth feeling like absolute garbage physically and mentally all the time. I’m getting mine removed ASAP (which I’m also so incredibly scared to do now by the way) If my personal friends and family asked if I would recommend it, I would tell them stay far away from it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the Kyleena for just over a year now and it’s been amazing! Insertion was slightly uncomfortable but no pain during the procedure. I did have severe cramping for a couple of hours after, and light spotting for the first 3 days. For the first couple of months I had irregular spotting and cramping, but it has now settled and I don’t get my period at all. Apart from doing my regular string check I actually completely forget I even have it! I haven’t experienced any weight changes (apart from a 10kg weight loss from stopping the pill), no mood swings etc. Getting the kyleena has been the best decision I’ve made for my body!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Hello, After having my son I decided to get on birth control for a good long while. When I went in for my appointment they gave me numerous selections of birth control but my original  choice was Mirena but they had told me the best choice was Liletta since I’m deciding to have another child within 3-6 years. After getting insurance approval my appointment was set ! … October 12th came and my heart was pounding because I had been researching what happens AFTER about the whole procedure. Let me tell you - it was absolutely a painful experience and I was told if you had a baby then you can most definitely get past this … to clarify I didn’t have a natural birth, I had to have a c-section. But overall YOU’LL LIVE if you ever decide on a IUD, pain is really temporary. I am currently heavy bleeding but it’s no biggy.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I also read all the bad reviews. Almost backed out. However, I went through with it. I will say, everyone has a different body/ pain tolerance.  Overall it went better then expected. My doctor prescribed medication to soften my cervix, I took one pill before bed time & one early AM the day of the procedure . I took 600mg of ibuprofen 1 Hr. before my procedure, please make sure you eat some breakfast.  When I got there my nurse heard my concerns. She mention discomfort but said it would be manageable. Once on the patient table, it was kinda like a pap-smear procedure. There were 2 moments I had bad discomfort but I controlled my breathing to get through it. There is mild discomfortness from start to finish, but nothing horrible. I had mild cramps afterwords, but that’s normal. I kept taking Ibuprofen to stay on top of the cramps. I did a lot of walking afterwords, so my advice just rest up. Today makes day 2 and barely any cramps. I’ve had 2 past c-section & that was pain. This was manageable.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got the iud (liletta) placed in June 2018. Never had any periods. The pain was not bad during insertion. After 2 years I started bleeding every time during sex. Then it would immediately go away. I could not lose weight. No matter how much I dieted. I had it removed 10/20/21- very easy. I felt nothing. I am hoping to see changes with my body.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta inserted on Jan. 2021 & it was truly the worst experience I have ever had. I was so excited to have an IUD, it seemed like the perfect solution. I just got it removed today on October 19, 2021 and it was the best decision to get it removed. From my experience, I have never felt so out of touch with myself or my body. First, I gained 30 lbs. I went from 128 to 160 in 10 months. Nothing changed in terms of my diet or workout schedule. I remember trying in clothes at a store and having a mental breakdown because I was always so bloated and my normal sizes weren’t fitting. As a woman, one of the worst feelings. Second, my emotions were all over the place. On certain days I cried because I felt so upset at absolutely nothing, while others I was very irritable and mad at everything. It was so frustrating to have your whole mood switched and not even understand why or how to fix it. Then I had to pay $300 to get it taken out. I would never want a woman to feel the way I felt.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Honestly, don't give in to the terrible reviews.  Take the chance to try Kyleena on your own after discussing with your doctor.... because EVERYONE will react differently.  No body or hormones function the exact same.  I can tell you right now for me personally Kyleena is the best IUD/contraception option I've ever tried.  I have a diagnosed depressive disorder and Kyleena actually helped with my moods, where as all OCP's made them much worse.  I tried the copper IUD, but that just made my periods heavier and cramping unbearable, whereas Kyleena has definitely helped with that as well.  No I haven't had it for years, so I can't speak on my personal long term "use", but all in all so far after a few months, I'm super happy with it!  I had on and off bleeding in the first few weeks (which is to be expected) but then it went away.  Some increased discharge too, but that also went away.  The body needs time to regulate, this is normal! Don't hesitate to try it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion experience only. I spent the day reading these and panicking that I was going to experience the worst pain in my life. My friends (who have had the IUD inserted) also told me that it was the most excruciating pain and that they passed out or vomited.Well, I had some Nurophen (Advil for any Americans) an hour before hand and I was fine! It was a bit like light cramping from your period followed by a sharp cramp that lasted all of five seconds and then done. I definitely had bad cramping through the day but nothing unbearable or agonising. Everyone is different

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got Mirena as a form of birth control in 2019, I've had it in for 3 years now. The initial process of getting the IUD in is very painful, I should have asked about taking a pain reliever first. After my appointment I felt a little panicky, so I went to review sites for Mirena (as you are now) and found so many negative reviews. Therefore, in support of Mirena, it has been 100% effective for me. My partner and I rely only on the IUD. The threads are initially a little pokey for my partner, but have since softened. I had the position of my IUD checked every 6 months for the first year, and it never moved or caused me major pain. My period did stop almost completely, I've only had it once or twice or some occasional spotting. I did not have any ill side-effects, such as weight gain or bad skin. I got the IUD because I was travelling a lot and it was difficult to take birth control pills. Although initially scary, I feel that the IUD is overall very helpful.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got my coil inserted about 6 months ago as I have a history of migraine with aura and my Mother had breast cancer years ago - which means by birth control options are very limited. A few of my friends have gotten the Kyleena and recommend it to me! The insertion was done by the doctor and nurse (both female) who made the experience as pleasant as possible. The procedure is similar to a smear test with all the poking down there but the measuring and insertion itself of the coil was a VERY intense cramp that lasted approximately 15 seconds. After that I walked home had no cramps or side effects until I got my period about 6 days later. The cramps were a bit more intense than usual (I get severe cramps normally) but ibuprofen settled the pain no problem. For the first 2 months I would get random cramps but those side effects are completely gone and I’ve nearly forgotten that’s it in there. Periods are very light now and has even cleared up my recurring acne breakouts! 10/10

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the Liletta IUD put in about two years ago because the pill was giving me terrible side effects. I had headaches, painful periods, and weight gain on the pill. I was also tired of taking the pill everyday and wanted to try an IUD! My doctor recommended Liletta (I believe the reasons were I have never had children and I suffer from PCOS). The insertion was painful but nothing unbearable, I drove home after and soreness disappeared within a week (the majority of the pain dissipates within hours). I have really loved Liletta, no weight gain, no crazy side effects. I do not get a regular period but I didn't on the pill either so that is to be expected. I love never having to worry about forgetting the pill or forgetting to pack it with me on trips. If you are considering an IUD, try it and if it is not for you, you can get it taken out whenever! To offset all of the horror stories shared here I wanted to share my story! I really like Liletta and would recommend!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD 13 years ago for birth control. At the time it was the newer option for birth control. I immediately started gaining weight and looked super bloated. I kept returning to my gyn office to ask if those side effects were normal and they proceeded to make me feel as though I was the one responsible for any weight gain and that Mirena contained no hormones so it could not be the cause. I had awful cramps as well. I had it the entire 5 years and I wish I had never agreed to getting it placed. I had no changed in my diet nor amount of activity. I honestly think the side affects can be very damaging and would NOT recommend any woman I’m getting this.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Had it put in after my Dr acted like birth control is a cure all. I wanted the Skyla like I had prior with 0 issues but no apparently what I wanted wasn't a choice. Had it put in in February had it checked 30 days later was told it was in wasn't going to move. 2 months later found out I was 5 weeks pregnant.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the liletta inserted 2 years ago (6 weeks after having my daughter by c section). I didn’t feel good for the weeks to follow but was told I was just my body adjusting and hormones adjusting. I was irritable, agitated, always felt bloated, started experiencing daily headaches which then turned into migraines. I felt depressed and have had no energy. 2 years later I weigh more than I did when I was pregnant and have been exercising and dieting for 7 months and the scale has hardly budged. I went to a new OB for my annual and decided to have my IUD removed after telling my doctor my concerns. They went to remove it and couldn’t find the strings. I had surgery to remove it on Thursday and since then I haven’t had a single headache, I am down 5lbs, my anxiety, agitation and bloated feeling is gone. my energy is back to normal and I feel excited about life.  Never again.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Let me just say thank you to my Mirena she has been a blessing for myself. This will be my 6 years having Mirena. I had a new one put in when the date was up after me having it in for 5 years. The only thing I will say during those 5 years I never got pregnant

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for 10 months now. 800 mg ibuprofen made no difference, insertion was very painful. I have extreme cramps from endo and this was my doctor's first choice after diagnosis. Insertion was honestly as painful as my period, but the cramps were different. I laid in her office for 45 minutes through debilitating cramping and dizziness. The next 12-16 hours I was in the fetal position in bed completely unable to stretch out or turn over due to pain. 2 weeks after insertion I started spotting for the next 2 months. My periods after were irregular, but less periods = less pain. I was susceptible to yeast infections for the first 6 months. Anxiety increased, but is manageable. #1 complaint is pain when I need to use the restroom. #1 or #2, it becomes almost unbearable if I don't go right away. Nobody knows why. I spot maybe 40% of the month. I only spot, no period and cramping is minimal, so I don't really like it. I don't get YI anymore. I've lost weight. I don't regret it so far.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena put in 6 weeks postpartum. I stopped bleeding at 3 weeks postpartum & am exclusively breastfeeding. The day I got Mirena put in, I immediately started heavy bleeding & I’ve now been bleeding for 1 month straight. I have no sex drive & bad depression. My relationship is slowly dying because sex is non existent. I feel gross bleeding constantly.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Liletta for about 3 years and for two years I had no periods. This last year I’ve been getting some spotting every three months. Got an ultrasound and it’s in the right spot still. Only real issue I’ve had is cramping occasionally and acne/oily skin. Symptoms were never enough to make me get it taken out. Considering getting it taken out this year or next and weaning off of it for a bit. I used to be on the pills and I was constantly having my brands changed and getting bloody noses. Pre-birth control I had awful cramping and extremely long periods - also have suspected endometriosis.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Everything was great at first. I went from birth control pills for 4 years to an IUD. My OB prescribed me a cervix dilation medication to take 2 hours before the procedure. I had to have it inserted while on my period, which made me feel a little self conscious, but oh well. Insertion was pretty painful with bad cramping for about 20 seconds. Afterwards, I was able to drive home but was cramping all day and night so I had to call out of work the next day. While I loved the positive aspects (shortened period length, lighter period & even skipped sometimes, no kids!!) the bad outweighs the good. I’ve experienced painful acne on my cheeks, worsened anxiety and panic attacks (which I’ve never had before), and complete loss of libido. Recently, I’ve also been having days-long migraines around my time of the month. I plan on getting it removed after trying to make it work for 2 years.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Insertion was like taking a hole puncher to the uterus. It is, intense. Not looking forward to getting the device removed. Was bed ridden for 2-3 days with pain, and the first week was so full of pain that I'd felt as though I'd reached a sort of Nirvana. Really I was just in too much pain to think straight. Spotted every day for the first 4 months, and my periods were heavier, longer, and the 4th month I got two heavy periods that both lasted 10 days. Finally normalizing now that I'm in the 6th month, still seeing spotting before and after my periods, and I'm experiencing more cramping that is also more painful than before I had an IUD. Partner can't feel the device, and my strings are so short that I can't feel them either when I do my monthly checks.Had a check up 3 months in, and everything is properly in position. Definitely don't recommend this if you can't handle pain. This has been a struggle to adjust to. Take b/c pills if you can instead.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):My period was all over the place on the pill so my doctor suggested the Mirena. She gave me Valium and Oxycodone to take beforehand for pain as I’ve never had children. I was in agony the entire time, felt sick and dizzy and couldn’t stop crying, the doctor ended up giving me a tramadol needle as well for the pain and I was still in so much pain for the next few days I couldn’t go to work. In the 3 months I had it in I put on over 10kg, got really bad acne, was crying all the time, bleeding and super bloated and I could always feel something was there. I have now had it out for 2 months and have lost nearly all the weight I put on, my skin is clear and I am feeling so much better! Worst decision I ever made was getting the Mirena.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Liletta for going on 6 months now I like it a lot. This is my first time ever getting birth control at age 24. I got this after my second baby and I have to say I am an all natural person so choosing a bc that’s right for me was hard but I have spotted for like 3 months on and off it was so annoying now I have a period so I’m sure after this I will stop bleeding. My sex drive a little better than before I had it I must say and I feel a lot more happier ❤️❤️❤️

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hey so you should read reviews of medicine because every body is different. I just got the Kyleena out today. Overall I loved it. I got it August of 2019 got it out September 2021. Super easy you don’t have to worry about it and super effective. The only problem I had was I went through boot camp and something there threw the whole thing off for me. Before I went I had it in for 8 months no problem with in the first 2 months I was not bleed or cramping or spotting at all. After I went to boot camp it was a nightmare tried to get it to stop but it didn’t. After I have kids I’m definitely going to get the kyleena again. The worst part for me was getting it put in for 3 weeks after I had awful cramps felt like it was getting put in all over again, but that went away. I think my body was just getting used to it. But if you in a place where you don’t want to get pregnant and don’t want to worry about taking a pill every day. I would sit down with your doc and talk about it.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):39 years old. Used pill most of my life. My periods have always been light with minimal cramps. This was my first IUD, and for me it was a miserable experience. Extremely painful insertion. Cramping immediately, which felt similar in intensity to an early miscarriage I’d experienced, way worse than my typical period cramps. I gave it 3 weeks and it never got better. Constant cramps, and bleeding as heavily as a normal period almost the entire time. I gave up and had it removed. Cramping instantly stopped. Bled heavily another 2-3 days and also stopped. Finally feeling back to normal now.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena for 2 years until I decided to remove it. I constantly had cramps and my period never stopped. Every single period I had was 2 - 3 weeks long. Sometimes I would bleed for 3 days stop for 2 then bleed for another week. Very unpredictable. Didn't have any other issues besides that.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had it put in on August 9 2021. Its September 27th 2021 and I am still bleeding. No weigh gain no other side effects just continuous bleeding. I got it to deal with my PCOS but I'm not sure  if it’s worth it anymore

Liletta (levonorgestrel):After I quit breastfeeding my daughter my period came back to heavy it was unbearable. My doctor talked me into the liletta to control and lighten my cycle. First of all, the insertion was so painful!! Since then I’ve been bleeding for 30+ days, taken 17 days worth of progesterone to stop my bleeding and nothing. In constant pain and always feel exhausted. Im hoping to get it taken out ASAP!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had liletta inserted after 3 years of being on depo. Insertion was painful but not too bad, caused some mild cramping for a few days. all was fine for the first few months until I saw a rapid decline in my mental health. My anxiety is terrible as it is, but Liletta made everything worse by causing countless physical symptoms. My back hurts 24/7, headaches, spotting that doesn’t go away, long periods, cramps, bloating, and that’s just a few. Not to mention the strings have gotten lost in my cervix and into my uterus causing me to have to get ultrasounds to check if it’s in place.  I’m not myself anymore, I'm so moody and have lost my sex drive too. I’m getting it taken out and going back on depo. It’s definitely not for everybody. At least I didn’t get pregnant.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Infections, anxiety, acne, and pain in my extremities. HAIR LOSS that has caused awful breakage. Super disappointing especially since coming off the pill felt amazing. It was great at first, but I’m coming up on a year and thinking about getting it removed this week.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I really don't like this honestly. It's been almost a month and the cramping is far worse than my period pain ones. Every time l have them, l can't sit, sleep or stand. From my waist going down will be on fire. I have gained weight which is the main reason l asked for it but the pain, is a no, l would rather remain skinny. It hurts so much

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I passed out when having it implanted and it was all down hill from there. My anxiety has steadily been creeping up since having it placed. I'm at about a year now and am seriously considering having it removed, I'm getting to the point where I can go to the store without my heart rate skyrocketing and feeling like I'm going to pass out.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I was pretty skeptical about getting Skyla but I am hella forgetful and the pill just wasn’t convenient for me. So I decided to get Skyla. I thought on it for quite some time and it’s honestly one of the best decisions I’ve made. The first 4-5 months I had terrible periods and terrible cramps. I thought about getting it taken out, but after the 5th month everything subsided and I feel great. I have occasional spotting but my periods have left me. I recommend getting it, it’s honestly the 1st birth control that’s ever worked and definitely convenient.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Horrible implantation pain and I fainted shortly after. Pain lasted 8 hours. Over 3 years I pretty much constantly had bacterial vaginosis. My partner thinks he felt pinched during sex from it. The best thing about kyleena was having it removed.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I so had this since April or May and at first I had the slight spotting but ever since then now in September I had the tiniest bit even spotting but I have been moody and bloated but non out of the ordinary but I still think it okay

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had the kyleena IUD for 10 months now and I really don't like it and I want it out.  It  was the WORST pain getting it in and I passed out after getting it in and had to stay in hospital for an hour afterwards. I was bleeding for 2 and a half months straight after getting it in. I have put on 15kgs since the start of the year and it has made my headaches worse and my hormonal acne worse! I am so self conscious about how i look now, it is almost impossible to lose weight, I have been exercising and watching what I eat for 3 months and Ihave gone up 2 sizes in pants!!! like what is that about. I’m so unhappy and I really think I’d be better off just not having sex at all compared to this rubbish

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have seen a ton of 10 star reviews from girls who made the review a week after getting it inserted. Please give it more time until you leave a review because the side effects come in the long term. I had the Kyleena for 2 years and at first I convinced myself I loved it but I was so wrong. The insertion was god awful and inhumane. After insertion I had my period for 90 days straight. A few months went by and I loved the IUD but then the real side effects started coming. I became extremely irritable and had terrible mood swings and has suicidal thoughts. I became depressed, had horrible insomnia, had trouble concentrating and really bad brain fog. I gained a lot of weight despite eating the same amount and my boobs grew 2 sizes and when I got the IUD they deflated and now look horrible. I got an ovarian cyst, had bacterial vaginosis, uterine spasms and cramps so bad I would scream. The doctor cut my strings too short so I had to pay $3000 out of pocket to get it surgically removed.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I'm on my second Mirena (I'm 27) and I haven't had any bad experiences. I chose to use the Mirena because I struggled intensely with varying pills for contraception. The Pill always messed with my hormones and therefore made me very depressed, gained weight and it didn't help with my skin. I wanted a contraception that wouldn't mess with my hormones and was very effective. The Mirena has calmed my period down and I haven't had any side effects from it, I don't even know it's there. I know every person is different but I do recommend getting the Mirena if the pill doesn't work for you. It works out to be cheaper in the long run and not having a heavy flowing period is ideal.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Horrible horrible horrible experience!!! Worse was only Mirena!!! I’ve been on it for over a year…still everyday spotting, still awful cramps…mood swings, acne (which I have never had before) protects - yes, for pregnancy it is 100% - no issues with that, but be prepared for the nightmare of its side effects.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I was on the birth control pill for a long time, and it caused liver lesions. So the doctor suggested the IUD. Ugh...worst side effects. I always feel it, cramps, bloating, weight gain, hair loss, BAD acne, bad PMS, headaches. I am getting it removed in a month and getting my tubes tied. I never knew about the memory issues that some people mention, but do feel like I can't concentrate. So ready for it to be gone.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta inserted April 2021 and immediately started having horrible cramps, bleeding, suicidal thoughts, depression, weight gain and every possible side effect you can think of. I immediately got it removed and ever since, I have been having constant cramps and back pain which only started when I got the IUD. I was not having pain prior to even though I had a baby in February. She was a big baby but the cramping stopped a week after she was born. I have had two pelvic ultrasounds, an abdominal and pelvic CT, liver ultrasound and endometrial biopsy. I’ve seen my Gyne 7 times since this started. I’m beginning to think they think I’m crazy. Do not get this! It is awful!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I tried a copper IUD against my doctors recommendation when I was in my early 20's. It was the worst thing ever. Such pain and constant irritation urinating. I had it taken out after 1 month and instant relief. As result I have always been reluctant to get another but I'm now 37 and at a higher risk of clots from the pill so I thought I'd give Kyleena a go. Anyway it's only been a little over a month since I've had it inserted and so far so good. I do get occasion waves of period pain which kind of feel like what I'd imagine contractions to feel like but the doctor tells me that's normal and should ease with time. It's nothing Pandol doesn't fix. I was also quite worried about my skin but actually my skin has been better since being on it. I used to get a blind hormonal pimples every couple of weeks along with a few back pimples. But I haven't had a pimple since I had it inserted which I'm quite surprised, but happy about. I wish I had of got it years ago.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I received my Liletta IUD in October 2019, when I was 19 and 5 months later in March 2020 I was rushed to the ER and I had ovarian cysts rupture. I had never even heard of this happening. I didn’t think it was totally related to my IUD however it has now almost been 2 years since getting Liletta and I have the most painful periods every month it feels like I have cysts rupturing and my right ovary is always in pain. I have never had painful periods prior to the IUD. I also have noticed a significant decrease in sex drive and I been diagnosed with have chronic anxiety. I plan to get my IUD removed ASAP, but unfortunately it’s impossible to get an appointment..

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Awful, had it less than a month. It was inserted Aug 12 2021 and removed Sep 4 2021. i was getting weight gain packed on pounds... developed acne  on my chest... mood swings.In the past I had Mirena. I felt like it made me crazy. So years later I tried Skyla because it is lower hormones but the side effects with this was worse than the Mirena...

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Hurt to put in, and my period was irregular for about eight months and now I don’t get any bleeding at all. However, I still get slight cramps, acne flush and mood swings once a month as you would on your period anyway, just minus the bleeding.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my liletta for a little more than 3 years. During the insertion I felt a little cramping for a minute, my doctor suggested me to take ibuprofen because It could get painful during the day. After 30min I started to have the worse cramps in my life! I didn’t even asked for the day off ahead because I thought I would be fine but no, so it was a very rough day. After that, I got my period some days later and I bleed for about a month! No cramping, not a lot of blood but I was concerned and mad. My doctor said it was normal, that I should worry just if I was bleeding like the pad can’t hold the blood. Then I had a second period that lasted for two weeks. After that, it started to get better. I don’t get my periods just some little spotting for a day once or twice a month, didn’t gain weight (I’ve lost about 15 pounds) no acne, no pregnancy! The annoying side effects that still have are: my libido went down and I have some random cramps that last less than a minute

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've had the liletta IUD for a year and a half. I'm being dramatic but it feels it has ruined my sense of self and me overall. They say weight gain is not apart of the side effects, but you'll feel incredibly bloated all the time. Then you'll be to depressed and chronically anxious to work out or do anything, it also for me, caused rapid mood swings, and cravings that I've never experienced. Prior to my IUD I was 120LB, now I'm reaching 160lb, despite staying active, eating healthy I can't shed the weight. I feel pregnant even though I'm not. Swollen ankles, bloated, moody, chronically anxious ALL the time, and the worst body and facial acne, that I've never had to deal with before. It caused these crazy cystic zits, despite me trying everything to keep it at bay. Needless to say, this has been a living nightmare, and I'm throwing a party after I get it removed. It's It's official divorce party from the nightmarish IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the IUD in April of this year. I did a lot of research and I knew I did not want to take birth control pills because of the hormones and side effects.  The insertion was ok, just some pressure- the same as a pap smear. I had really bad cramps for almost a month, first 2 weeks I had to take pain meds almost every day. The pain Is different than period cramps... I'd say feels more like pressure. My periods still come on time but they are definitely lighter! I always had heavy periods. I will say the spotting after my period lasts anywhere from 4-7 days.  I do get a cramp attack every now and then but usually goes away. No weight gain, just some very small breakouts near my chin , I do feel slightly more anxious but then again could be the pandemic. I'm hoping by the 6th month mark the cramps will go away and my body will adjust a bit better.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I only had it in for a few months before removing. I bled the whole time it was in, had no sex drive and gained weight. The worst though was becoming borderline depressed. I felt blah about everyone and everything. To say hang in there for it to even out for 6 months to a year? Technically works as a contraceptive due to the constant bleeding and not wanting to do anything sexual  due to the low sex drive.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had my IUD in for 6 months now and I LOOVVEEE it. I hated birth control pills. I tried them all, they made me emotional, increased my appetite, gain weight, affected my mood, it was horrible. Then my doctor recommended the Kyleena IUD and I am so glad she did! I have not had any side effects, except for some spotting here or there, which is normal and stopped after about 3 months. The insertion was not bad at all, later that day I was at a friends party! I recommend this to all my friends, it is a one-and-done birth control that lasts for 5 years and can be taken out whenever you want.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I initially gravitated towards it because my doctor mentioned it takes away your period. Instantly I bleed for 10 weeks and got severe acne. It was really bad I never had acne and as soon as it was inserted I had the most severe acne my face and back was broken out. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone. Please look into paragard instead. Only had it for 4 months. If you do have it and start noticing acne remove it , it will get worse and cause scars. Epiduo and doxycycline cleared my acne after some months. I BEG YOU DO NOT USE THIS .

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Hey ladies, came here to see if I was the only one experiencing this drawn out bleeding experience. I had Mirena placed late May 2021 and have had spotting just about everyday since…fun summer! We are now approaching September! Currently on my period and have had regular periods since having it placed. But the spotting daily in between periods has been such a pain. It’s a brownish colored discharge which I thought would go away a couple weeks after insertion but hasn’t. Really hoping to get over this hump and feel back to normal. I had the Mirena in the past before conceiving my son and really don’t recall the spotting being this prolonged at the start. Seems to be a common side effect though….looking forward to spot free days ahead.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I scheduled a kyleena appointment on August 23rd, 2021. I was very nervous going into my appointment but since I had been on depo for 7 years, the doctors highly recommended that I switch to something else (long term usage of depo can lead to infertility & bone deficiency). I was told to take 3 tabs of Motrin before I went into my appointment. When she began the procedure, it was uncomfortable from the start. But when she measured, I screamed, I cried, my finger tips & lips went numb. It was so painful my body had forced itself into shock. I would NEVER recommend kyleena to any YOUNG woman who has never experienced contractions or that type of pain. Moral of the story, I could not finish with the procedure and I left the appointment, in tears.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had the mirena for just over a year now. I never bleed at all. But in the past few days, I have been almost passing out with pain and today I am experiencing light bleeding. This isn't normal for me at all. I'm hoping to have it removed ASAP as the cramps are getting too much. I've had mild cramps the full year but nothing like what I'm experiencing now. I also seem to have thrush all the time as well. Although my doctor thinks it maybe isn't thrush and is something called lichen planus. I had no problems before having the mirena. The sooner it's gone, the better.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion only review ******** For the ladies out there reading reviews and getting scared of the procedure, my experience was good. The measuring of the uterus was the most uncomfortable part which only lasts like 15 sec maybe not even that long. And then they insert the IUD which again only takes like a minute and your done! Not scary at all!!! So don't be afraid if that's what is holding you back. It's now been 5 hours since I've had it put in. I've had some cramps and pain but I've been using a heating pad and took and advil and I already feel much better. Going to do another review after a month or so !

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So I was told this was the best IUD! I have been on the pill before and had really bad depression, so I was hoping this would be a welcome change. I really tried to power through these symptoms, but I just can't anymore. I suffered 3 months of constant bleeding and debilitating cramps. I survived that. But around the 6 month mark, the hair on the back of my head started to feel thinner, like baby hair. It would tangle super easily and get really damaged. I kept reaching back there to try and untangle it, and I realized I was doing it so often people started to think it was a nervous tick. Fast forward 5 months, and I have half the hair I had on my head pre insertion. I had thick, wavy red hair and now its all thin  like a baby's. My hormonal acne along my jaw is bad. I'm always bloated, and it caused cysts. I gained 6 pounds. I really don't want to discourage people from getting it, but I've had mine a year now and I wish I allowed myself to take it out 6 months ago!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have a horror story about how painful it was to get the Mirena inserted. But I'm going to let that go in the wayside because I hear it's much more painful for women who have never had children AND I only have to do this once every 6 years. I also still have periods, but they're just like a little bit of light bleeding for 3 days every couple of months.Other than that, I love it that I have this baby proof vagina and I don't have to do anything. I initially switched to Mirena because I don't like being hormonal with all other birth controls. It's been great. I'm on my second one (It's been 6 years since my first insertion so I had to replace it)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):If you read nothing else during this review remember this, don’t do this. The insertion of the IUD was extremely painful and I fainted while she put it in. I had to stay in the office, they would not let me drive home. I was extremely nauseous in the office and for the rest of the day. Most days I’m cramping and spotting. I still get my period, although it hasn’t been that long that the IUD has been in. I plan to get this taken out as soon as I can, I’m just afraid that will hurt too.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I want to share my positive experience because I almost backed out of Kyleena when I was reading reviews before insertion. I have had it for over a year now. I haven't noticed any side effects. I feel like my normal self and love that I honestly forget it is even there. I used a combo pill for birth control for 1.5 years previously and I really didn't like myself on it. I was tired, irritable, and lost a ton of sex drive. I lost 15 pounds in 3 months after getting off the pill with zero lifestyle changes. (I took a 8 month break between the pill and Kyleena to get to my "normal" again.) Kyleena has not caused my to have any weight or mood changes. The insertion did hurt a lot but it was bearable and is worth it in my opinion.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Ok so I didn't understand why I'd been feeling like rubbish for the last two years until now.  I was tired all the time in a fog depressed even though I literally have everything a girl could want (except having to work full time haha) but seriously depression would sneak in and take over out of nowhere. I've been short tempered and wow the anxiety has been awful to say the least. My arms have broken out in chicken skin and because of it I now have scars from popping the pimples, gained 15+ lbs and bloated all the time, I even often felt dizzy or light headed. I have had it out for 4 days now and let me tell you my whole world has turned around, it's as if a giant weight has been lifted off my chest.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was told kyleenas insertion pain would the worst of my experience... Boy were they wrong.I took 600 mg of Ibuprofen, a cervical dilator medication, and some anxiety medication the OBGYN gave me. Fair warning, none of it seemed to help. I was still incredibly anxious, which made me tighten up, and made the pain so much worse.I was told to give it a year to see if I like it. I was a few days shy of 1 year and I made an emergency visit to my OBGYN to get it removed.Halfway through every cycle I had pain at ovulation, and I could tell which ovary it was. I had ovarian cyst every month as well, leaving me in pain until my period. My period had bad cramps, and heat pads nor ibuprofen would help at all. I would take 800 mg of ibuprofen and no relief.My doctor had said because I never had kids, my uterus is small. She assumes the pain on my period was from my uterus cramping against the Kyleena, and I could have punctured my uterus.Not a pleasant experience at all.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I honestly have had the worst experience with Kyleena. The insertion was absolutely terrible for me; I would rate the pain as a 10/10. Immediately after insertion, I had to use the bathroom and throw up at the same time. The pain persisted the whole day and I had difficulty doing anything. My period cramps became worse than they were before and now last the entirety of my period (I already had very painful cramps during my period but they typically on only lasted 1-2 days). I want to get it removed but I am so scared that the removal will have a similar pain level as the insertion.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had relentless vaginal infections while on Mirena.  I would get cramps , bloating and spotting at random times, but especially after sex . My partner at the time, who was nowhere near well endowed, would feel it poking him.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I'm coming up on 5 years in September.   Time to remove but I want to replace it.It, (the Mirena), has been the best thing for me since my periods were bad. Before this  I cried myself to sleep, spent so much money just on pads per month.  Had to endure it at work.   I've had a couple of bad episodes,  even with it.  But at first though.  Now I was/am able to do all the things I couldn't do because of my bad menstruations.  I don't want to go through that again,  that's why I want to replace it.  Or get a partial hysterectomy.  We'll see!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I chose IUD  after some thinking because I don’t like taking pills for many reasons. The insertion went pretty well however since then I don’t feel like myself. I feel very lonely, sad and have no motivation to do anything. Physically my vagina became very dry and I don’t enjoy sex anymore because it hurts pretty much all the time. On top of that I am bloated every day so I don’t feel confident anymore. I think it can work for some people however after reading through so many experiences I am thinking of getting it removed.Maybe it’s reliable but it’s probably not worth all the troubles I have.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hey everyone, I just got Kyleena um, 12 days ago? Anyways, the insertion process was pretty awful. Not gonna lie, I almost passed out. The nurse waved an alcohol wipe in front of my nose and fanned me because my eyes were leery. I've never been pregnant or given birth and my period cramps have always been fairly mild. I've had 4 straight up contractions in the last 5 days. And I have a very high pain tolerance. I'll be driving or in a restaurant and it feels like something is trying to climb out of my uterus and I have to breathe and count til it's over. Does this subside? I'm starting to wonder if I made the wrong choice. I miss feeling normal. Everything I read is so mixed and I know everyone has different bodies and reacts to things differently but I really would appreciate some solid answers and know what to expect. I just want to know if I should get it taken out and switch to the pill or wait it out and experience the "no fuss" birth control some people say they love.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD in October 2019, process was excruciatingly painful. I experienced cramping and spotting for the first months. Then my period went away for awhile. Eventually it started occasionally but, for example I’ll have cramps but no blood. I’ve had this IUD for 1 year and 7 months, it’s prevented pregnancies. But affected me mentally and sexually. I’d dealt with depression in the past. And I went to therapy and got better. Once I got the IUD, it just went downhill from there. Every time I’d wanna have sex it didn’t feel good or I’d bleed out of nowhere because my periods were so irregular. I lost over 20 pounds because of the depression and my sex life has been lack luster. IUD’s are great but can have greater side effects on younger women with sensitive bodies, prone to depression. I’m getting it taken out because I want my body back and I realized that I underestimated the IUD as the key problem to not feeling like myself.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I read probably every post you can find on the internet about Kyleena- making me cancel my appointment 3 times to get it inserted . DON'T DO WHAT I DID!!!!I finally stopped being a chicken and got the procedure done, and let me tell you, it was a breeze. My doctor did proscribe me Xanax for my extreme anxiety around getting an IUD, and a cervix softener to aid with the insertion (I highly recommend). I felt almost nothing! The most uncomfortable part was measuring the cervix, which just felt like some sharper pressure that lasted  all of 3 seconds. I didn’t even feel the Kyleena insertion after that. I am having some painful cramping after the procedure (all day now) but I’m hoping it will subside by tomorrow.Moral of the story: the procedure is no big deal, and I’m the biggest baby ever. If I can do it, so can you!!Hoping the kyleena agrees with me after all!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for about 4 years now, At first it was all great but the past 2 years its been spiraling! Recovery isn’t all that terrible but it’s made my anxiety 10x worse, and my hair is thinning out!!! Cramps are terrible, mood swings, random waves of sadness, always emotional, constantly bloated and tired. Not to mention I got a huge hemorrhagic cyst from Kyleena that is insanely painful. I am getting mine out ASAP. Birth control is terrible for us, the doctors don’t tell us but it really is…

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I did not have a good experience with Mirena. I had it inserted at 9 weeks postpartum and the following week started bleeding. I had a 3 week long heavy period followed by 2 more weeks of lighter bleeding. After 5 weeks of continuous bleeding and cramping I decided to have it removed. It was important to me to not bleed for several months even if it meant the possibility of no bleeding after a year. I did not like the idea of not having control over my body and not knowing where in my cycle I was at. As I read more into the potential risks I was even more convinced that the IUD was not for me. Although my experience did not end well, I am glad I tried it and would not discourage others to give it a try. Everyone’s body is different. Thankfully the insertion and removal were painless for me because of having just given birth and having an excellent OBGYN. Good luck with your birth control decision ladies!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I highly recommend not getting this IUD as I have had an incredibly horrible experience.  I took 2 Advil prior to the insertion and the pain was bearable. I bled for about a month straight after, which is what I expected. Exactly one month after getting my IUD was when everything went down hill. One month in I developed severe anxiety and depression. I couldn’t go a day without having an anxiety or panic attack. It got so bad to the point that I couldn’t drive my car or go out to eat. Not only was I struggling with anxiety but I didn’t feel my self. I had horrible brain fog and felt mentally off. I am convinced that my IUD caused this. I got it removed about 2 months ago after having it in for only 4 months. I am finally starting to feel more and more myself. Please please do your research before getting this put in your body.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the Kyleena for 3.5 years. For me it hurts like anything getting put in, I had to ask my mom for a pain pill which says a lot because I don’t even take aspirin normally. I immediately stopped getting a period which has been great but my weight has continued to climb (not saying it’s entirely due to the IUD of course) and it’s damn near impossible to lose weight with it. My skin is still clear but very oily, and I lose a lot of hair in the shower. I had a hair loss problem with Nexplanon as well so I definitely attribute that to the Kyleena. After 3 years I suddenly started having cramps at random for weeks at a time and spotting frequently- still no periods. The depression has also gotten much worse over the years it’s a struggle. I’m contemplating having it removed now that the side effects are suddenly ramping up. Overall it was nice to begin with, and has gone downhill as the years pass.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hi ladies ! So I’m laying on the bed as we speak lol I literally just got my IUD put in. First let me say some comments here are horror stories  but they are just a few people experience. The insertion to me felt like a BIG period cramp . I have bad cramps so that’s exactly what it felt like but the pain has subdued in the last maybe 3-5 minutes maybe less. I feel ok honestly. I could feel it when it popped into place but now when I sit up I can’t feel it anymore lol it’s right in that place under your stomach or foopa area . I’ve never had a baby so I wonder if that was a contraction lol but yes it’s definitely bearable especially if you’ve been handling monthly cramps.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I can’t believe the reviews here aren’t better. I’ve had a wonderful experience. Insertion was somewhat painful, a bit more than one would experience during a period cramp, so I wasn’t thrilled but it was not major. I had no pain after and enjoyed sex the same evening. I was told it is better to get it while you’re on your period, which I did. 3 years later, I have had almost no period symptoms and go through 1-2 softcups (tampon alternatives) per year so I haven’t purchased any period supplies in these 3 years. When my post-menopausal mother said something about how nice it is not to get periods anymore, I agreed instead of wishing I had that freedom. I haven’t noticed a change in mood or weight. It’s nice that I don’t have to think about birth control until 5 years go by. I didn’t pay a dime because it’s preventative care. I really can’t recommend it highly enough and absolutely plan to get another one when the time comes.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):This caused side effects of insomnia, extreme random cramping, no sex drive, yeast infections, anxiety, panic attacks, developed subclinical hypothyroidism that has gone back to normal since removal of the Mirena IUD.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena for 3 months. In those 3 months, I experienced the most horrific symptoms ever and it was definitely the Mirena as didn't have it before it and I was tested for many other things which all came back normal. I got it removed today and almost instantly my lower back pain disappeared, along with constant cramping and even the headaches I started getting from it has subsided today! I became HIGHLY, dangerously anxious on this thing. I got into a severe manic depressive state on it, had such bad anger problems and outbursts over nothing, not to mention the weight gain and sudden migraines/headaches, joint pain and pressure in my skull! I am actually furious as to how much this messed me up but I know not everyone had bad experiences on this.. which I find so shocking due to the things it did to me.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the mirena IUD for almost 4 years. I have been pretty healthy before getting it. In the last 4 years I have experienced a mental fog, short term memory loss, heart complications and severe depression (I did have depression before but never like this). My family has a history of heart palpitations before the mirena I did not have any heart issues. I got it at 21 and I'm 25 now.. I have seen a cardiologist and have been told I have the heart beat of a 70 year old man. I found more reviews and seen I am not the only one. I am having mine removed today. Some people have a good experience but others it can be life threatening. Hopefully I feel more like myself after getting it removed. I can say that I have not been pregnant while on mirena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I used to be on the pill for years due to terrible periods but over time it just wasn’t helping anymore so I got the coil around 8 months ago. The insertion was painful but manageable however the cramps afterwards for 3 weeks was unbearable and I bled for 3 weeks straight therefore I had to be prescribed ponstan and other tablets which eased the pain and finally stopped the bleeding. After that I got acne on my cheeks and I’ve never had acne before. However it’s calmed down a lot since I invested in skincare and over time in general. Initially I wanted to get it removed so bad but the previous 6/7 months have been great, I’ve had no periods at all which is fantastic as periods are usually so heavy and unbearable for me to endure. It was one of the best decisions I made and I’m glad I stuck it out and let my body adjust to it. I would rate it 10 but I’m rating it 8 since the start of my coil journey was rough But the side affects were worth no period now!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted on July 8,2021. I have read many negative reviews here before my procedure...so I have planned for the worst. However, the procedure only took 5 minutes. I was afraid of spotting, so I put on a pad. I only got a little bit of spotting after a few hours. Then it's all good. I took two pain relievers before my procedure, so I could only felt tiredness. My period supposes to come yesterday ( July 13) but no sight of blood. I decided to go through this procedure because I have severe endometriosis pain...I usually get that pain every 2 weeks (pain for two weeks straight before and after my period). Birth control pills don't work for me...and I have very bad side effect.It's been a week, and I am feeling great so far

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):JUST had my kyleena inserted and wanted to review the insertion process for others because it was one of the things I was most worried about! It really was not too painful, it mostly felt like intense pressure in my uterus (basically like a painful cramp), and lasted under a minute. I would definitely recommend getting kyleena if your only concern is the insertion - you can handle it! I took about 800mg of ibuprofen an hour beforehand and I really think that helped. As soon as she was done with the insertion I immediately felt 100% better and haven't had any cramping today since! I'll write another review once I'm further into my experience but the insertion process should definitely not be a deterrent!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena IUD for a total of 3 months and it wrecked havoc with my body. Previously I had the copper IUD for 6 years but due to heavy periods caused by the copper IUD I had it removed. Insertion of the kyleena was actually fine and not so painful. Just a little pinch. But for the next 3 months I suffered horrendous bloating. My weight has always remained the same even after having two kids but almost immediately I started gaining weight. I eventually cut down to just one meal a day and gave up almost everything sweet to see if this would help but I kept on gaining weight. I had a constant brown discharge everyday for 3 months but it was the bloating that affected me the most. I had it removed almost one week ago. I had heavy bleeding for 4 days after removal. The bleeding has now stopped today and the bloating has already significantly reduced. Today is the first day after 3 months that I feel like myself again. Sadly it didn’t work for me

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hello all! Just so y’all know, I have had the kyleena for almost a month so I’m not completely out of the woods. But, I would like to share my experience with insertion pain etc. to assure everyone that it is not horrible like many others have said! I was petrified before I got my IUD inserted, because many women were saying it was worse than child birth. I will admit it was moderately uncomfortable, BUT nothing that could not be tolerated. The cramping afterwards was that of a bad period cramp. So far, I would HIGHLY recommend, especially if the pill caused emotional and/or stomach issues like it did for me. Everybody  perception of pain will be different. I was so paranoid because of what the internet said, but my experience was far more bearable. Please consider!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had my IUD inserted during my cesarean, yes I was told it could come out of place more easily because of the uterus and childbirth. During my postpartum visit my ob couldn’t find my strings so I had an ultrasound to check placement-everything was ok with that thankfully. My sex drive is almost nonexistent, which would be great to prevent pregnancy lol but not for my partner. The bleeding - I’ve had two cycles I believe in almost 4 months pp..I did had some constant mid cycle bleeding but it’s seems to have leveled out. It definitely effects my moods - like I’m not a crier at all but I could easily cry over some situations, I am easily irritated and get flustered. When I did ask my provider about my moods and bleeding, it was made to seem it’s not enough hormone something like that but its 100% noticeable changes. This time next year I plan to have it removed.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've had the liletta for a few months now, I've been reading through the reviews on this website and I can honestly say I have not experienced the things that most of these people are experiencing... it has HELPED with my mood swings and anxiety. I have not gotten pregnant with it yet.
Mirena (levonorgestrel):Side effects include migraine headache, nausea, jaw tightness, fits.  Worst experience in my life - please no one use this Mirena IUD it is life threatening

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD Skyla placed in May 2019. I remember the cramps being unbearable and I have a high pain tolerance! Then I bleed for a few months which completely messed up my sex life. I still have it but it’s due to be removed May 2022 and I’m debating if I want a new one or if I want to just want to discontinue the use all together. I gained about 15-20lbs, I feel like my lower abdomen is swollen/bloated all the time and after reading the reviews I see many people who are agreeing with me on the weight gain/symptoms. I honestly want to get it removed and I most likely will because I do want to see if the bloating goes down and if my weight goes down as well. BUT out of all the IUDs I would recommend it would be this one is the smallest and you do still get your period. I haven’t had any complications, but I thought I couldn’t feel my IUD strings and my GYN did an ultrasound it was fine and in the correct position.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had several Mirena’s for the past 17 years. First it was for birth control and now part of HRT. The main attraction to the Mirena was the stopping of periods and PMS. The insertion and removal were not bad at all, but also taking Advil before the appointment. I only have good things to say about the Mirena. I had some spotting for a day or two when I had a new one inserted. No pain, no cramping, no mood swings, no weight gain and sex drive didn't change. I know it does not work for everyone but if it works for you it will change your life.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've been on Liletta for 5 years. I was 24 yrs old 125 lbs Im 5'7. I'm 29 &160 lbs now. Issues I've personally had are - having the IUD implanted hurt REAL bad for me. I literally almost fainted, I felt so awful when I left. I got to my car I balled my eyes out - heavy cramps, bleeding for the next week-bleeding with some cramps for next 3 months straight (not super heavy, just normal) - extreme nausea at night to the point I feel like I'm going to puke but never do (its weird) happened when I first got the implant, has kinda dissipated now I'm at year 5 but not much-bloating, fatigue - cramps got worse for me in the last 2 years, along with my periods coming back to actually bleeding vs spotting - sex was rough for about 6 months - sexual partners stating they can feel it or it pokes them.  It got rid  my sex drive for about 8 months - so far no babies, no close calls. I will close with this, if you can take something else that isn't as invasive/hard on your body as this, I highly suggest it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had it for 11-12 months, back in 2018-2019. I can’t remember it effecting my periods that much. It worked great other than after between 3-5 months of having the IUD I got cystic acne on my cheeks in a specific area. Before that I had clear skin other than your typical few black or white heads. So, I went to see a dermatologist for a topical since the other medications she could have gave me would make the IUD less effective. I waited out a year to see if my topicals were clearing up my skin because those too can take time to work but no luck! I was very insecure and lost a lot of my confidence due to the cystic acne on my cheeks. I want to mention didn’t gain weight, but I was active in the gym, 3-4 days a week. I gave it 7/10 because it was effective of not getting pregnant. Other than the cystic acne, I was fairly pleased with Kyleena. After I have my baby in late 2021 I plan on trying Paragard and seeing how that works! Best of luck!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Positives:. my mood is WAY better than when I was on the pill. I feel happier, more relaxed, more whimsical?. my sex drive has *rocket taking off into the sky*. sex physically feels better? Hard to describe lolNegatives:. I do have slightly more acne now. It's mild, but I have it on my back now which I didn't have before.. I have had light bleeding for a VERY long time. Like, last day of your period, every day--and I'm coming up on six months. I think it's going away, but damn it is taking its time.. Since my period still hasn't evened out, I find that it's easy for me to weep out of the blue. But it usually passes quickly and I'm not having full-blown, sobbing breakdowns like I did on the pill.To me, these changes are worth it. So far I'm very happy with Kyleena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I was advised by my health practitioner to get the Kyleena in as birth control as said would help when comes to HRT, less hormones than the Mirena and smaller in size. I was thinking of having the copper coil but she talked me around.  Anyway my experience was really bad with it. I had severe cramping to the point it was very painful, I bled very heavy and constantly throughout this time and my stomach was swollen and the hormones in it I found unbearable.  I literally became a different girl with it very quickly.  I was back in my practitioners office in under 3 weeks to get it out and the copper coil put in.  The copper coil is only in a day and I feel so much better already.To mention, I am 42 so not sure if my body just rejected it as see some good reviews here but didn't suit me at all

Liletta (levonorgestrel):If you follow the direct instructions by your GYN before IUD insertion, it really isn’t that bad having it inserted.I’ve had the IUD for nearly a year, however, and here is my list of thingsPro: very effective birth controlStops your periodEasy insertion of you follow GYN instructions and they are experienced Cons: I had crazy acne after insertionHaven’t changed a thing about my routine and I’ve put on 25lbs that is still just packing on.Due to the uncontrollable weight gain I’m going to have to have it removed. If it were showing signs of stopping (even with my diet and exercise!!) I’d keep it in because it did stop my period, but I’m still just packing it on like I’m eating McDonald’s 3 times a day or something. It’s so frustrating!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I previously had a Mirena with no issues so I'm not anti-IUD by any means. However my healthcare provider decided a Kyleena was better this time around with the words "people prefer it because it has less hormone". I smiled and nodded and now feel like a complete idiot for agreeing to it.I lasted 6 weeks with it. During that time I got deep, pitted acne on my chin (I'm 37, my acne years were a thing of distant memory), I bled every single day, I had horrendous cramps, I lost a lot of my sex drive and finally my hair started falling out.That was enough. The wretched thing is now gone. My advice would be read up on the Kyleena before you go for it. The research isn't great and possibly due to it being around for less time than other IUDs there's much less compelling data.I've given it a 3 because hey, I didn't get pregnant but then to be honest I didn't feel like having sex whilst dealing with the stupid thing.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Everyone has a different experience this one is mine. Just had the Liletta inserted today there was discomfort but quick. I’m having a lot of cramping and I feel drowsy and sore. I honestly feel like I just gave birth, I can’t find the strength to walk. If you do plan on getting the Liletta IUD just be prepared to have the rest of the day off to rest if you happen to have the same experience as I do.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I love Kyleena but I did get pregnant soo…do what you want with that information!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I suffer from mild-moderate acne and figured I may as well try Kyleena as and IUD. I had Kyleena for about a year and my acne had never been WORSE. Do not get this IUD if you suffer from acne. I even went on Spironolactone to help mitigate the issue and it didn't help, at all. I had the IUD removed and my acne almost completely cleared up in 2 weeks. Its been 2 months and my skin is amazing. No changes except for taking out the IUD. Don't do it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Getting IUD put in was extremely painful. No medication was given prior. They cut strings too short I believe or the flipped upward. Went I’m in 3 years later with discomfort. GYNO informed me IUD was slightly poking into muscle. They said I have to schedule to come back and have it removed. They tried multiple ways including a hook, unable to retrieve. Was about to cry in office, EXTREMELY PAINFUL. After was very emotional and bled all day, Doctor informed me I’d have to wait to have surgery done under anesthesia. Now I’m waiting to have surgery, very scared. Very unpleasant experience. Gained around 20lbs. Retaining water, bloating, abdominal pain, and about 20 cysts. Never again. Please do your own research this is not medical advice or guidance. Just a bad personal experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is THE WORST decision EVER. I first took a combination pill for birth control and was really happy with it until my OBGYN told me I needed to stop taking estrogen because of my history of migraine. So, my OBGYN recommended I get an IUD. I reluctantly agreed because in theory it seemed like a great thing;no more acne, still won’t have periods, and won’t worry about getting pregnant. The pain was the worst pain I have ever felt in my life! NO ONE TOLD ME THAT! I was medicated when they did it, the insertion went well besides the unfathomable pain. I had it removed 2 days later because I was a train wreck! I have a history of anxiety and I am not joking when I say my emotions were uncontrollable. I could hear how awful I was being and literally couldn’t stop. Besides that I literally couldn’t walk for the entire two days because the pain was still horrible even when taking 5mg of oxycodone  every 4 hours. I had a mental breakdown every 2 hours and couldn’t take it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena has served me well! I  have had Kyleena for  a year and 3 months, I am 21. Yes it was uncomfortable inserting it and I had cramps afterwards, it wasn't until I got home that they worsened.  I still get my period, but very lightly. I have had some side effects: acne breakouts , raging and depressive moods. When it comes to my mental health  it hasn't thrown it off balance too much, but I do have to say I have had some bad rages for extended periods of time. I will say mean things and will look back wondering who that person is. I am a little more reactive, my awareness of this has helped me, I'm working on it  and practicing patience. I believe with a strong mentality and our woman intuition, every woman can decide for themselves how this affects them and what areas we need to focus on when on it.  I never gained weight and it's been great besides some hiccups I mentioned. I am grateful to not have to remember to take a pill. 10/10.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Mirena IUD in for going on 8 months now. I am 23 and got it for contraceptive reasons and because I was sick of always having a 8 day period. I got my period for about 2 months straight and have been getting it on and off since pretty regular. Sometimes if I have sex it will bring on a period which is really annoying. I got VERY bad cramps for days after it was put in and now get much much worse cramps when I get a period which I never got before. I literally have to take pain meds as soon as they start if I don't I feel like I can feel the pain in my hips and bones almost which does sound weird. I think if you're going to get it just don't have the expectations that you will have no periods and it will all just be pain free. It's different for everyone and just depends on how your body will react to it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I only had kyleena for four months and I probably wouldn’t ever get it again but that’s just me. Everyone’s different but the reason I say that is first the insertion was pretty bad I would recommend 3 Aleves. The pain only lasted 2 seconds which really wasn’t bad if that’s all there was. I broke out TERRIBLY after about a month and it didn’t get better until I took it out. I had no problems with acne before. I didn’t bleed much tho! I only bled the day I got it in,  & had one small period a few weeks later and then nothing for the rest of the time. But where everything changed for me is I started having terrible anxiety and I mean pretty much no anxiety to 1-3 panic attacks everyday after one month of getting this inserted. I can say I can’t say for sure if Kyleena had anything to do with it because after I got it removed I still had anxiety but it did calm down quiet a bit. I do have GAD, it may have just been a coincidence.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena IUD put in December 2020, and the insertion was painful, but not EXCRUCIATING. However, I do have somewhat of a high pain tolerance. I had heavy bleeding for about 12 hours after, then on and off bleeding/ spotting for about 3 months. Everything was fine for those 3 months except the irregular bleeding. After 3 months, I got painful, cystic acne around my jawline and chin. I also gained 7 lbs, and can’t seem to get rid of it even though I've been active all of my life and workout almost everyday and eat in a calorie deficit with healthy foods. I would also have mood swings quite often, and wanted to get it removed, but I stuck it out 3 more months because I heard it takes 6 months to adjust. Finally, after 6 months my acne has gotten better, but still have bloating and moodiness around my period . My period is still somewhat irregular, and I still have intermittent cramping throughout my cycle. Overall, better than the pills, but still some negative aspects.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got the Skyla in on April 3rd, 2018 after I got pregnant with my boyfriend of 4 years then had a miscarriage because of the other meds I take.The insertion hurt worse than I was expecting but it only lasts a second so it’s definitely bearable. It feels like a contraction in your uterus & the nurses recommended you take an Advil/Ibuprofen before coming in for cramping. They tell you it’ll feel like you’re on your period for at least a week. Welp - I bled for a little over a year. Usually it was very light off and on & it did make me gain weight and my acne got worse. Also at first when my bf & I would have sex the wire strings would poke his penis in certain positions lmao. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a long term contraception that’s low maintenance or someone who isn’t good at remembering to take their pills every day(me). I’m 20 years old now and I just got the Skyla removed after 3 years and got the Kyleena in which is for 5 years but you can get it removed any time you want!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I was suffering very long and heavy bleeding once my second child was weaned off and periods had come back. So it seemed a good idea to try the coil. The insertion was quite painful and I had some cramping and bleeding, but it was manageable. However what I didn't expect were all the side effects I was having. Hair loss, bad headaches, bad skin, back ache, joint ache ( couldn't run without knee pain ... I have never had knee pain in my life ), hot flushes, mood swings, teary and it reduced my sex drive to nothing. I have had it in for almost a year now and while some of the symptoms have gone, like the headaches, hot flushes. The hair loss, mood swings, joint aches and low sex drive have stayed with me. It helped with my overall health in terms of having no periods and therefore I had no other illnesses, but the sum of all side effects outweigh the benefits in my case.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena is an incredible option for women to prevent pregnancy! I am SO glad I got it and think that it's the best BC option for me! I had Kyleena placed Feb 2021, and really don't be afraid of the insertion! It felt like an uncomfortable 30 second pressure. My OBGYN had me wait until I was on my period and had me insert misoprostol the night before to soften cervix. I took Tylenol for minor cramping following IUD insertion. I did however have  sharp pains for the first day of my period the first 3 periods. I think my body is still adjusting! I also have had 3 yeast infections since IUD insertion…which I had never had before. I still get a regular period which gives peace of mind! I've had zero mood/weight/acne changes too! Knowing that no birth control method is perfect (And that I previously had bad experiences w/ BC pill side effects) I think this is an extremely effective form of BC that I would absolutely recommend to women, don’t let the bad reviews scare you :)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I choose Kyleena as I wanted contraception that had fewer hormones than the pill I was taking and low maintenance. Whilst the nurses were kind and informative, (giving me pain killers to take an hour before the fitting), it was still immensely painful. If you decide to opt for Kyleena or any other IUD fitting, I would recommend taking the maximum painkillers beforehand and practicing some deep breath and relaxation methods before as these make the fitting less painful. However, do be prepared it is very painful for around 8 minutes, but the more relaxed you can be, the less painful it is. Following the fitting of Kyleena, I experienced bacterial vaginosis which was difficult to get rid of. Therefore before getting it fitted, I would ask your medical professional what you can do to prepare your vaginal bacteria balance before it is fitted. Aside from the painful fitting and the bacterial vaginosis, it has been pain-free. I have periods that are lighter and less painful.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion was uncomfortable at worst but the cramps for the following two days were painful. I had a full month period for the first month after insertion which was just light bleeding on and off for the full month. Around the time for my period to start now my cramps are painful but once the bleeding starts they subsided!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta 10 months ago. I am 22yrs old, 165lbs, 6' tall, and very athletic. Insertion hurt, but it was not unbearable for me even without pain meds and lasted a VERY short amount of time. I was fine during and immediately after, but once I stood up I got very nauseous and almost passed out. After I laid down for a few minutes I was fine.
