I spent the rest of the day with cramps and a headache. The next afternoon I was fine to return to my job. After that, I lightly bled for about 3 months, with cramps on my period that were so bad at night to the point where I had to take advil and lay down. I think I was a more moody than usual as well. The next few months my period was light with light cramps and was 3-11days. Month 10 I don't know if I got my period or not because it was so light. I have not gained or lost any weight and have experienced no sign of body, mood, or sex drive changes. As an athlete it did not change my performance. I give it a 9 because the string is hard to find

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD as part of HRT. I didn't really do a lot of research before I had it fitted. Glad I didn't because most reviews online are negative. So the insertion was horrible and the 3 weeks after that I bled. 4 weeks in now I'm feeling good and my Menopause symptoms have now reduced greatly, I actually feel normal again !

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Mirena IUD for 5 years and it was the best decision I ever made! I had very long and heavy periods and the Mirena  IUD has helped calm my period symptoms and allow me to skip the period all together! It was easy to have placed and didn’t hurt other than some slight cramping afterward, no worse than a regular period cramp. I highly recommend this IUD for anyone considering it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The first year I had it it was great. The insertion wasn’t terrible for me, I had some pretty intense cramping afterwards. But now it’s rare I have a month where I don’t have intense, and painful cramps. Unfortunately at the year mark I suspect it may be displaced. Thankfully it hasn’t resulted in a pregnancy, but every few days the strings go from being very long, or short. The reason I got this birth control is because I was about to lose access to my moms health insurance and was hoping this would be a good option because I had 5 years to get a better job and health insurance. Now it looks like a lot of my money is going to have to go towards an exam, possible removal, and trying to find a new birth control. This is great at preventing pregnancy, but if you don’t have health insurance, or are about to lose it I wouldn’t suggest getting it because should you be apart of the apparent low percent of expulsion/displacement it very well could be very bad for your bank account.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got it inserted almost a month ago, and so far I haven't had any issues with it. Insertion was painful and I had cramps for about 10 days, but after that nothing. I didn't get any bleeding or spotting at all! I haven't had any other side effects like mood changes or acne. My period's coming up soon so I'll see how it's affected then, but so far its been amazing!! If you're on the fence, just try it out and see how it goes. You won't know how it'll go unless you give it a try first!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena in early April was fine putting it in had a few cramps for a couple of days but no bleeding. Then 2 weeks later I was due for my first period and it came but was lighter than usual had sharper cramps and only 2 days were heavy, however the bleeding did not stop for 45 days. It was very light though not enough to stop anything and cramping was minimal but still sharp pains when it came. After light bleeding for 45 days through one period cycle and 1/2 another bleeding stopped and only occasional cramping. Hoping the bleeding doesn’t last as long when my next period starts.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena is an amazing birth control method only a hassle once every 5 years. Also the ease of not having to take a pill every morning or replace a patch every month is really great. Insertion of the IUD was about 5-7 minutes total. Everyone’s pain and experience is different but my pain rating of the insertion was a 2-3/10. I had no cramping after insertion and was able to get up right away. It has not caused me any problems thus far. I have noticed lighter periods.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta inserted after my last baby.  The dr told me it was the same as Mirena but it is NOT.  I didn’t have any problems with Mirena but 3 months after Liletta insertion I got Telogen Effluvium and lost a lot of hair. (More pp shedding than I have EVER experienced.) I gained weight and my libido is completely GONE!  My hair is continuing to fall out. I had my hormone levels checked via twice and my estrogen level has dropped so low that it barely registers on the charts.  My dr told me that could be from the Liletta suppressing my estrogen (and progesterone) production.  Those are two VERY important hormones for a woman, especially for hair growth, skin, nails, etc. Nothing like having a birth control that basically puts you into a menopausal state LONG before you are due for that.  After having this awful device in me for 14 months I am finally getting it removed tomorrow!  I do NOT recommend Liletta to anyone and do NOT let your doctor tell you it is the exact same thing a Mirena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena for about 10 months. It’s worked great for my sister and she had her period stop while I on the other hand had bled non-stop for about 6-8 of those months and it never got any lighter, plus I got pretty bad cramps for the first time ever. It did the job in preventing pregnancies but the side effects outweighed that one plus for me. Other than the forever lasting period, I was extremely emotional, was depressed the entire time, and crying almost everyday multiple times. I will say that insertion wasn’t terrible, just very uncomfortable. Removal was a breeze and I had no bleeding afterwards. I was on the pill prior and got every symptom you could get and my only plus with the pill was clear skin. Going onto the IUD acne came right back of course. On the plus side- after taking it out I've been my happiest. I won’t be going back to birth controls (they don't react well with my body clearly) but if you guys have any natural suggestions on how to regulate your period, let me know!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have been on an IUD as my form of birth control for about 5 years now. For my first 4 I had the IUD Skyla, which was without a doubt the best thing ever. It was time for me to get one and I have been on Kyleena for a year and a half now and it is the worst experience of my life. Cystic acne all over, hair breakage/chunks falling out to the point I had to get it cut short, and most importantly the weight gain and difficulty to lose it. Before getting Kyleena I was one of the most active people you would know. I can barely go to the gym most days because of how uncomfortable I get and bloated. Hardly anything has changed diet wise and yet I still gained over 10 pounds.  I tried to lose it by going to the gym often and working hard at lifting weights. For sure I gained muscle but weight loss? Still a no go. It’s very depressing. No matter how hard I’ve tried diet, exercise routine, tracking nothing has helped with a single pound.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Im typing this in TEARS! I developed endometriosis after this birth control. When this BC was placed I started having cramps like contractions. The pain was so bad I would vomit. I kept going to the doctor and they would tell me it was normal. I DEMANDED they do an ultrasound and they did and found a cyst on my left ovary they needed to remove. This was nearly 2 years ago and I still feel pain on that side... unusual pain, not the dull pain or the sharp pain but its very unusual. I even had a miscarriage. I didn’t want this but at the time I was living with my mom I ended up having to be on it. Idk whats going on in my body because I haven’t been to the doctor... doctors don't help! They make everything worse. I’ve been trying to take pills to get rid of the extra estrogen in my body. I still suffer from cramps but they’re not as bad as they were. I just want to be normal again. Don't get this if you care about your reproductive . I’m 24 with no kids and suffering!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta inserted about a week ago, after 3 years of being on depo. I was extremely nervous and took 800mg ibuprofen. Insertion went so fast. It’s not so much PAIN, just discomfort/strange invasive feeling that is very short. Honestly it feels cold in there lol. cried my eyes out after the speculum came out, not in pain but in relief that it was over. LET YOUR DOCTOR KNOW if you have anxiety! The rest of the day I had mild cramping and I had very light spotting that went away the day after. The cramping was easy to deal with and subsided after about 2-3 days. A week later- no spotting, no cramping, however, I feel so much better mentally.  I’m less bloated! My face and tummy get bloated easily and that’s really gone away super noticeably! To anyone considering it, the mild discomfort was totally worth it for me, someone who has GAD. I’m also a major hypochondriac, so my advice to you- tell your doctor about EVERY single concern/question/anxious thought you have.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena IUD inserted a year ago and have had a great experience so far! I got it because I have a blood clotting disorder and it was the birth control option my doctor recommended the most. I definitely suggest taking some ibuprofen before the insertion just because there will be some cramping afterwards. For me, it was the same amount of cramping that I get with a normal period. You should also expect some spotting for awhile after. I now have semi-regular periods, but they are significantly lighter and only last for a few days. I haven’t had any side effects.   Overall, I’m very pleased with my experience with Kyleena.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):This was the first time I have used an IUD. Insertion of the Mirena was easy, and the first week was fine but then my mood started to be affected. After two weeks I was spontaneously crying, not wanting to move from my couch but forcing myself to go to work. By four weeks I was thinking suicidal thoughts and couldn't bring myself to make dinner for my family. I have never felt like that before, it was overwhelming and scary. At 5 weeks I called the doctor and had it removed a week later. Within a week of removal my depressive symptoms disappeared. While it is not listed as one of the possible effects, my doctor said that mood change was the second highest reason that she had personally seen for Mirena removal. I have had a TT380 Short copper IUD for two months now and have had no problems at all, feel completely normal and average 3-4 day periods.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I originally had a Jaydess IUD for 3 years. I decided to try hormone free and switch to copper. That didn't work for me then I switched to Mirena for 2.5 years. While on the Mirena I developed cystic acne. I was referred to a dermatologist who prescribed creams that I was highly allergic too and made everything worse. I was diagnosed with hydradentitis suppurativa. My acne was so painful. I asked my GP and dermatologist if this could be from the Mirena. They both told me no. I convinced my GP to take out my IUD and start on Seasonale birth control, 3 months since then my acne has completely cleared up, and I've been told now that I don't have HS any more. I hope this helps anyone out there struggling with cystic acne with the mirena to question their doctor.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I love Kyleena! After having my first baby earlier this year, I chose this birth control option as it was recommended by my OB.It is estrogen free, so if you have a history of breast cancer or clotting this is a good option for you. Insertion was almost painless, it felt like a step up from the Pap Smear - 3/10 pain level, if that and took less than 2 min to insert. I do want want to stress the importance of going to someone that actually knows what they’re doing. A lot of doctors are not trained to properly insert an IUD.Not to downplay the negative reviews, but IUD’s are marketed for women who have had a child - our bodies have gone through hormone changes. I don’t think many of the women commenting negatively have had had a pregnancy and my OB said this can definitely make a difference in pain and tolerance of hormones.No side effects with Kyleena, very minimal bleeding for a day or two and feel great. 10/10

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I was recommended this because I was worried about taking the pill due to hormones and worry of blood clots. I was assured by my gynecologist that the hormone in Mirena would stay in my uterus and not get in my system. I do not believe this is true whatsoever. A couple of months after having it replaced I began to have extreme panic attacks to where I could not function. I was constantly going to the ER or calling 911 to talk to me until I could calm down because I thought I was going to die. My breasts also shrank significantly on this which I thought was very strange considering I gained weight. I would not wish what I experienced on my worst enemy. These side effects were not listed at the time I decided to get it placed or I never would have done it. My gyno insisted the Mirena wasn't the cause but I made him take it out and the anxiety decreased significantly. But I do have PTSD from the whole experience.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena over 5 years ago and had it removed several months ago as I want to get pregnant. I felt my strings each month and had no issues with them.The first month with it was like having period cramps. The cramps decreased in intensity over that month, with the first week being the worst. My first period after having Mirena put in was late but not that different from my normal period, albeit with far less cramping. As time went on, my periods got shorter, further apart, lighter, and I had no cramps. One year in, no more periods and no period symptoms.I got my Mirena out this year. My periods returned the week after I got it out. I have dream periods now!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had this for 5 years. I had zero periods. None. It was amazing. However, I’m not a fan of the insertion/removal process. So I chose to return to the pill. While it really doesn’t hurt that bad for either insertion or removal, my anxiety was sky high about the process. So I just prefer the pill now.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):It's been over a month since I've been on it & I'm really happy with it.  No weight gain, sex drive is the same, no acne - however with that I'm taking FLO gummies which I read helps with cystic acne which can be a side effect of this IUD.  The insertion was painful, but it was quick & after taking ibprofen I was fine the rest of the day. I haven't really had a period, but I do spot quite a bit.  It's light brownish, but nothing too bad & it's only ever in the late afternoon for about an hour.  I don't mind how frequent it's been considering I switched from the copper IUD where I was bleeding HEAVY for 2 full weeks every month so I'll happily take this frequent spotting right now.  Would like it to taper off, but it's only been a month so I'm gonna be patient with that.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena insertion was extremely painful for me (I screamed and swore). This BC was convenient in theory, that is, until you get the unpleasant side effects: random panic attacks, anxiety about everything and nothing at the same time, lol. The anxiety became more frequent and intense over time. It also felt like a dark cloud was looming over me, I didn't feel like my happy self. I also had vivid and sometimes frightening dreams. This all greatly interfered with my daily functioning. I finally requested removal after only 2 months because I couldn't tolerate the experience. I was not willing to wait a few more months to see if I felt better--"IF" being the operative word here, lol. Removal was far less painful. I am now 2.5 weeks post-removal and my anxiety has been dissipating and I am slowly but surely starting to feel like myself again and at peace. I think the IUD is a convenient method of birth control if it works for you. It just did not work out for me, and I am okay with that.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):1st 24 hours with Kyleena were horrendous and I'm quite a tough cookie, I had the worst contractions, my body went into shock.I never relaxed with this device within me, ever, always worrying if it had come out, if it was in the right place if it was actually working correctly. I had excruciating pain and on checking, I could not find my strings. I had a pelvic check and they could not see or feel the strings, so I booked an appointment the next day with the clinic that fitted the coil and on arriving they could not find the strings, then when looking further, the awful device had tried to come out, and had got wedged on doing so, in my cervix. Removal was horrendous, literal yanking it out, but better than having an operation, but I imagine this is due to its wandering, it had also given me a cervical infection.I'm back on the depo now and will suck up the injections. PLEASE do your research on this Kyleena, it is really quite scary when it goes wrong and it starts coming out by itself.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Two years ago after my second pregnancy I got the Kyleena and honestly the process of putting it in was horrible, But more horrible is the side effects that I have had to experience, anxiety, constant tachycardia, depression, nervousness,t iredness, little desire to do things. I felt so bad that I made an appointment with my primary doctor, I asked him about what I was feeling and about He sent some studies including the thyroid and everything went well. He sent to the gynecologist because after investigation we came to the conclusion that it was Kyleena. I went to the gynecologist and I talked to her about my side effects and she very relaxed told me that they were NORMAL!!!! And I told her depression, anxiety, urge to cry, fatigue, were they normal? When I went the first day, you did not tell me about those side effects, I have lived almost two horrible years and it is normal? On Thursday, May13 2021 I got it taken out and from that first day I felt calmer, I did not feel that it accelerated in a more relaxed

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena put in March 2020 and at first it was great, I was going to put a review here after 6 months but decided to wait. Everything has changed since then. I thought the weight I gained was due to quarantine but it’s from the Mirena. I can’t fit into any of my clothes anymore, and my breasts have almost doubled in size. I’m extremely dry around my vaginal area, and my sex drive is nothing. I can’t feel anything when I’m touched and cannot orgasm. My period is every 18 days and lasts for 10-14 days, it feels like I never get a break. Recently I have been bleeding even when not on my period (filling a pantyliner everyday). I have also been extremely emotional and it doesn’t take much to tear up. Overall I’m sure that this works for some, but I’m ready to get this removed. I want to feel like myself again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena for 3.5 years. Insertion wasn’t the best but I’ve never had kids before it made me so sick after inserted and it tookmonths before my body adjusted to it.Then about around year 2.5 I started getting these awful yeast infections which never went away. Always had lower back pain. I honestly feel like my body started rejecting the IUD. I was miserable it was so bad my gyno had to put gentian purple in my vagina - twice  - to remove the pesky yeast infection. I have known a couple people to have Kyleena and had the same issue as me. It was great for about two years then after that it went down hill. I just had mine removed and no lower back pain for the first time in 3.5 years. Such relief. Great for if you don’t want kids will definitely work at preventing that but as far as enjoying sex. I did not when I had the IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I chose Kyleena instead of Mirena or the copper coil because I wanted as little hormones as possible & I heard the copper coil was inflammatory & caused heavier painful bleeds which I already had to deal with due to PCOS. I got Kyleena in December 2020, it’s now May 2021 & I’m so happy with my decision. I bled everyday for like the first 45 days & I’d have these random sharp cramps like contractions. But after that it’s been smooth sailing. I was worried about acne & low mood but it hasn’t affected me in those ways at all. The only annoying thing about IUD is that it can move around so you have to check it every month & maybe go to the doctor if it moves. But it’s such a stress free birth control option for me. I do think that birth control is trial & error which sucks because you put your body through so much to figure out what works for you. Because everyone’s body is different so you can’t go based off other people’s experiences. I’m loving this though :)

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Obviously, everyone’s body is different, but if you’ve struggled with other birth controls, I don’t recommend this one. I got the Mirena inserted two days ago. The pain during was absolutely awful. Immediately after I felt light headed and on the verge of throwing up. Took me 30 min before I could drive and I didn’t even make it home. The rest of the day and the day after, I was throwing up, having painful cramps, no appetite, headache, and pelvic pain. Two days later and I just have no appetite. Any time I eat, I get nauseous. I’ve had bad experiences in the past with birth control as my body just doesn’t react well to the added hormones. I’m probably going to get it taken out next week; I can’t stand this anymore.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):So I just had it put in today and was scared after reading the reviews so once I saw all the equipment on the table and saw how long it was I was more scared. I asked GOD to help me and just laid there telling myself not to tense and trying not to tense, and it was a breeze. I did feel it get inserted in my insides but nothing painful just a discomfort but not to bad on a scale from 1 to 10 I would say a 1 level I just had my baby 7 or so weeks agoSo far I am bleeding so its a wait game to see what happensOnly other birth control I had back in 2013 through 2014 was Mirena and no complaints there I did loose all my pregnancy weight at 10 months So just hoping I don't get fat with this one since this was #6 and I'm already older and metabolism isn't the same like my first

Mirena (levonorgestrel):This is my second time with Mirena. I first had it for 5 years and had it removed to try for pregnancy. I got pregnant, had my baby them and had a new one inserted after 6 weeks. I never had an issue the first time other than spotting every few months. I am not at my 6 year mark as they have  extended the removal recommendation to 7 years. I am not bleeding after sex a lot. I am spotting every couple months. I have had an annual pap and nothing seems to be abnormal. I am thinking about getting it out and trying something different.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 25 now and have tried 3 different hormonal birth control pills over the past 8ish years. I had horrible mood swings, low sex drive, but most inconveniencing was the bleeding between periods. For the past few years, no matter what pill I took, I bled between periods. I'm only a couple months into having Kyleena, but I wanted to compare my experience with others.  The insertion itself was uncomfortable, but not nearly as bad as I thought. The cramping within the first 3 days, however, was some of the worst I've ever experienced. It was horrible, and I'm glad I called off work from the get-go. Aleve helped A LOT though. I don't experience the cramping now, other than occasional mild cramping. I can already tell a difference in my mood, for the better. My face has broken out, but like someone else said, my derm has prescribed me spironolactone for a while. For me, the elimination of mood swings and abnormal bleeding was worth all the cramping and tiny breakouts in the world.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla 2.5 years. The insertion pain was quick and about a 4/10 but then cramps lasted for about a week or two after. It wasn't bad just uncomfortable. I didn't have a period while on it. I was on birth control 4 years before and got Skyla at age 20. Instantly I felt relief from birth control symptoms I didn't even know I was having!!!!! My mind was more clear, my energy was increased, my libido increased, and sex felt even better. Unfortunately, I had NEVER in my life had a pimple and suddenly my face was covered in acne with absolutely nothing able to fix it. I got on Spironolactone which didn't help the acne but anyone looking to lose weight I 100% suggest taking it. Anyways, after trying everything to get rid of the acne I finally decided to get it taken out. It's been a while and I still haven't been able to get my acne back in check. I wish I had never gotten it but if it wasn't for the acne I would have loved it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Having read lots of scary stories online about coils, I have to say I’ve loved having this.First few weeks after insertion are crazy wild with cramping, breast pain like you wouldn’t believe but it does settle down as your body adjusts to it. 3 months in I feel really happy I decided to have it put in and periods are lighter and no issues with skin or spots.Would definitely recommend. Very happy so far.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the Liletta inserted shortly after my second child was born. While on Liletta, I did notice an extreme uptick in my sex drive which has been great. But, like others -  my anxiety was out of control, moods were up/down, there was an odd odor all the time.  But the constant bleeding was what had me mostly concerned. I literally bled non stop. It would be consistent for three weeks, wane off for two, back for a few days, away for another few days, etc. It was awful. I complained to my OB and he chalked it off to your body is getting used to it etc. Finally, one and a half years after insertion, I’m two days post removal (had a Mirena put in on Wednesday after getting the Liletta out) and I feel awesome. No pain, physically lighter. My jeans fit better- no bloating, my mood is incredibly brighter- no odor, and NO BLOOD! My experience with the Liletta was not a favorable one.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):So I got this put in after my 2nd child, 6 years ago and this is not what I wanted.  I was supposed to have my tubes tied, I had my daughter at 24 weeks & during birth my placenta ruptured &  had to be removed ( horribly painful) my OBGYN decided it would be more safe to get the IUD because of the trauma I had just went through. I delivered when I was 137lb now I’m 182lb and nothing has changed except the IUD. I really hadn’t put it together until a friend told me her experience with liletta. I’ve also had terrible depression & I’m  on medication for depression (Wellbutrin)&(Topamax & Fiorecet) for migraines. I wrote my experience to urge women to pay attention to yourself, I may have connected the dots sooner if I did. I know not all are bodies are the same, so do what you think is best just pay attention. Also by all means this IUD did keep me from becoming pregnant again so it did do it’s job in that department.I just want to return to my normal self physically and mentally.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena  IUD inserted almost 2 years ago because I wanted a longer lasting form of birth control. I have no children. The insertion was not bad at all and going into the appointment I had just taken the max recommended dose of ibuprofen. It was a 3/10 on pain. 5/10 for the cramping and spotting afterwards. I kept a consistent, but much lighter  cycle for the first 9 months. Then it disappeared entirely, which I loved at first.. However, I also experienced significant hair loss. I have gained 15+ pounds inexplicably and am bloated regularly. My hair/skin is OILY like never before, such that acne has definitely worsened on my chin, neck, chest. My derm prescribed me spironolactone for hormonal acne, but it has not helped much and the side effects (constantly peeing, dry mouth) don’t make it worth it. My partner has also observed moodiness / bouts of depression and very low libido. I plan to get it removed and will switch to either Yaz for my skin’s sake or the non-hormonal copper iud.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had 2 Mirena's placed the 1st was inserted incorrectly caused a moderate amount of cramping and an ovarian cyst that dissolved on it's own. I had the one removed about a 4 months later and immediately got pregnant with my son. About a year after he was born I had my 2nd Mirena placed and had no issues with placement. The first month I had a mild headache and mild spotting daily. Year 2, at best I had 2 irregular periods a year. Year 3 & 4 the depression started to set in, suicidal thoughts came as well. I just had mine removed about a week ago and I feel like a dark cloud has been removed. I made it to 4 years and 8 months, but I decided enough was enough with feeling like that. I do not take any daily medications that could have caused an interaction either. I mentioned to my doctor upon removal that depression was my sole reason for removing the IUD early and she says to "just monitor" my thoughts going forward.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for about 2.5 years now. The insertion gave me mild cramps, but not too much pain. For the first two years, I had no period. Then, randomly, I started having periods again. My cycle was also shorter, the shortest being 17 days total. Before getting the IUD, I hardly ever experienced cramping and my periods came like clockwork. Now, I’m wincing in pain monthly. I have not experienced much weight gain, acne, or other negative side effects, but having no period for a year, then suddenly having painful periods and short, random cycles is an unwelcome development. I talked to a gynecologist about it and she said that starting an irregular period after having an IUD for a while is normal. Still, it’s unpleasant. I will say that it has done a great job preventing pregnancy in my experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Overall this has been amazing!! I had so many negative side effects from birth control such as mood swings, no sex drive at all I went from being a very sexual person to never wanting to have sex, insomnia, and I would uncontrollably cry before my periods. Since switching to the Kyleena I have returned to normal and feel like myself again finally! I have had no negative effects besides some random mild cramping...truly just feels like period cramps! The insertion was not horribly painful and I have a low pain tolerance. It was 3 minutes of pain for 5 years definitely worth it in my mind! If you're considering switching to a Kyleena IUD don't let other peoples experiences on here discourage you it works differently for everyone and was the best decision I ever made for me!
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The procedure was very uncomfortable.  My periods have become lighter.   I was so scared and nervous that I almost passed out on exam table.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is truly the worst birth control I’ve ever had. I used to take the pill, and never had my period more than 4 days. Now I get my period for weeks at a time twice a month. Not to mention the insane mood swings & anxiety I experienced after getting this. And intense cramps for the days leading up to and throughout the duration of my period. Do not recommend, it keeps getting worse!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Honestly, would highly recommend for long term birth control. Getting it was pretty painful, but short. I’d say for me it was a 9/10 with pain for about a minute and I took pain relief medication before insertion. I’m on year four of five, and couldn’t be happier. My periods are extremely light — like all I need is a liner — and all side effects I had are basically gone at this point (mostly just heavy cramps during my period the first year or so). I didn’t really have much pain at all after insertion. I'm so glad I went with a long term birth control that I can just forget about.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD in January 2020- I had to get off the pills because of my migraines. Getting it in was not as painful for as it is for some and for the first few months it was great. One positive is I love that I only have periods every few months. However, I had never had acne my entire life and about 3 months after I got it I started breaking out everywhere (face, chest, back). I got on strong acne meds but now I have permanent scaring on my face.  I also gained 2-5 pounds a month starting 6 months after I got it and have now gained almost 25 pounds. I started experiencing anxiety and depression like never before and have decided to get it removed next week. I know it works for some people but it really has not worked for my body.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND, horrible experience with Kyleena, it caused had horrible acne, weight gain, and even my mental state was going down hill while on it. To top it all off mine decided to come out on it’s own, it wasn’t an easy process whatsoever. I was bleeding horribly on my periods so when it came out I thought I was having my period, little did I know you can see it when I lift my leg. So I had to go to urgent care because no gynecologist was open and they said that they couldn’t help me and if my bleeding kept happening I would have to go to the emergency room. Things have gotten worse I was bleeding even more I was experiencing chills and I lost color so I had to go to the emergency room pay even more money and they said as it was trying to come out it was cutting me so they had to open me up with the little duck tool and take it out ended up with a huge bill from my insurance, the emergency room and urgent care.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):The insertion (12/30/2020) was probably the most traumatic experience of my life, I passed out afterwards due to the pain and meds my dr gave me. 4 months in and I’m  still getting excruciating cramps every day. They are severe to the point of taking my breath away or even vomiting. Plus constant nausea just like morning sickness but all day. My eczema has returned on my scalp and hands/feet, with my prescription medicine no longer working. I also experience severe anxiety now. I have absolutely no sex drive anymore. I’m developing painful cystic acne on my chin, jawline, and forehead. I’m meeting with a new doctor next week for a second opinion on my reproductive health as my current doctor has listened to none of my concerns and tells me that they’ve heard no complaints from their other patients about the Liletta. This forum obviously proves otherwise! The only positive to this IUD is that it prevents pregnancy but at this point, I wouldn’t be surprised if it didn’t.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Placed in 2017 and removed in 2021. If you have a small frame, are sensitive, or prone to depression Kyleena isn't for you. I felt my IUD in my body for the duration of having it. I didn't realize how much daily pain I had due to it. Removal was a HUGE relief.Placement pain varies; best comparison is to think of your cramps- if you generally suffer from chronic pain then  insertion could hurt more. It feels like 2 quick hot pinchs in the cervix. Then there was pain after like severe period cramps, only lasted about 12 hrs.After placement I had random sharp pain in my uterus with movement, like jabs from a piece of sharp plastic. Intercourse was only affected in this respect; fear of pain from IUD. My libido/ lubrication weren't affected. Severe depression due to Kyleena. Within weeks of placement symptoms were apparent. (I speak about depression because since removal most symptoms have fallen off). My digestive system and bowels were affected. This ceased with removal too.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It was.. okay. Terrible cramps the first 8 months. Never before have I felt any as bad as those. They were crippling so bad I would almost keel over if I was out somewhere.Plus light abnormal bleeding all the time in the first 5 months. It's been almost 3 years and still get random cramps all the time when I'm not on my period. Occasionally they're as bad as they used to be. But I don't have to worry about remembering to take a pill, or inject anything into me, so I still prefer it. My period is almost nonexistent. I sometimes doesn't get it at all, and when I do it's only a day or two of the lightest period ever. I would still recommend an IUD. No period, no worries, no nothing.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got Kyleena 3 months ago and I was very scared of gaining weight and acne, none of that has happened. The only con was the insertion. I have an extremely high pain tolerance and it was the worst pain I've felt in my life. The pain only lasted 2 seconds but it is extremely worth it. It beats having to take a pill everyday. Very satisfied I got it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my first Kyleena IUD placed at age 20 and just had my OBGYN place a new one a few weeks ago since it was set to expire soon (it's a 7 year IUD but they replace after 5). I haven't had anything more than the occasional period spotting over the past 5 years, which I am VERY pleased with. Not the case for everyone, but it has saved me a ton of money on feminine products, horrible cramping, stress, etc. I used to have excessive menstrual cycles lasting 1-2 weeks, and I did not like the way the oral contraceptive made me feel (e.g., weight gain, mood swings, lack of energy, etc). Now I just check my strings once a month and go about my life. The worst part is the initial insertion, but honestly, if you take ibuprofen beforehand and expect cramping during insertion and within the first few hours afterward you'll be perfectly fine!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Let me tell you I was terrified after reading the horrific reviews about Mirena, I can only say that I got it about 2 hours ago and it was so painful for me, I got it on my second day of menstruation and took the medicine I was prescribed to take a night before and in the morning before Mirena. I am not sure if its less painful for women who have given natural birth, but I had a c-section because I didn't dilate enough, so I had to get emergency c section.My experience during insertion was so painful after insertion I felt dizzy, hot , nauseous, almost felt like a panic attack. I had to sit and wait for 15 mins approx to be able to walk and drive home. After 30 mins I would say my cramps got better, almost no pain I feel good.I hope I get a good experience with Mirena from now on

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Had a Mirena inserted as birth control after a miscarraige upon recommendation by my hospital. Prior to this I had very regular, light periods. Instantly had issues with the Mirena, caused irregular bleeding, heavy bleeding, lots of discharge and generally problematic. Had the Mirena out 8 months after having it in as the complications and erratic bleeding was unbearable. It has been 3 years since taking the Mirena out and I now seem unable to get pregnant agent. My cycle has never returned to normal, oscillating between 3 weeks to 10 weeks. I warn any woman who wants to have a baby do NOT get this device. I am thoroughly devastated and wish someone would have told me my periods would never return to normal.Note - this is after multiple returns to the hospital and assurances every time 'it will take some time but it wont be long'.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena in Dec 2017 to help my mood and heavy periods. I bled almost every day for the first 6 months.  From 6 months  to 1 year I started to get my period at somewhat normal timings but I was getting my period for 10-11 days as opposed to 6-7 days before IUD. I just kept telling myself it’s just gonna take time for my body to regulate. Another year went by with the same thing, plus it also amplified PMS symptoms. I went in multiple times to ask if this was normal and I even got an ultrasound of my stomach to make sure everything was in place and nothing wrong. At about 2.5 years I started spotting 7 days before my periods, so I was bleeding for around 17 days per month. Finally at 3 years I said enough is enough and got it removed. After removed the first couple weeks I didn’t feel any changes but now I am two months after removed and I am having the worst anxiety/depression/brain fog that I’ve ever had in my life and I’m wondering if it has to do with getting my IUD removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The insertion of Kyleena wasn't painful at all, in fact I didn’t even feel it! I had some sharp cramps after insertion for a couple of days, and bled for about 3 weeks on and off. I have it in some time now and have no mood changes, some small acne spots on my chin but it’s clearing up.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion hurt so bad I screamed. A month later (horrible cramps almost daily) I woke up in the middle of the night shaking uncontrollably. I couldn’t stop and I wanted to go to the ER. I was able to sleep through it but when I woke up in the morning my heart felt wrong. I felt every single heart beat and it felt like my heart was working too hard. Went to urgent care and they did nothing. A few days later I got dizzy and felt like I was going to faint so I went to the ER. They told me nothing was wrong and sent me home. My gyn said that there was NO WAY the IUD was causing my heart palpitations anxiety dizziness chest tightness and panic attacks for 6 months.My symptoms got under control for 1.5 yrs then came back. 3 years 9 months later I can barely function some days without taking Xanax. Before the IUD I had mild anxiety (under control) but now its horrible and I still get heart palpitations. I was FINE BEFORE GETTING KYLEENA. Removing in a few days.Pros no period or pregnancy

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Like anyone else I read many many stories about getting the coil inserted and to be quite honest, I almost cancelled my appointment I was that nervous/scared. I had my coil fitted 2nd April, the pain was no where near as bad as everyone made out to be, just felt a little bit uncomfortable !! The cramping for an hour or two after was a little painful but nothing paracetamol and ibuprofen couldn’t handle ! Besides the pain on the day I have had absolutely no pain whatsoever and no spotting/bleeding ! Not sure whether I'm just a lucky one or if people are just extremely dramatic !! But take my advice and NEVER read horror stories before, everyone’s pain tolerance is different, therefore everyone’s experience will be different !!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The reviews were worse than the insertion. Lol! I was so hesitant and insertion was nothing compared to having my daughter! I didn’t feel much of anything and I couldn’t believe that I waited so long to get it. I had my son Jan 2018 and opted not to get and guess what 6 months later I was pregnant with my daughter after being on BC pills. So April of 2019 she arrived and not long after I was scheduling Kyleena! So far it’s been almost 2 years and I have no complaints at all. My periods are light but extremely predictable. My husband does say he can feel it but it’s not bad.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena for 5 years. Year 1-2 was pretty numb and foggy minded. I lost 15-20 pounds, how ever I was highly active. Still spotted. Year 3 depression hit, suicidal thoughts which scared me and led to do more research and found so many forums like this to give a story. Year 4-5 I got control of my mental health, the numbness was slowly going away, but still didn't have control over my feelings at this point climax during sex was non existent, sex drive was still there and periods were completely gone. Putting it on was painful and felt cramps for 3 days. The first doctor I went to needed to surgically remove it, but the second doctor took it out with out an issue zero pain no side effects and I started my period for the first time in 4 years on time. Huge pro ZERO kids, I was able to plan my life accordingly. Zero periods were cool. It felt 110% effective.  Note: If you get on the IUD please note down all side effect symptoms and focus on your mental health

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena inserted about 3 months ago and honestly it was the best decision I made for myself. I have kind of abnormal anatomy (large and antiverted uterus) and it did take my ob/gyn a couple extra minutes than usual to get it in perfect place. I had little pain during insertion which was like two intense cramps lasting 30 seconds and I was fine within 5 minutes and walked home from the clinic with no pain or bleeding. My period came on schedule but I did experience more intense cramping and heavy bleeding for two weeks followed by spotting for 3 weeks and then it stopped completely. I haven’t had a period since and I am not pregnant. no cramping, no hormonal acne, no effect on my mood or weight, no effect on libido (just as high as it was before insertion) and no problems. It works great for me so far, better than the pill personally.
Liletta (levonorgestrel):So overall, the IUD has been a blessing. It made my sex drive go up to the point that my boyfriend of 10 years avoids going to bed at the same time as me if he’s tired

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got my IUD a couple days ago had cramping for the first night and a little into the next morning nothing worse then intense period cramps barely hurt at all to get inserted. I was able to have intercourse the next day and my spotting has been little to none since insertion. This has been super amazing and so far my experience has been amazing. I’m 21.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Took paracetamol and ibuprofen before insertion. Insertion was actually okay, MUCH better than all the scare stories I had heard. It was weird as it just feels like a part of your body you haven’t felt before (womb) and pinching for like 10 seconds max. Immediately after felt a bit faint, but then for the rest of the day was fine. The week after insertion to be honest had some pretty bad cramps and period - dosing up with painkillers helps a lot. Had cramps for a few months on and off but they became less with time. Don’t get cramps at all now, only occasionally mildly on period. Periods irregular for about 8 months, but after that became pretty regular. No mood swings (which I’ve had for all pills -combined & progesterone only I’ve tried), no weight gain, but had some bad acne (which I’ve never suffered with before) that appeared only about 1 year after but has been treatable with antibiotics. Worth getting this 100%, would recommend and wish I’d got it sooner!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The insertion was not bad for me. The doctor told me to cough as she pushed it in & I felt nothing at all. I was SO afraid of the pain but there was none. I had cramps for 5 days which were bad. All was fine, and its carefree for sure, BUT... It took about a year to notice that it has to be the reason behind my weight gain, and now, after 2.5 years, I am pretty CERTAIN that it is. I am about 15-20kg heavier! I am heartbroken. I also have acne that I didn't have while on the pill. I have NO libido whatsoever, but I didn't really have any on the pill either. It's still 'valid' for 2.5 years but I would like to have it removed, and I'd like to go back to the pill. It's been an effective contraceptive, and I know that women do not react the same, so the rating is in my experience. You won't know unless you try, but just know that side effects are common, because these are hormones we are dealing with. Try it, and give it a year to see how you react, if you do want to try it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena in October 2020. The insertion made me cramp and was uncomfortable, but manageable. The worst pain was the next days to follow. I took the allowed dosage of ibuprofen that week every day. Around 4 am, I would wake up crying from the worst cramps in my life. After that week, I still don’t know I have an IUD  unless I am on my period. My periods are much lighter and shorter, however, the cramps are insanely painful. I’ve had this IUD for over 6 months and I just woke up crying from cramps. I just took 600 mg of ibuprofen and I’m waiting for it to kick in. Overall this birth control is doing what it needs to do. I just wish the cramps weren’t so awful. I was on the nuva ring for 7 years previously and never experience cramps like this. I would recommend this birth control, even though the cramps for me personally suck the beginning of my period.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got Mirena IUD 2 days ago. The experience was not bad. It felt like a period cramp but 2x worse, but only for 5 seconds twice. Not extremely painful, honestly it was just 5 seconds of pain. It was my first day of my period and she said it was an easy insertion. I recommend getting it first day of your period, made it less painful. MAKE SURE TO BREATH WHILE GETTING IT. I did not breath and got really nauseous for 20 minutes. Other than that, it didn't hurt at all. Get it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am writing this review after a lawsuit I had with Bayer Bayer over the issues I had with Mirena. Long story short, it had perforated my uterus, and got caught up in my intestines requiring an emergency surgery to have it removed. This happened after 3 years from insertion. I do not recommend anyone to get this IUD!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got this IUD placed on Nov. 18th 2019. After about 6 weeks I noticed my hair seemed deflated towards the middle after my stylist pointed it out. My scalp around the same time started to itch really bad. It would come and go. When it was really bad it would itch for days.  I had a lot going on during that time so I wasn’t sure if it was related to stress. My hair started to tangle badly and became brittle. I eventually looked up mirena and itchy scalp and saw some people saying the same thing. I got it removed in March 17th 2021. I had to shave my head and see a dermatologist.  She had to prescribe 3 different medicines. It’s been a month and my scalp is almost completely back to normal.  I would not recommend this to anyone. My PCP and OB GYN had no idea what was going on. The only thing it did do was completely stop my period, but it was not worth losing my hair and suffering from itchy scalp.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Heavier than usual period without cramps in the first month. Used ADVIL extra liqui- gels + TYLENOL regular for nausea. Bleeding stopped right away. Apparently period can be heavier initially & then become lighter later. I plan to use this combination of pills for first 6 months, and going forward if needed.  Going for a string check in 2 days. I'm happy with Kyleena so far & expect all is well - it will work better for me than Mirena due to lower dosage & smaller size.I've had 3 Mirenas in the past. With the first two, I experienced various side effects &  malpositioning after about a year each. The third was similar & expelled itself after 6 months with heavy bleeding, clots & cramps. Mirena was always covered for me & I preferred to try it to reduce my menstrual flow - a result that I never got, athough it was effective as a birth control. Kyleena is not covered for me, but I'm happy to pay for it to avoid side effects etc. Quite pleased with Kyleena right now. Yay!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have tried pill after pill and each time I am left feeling depressed, anxious, and not myself. The last pill I took left me feeling out of whack for 3 months after stopping.  After that, I decided it was time to look for a different form of birth control. I was recommended the Mirena IUD. I was absolutely terrified and worried that I would feel out of body again. Hate to break it the news to you, the insertion was pretty painful, but let me tell you, so worth it.  I have now had my IUD for about a month. I feel perfectly fine, nothing painful or odd. My first period with the IUD was completely manageable, minor cramps at most. I feel protected, comfortable, and most importantly, myself. Again, EVERYONE IS DIFFERENT. But I would seriously recommend the Mirena.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the skyla IUD for almost 6 months and it’s definitely not my favorite. I have horrible hormones from this and I have gained weight. I went from 128lb to 137lb just in a couple months which is very out of the norm especially because my diet has not changed at all. I seem to be very irritable all the time which once again I was not like before... I also noticed an increase in anxiety. Every time I feel as this storm has passed it just gets worse.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my Skyla IUD inserted in Feb of 2020, and was excited as I have tried countless hormonal levels of the pill, and the Nuva Ring before. My periods have always been extremely heavy, and prolonged for up to 17 days. I decided with my doctor to get the Skyla IUD after having 6 periods in the course of 2 1/2 months. After a painful insertion process, which left me throwing up, and a month of spotting, I didn’t get a period for 7 months. I was so happy until they hit worse than ever before. I thought maybe my body would normal out, but I continued to have periods lasting from 14-21 days for 4 months. After bleeding from March 5-today, and having excruciating cramps that made me feel like I would faint, my Gyno removed my IUD. I’ve had it out of me for 4 days, and despite the heavy bleeding from removal, my mood, skin, energy levels, and sex drive have improved drastically. Please consider the negative comments before insertion of the Skyla IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my IUD for 1 year and 9 months. The good part is I did not get my period much but of course I panic cause I always think I’m pregnant lol. Anyways, while using kyleena... my mood swings were crazy. I was super mean to my husband, I had severe depression and anxiety and acne . I gained so much weight with it and ITS SO HARD TO LOOSE WEIGHT WITH KYLEENA. Also vaginal dryness was awful, I constantly had yeast infection,  tears, lost so much hair... and my sex drive decreased.  Overall, I did not like it, I got it removed today I just couldn’t handle it anymore.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):9/2016 right after I gave birth I had the Liletta in  and within a day or 2, I wasn't bleeding it completely stopped. Then 5 plus months later I started bleeding heavy for like a month. I asked friends & even Drs my body is trying to adjust still after 45 days.  I felt Ill and exhausted from loss of  blood, then  to find out my IUD fell out! They did more testing before insertion of a new one during that time and the appointments I was denied a replacement because we'll I was pregnant!! After I had my second child they replaced it sometime in Feb 2018 I've had no more periods sense no pregnancies now just extreme pain inside my vaginal area around my uterus I have an infection on my uterus, a UTI on 2 antibiotics and need vaginal ultrasound to try to find my IUD because they can"t find it, can't feel the strings or even sure it hasn't taken it's own  route. I hurt inside like nails dragging and scratching inside. I have no sex drive because of the pain and if I give in and have sex I have blood on my toilet paper when I wipe.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):PLEASE READ THIS! I was so hopeful to get the Kyleena since I had a bad reaction to birth control pills! I originally wanted the Paragard but my old doctor talked me into the Kyleena. Soon after inserted, I started getting side effects (mood swings, acne, hair loss, depression, insomnia, loss of appetite but still being constantly bloated, etc.) I found a new doctor who is double board certified and extremely knowledgeable and she explained that synthetic hormones (specifically BC pills) compromise the gut microbiome which is responsible for almost our entire body’s function. As doctors say the gut is the second brain. Unfortunately medical findings take 10 years to hit medical school so that is why only doctors who are constantly researching know modern info. The vagina actually has its own micro biome too! Since the synthetic hormones leak into the gut and bloodstream this is why I had so many side effects.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got my Liletta IUD placed October 2017 and yes, the insertion 100% sucked. However, that lasted only about 5 minutes. I cramped a bit and put a heating pad on me for that night but was completely fine the next day. Overtime I realized that I haven’t experienced any mood swings, headaches, or weight gain! I actually lost weight and I am so happy that I don’t have to take a pill and I love even more that it doesn’t have estrogen in it. More importantly, no baby! I check the wire a few times a month (out of habit) and learned about my body better. I honestly love this birth control. Liletta is by far the best BC I’ve ever had.  The ONLY con for me is that my man can feel the wire when we’re intimate and it sometimes hurts him to the point that he has to stop. I’ve been told it’ll soften up.... buuut it hasn’t. Still, best BC otherwise.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena in November of 2019 and recently got it removed March of 2021. Overall, the experience was not too bad. Of course, the insertion was painful and I bled lightly for 3 continuous months, but then my periods went away. At first notice, I didn’t appear to have any symptoms; however, after a while they started kicking in. I first got chronic BV and a lack of sex drive. I also noticed how I started to  bloat more & my face and body started to get less toned, no matter how healthy I ate and how much I worked out. It’s been around 2 weeks since I got it removed & almost all of my symptoms went away quite instantly. Overall, I honestly would recommend Kyleena just because everyone has different experiences with it & I’m glad I tried it to know it’s not right for me. I hope this helps some people!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for 2 years and I went from 125 lbs to 175 lbs and I can’t loose the weight. I get super bloated and I thought I was due gluten (I'm gluten free) but I think it’s my IUD. I loved everything else about my experience with Skyla but it’s time I get it removed so my body can go back to normal.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):After almost two years of agony I finally got my IUD taken out. I had this IUD in after the birth of my second son. My experience was horrific to say the least. I was irritable, moody, had fits of rage, depression, ZERO sex drive. I also experienced a deformity of my body, my hips and legs got skinnier while my stomach, arms, and face gained weight. Wrinkles and dry skin too. I had joint paint, back pain, and  frequent urination. I felt as if I stayed pregnant for all these years. Anyway, I had it taken out two months ago and my pain has diminished, my mood is better, and stomach is flat again. Unfortunately, my period is now irregular and I am pretty sure I am not ovulating. My husband and I want more children and now I am worried my fertility has been affected! I am going crazy trying to find supplements to balance my hormones again. I warn you do NOT get this IUD or any hormonal birth control. Especially if you are not done having children. This product should be against the law.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Had this Liletta IUD put in January 2020 because of irregular and heavy periods. The insertion was not bad. I experienced cramps for a day or two. But the spotting that followed was unreal. It lasted about 5 months accompanied with my regular, irregular periods. Additionally, I have gained 15 pounds which is frustrating considering that I have maintained a consistent weight my whole adult life (except pregnancy) due to following a strict exercise and diet regimen.  My sex drive is also completely gone, and been replaced with headaches, mood swings, anxiety, and depression. I am grateful to have found this website to learn this is not all in my head and others have experienced the same side effects. It’s not worth it anymore, and will be having the IUD removed shortly.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was on the pill for about 5 years and after a while, I started breakthrough bleeding. The pill was pretty good besides that, but I wanted to try an IUD. I liked the idea of Paragard because no hormones but I was low-key talked into the Kyleena or Mirena... I went with kyleena. It was okay at first, insertion I'd give a 3-4/10 and bleeding wasn't too crazy. I ended up kinda losing my period, but I still had that weird shadow of breakthrough bleeding. The real thing that did it for me was the hair loss and acne. So bad, after about 7-8 months with kyleena I got it switched to ParaGard; no more huge clumps of hair falling out and only like 1-2 pimples during period. Periods got a little heavier and cramps are a tad annoying, it's totally fine though. Throughout the whole process, my periods have been a little irregular, maybe 28 days one month and 40 the next. Since ParaGard it seems to be balancing out. Hope this helps, remember to always be an advocate for your own health.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena for two years. The insertion was extremely painful but I also have an extremely retroverted uterus and the IUD applicator is pretty rigid and straight. Anatomy wise, the pain can likely be attributed to this and my providers underestimation of ease of application. It took the doc three tries to place the IUD which was super painful. I wish she would have prescribed miso to dilate my cervix and help with the pain and insertion difficulty. I had intense cramps that day even with Tylenol, Motrin, and heating pad. I had heavy bleeding for 4-5 months. After a year, my period went to about a week vs the two weeks for first year. I also lost weight and had no acne. The IUD levelled out my emotions and no mood swings or such like BC pills in the past. I just wanted to share because everyone’s anatomy is different and you should do your own research and see if it is best for you.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I received the Liletta in October 2018 and I am getting it removed in April. I absolutely can't stand this damn thing. It is the worst decision I made in life. I originally got it for the sake of not having my period. Well that was a lie. When I first got it, I bled for almost 3 months straight. But I didn't want to be a sore loser, I said I would stick it out. My life has been nothing but a spot show. All I do is spot, even for up to two weeks at a time. Yes it made my periods lighter but its like I have not stop bleeding. It is awful and can't wait to have it out of me. Someone referred the Junel birth control pill to me and I think that is what I am going to try. I can not wait until April, I'm over this thing!
Mirena (levonorgestrel):Uncomfortable. Sleepless nights. Bad skin. Weight gain. Dark depression. Suicidal. Terrible thing. UK

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am 40 and never been pregnant, insertion was a bit painful but not horrible. What was horrible, though, was the cystic acne all over my neck and chest. Absolutely nothing helped with it other than removal. The acne cropped up within a few weeks of insertion and completely went away after IUD removal. Also gained weight and had longer periods. It was not for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted mid December 2020 and have had an overall positive experience. Insertion was quite painful however this pain only lasts about a minute at most and is 100% worth it! After insertion I had no cramping for a day or two. After that I have had random cramping and have been given medical advice on this that it is just the coil still settling and my body adjusting to it so I am hoping this eases within the next few months. As far as bleeding goes I have had none at all which is amazing since I have struggled in the past with bleeding every day on other methods of contraception. Myself or my partner cannot feel the coil during intercourse and this is no longer a worry for me. Before insertion I was struggling with psychological effects of being on both contraceptive pills and injection and these have since dramatically improved.  I would 100% recommend kyleena and put the horror stories out your mind until you try it for yourself.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Worked to stop my periods and was good for 3 years. Some intermittent cramping but other than that it was fine. Gave me an ectopic pregnancy, which is an increased risk with the Mirena which I feel was not properly disclosed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I love Kyleena! This is my second IUD, first one was before my son was born and had that copper IUD replaced with Kyleena and was the best decision ever. I had extremely heavy bleeds with the copper one and almost nothing now after 2 years of having Kyleena.. Insertion was painful but manageable with pain meds - Advil helped a lot. Initially had light to moderate periods in the first 3-6 months then gradually lessened until now - I don't even use a pad anymore.  Occasional acne and my hair is oily but nothing that is major. I wouldn't trade it for anything else.. I recommend it to anyone I know.. It was covered by both mine and my husband's insurance so it was free..

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had a lot of negative side effects. - My hair gets greasy within 16 hours and I'm not able to train it anymore. I've had to resort to washing my hair every morning because of the hormones in the IUD. - I've had  new hair growth because the IUD is progesterone based. Black hair on my stomach and lower part of my butt and upper thighs. I have honestly considered getting laser hair removal because I can't even wear a swimsuit anymore. - I am one of the unlucky ones, where I cramp pretty bad almost every 2-3 days due to the IUD. And it's not misplaced either. - I've had to start taking acne medication because I was getting very painful cystic acne constantly because of the IUD. Even with the medication, I am still getting acne.Honestly, I would weigh your options - the pros and cons for the IUD. I don't regret having an effective birth control against pregnancy, but I regret all of the stress and negative effects it's put me through.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had this IUD in since 10/2018. I originally had the paragard in since 2010. When I talked with my Gynecologist she recommended the Liletta to stop or slow down my periods. Sure enough I have not had a period since 11/2018 and it’s 3/2021 . Yes I did gain 5lbs but I have lost it since the initial gain. I have 2 more years and no complaints here.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I used Kyleena to avoid heavy periods due to my chronic low iron levels. Had no issues with  insertion and removal. I bled for four weeks then had it removed as my iron levels dropped further. I also developed severe depression from it, four months later and I'm still recovering from the side effects. Would not recommend.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had it in for a year and a half, I gained 50 lbs and even when I tried to lose weight, I could only lose 5 lbs from a month of working out. I also had prolonged and heavier menstruations.  I was told it would regulate after a few months but that never happened and I even started getting cramps and back aches which I never had before the IUD. I took it out March 4th 2021 and I have lose 7 lbs already! This was a nightmare of an IUD and I will definitely never get an IUD again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'll start by saying that I typically have really painful periods and cramping is usually bad for me in the first few days. I was never told by my doctor how painful insertion would be and if I had known you could not pay me all the money in the world to do it again. The pain was so severe I was screaming in the office, it felt like someone took a knife to my uterus and there was constant sharp pains while she was measuring and "stabilizing my uterus". Worst pain I have ever felt in my life and if it is anything like having kids I will not even bother having them now. I've had it for a week and I'm still experiencing awful cramps. Seeing these reviews I really hope I do not have more acne and mood swings but honestly it doesn't seem like this will help me at all with that, only make it worse. Good luck if you do this and make sure to take a pain reliever prior as I didn't and it was torture.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had Liletta since August 2018, so it's been almost 3 years. My periods have always been light, and after getting the IUD they completely went away. I forget that it's there! For me it has been a worry free experience.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Hi sisters. This is my review only of the insertion, as I just had the Mirena put in 2 hours ago. Before the appointment, I took the recommended Motrin, Ativan (to calm my nerves) and the medication that softens your cervix, which my gyno was kind enough to prescribe for me to hopefully make the insertion process smoother.  The entire process took no more than 5 minutes. It felt like a slightly longer pap exam, with more pressure than usual. I didn’t cramp, I didn’t yelp in pain, and I didn’t pass out or feel sick. What got me through my anxiety was taking deep breaths. It was not excruciating as I expected it to be, since I have never given birth (I’m 40, btw). Here’s hoping this device works for me and agrees with my body. I had been on the pill for over 20 years, and I look forward to not having to take them every day.  I’ll report back in a few months with an update. Good luck to all of you ladies. Do what is best for you.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was recommended to get this inserted to reduce menstrual bleeding. After eight months, I am now having periods that last for more than two weeks, with spotting in between. I then have less than a two week break before the next one starts. The doctor is unable to get it out, so I have to schedule a surgery with a general anaesthetic. As I'm trying to move interstate, this is massively inconvenient and stressful. Not to mention all the time taken off work and expenses incurred. This has had a hugely negative impact on my life and I wouldn't recommend it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kylenna about 7 months ago now. The pain when getting it inserted was bad, but not unbearable. I had cramps right after, and for several days after inserting. I also bleed a lot, but I had heavy periods before the IUD so I expected that. For the first few months it was great, didn’t even notice it was there. No periods, no cramps, no nothing. I’ve just hit the 7 month mark and I’ve been bleeding for 10 days straight now (my first ‘period’ since getting the Kyleena) the bleeding is light, it’s too light for a light tampon, but heavy enough that I need to wear a pad during the day. I’ve been increasing getting worse and worse cramps as the months go by.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I give this IUD a higher rating due to its effectiveness. It definitely does its job. However, the side effects were very much like taking the pill. I’ll keep in mind that every woman’s body reacts differently to different things, but just like the pill, my body wasn’t reacting well to the hormones. I experienced mood swings , anxiety, and low tolerance to stress. I had to switch to non-hormonal after 3 months.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena for birth control and bad period pain. I had it in for 3 years. Overall a terrible experience. After insertion I bleed straight for 6 months. I got bad acne and didn’t see any improvement in my period pain. I gained 30kgs. I had two ectopic pregnancies with the Mirena in place (3rd year after insertion), it was removed after the second ectopic pregnancy. It also made me have terrible mood swings.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena for a year and actually loved it and I usually have all the bad side effects from birth control but this one did not make me crazy or gain weight etc; HOWEVER, I had it removed because I’m in a new relationship and he and I both could feel it which was uncomfortable. After having it removed I was spotting then that turned into dam, I was  near hemorrhaging, I had huge golf ball size clots of blood basically pouring out of me so I had to go to the ER. But since my CBC levels were good they just monitored me and sent me home after a while, I had to go back 2 separate times in a weeks period because I was nervous about the amount of blood I was losing, well that was almost a year ago and I’m still dealing with random bleeding and extended periods, that IUD mucked me up for life I feel, it damaged my insides somehow and I’ve been to the Doctors multiple times for abnormal bleeding and they basically have no answer for me. So thanks Kyleena for ruining my life and insides

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for two months (I was using if to provide progesterone so I could take estrogen for HRT).  The first two weeks were fine, afterwards had one month of insatiable hunger which then settled. Though I know I only ate around 8000 calories total more in that month, my face became puffy pretty much all the time and my body ballooned so none of my clothes would fit- even jeans I could wear when I gained ten pounds once before were impossible even to get the button near the button hole. I work out 5-6 x a week and was doing keto at the time. The doctor was shocked when I got on the scale - he gave me a diuretic but this didn’t help. Also my skin kept breaking out and I was having light stomach cramps almost every day. My mood was fine and sex drive was fine. I know from experience that some bc and HRT methods are wonderful and some just don’t suit me but usually I can tell immediately as my body responds within days- this time it was subtle and now I’m off it and have a heck of a lot of weight to lose. I hope it’s mostly water retention...

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’m 27 w/ 0 pregnancies & always had a normal period cycle & light flow yet I have the worst period cramps. I got my IUD placed 06/20 by a specialty gynecologist (I have a tilted cervix/uterus). It took 2 drs 2.5 hours to place the IUD after numerous numbing shots, it was absolutely excruciating. I was bedridden for 3 weeks with the worst cramps all day everyday. I spotted every day for the first 3 months. My period started to lighten drastically & I only have 1-2 real period days per month now. My partner can’t feel the strings nor have I had any pregnancy scares.Ever since getting Skyla, my cramps feel sharper but less intense. My nausea has increased a ton. My sex drive is all over the place, as are my moods. I feel the best way to put it is I’m always PMS-ing. Always! It has increased my IBS symptoms as well. I have been heavily debating having it removed as I don’t feel like my personal experience & symptoms outweighs the fact that I barely have any periods.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got it June 2020 it hurt a little but not bad. My period didn’t go away but no probs. FFW to Nov. bleeding daily severe cramping like sword sharp pain which is really bad! Got moody fighting with my boyfriend over everything depression/anxiety getting worse meds not helping. OB said pain & bleeding was normal so  I went a bit longer getting worse. My regular dr refers me to a diff. OB who tells me it’s normal and to take ibuprofen 2-3x a day will stop pain & bleeding - it didn’t. Meds increased & added still getting worse. came across a horror story so I started digging for info. Then talked to dr again he sent me back to my OB. went 4 days ago & had it removed. OB gave me a hard time but I kept saying I want it out. That sword feeling in my uterus? GONE! mood? Completely turned around! My boyfriend & brother both noticed a huge difference that night & my sister could tell the next morning. I have to adjust to not having the hormones from the IUD & the removal kick started a period which I 1000% expected but I feel soooo much better!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm writing this is tears since the cramps I'm getting are so painful! My hair has fallen out! I'm the heaviest I have been ever! Cystic acne all over my chin and jawline. Painful sex! Spotting throughout the whole month! I'm taken it out in the following days! DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFORE CHOOSING THIS IUD

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I found Mirena 100% effective as birth control. Sadly, my most recent insertion expelled in 6 months, right after a period.  It appears IUDs are not for me. I have had 3 Mirenas inserted within the last decade, and kept them for a total of 3.5 years. I also experienced bleeding and PMS-like side effects with all three IUDs.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):6 months bleeding with no breaks. Only some light spotting days. And then after 13 months my periods became my new  normal 10 days of menstruation with two weeks between. Now at 15 months I am starting to skip periods. 30lb weight gain. Mood swings. And absolutely no sex drive. This works wonderfully for birth control because I don’t even want sex. 0/10 would not recommend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for the past 6 months. I was very nervous to get it placed because all the reviews I had read/watched said it was the worst pain they had ever had. I drank extra water starting and also started taking one Advil every 4-6 hours 4 days before my insertion. I also put icy hot numb cream on my stomach going into the appointment. I barely felt anything. It was uncomfortable but far from painful. I have bled on and off for the last six months, but my period has overall been lighter. The worst is the cramps. I have never experienced cramps like this. They sadly have continued into the 6th month so I am hopeful they will lighten up within the year. If you have a high pain tolerance like me, I am sure you will have a positive experience. And even if you don't, there are plenty of ways to make an IUD work. The best part is knowing I am being extremely safe and that I can feel confident knowing I likely won't get pregnant. And my boyfriend hasn't felt it hehe

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):DO NOT GET KYLEENA!I got Kyleena a year ago in February. My husband and I decide we were done having children, but didn't want to do anything permanent. I had taken birth control pills before, but never found one that worked for me, so that's why I went with Kyleena. Inserting didn't hurt too bad, but I did bleed for several weeks and spotted for months after that. I would bleed after having sex, every time. I cramp really bad during ovulation and now my periods are longer and heavier than before. They used to be light for 5 days, now they are heavy for 8 days!! And then I spot between. I have developed an ovary cysts and PMDD which is an extreme form of PMS. It is effecting my relationship, my work, and friendships. I am getting it removed! Do not get Kyleena, or at least know that this could happen to you.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):PLEASE DO RESEARCH BEFORE GETTING THE KYLEENA IUD :( Getting this thing in is one of my biggest regrets! First off it hurt SO BAD to get in... After insertion I bled for almost 60 days straight!!!!! It was medium to light spotting EVERY SINGLE DAY! If that was not enough.... I developed an ovarian cyst! Sometimes the pain would be so bad I would just cry.... THEN I started going through - and still am going through till I get it removed- major insomnia, mood swings and even depression. Oh also not to mention I get constant yeast infections because of the IUD and it constantly smells like fish in (BV). Don’t forget the cystic acne either!
