For me the insertion was painful, but tolerable. The more annoying thing for me was the cramps that followed for about a day. However, I barely experienced spotting and am feeling completely normal. Overall, I am extremely happy with my choice to go through with insertion.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla in for 4 months and it was horrific. It did not hurt to have it inserted but my pelvic cramping has been so severe! I had to take Ibuprofen around the clock for 4 months straight, including for my wedding and my honeymoon. I also had horrible vaginal dryness and bad mood swings. My periods lasted about 7 days and were very light. I was having such bad cramps I would wake up in the middle of the night in horrible pain, I threw up 3 times because of how horrible the pain was. I had a vaginal ultrasound done to ensure it was in the correct area (which it was). I finally had it removed today and I feel amazing!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had a Kyleena inserted in April mostly for heavy periods caused by fibroids, also for birth control. Let me just tell you - not everyone has those horrible insertion experiences that are described here. I took naproxen a few hours before as well as a lorazepam. I had NO pain. My uterus is even posteriorly located. I have had PAP smears that hurt more than this. It was also over within a few seconds. I did have a drop in blood pressure while in the waiting room after the procedure - I was sweating heavily and felt dizzy but it passed after I went to the bathroom. As for side effects, my periods are basically GONE which is AMAZING. I have had a little bit of acne here and there as well as discharge because of the IUD being a foreign object. Other than that, it has been perfect for me!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The 1st week following Kyleena I had bad cramps and had to take a hot water bottle to work/ take painkillers. Then the pain subsided and I stopped bleeding for a week. However, at the end of the 2nd week of Kyleena I have started bleeding with SEVERE cramps; it felt like my cervix was spasming which was coming and going in waves. I am used to severe period pains but this was a different type of pain; like a pulling/nerve/spasm pain which was unbearable. The bleeding lasted almost 2 weeks, and yesterday I had to go to A&E to have this removed.... I would say however, that I have always suffered with very bad period pains and having spoken to the doctor when getting this removed, she mentioned that if you are going on the coil to reduce pain, then Kyleena is not the one for you. I have also heard great case studies from friends that it has worked well with so I really think it is completed based on your body as an individual. It simply didn't work for me.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Just wanted to share my experience because I think it is really important to add that more often than not people post negative reviews rather than positive because they find it more necessary. Nothing wrong with that, it's just the reason I am posting my review. Please if you are considering birth control talk with your health care provider about what is best for your individual need.Anyways, I got the Mirena about 2 and a half years ago and I have NEVER looked back. I recommend it to all of my girlfriends. Yes there is some discomfort upon insertion but I haven't had my period in 2 and a half years! The amount of money and time and honestly just stress and emotions that I've saved make up for it ten-fold. I also did not gain weight, didn't get acne, and just overall have forgotten I've even had it. No period and no unwanted pregnancy with no side effects, I really couldn't think of a better scenario. I highly recommend if it's something you've been considering.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):If you're having side effects believe that they from the Mirena. I got mine in Oct 2018, ever since then I have been miserable. I didn’t notice much nor did I think it was the Mirena until one day I kept on noticing a pattern , around the time my cycle suppose to come I get these horrible symptoms and this been going on for 7-8 months now with nothing getting better. I had enough went to my gyno to remove it she agreed to remove but could not locate the string it’s in place.  I am so stressed out over this cause the fear of what’s its doing to my body or it might continue to do. I now have to  wait until Oct to be put to sleep  so they can fine it and then  remove it ugh!!!!.  I am really suffering. These are the symptoms am having, IBS and I feel like it’s linked, severe depression & anxiety, back pain, cramping, dizziness, eye dryness, ovarian cyst, cystic pimples on my face & acne, obsessive & racing thoughts, numbness in my feet & the list goes on. The only good  thing is that I am losing more weight than gaining because  I am so  stressed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is my 1 year 10 month check in. The first 90 days were crap because of the bleeding but eventually it was fine. I NEVER get a period. I have had cysts but they come and go and are only briefly present. Compared to period cramps, they’re a breathe of fresh air. If you are experiencing cysts and find it hard to cope, I recommend taking a brith control pill as well because it will stop them. Every now and then, I do experience minor cramps in my uterus but I think it’s because I’m supposed to be starting my period. I do not recommend reading a review that is less than six months because yes, it does sound scary but some people cannot handle it and that’s okay. You shouldn’t let the rougher months scare you. In the long run, I never have to worry about period for the next five years. I don’t bloat. After insertion, go home and rest.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I wanted the copper  IUD since my body hasn't reacted well to hormonal medicines before, but my gyn recommended the smaller Kyleena. Getting it inserted was definitely painful, but manageable. I forgot to take ibuprofen beforehand and went to work (waitressing, so on my feet all night) immediately and it was fine. It's been 4 weeks and I've been spotting every day. And the cramps?? Y'all. 3 or 4 times a week, I'll cramp for hours with the most intense pain. My pain tolerance is high, but these cramps bring me to a full stop where I can't move or breath and I can feel the pain all the way up into my cheeks. Not pregnant so it's doing its job!! My husband doesn't feel anything. Sex hurt the first couple times but not anymore. I'm hoping to wait out a full 12 weeks before deciding if I'll keep it, but the spotting is annoying and the cramps are becoming unbearable. Very slight acne and no weight gain. Extremely tender and swollen breasts. Worth the try.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am very hot and cold about this IUD. I was bleeding/spotting irregularly for the first six months-1 year. My periods have not gotten shorter (last more than a week) but they have gotten lighter. This IUD threw my pH completely off and its something I have been trying to get back under control for months now. It also made it a bit harder to lose weight and made me grow some hair on my chin. Overall I don't regret it but it really messes your hormones up. Taking it out  before expiration date

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted a little less than a month ago. The insertion went great. My doctor numbed the cervix and I felt a tiny pinch of the needle then a small cramp when he measured my uterus depth and that was it. Afterwords I felt excruciating cramps for a few days and I’ve been bleeding for 13 days now. Hopefully it stops soon. I’m going to stick it out and hope my body regulates and gets used to it. My sister has had 3 Mirena placed over the years and loves it. She says this is normal so I’m going with the flow. Pun intended. If your thinking about it, definitely go to a doctor that numbs you with an injection.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got liletta because I just want my period to STOP! I read that most women just spot or stop getting their period which is not my experience. I got it back in February 2019 and since then my period is the same just with more cramping and occasionally leaking through tampons so I have to wear a pad. The worst part is weight gain and constant bloating. My breast regrew after breast reduction. I am so depressed with the way I look. I am getting it removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Well, I got the Kyleena inserted back in June and, I haven't gotten pregnant, yet so there's that....Probably because, I'm still bleeding! I've been bloated and cramping. I spoke with my nurse she advised me to just wait out the 90 days so my body can get used to it . Here I am just shy of the 90 days and still bleeding so I don't think this is going to work for me . I did have the Mirena for 5 years with no issues. I think it maybe time to try another alternative.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I think IUDs are a different experience for every woman because we all have different bodies. For me, Liletta has worked wonderfully! The insertion felt like bad cramping, but not unbearable. I've noticed some women on here are saying that they didn't bleed long after Liletta insertion which is awesome, but my experience was that I spotted for a few weeks after with some occasional bad cramping, which I didn't feel like it was a big problem for me. A few months later my periods are consistent and I only get some slight cramping before periods. I used to have horrible cramps and heavy periods but now my periods have become lighter and the cramps are not nearly as bad!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for 4 months now. I was debating between getting a copper IUD or hormonal because my body reacts badly to hormones in the past. I first got the copper IUD and it immediately expelled (I am 24 and have never had children). It was extremely painful and the cramps were unbearable. My doctor recommended getting Kyleena in May 2019 and I've really liked my experience so far. I bled for about 2/3 weeks after insertion and now I get my period every month around the same time. I barely have any cramps and the insertion was nothing compared to the copper IUD/Expulsion. The only downfall to Kyleena is that I noticed some face acne which I've never had and my breasts get very sore and bloated throughout the month. Other then that I love it! Best decision :)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena after my body rejected Mirena and pushed it out. Insertion was really painful, but a small price to pay for successful birth control. I did spot for the first two months, but haven’t really had a period since insertion. No mood swings, or cramping. 2 years and it’s done it’s job. I’d definitely recommend!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena for about three months. Overall, it was a good experience. The only reason I had it taken out was due to the hair loss I experienced with it. I noticed about 6 weeks in that my hair was shedding at a significant rate.  Three months in, it was still shedding a lot , to the point where it was affecting my hairline. I decided to have it removed-can’t deal with that!  I had some minor spotting and cramping, no periods, better skin ( I had dry skin before using it) and swollen breasts from it. I would have kept it in but I couldn’t deal with hair loss. It’s worth trying as you may not experience hair loss!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am a mom and I’ve had Kyleena for about 7 months now.  So far, I am happy with my decision.  I have endometriosis which causes my heavy periods and painful cramps.  I was on a continuous birth control pill regime previously, and wanted an easier option.  Insertion wasn’t overly painful, lasted a few seconds.  I had cramping the remainder of that day and was gone by day 2.  I had a regular period for the first couple of months, but they fizzled out there after.  Now I just have bloating, mild cramps and a light flow (pantyliner) for a few days each month.  This is ok for me considering I felt like a slaughtered pig, who need prescription pain meds for cramps without birth control.  I hope this helps!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My girlfriends always ask me about my IUD and I always tell them that it’s probably the best decision in term of birth control. The slightly uncomfortable placement is worth the reward. The first IUD I had placed was a little painful but the cramping only lasted for about a week and was nothing some Advil couldn’t fix. I got my IUD replaced about a month ago and I was scared that the removal would be even more painful however the whole procedure went by without any pain. I had some light cramping for the next few days and that was that. If it’s the pain that you’re scared of then there is no need to worry, plus I figured I’d rather be going through the pain of an IUD than going through the pain of labour.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got my IUD in Jan, coming off 7 years of using Ortho Tri Cyclen. The insertion was vile: I jolted and cursed out the doc; next was excruciating cramping: couldn't work, walk or sleep. At 48hr it subsided and I just had light bleeding for 2 weeks. Now passing the 6 month mark I still have the following side effects: nearly daily random cramping and bleeding; irregular crampy periods, normally light, but just a week back a massive 2 week period; pain during and after vanilla sex, not even banging against the cervix; my partner getting scratched by the strings, kid you not, I’ve seen the redness and scabs. The strings didn’t soften after 6mo and can’t be cut any shorter.  I have acne all over my  face, chest and back. Ladies with hormonal acne beware, seems like a trend if you're prone! Zillion derm visits later onto retinoids: tret then tazarotene. Acne only got worse. Now taking spironolactone pills TWICE a day *facepalm* side effects from all those treatments. Getting the IUD out. I really wanted it to work for me

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla, but the anxiety and depression that I experienced is a common symptom with any hormonal birth control option. The issue with the IUD is that it is designed to be out of sight. So, if you have other stressors in your life you will look to those before you think about the IUD you put in a year ago. Many of the studies I searched said there wasn't a correlation to depression, but the results from those studies have been invalidated by peer reviews because of the method they used to track their subjects (mostly just self-reported, or reported uses of anti-depressant) So, if you couldn't muster up energy to contact the clinic that you got your IUD in 6 months prior or didn't get to the point to be put on antidepressants, they would count that as asymptomatic. If you are getting an implanted form of birth control that is design to be "out of sight of mind" remember to check in to think how birth control has changed your mental or physical health over that time.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):After my second child I thought I would go back to the pill (I've taken the pill before children and worked great). But after three months of using it I had lost so much hair and my mood swings were crazy and I felt emotionless..dead inside. I knew I had to stop so I went on the mirena for the second time. What a complete change. So my insertion was painless..just felt some pressure and then cramping for 2 days. I had light bleeding after a month for 2 weeks straight. I have some bloating (water retention) but I remember all these symptoms go away after 6 months to a year. This IUD isnt for everyone as everyone is different, but don't turn your back on it unless you've tried it once. I'm hoping to keep this IUD in for a while..but it will always be my go to.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I LOVED the thought of this IUD. I got it inserted, and three months later I got the WORST ache I’ve ever had in my life. Keep in mind, I had acne prone skin before switching to Kyleena, and I took the birth control pill which cleared up my skin. The acne Kyleena caused plus super sharp stabbing like pains 3-4 times a week, sometimes for hours, made me decide to get my iud removed today. I only had it for 8 months and overall I do regret getting this. However it did not cause any weight gain which is good, but it did make me extremely bloated sometimes. This is to be expected with hormonal birth control though. I really wish this worked for me since it’s such a hassle free long term option! Back to the pill I go...

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my IUD placed back in Feb, and I spotted for 2.5 months, but my periods always been light, very tolerable. The insertion was, very uncomfortable, but I wouldn't classify it as painful when you consider its  pros. But what I never read up on was the side effects & risks. More specifically, my ectopic pregnancy. One night after sex, experienced EXTREME abdominal pain like never before, only to find out my IUD caused 2 cysts on each ovary, I was severely bleeding into my stomach, and on the 3rd day of nobody knowing why it was so intense, why I was bleeding so much & tons of blood tests & pain, I was told at 1:30 i was 5 weeks pregnant. At 1:32, I was told it was ectopic, and they were going to have to remove the fetus & my right Fallopian tube. Recovery took about 2.5 weeks. I'm now 15% more likely to have another ectopic. I had them remove my IUD during my surgery. Do I still recommend the IUD? Yes. But don't be like me - no birth control is 100%. Be cautious, protect yourself.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena in on July 18th of this year so I have only had it for a few weeks. Insertion for me was quite painful (I’ve had colposcopies with biopsies and this was much worse), but I was able to breath through it. I had pretty severe cramping that interferes with my sleep for about a week, ibuprofen/Tylenol/midol etc did not help whatsoever, but that seems to have settled down now. I have had spotting since insertion but only need to use a liner. I have also noticed my skin is much oilier and I am breaking out along my jawline and cheeks - I really hope this passes because I really want this to work for me.
Liletta (levonorgestrel):A lot of intermittent spotting.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the Mirena IUD placed July 23th, 2019 for endometriosis and I have been in pain every since then... sore nipples, spotting, back pain, sharp pelvic pains, pelvic pressure!!! Ugh warm water bottle doesn’t work hot tea works for a sec and I can’t really take medicine weak stomach... what to do get it removed right?!!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the mirena for almost 2 years. I hated it, first of all it is so painful to have it inserted I was in tears. The bleeding stopped after 2 months it was just a 2 month period that never stopped it was so annoying. But the biggest side effect I experienced was acne. My whole face broke out into massive cystic pimples and they would never go away. I use to have perfect clear skin until this IUD. I finally got it removed, it has been a month, my acne is so much better and definitely improving, I still need to be a little more patient for it to clear up at 100% but its definitely getting there. I didn't like how I had no control over my body, for example, I had to wait to have the Mirena removed and I would tell doctors what is happening to me and I was constantly dismissed they did not want to remove it. I like taking the pill better because I have control over my body if I want to stop taking it I stop I don't need to see a doctor were as the IUD you have no control over your body.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Having the IUD was not a good experience for me. Horrible acne and warts. As soon as I got it out all of my warts started going away!! My acne is now almost clear. I would not recommend the mirena.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena back in Oct 18. All has been great. Some spotting here and there but nothing to be concerned about. Recently the past two weeks I’ve been experiencing heavy bleeding and cramping. Waiting on doctor to return my call to see about removal and possible hysterectomy.  Was really hoping this would have been a solution to my bleeding problems but it was only a good thing for 10 months

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had kyleena for almost 2 years now, and it’s the best birth control I’ve ever had. No acne, no weight gain, no side effects at all. For the first year my periods were very light and after that I stopped getting periods all together. Though my boyfriend can sometimes feel the strings during intimacy, they’re very soft and flexible and he doesn’t even notice them anymore. I very highly recommend kyleena, it’s been very reliable. Plus, you don’t need to remember to do anything like you would other birth controls. You get it inserted, which didn’t even really hurt, and you’re covered for multiple years!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Before getting Kyleena, I did the biggest mistake by reading online other people’s experience of getting it inserted. Let me just say, I was scared beyond anything you can imagine and didn’t want to do it. But I sucked it up and went  through with it. During the procedure I couldn’t believe how easy it was. It just felt like a giant cramp for less than a minute. Totally bearable and I had little to no cramps afterwards. Highly recommend this form of birth control for those who found it hard to remember to take the pill and are looking for something long term :)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got the kyleena inserted almost four months ago. Doctor recommended it because I have PCOS and I also get migraines, since this is estrogen free I guess it was the best choice. Insertion wasn't TERRIBLE, it was painful, i took ibrofen before hand and it didn't help at all. I agree with the comment it feels like a knitting needle being jammed up there. I had bad cramping the day of insertion and the next day, after that nothing. Biggest side effect is I have bleed EVERY SINGLE DAY. I have not had a single day since insertion that I haven't bled. Doctor said it's normal but I don't know how much longer I can take this before I get it removed. As of right now I don't think I would recommend this to anyone.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My doctor asked me to please share my positive experience with the public! So here I am! I love this product! I was like everyone else at first very nervous and skeptical and read all those horror stories but I am glad that I was brave and did it anyway! The procedure was quick, a little uncomfortable but nothing that didn't feel like regular period cramps. I have next to no period a month now, with small PMS side affects for a couple of days. And sex and tampons are no different. And my cost savings are crazy! I no longer have to spend $60 a month on BC, I paid $15 up front (insurance covered the rest) and I don't have to pay a dime for 5 years!  Great choice for my life style!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my kyleena put in 2 years ago. I previously was on the pill for 7 years, while on the pill I did not have a period or cramps. Kyleena is a different story. I have cramping 3-7 days of the week minimum, randomly start my period or spot always with different amounts of flow. The cramps were so bad after a year, my Gyno was worried and had an ultrasound of my ovaries. I often have pain/cramping after sex since I had Kyleena inserted.  My cravings are constant and I have put on a significant amount of weight, 40 pounds also having the hardest time getting rid of the weight. Kyleena is  convenient  but not sure how much longer I’m going to be dealing with this pain.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted July 1 and it’s July 31. The insertion is as bad as everyone says seriously never experienced anything worse but it was only for a minute. Since then I’ve had irregular bleeding and my period has lasted 14 days. The main reason I got on it was to help with my period. My face seems clear and I don’t notice any changes in mood swings. I do have cramps daily though so I’m constantly having to take Advil. I’m going to the doctor this Friday to get it removed. It is affecting my sex life since I am always bleeding my boyfriend and I can’t ever have sex. I should of googled more reviews on it before getting it and I do not like the fact my OBGYN did not go into depth with me about it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Mistakingly got this device, for heavy periods, before going on a backpacking trip. Not only did I bleed continuously for months, but I had such extreme cramping that I would cry out in pain, and I have a pretty high pain tolerance. I had moderate anxiety before, but with the IUD it reached new levels; from panic attacks to racing mine. I have been extremely bloated ever since insertion (month post-removal currently) and gained 20lbs in 9 months. The costs of getting this device are much too high. I would never recommend it unless it’s a last resort.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted 14 months ago and as far as preventing pregnancy it has worked perfect. Other than that my experience with it has not been good. First, the insertion was the most painful thing I have ever been through. That alone makes me never want to get it again. But I also developed painful cystic acne along my jawline and severe cramping right before my period. My periods are the same length and flow as they were when I was on the pill so it did not help in that department. I have an appointment to have it removed tomorrow and plan on going back on the birth control pill.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I decided to get kyleena a little after having my first baby So the whole insertion has to be while on period the process was very short like 7 mins it only hurts for like 10 seconds the rest was not painful. I did feel very very  small cramps and a little dizzy after process was done my ob let me know I was going to bleed for 6 weeks. I guess everyone’s body work diff or maybe cause I just had a baby but for me I did not bleed I just finished my period regular and spotted for like 4days after. I sometimes get a little spotting when I wipe nothing crazy to the point of feeling uncomfortable. I had no pain so far just a bit cramps in the beginning and a little dizzy but definitely loving it so far. I would like to say just give it to go and have faith that it will work for you!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm just going to start this off by saying everyone & every BODY is different. If you're considering getting an IUD for birth control, or have bad cramps, whatever the reason. Don't psych yourself out because a few people had/ are having a bad experience certain things aren't for everyone and that is OK!. I had it inserted a month ago, the procedure was painful I took 2 Advil an hour before and it didn't help. I would recommend getting the freezing spray if you can, it lasted a total of 10 seconds. I got it inserted on lunch and went back to work right after the cramps lasted a few hours, I did get it inserted on my period. So far I have no issues, I did get a few pimples, they go away after a few days, my period almost no longer exists, no weight gain and no mood changes. I was on Alesse and I feel much happier in my head space with the IUD compared to the pill. I hope this helps someone who is curious or scared like I was before hand. You won't know if its for you until you try.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my Kyleena since I was 17 ( two years). The insertion was uncomfortable and the pain winded me, I cried and vomited but after I got home and rested for a day, with light cramping the pain wasn’t so bad. I experienced spotting and intense cramping for the next 4-5 months then nothing, no acne or weight gain for about a year. Lately I’ve experienced some intense cramping, and some bloating. Honestly I’m just glad I don’t have to worry about taking a pill every day but sometimes the pain keeps me up all night and makes me really, really sick.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta inserted last week but I have had several other IUDS prior to this one and all insertions hurt, followed by extreme cramps for a few days, however this is the first where I did not bleed forever afterwards. I bled only for a day and a half after insertion and mostly only when I wiped. I have noticed an insane increase in my sex drive that almost too much. I honestly don’t know if I’d call that a complaint or not but so far so good otherwise.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had Skyla for almost 3 years (removal due date September 2019). The insertion was painful for me, only because they have to clamp your cervix to insert it. I almost passed out (needed to lay down with an ice pack) but I also have a weaker pain tolerance. I don't believe this is a deterrent to get it, because it has been 3 wonderful years. At first, I bled a lot. Almost every day for 3 months. After that, I've had either no period, or fairly light periods (3/4 day maximum, not heavy bleeding). I've actually lost 40 lbs since I had it inserted (unrelated, healthy eating/exercise) since I binge ate before and was simply unhappy with my weight. I have not used protection with my SO for 3 years and have never had any scares or concerns. I use pregnancy test strips occasionally just to make sure if I skip a period, but I've never actually worried. I can't wait to graduate from Skyla and move up to a Mirena for another 5 years of protection!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Do not read the horror stories about insertion online!! I was expecting to pass out/throw up/ etc after reading different stories but my experience wasn’t bad at all! I took 800mg of ibuprofen (as instructed by my gynecologist) 20 mins before my insertion in the morning. However the pain wasn’t much worse than a really bad cramp that I’ve experience before. Keep in mind, I’m young and have never had kids. It was uncomfortable but only lasted for maybe 10 seconds and I was able to breathe through it. Afterwards I could walk and go up the stairs fine with just a little soreness. I’ve had no adverse affects yet and was able to go back to work shortly after the insertion. I had moderate period cramps throughout the day, but again nothing crazy. Remember everyone’s body and experience is different! Don’t scare yourself away from something based on others experiences.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Sex feels exactly the same my boyfriend can't feel anything different. I can feel the strings when I check in the shower. I don't feel any different mood wise, my skin is the same, clear I have lost a stone since getting it but that's probably due to my thyroid medication and getting my metabolism back. Overall I'm really happy I got kyleena my only concern is being able to easily concieve after the five years as we do want babies one day. It seems your fertility returns to normal after having it removed so hopefully it'll be the case for me. It's the most effective IUD and the smallest too. It's fairly new on the market so I was keen to try it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was really nervous about getting an IUD but it’s been good overall. I haven’t experienced any acne or weight gain, though I feel bloated in my tummy often. Insertion wasn’t bad at all, just like a big cramp. I was on my period when I had it inserted, which I heard was better because of the slight cervical dilation during mensuration. I’ve had it for about 4 months now and I have experienced very painful period cramps and emotional fluctuations, though they’ve lessened each month.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena IUD inserted on July 18th. The process itself was extremely painful, short but excruciating cramping during insertion. Immediately after insertion I felt nauseous, cold sweats, and cramping. I had to stay in the doctor's office for 30 extra minutes before I felt okay to get up. The next few days were fine, just mild cramping that I was able to take ibuprofen for. Since July 22nd, I have had a mild fever, abdominal and pelvic pain, dizzy spells, constipation, shortness of breath, migraine, painful urination, and dark spotting. I have no appetite and have to force myself to eat once a day. My OBGYN sent me to urgent care to ensure my IUD was in place and it was, and they also ruled out infection. Since the IUD is in place, my obgyn told me they could not help me. Everybody reacts differently, but I will be getting this device removed because it is not worth the mysterious complications that doctors don't seem to have an answer for.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Hi, I’m writing this to hopefully ease your mind about the whole insertion process! I have only had my skyla for a couple hours, so I can’t speak for the long term effects, but do NOT!!!!! let all the terrible reviews about the insertion scare you off, it is nowhere near as catastrophic as some people are making it out to be. My doctor had me take 800 mg of Aleve an hour before the procedure and I was fine. The most painful part was the speculum he used, that felt like a really intense burning pain but it didn’t last too long. After that he had me cough and he inserted the clamp and then the IUD, both the clamp and the actual insertion of the device felt like 2 strong period cramps and then I was fine! I have been bleeding since then and have some very minimal cramping that’s super tolerable. I’m 18, have never had children, and am not sexually active so don’t worry about those affecting the pain! Hopefully all goes well from here!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hi there, use to have the implant in my arm, ended up losing too much weight and switched to the kyleena and I have never felt so great. Not only do I have so much more energy but my periods are lighter ( on the implanon it was heavy and for two-three weeks ).Pain level when kyleena was inserted actually wasn't bad as my doctor gave me an injection for pain which literally was the best. 10/10 rating I love the kyleena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Like many people say, the insertion was definitely painful. My OBGYN prescribed a medication to take both the night before and the morning of my procedure to soften my cervix, which I didn't experience any side effects for. She also numbed my before the procedure, which hurt. The actual insertion process was not as bad as I thought it would be-- felt like really really bad period cramps. The one thing that really took me by surprise was the blood because I bled a LOT during the procedure. About ten minutes after the procedure the cramps got REALLY bad, to the point where I could feel the pain tingling in my legs. I went straight home and took more ibuprofen and went to bed and felt better after taking a nap. For about a week after the procedure I had cramps off and on, but nothing terrible. I haven't experienced any spotting so far. All in all, not pleasant, but not horrible.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena Nov 2018. After the painful insertion, I felt some cramping but it only lasted about 2 days with minimal spotting. At first it was smooth sailing, no discomfort nothing. It felt like nothing was even there, no periods. Fast forward about 3-4 months, it started to go downhill. I became extremely depressed, I gained 25-30 lbs from November to now. My sex life was non existent because of the pain I would experience during intercourse. I experienced almost every side effect of this birth control. I'm having this removed first week of August. I would rather set a timer and take the pill than have something messing with my body in ways that I've never experienced. I hope this helps everyone. I wouldn't recommend this at all.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my kyleena for 6 months. I would say that my experience is mostly good. I can’t tell if the insertion is painful because I got mine at the same time as an abortion so I was under mild anesthesia. For the week after I had small cramps and spotting for around 7 to 10 days. My periods (which used to be very painful and around 5 days) are now only spotting for 2 days and very small cramps 1 or 2 days before or during the actual period. Overall I would say I am very satisfied. The only 2 downsides: mood swings and bloating. The mood swings I can live with it, but the bloating really annoys me. Not to the point of getting it removed tho. I’ve had trouble with my weight a good part of my life and when I’m bloated (usually 3 days per cycle) I feel (I don’t weight myself) like I’ve gained 20 pounds. And usually the mood swings are around the same times so it reallllly gets to me and it makes me feel every worst. But my overall experience is good.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It has been a year and 9 months since I got my IUD. The first few months were pretty weird with cramping and spotting but once you get through that, it is great! I used to suffer from unbearable cramps and now I might take one pain killer on my first day then be fine and my periods are super light. Didn't experience any weight gain. I highly recommend Kyleena because I don't have to remember to take medicine every day and after the first few months I have had noticeably easier periods.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):When I had Kyleena inserted (my first IUD, inserted 4 months ago) I did NOT experience any pain. I took probably 3 Advil beforehand. It felt like a normal Pap smear. I was incredibly relieved that I had no pain (I literally told the doctor don’t let me know when you insert it while he was down there and he said I already did!). I did have some pretty severe cramping later that night. But then it was gone by the next day. I had discharge for probably 3 months following insertion and had one period, a month after insertion, but no more periods since. I have not gained any weight or experienced a change in my appetite. If anything I have actually lost weight since getting it. Once a month, every month since getting it, my skin breaks out. Then it clears up for the rest of the month. I feel like this is the residual period I have now instead of actually bleeding. Overall I am EXTREMELY satisfied with Kyleena, and I recommend it to all of my friends.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Insertion of Litletta was  painful for a quick minute. Bled for a few days. Week 1- couldn’t find strings. after bleeding stopped I got nasty smelly discharged. Called Planned Parenthood, they said take a probiotic. Ok? Week 2- EXTREME cramps for a week straight, worse than insertion. Tender breasts, constipation then diarrhea  and vaginal bleeding whenever I had a BM? Couldn’t get hold of planned parenthood. Cramps stopped and then I had HEAVY bleeding. Bled through a regular tampon in a half hour. Was bleeding nonstop 24/7 for 4 days after a full week of bleeding with cramps. Still couldn’t get hold of anyone to help me. This morning- (end of week 2) woke up, and the  IUD had come out. Okay???Cool, didn’t like you anyway. I’m more dissatisfied by how I was treated as a patient than I am with Liletta. I’m pretty sure it was misplaced and that’s why I had weird issues. Might try again with different provider.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I absolutely love my Mirena so far! I had Skyla removed 3 months ago and had Mirena put in 2 weeks later. I spotted very lightly for 2 days afterward and haven't at all since. The insertion process took a bit longer then I expected because my doctor said she had to straighten my uterus due to how it was positioned, but it was just a very big cramp for a total of about 4 minutes. Super tolerable. So far I haven't had any negative side effects like I did with my previous IUD, and I am so happy I gave this a try. Don't let negative reviews deter you if you're contemplating it. Everyone's body reacts differently but the quick cramp was well worth it for me so far.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted in October of 2017 after attempting to use oral birth control to reduce my very heavy, and long period along with severe menstrual cramps. I have a low pain tolerance, and the insertion was menstural crampy painful. Two days after its insertion, the majority of the cramps were gone, but I spotted for a week or two. After the spotting/cramping from insertion went away, all cramps and bleeding disappeared completely. Starting in December of 2018, I started to get some cramping and some spotting that would last about a day, but then would completely dissipate. As of June 2019, I typically get some cramping for a day or two, which is simultaneous with light enough bleeding that a liner can be worn. The bleeding lasts for 4-5 days. Overall, compared to how my periods used to be, Kyleena is a life saver. However, if you are looking to completely get rid of all cramping, bleeding, etc. on an IUD for a long period of time, Kyleena may not satisfy your wants.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my insertion done on March 25th 2019, insertion was  bad. Not gonna lie. For me it was one big long cramp for literally 5 hours. I was shaking awfully bad, but wasn't bleeding as much as she said I would. I made sure to take ibuprofen before hand, had heating pads. Cramps weren't that bad. Spotted for a few days and within a week or so I was back to 'normal'. I have developed 2 large cysts on my right ovary that I didn't have previous. Kind of painful sex, but I've attributed that to the cysts. Swollen breasts, fatigue, headache and weight gain was my common symptoms for the first 3 months, I finally got my first actual period and it was pretty painful, but now I think my body is adjusting well.AND no babies!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena gave me the worst acne of my life( and I was not on any form of BC beforehand). I have always been prone to breakouts but I have never had acne this bad. The breakouts are only on my chin and have been persistent since about a month after I got the IUD. I have cried at least once a week because of how bad my acne is. I don't want to talk or hangout with anyone because it is so bad. I had to get it taken out because it was affecting me so much and I could not manage to wait to see if it would improve with time or a dermatologist's intervention. It was severely affecting my mental health and still is. I have had it out for almost 3 weeks now and the acne is still there. I am in awe of how there could be such damage to my system in such little time. I am praying that my skin will go back to normal soon. I never do reviews but I am just putting my experience out there to let people know they are not alone or to hopefully prevent acne-prone people from getting this.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have been on the pill since I was 17 (currently 24) and was excited to try a new birth control method that I could just forget about. I initially wanted the Mirena but apparently, it was too big for me, so I got the Kyleena. The insertion was not bad, it was uncomfortable and painful, but manageable. I heard that being on your period, and having sex before the insertion was helpful, so I had both! I only had two ibuprofen before. The cramping went away by the following morning and I had little-no spotting. In the past few weeks, I have noticed a significant emotional shift in that I am having spiralling thoughts and have intense mood fluctuation. I also have some puffy-ness/bloating around my tummy constantly but have not had a weight gain. The mood changes are concerning and I have booked an appointment with my dr to consider having the IUD removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Have had this for over a year now & it does it’s job perfectly at preventing pregnancy! I still have my periods every month though but they are much lighter than they use to be. Mild cramping during my monthly and no weight gain or acne. I definitely recommend this but everyone is different. My experience has been positive and I’m glad I don’t have to worry for another four years!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I thought I would share my experience since I’ve been on kyleena for about a year now. I was someone who never got cramps before, so I was very discouraged when I started getting them every month along with my period. The only upside to this BC is the fact I don’t really have a period. It’s super light & some months I don’t even notice it.  Now a year in, I have really bad acne on my back & chest, I’m always so tired to the point where I don’t even want to get out of bed & I can sleep 14 hours & still feel tired enough to sleep more. Also been feeling a dark fog or cloud in my mind & feel very irritable & sad all the time. It’s making me super anxious to the point where my appetite is completely gone. I am planning on making an appointment to get it removed because if these side effects are from it, it’s totally not worth it. I just want to get back to the normal hormone levels of my body.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Cons: The IUD insertion was the worst pain I’ve ever experienced in my life. I felt 1 intense cramp and then 2 stabbing pains when it was inserted. Perks: It only took a minute and I didn’t get bad cramps after at all and went on with my day.  I just had my 5 week check up and thank goodness it’s still in place ! I actually love the IUD now and have no symptoms (other than minor breakouts on my chin)The insertion pain will hopefully be worth the 5 years of not worrying about contraception

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got pregnant earlier this year, and decided to terminate. I wanted a birth control that I could start immediately and my nurse recommended Liletta. I have a history of really bad cramps, but normal periods and bleeding. It's been 5 months, and I've had some irregular spotting, and random cramps, none too bad though. I have gained weight, but only about 11lbs. Overall  I'm happy with this method, no daily pills, or weekly rings to remove/replace.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I love my Kyleena IUD, I have had it for almost a year now and it has been amazing, for the first few months I had some acne but that went away, I don’t have period cramps, I have normal periods, and no acne or mood swings. I highly recommend the IUD to anyone.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted on the 5th of June 2019 & I only had my period once and that was June 13-16 & other than brown spotting I for a couple of days a couple of weeks ago I haven’t had anything since.  I’m hoping this is normal!!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've had my IUD for about 4 months. I got it put in at my local Planned Parenthood, and it wasn't as bad as I expected. I got dizzy for a few seconds after and had teary eyes, but the cramping was on par with my worst natural period cramps. I do not have a high pain tolerance at all, so I think most people should be fine.         I had previously been on a combined birth control pill for 10 months, but had to stop because I got migraines so badly that I would often throw up because of the pain--something that I've never done before. My headaches have completely stopped and I never had another migraine after getting my Liletta.         I have a longer cycle (not bleeding days) and get worse cramping than I've had before. Personally, this is much less of an inconvenience than migraines that would completely immobilize me. I definitely recommend Liletta, and I would suggest getting it placed by someone who has done it many times such as a gynecologist over a family doctor.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just had the procedure done today. Switched from Nuvaring to Kyleena. The procedure itself was painful, but very tolerable since I suffer from very bad Endometriosis. My Dr. guide me through it and was very informative that due to my migraines, Kyleena (along with non estrogen meds) are beyond helpful. Still have some minor cramping here and there but the worst is gone. Definitely recommend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):When the IUD is inserted they have to dilate the cervix. Therefore, you experience cramps like early labor pains. I have a high pain tolerance. The cramping, pressure and pinch during insertion was beyond awful it felt like someone is taking a knitting needle and jabs it quickly inside you. I screamed almost vomited but that was not the worst. The worst are the cramps that come after. They crippled me for 2 days. I couldn’t stand or walk. I crawled into my apartment door when I finally made it home. I laid in bed for 2 days with heating pads, midol, Aleve you name it. Nothing works. that pain was not worth it and had I known I would not have done it. It’s been 3 months. 15 pounds of weight gain despite a heavy gym regimen and diet. None of my clothes fit. I am consistently bloated. I experience period cramps so bad for 15 days of every month I get waves of chills, goosebumps, pinching pressure, light headedness. The period itself isn’t bad but it is about 8 days long. Also increased acne. Getting it removed

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Paraguard and took it out to regulate cycle then had Kyleena put in - insertion went fine, .  I gained a few pounds, and acne got worse (on medication for cystic acne).  Those side effects were liveable.  What I was not prepared for, were the gnarly cramps. I've had 2 IUD's inserted, but have never felt anything like the cramps I've felt. It felt like a migraine in my pelvis. Taking it out!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The reason the reviews are so high for kyleena is because most people are leaving 10 star reviews a few days up to a week after they got it inserted. Let it settle and your body get used to it and wait until you know how it affects your body. I have had mine in for 9 months and at first I loved it but now I can't wait to have it removed. For the past few months I have been very irritable and angry, very bad stomach aches and bad bowel movements, bloated, and absolutely no sex drive, I don't even care about sex. I thought there was something wrong with me to the point to where I thought I needed to talk to a therapist, then it clicked in my head that it was the IUD. Do not write a 10 star review when you have only had it in for a few days.
Mirena (levonorgestrel):My Mirena was only in for two years and became embedded in my uterine wall and put me in a coma for a month. Thanks Mirena - how much more dangerous can something get????.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got Kyleena put in today so I can  my speak about the procedure.  I read so many horror stories about it and was terrified. The actually procedure was not bad at all. It was just uncomfortable and the actual insertion pinched for a second followed by a little bit of cramping. I was even able to go on a run later at night and it felt so good.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):My insertion experience of Liletta insertion was HORRIBLE despite taking 800mg of ibuprofen and a drug to dilate my cervix. I had sudden, short term cramping for the next three months and light irregular periods for the next 6. After six months, my periods stopped all together. For the first 8 months, I experienced issues controlling my bladder. After a year and a half, I have all but forgotten that the IUD is there however. I have no periods, I do not experience any pain, I haven't gotten pregnant, and I have not gained any weight. If you can get through the first year of back and forth side effects, I would say it is worth it in the end.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD inserted June 18th of 2019. I’ve had it in for a month and 4 days so far. I’ve been spotting everyday since I got it inserted which is normal. When I got it inserted it was quick and easy, the pain would be a 3 out of 5 (everyone is different). I had cramps after the insertion but they didn’t last long. So far I’ve had a good experience with it, I just hope the spotting stops sooner than later. My partner did not complain about feeling the strings during sex. Overall I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Mirena. There is nothing I have to remember to do. But I do  have to check for the strings (as you should but you don’t have to, you can just go to the hospital to get an X-ray to make sure their in place) and I had to do a little twirling my fingers around but I eventually felt them and they were fine. Btw I am 18 years old and had never had a baby.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had liletta inserted January 2018 and removed July 2019.Insertion was extremely painful but the pain went away in a few days.Premenstrual cramps were also extremely painful after never having experienced them before having an IUD.My periods became lighter than normal but were still very much there (the main reason I got this was because it was said to eliminate periods in most women).Over the 18 months I had it, I had 3 separate yeast infections and 1 bout of bacterial vaginosis. I have never had infections like that before.Since having it removed several weeks ago, I feel like a weight has been lifted as I can actually feel my body becoming more balanced again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena IUD for a year. Insertion was easy! My doctor recommended I take 600-800mg ibuprofen 30 min before, which I did and that I have it placed while menstruating. I had it inserted on 2nd day of my period. No pain or discomfort during procedure. No spotting but mild cramping the week after my IUD was inserted. After, I lightly spotted daily for 3 months (my Dr. said to expect). Now my periods are SUPER light, but not shorter. Cramping is light, which is more than I used to have. No weight gain, and don’t really have any side effects, which is way different from my experiences on various birth control pills. My boyfriend feels the strings sometimes during sex, but he doesn’t mind. It’s very effective in preventing pregnancy. I would recommend Kyleena to those that are interested! For reference, I had it inserted when I was a 20 year old virgin with no kids (obviously). I also was/am a healthy weight with no medical conditions.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Having Skyla now for a few months has been the best decision. I did have some spotting in the beginning, but that’s gotten a lot better as a few months have gone by and the best part is, my periods have gotten lighter too. I also didn’t find the implantation that bad, and even went to a concert that evening after my appointment in the morning. You definitely will have cramping afterwards, but if you take it easy for a few hours it shouldn’t be too bad later on. All in all, the spotting was a bit frustrating in the beginning, but that’s practically gone now. It really is a win-win decision. I also feel a lot more sexually protected, and more in control of my body

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had Kyleena since March 19. Found the insertion process very discouraging after 3 failed attempts I was encouraged to get local anaesthetic to the area and that didn't work. Eventually I had to have an hysteroscopy(scope)  of my uterus to have it inserted. Absolutely horrific experience. The pain was next level for me anyhow. No valium or pain relief even provided by the hospital. I hope no other woman endures that! Post operative I find the Kyleena great, no major side effects, feeling far less bloated compared to the pill, some discharge noted. Periods not dissimilar from the pill but possibly last a bit longer. Overall. I am impressed. And it's nice not having to worry for 5 years!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta inserted January 2018 at Planned Parenthood. After insertion, I was bleeding for about 2 months. It was pretty heavy.  Today, July 21, 2019 I still have it in me. I want it removed, following me gaining 30 lbs. This IUD gives me SEVERE anxiety, depression, agitation. I always feel tired, my legs get swollen, and I just randomly started spotting. I wonder if it moved its placement a bit. Scheduling an appointment to remove it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my Mirena IUD for over 2 years. I struggled with the decision to get one because I refused to take the pill due to hormones. I wanted the copper IUD. Because my period was already heavy and usually involved serious cramping, she recommended the Mirena. I read as many reviews as possible only to conclude that it’s really case by case. I decided to go for the Mirena. I had my period for 3 months but haven’t had my period since. Wow, what a wonderful world where you don’t have a period. The insertion process involved uncomfortable cramping but 15 seconds for 3+ years of peace of mind? The day I got Mirena, I felt as I did on a heavy period day with lots of cramps but nothing worse. I’d give the Mirena a 10, but I feel skeptical that something could work so well without repercussions. My thoughts now are more long term, which I cannot answer. But today, I recommend that you wonderful ladies consider Mirena and hope you have as peaceful and pleasant experience as I have.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got my kyleena inserted a month and a half ago and I have to say it is worth it. Insertion didn’t hurt too bad, just felt like period cramps because my gynaecologist froze my cervix before inserting the Kyleena. I found that getting my period for the first time after having it inserted hurt more. My cramps hurt worse, but we’re nothing unbearable. It is nice to not have to worry about taking birth control everyday. It has definitely given me worse headaches though and has cause some pretty consistent bloating, which I’m hoping goes away with time. All in all I really do enjoy this birth control method as it has minimal side effects, is easy to maintain, and works efficiently.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I received the Mirena in 2012 with slight pain and cramping for 3 days. It was well worth it, because I never had another cycle, cramps, or mood swings during the duration of having the Mirena. 2017 arrived and it was time to replace my Mirena, but my insurance would not pay for a new one due to my provider changing. The cost was going to be $900.00 for removal and re-insertion. I did a lot of research and decided that I would keep in my Mirena for a few more years. I didn't want to switch to a cheaper BC and risk having a cycle again. I didn't want to pay for another Mirena because I wanted children in about 2 years.     My Mirena was removed May 2019 with no complications. I had the slightest spotting for a day. My cycle took 7 weeks before it resumed, and it was like I remembered it 7 years ago. I hope to have another Mirena put in after I have a child, it has been the best BC on the market for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Mid 30s, no kids, one partner. It was recommended by my doc to be on an BC because I have some medical conditions and a pregnancy would do more harm than good. The worst part of the insertion was also the shortest part of the insertion. A lot of cramping, and felt like I needed to go to the bathroom. Took 2 ibuprofen prior, and took 2 more afterwards. Luckily I had my husband with me since I wasn't sure how I was going to feel, and for  support. Got dizzy and car sick during ride home. Slept for rest of the day. Just got it 2 days ago, so can't speak for long term effects. No bleeding, occasional cramping, bloating, and still feel like needing to go to the bathroom. In general, I don't usually get side effects from medications. Bodies react differently to everything, so don't scare yourself first.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Try it everyone is different. I gave Skyla 10/10 because it was effective I did not get pregnant for the 10 months I had it. But it was just not for me. Periods sucked. I had painful bleeding every time I lifted something heavy. Always spotting.  I was on my period/ spotting half of every month. In my 9 months with Skyla I gained weight, had anxiety, depression, acne. But it could have been my lifestyle as well. I was also on birth control before Skyla so that could have been a factor as well.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It’s been 2 Years since I’ve gotten Kyleena. My first 2 months was a nightmare. Intense on and off cramps. Spotted everyday, and bled more when my period started. I was popping ibuprofen daily and switching it out with Tylenol so I wouldn’t max on one medication. After the 2 month mark, my cramps lightened but I still bled once a day. For me, things got better after the 3rd month. I stopped spotting everyday, my periods were 6-7days long. After a year, things felt more normal (before Kyleena I had 4 day periods with medium pain cramps). Currently, I have 5 day periods with medium pain cramps. Even though Kyleena is tough, at least I’m not pregnant, gaining weight, or worry if I took the pill or not.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena since about March of 2018. I like Kyleena for the most part, but I do have a few issues with it that have recently made me think about getting it removed. To start, my biggest issue is how long it makes my period last. My period almost every time is 14 days long, sometimes 20+ days. Other things that I’m noticing is that my breast hurt all the time! It’s has caused me bad acne and extreme weight gain (fluctuating between 20 to 30 pounds).The thing that has been giving me a huge concern over the last few months is my blood pressure. I can’t exact say that it is causing the increase in my blood pressure, but it could be (I have pre-existing hypertension). Since getting it I have went from one hypertensive medication to 2, and now my second medication had to be doubled in dosage. I plan to talk to my HCP soon, to get recommendations.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena fitted in 6th March. The insertion was fine. By the time I left the doctors surgery I could hardly walk. The cramps were HORRENDOUS!From that day until the second to  last week in June I did not stop bleeding. The cramps would kick in at any given minute and I thought I would pass out with some of them. I’ve given birth - pain relief free, but I was not prepared for these cramps. Also for the first month I almost couldn’t leave the house. I was a hormonal wreck! Sobbing uncontrollably It was awful. Thankfully that’s stopped. But the bleeding continued. From middle of June to start of the second week July no period. A little cramping nothing major... now I’ve started what I thought was going to be my first normal period after the bleeding settled down. It’s anything but normal. I can’t move. I’m exhausted, the bleeding is so heavy. I’m really thinking about getting this thing taken out. I don’t feel myself on it. I really see no bene fits - apart from not getting pregnant.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am 3 months postpartum I have 2 children. My doctor recommended me getting Mirena. I did not want it but she kept insisting that it was the best option and very safe. The day I was getting it when she placed the Mirena inside my uterus my whole abdomen felt a HORRIBLE cramp which lasted a few seconds then it was over. I went home with only mild cramps. The next morning I woke up I was in severe pain I couldn’t walk or sit. My whole abdomen was swollen and hurt if I barely touched it. My entire body felt sore , I was freezing cold and shaking I went to the ER. They took my blood and checked my vitals I had a fever and an infection. They took x rays and an ultrasound the Mirena was out of place and one of the T’s was poking into my abdomen. I was getting bags of antibiotics and morphine for pain which didn’t help my pain at all. The pain only went away after it was removed 2 days later. Now 4 days after removal I am still cramping , in pain , bleeding and very nauseous.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Just got the Mirena put in today. It hurt, a lot. It's been about fifteen minutes and I'm still sitting in my car in the parking lot. The cramps are killing me. I'm 45, and was previously on the depo shot which I hated having. I've had a lot of irregular periods, even month long periods and weight gain with the depo. Fingers crossed the Mirena works better. I'll keep my post updated.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena inserted in October 2018 but had it taken out a month later due to an issue with my cervix requiring a procedure be done. Had a new one inserted 6 weeks after and have had no problems except spotting when I’m due for my period. Insertion was easy, no pain at all. I let my OBGYN know that I had a retroverted uterus so he knew what angle to insert the IUD. Barely any bleeding in the first week, and then two heavy periods the first two months eventually tapering off to nothing. When I’m due for my period, I spot a light brown or pink discharge. Only downfall is my skin seems to break out a bit more around my period.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my Kyleena inserted on July 9 2019. My dr had recommended it because I was diagnosed with PCOS and she wants to be sure I have at least one period a month- my "usual" cycle was from 9 to 90 days- and she knew that I can't take the pill because I had awful side effects, so she said kyleena. Insertion went fine and was pretty mildly uncomfortable but I had no cramping after until about 3 days later. I have had now nonstop cramping and it gets so intense that I have many times thought about going to the hospital. I have been nursing a bottle of Aleve twice a day for the last week. Nothing helps. Pain meds only help a little and moving, sitting, laying down, heating pads cooling pads mint tea, nothing works. I have an appointment coming up to go over this because I can't live like this. I can barely breathe when some cramps come on and they are so regular that I count it a blessing if I don't cramp every 3 minutes.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I'm 29yrs old and I've been on birth control for 14 years. I have been on Nuva Ring for maybe 12 years.  I was very nervous to mess my hormones. Reading other peoples experiences with IUDs made me very nervous to make the change. I decided on Skyla because it is the smallest of the IUDS, and it was covered by my insurance. I had Skyla placed on July 5th and since then it has been the best decision I've made. My doctor did prescribe me a medication to take 3hrs prior to the appointment that softened my cervix which I am sure helped. I also took Advil 30 min before my appointment. The worst part of the insertion process was just the feeling of the metal clamp thing that they always use at every check up visit. The first day was like I had my period, bleeding and cramping. I rested for a while in bed with a heating pad. Some light bleeding and mild cramping here and there for about 5 days after and then things went back to normal.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted 2 days ago. Day 3 of my 4 day period, only discomfort was when she opened my cervix. Semi bad cramping and spotting since. The pain is NOT unbearable. For me it was pressure and pain similar to a contraction. As soon as it was placed the pain was gone. I’ve had the  Mirena twice, loved it! My provider said Kyleena is the generic form of Mirena and cheaper.      Reading these reviews, I’m wondering if you ladies have any unknown pre-existing health conditions, or whether it has been placed correctly to have all of the side effects you are having. I haven’t felt any different since having it placed, only been two days so I guess I’ll find out. I will update with my experience.     As a nurse, my advise is update yourself with family health history and mental health history before insertion and discuss any concerns you have with your provider!! Not rating yet due to not having it long enough to know.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Got the Mirena put in back in July of 2015. The insertion pain was the worst I thought and I spotted a little bit afterwards. I’m now on year 4 and I’ve been thinking about getting it taken out early. For the last week I’ve been super bloated and just feel gross. Anyone else dealing with this?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for coming up on two years now. I have had pretty normal periods throughout my two years of being on this. Overall it’s been really nice not having to take a pill every day. I will say that sex can be painful at times, to the point of having to stop because it causes such a bad cramp. I have had MANY infections (uti,yeast, and my most reoccurring is bacterial vaginosis.) I had never had bacterial vaginosis before getting Kyleena inserted but I have had it over 10 times just this year... that would have to be my biggest complaint overall about this. I do plan on making an appointment to get it taken out because to me it’s not worth all of the money to spend curing all of the infections that I keep having to deal with.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena was NOT for me. I took 600 Ibuprofen prior to getting it. Before Kyleena I was on  pill, Minestrin 24Fe, which gave me about 5 UTIs that year. I had a horrible experience. My Kyleena felt as though it was in wrong setting the entire 8 months I had it. My period lasted about 2 weeks, and then I spotted off and on, just to have it return for another 2 weeks. I was nauseous and constipated most of the time, and always felt as though I had cramps. My acne was worse, and I had no sex drive, nor did I want sex feeling in pain all the time. My doc said it was fine, but I got it removed, I got it removed after the "6 month" grace period they talk about having, and implanted Nexplanon. Now, 6 months later on Nexplanon, and I have had only 1 short period since.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):After just a of having Mirena put it in I got it taken out and for better. My periods became heavy. Glad the medical person listened, did ultrasound and found it was pushing its way out and had reached cervix. Glad to get rid and now my stomach and uterus have calmed down.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Absolutely love my Mirena IUD. I have not have my period since it was inserted (which generally takes about 6 months for most if you do stop getting it). The pain on insertion was definitely manageable, I got it inserted at the tail end of my period so that the pain would be less, didn’t even take any painkillers before or after. Went right back to work. My doc gave me some pills to take a night before and 2 nights before to soften my cervix. The insertion felt like a bad cramp that lasted less than a minute. I’ve never had kids either. I don’t usually write reviews but I feel compelled to write a review about Mirena because before I got it I read so many reviews, a lot being negative about the pain or feeling it during sex, of course everyone’s experience is different and pain is subjective but my boyfriend can’t feel it, and it isn’t a wire hanging down like some say, the string is more like a fishing line, that can be shortened if it can be felt during sex. Absolutely love it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted 6/21/19. It was not too painful, just felt like bad period cramps for 30 seconds. I was a little dizzy afterwards but after a few minutes I felt okay and went about my day. I started bleeding instantly after, a light flow. A few days later, the bleeding started getting heavier which lasted for about 2 weeks. Today is 7/18/19 and I still am lightly bleeding. I have had bad headaches on and off, mild hair loss, and random cramping/discomfort. My husband didn't really feel anything during intercourse which was a plus. I like that I don't have to remember to take a pill everyday. I hope as time goes on I can stop bleeding every day and not feel so blah all the time but as of right now I do not hate this IUD. Will update my review in a couple months!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):This will be my 4th Mirena. First was for birth control and was good. The insertion was a bit painful . The first was for contraception and I didn't have periods during five years. I did feel a bit moody on the first year. When  expired I had it removed and fitted a new one on the same day.. All was well for two years when I started bleeding after intercourse. The Mirena had moved and couldn't be found so I had to have it removed by hysteroscopy day surgery. I bled heavily for months after that but it could also be because I have fibroids and on the peri-menopause. The excessive bleeding has been going on for 2 years and the doctor recommended the Mirena again but I was  unsure  Went ahead anyway because the options to reduce the bleeding was taking hormones orally or having my uterus removed . 3 months had Mirena inserted but it came out after 3 days. Yesterday had it put in. Fingers crossed that will stay in and sort the heavy bleeding. I will come back  let you know how it goes.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for about 5 months now. The insertion was honestly horrible. I was sweaty, I puked, & nearly passed out. The first month had lots of cramping, but it wasn’t too unbearable. Overall I like the Kyleena as my birth control because it isn’t something I have to worry about too often. My periods of stopped completely. I just get some light spotting a couple times a month. My only complaints would just be that it has caused me to have lots of mood swings and depression & anxiety issues, and  I’ve ended up gaining some weight, but that could be my own fault unless the birth control makes my appetite increase a lot.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just got Kyleena inserted yesterday and TBH so far it’s been pretty good. My gyno discovered I had an extremely tight cervix (super super rare and she’s never seen this before) so insertion was almost impossible even with the dilation medication. But after maybe 30 seconds of pain we managed to get it in. Minor cramping for maybe 30 mins only bled for a few hours since it was the last day of my period and so far everything is going great. Just a heads up if you go into it too stressed out your body will react and it will be more painful. Just relax and take a lot of pain medication and everything will be alright!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena placed yesterday. I was literally so nervous going in because I work at a gyneoclogist office and I know a lot of people don't handle insertion very well. My doctor talked me through the entire process. First the tenaculum which is an instrument to hold your cervix in place, she told me to cough as she was clamping it and I didn't even feel it go on.  Then she used a "sound" to measure where she needed to insert the IUD. The sound felt very crampy and quite a bit of pressure but was not unbearable. As soon as she was finished measuring she inserted the IUD and cut the strings. I literally didn't even know the IUD was in because I didn't feel anything. I have only had a little bit of spotting when I use the restroom. Knowing this is good for 5 years and I don't have to remember to take it every day I would get it all over again. Such an easy process and I got myself worked up for something I barely felt. In my opinion the speculum hurt worse than the entire procedure.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Mirena IUD procedure twice now and have never had any issues. No form of BC is natural and with anything unnatural there will be side effects. The only complaint I have is of course the discomfort during the procedure and cramps for the first day, but that's it. My period stopped immediately and hasn't returned, and honestly it's one of the best things that has happened to me.  I don't like that there is something artificial inside my body but I'm definitely not having kids! I never have to remember to take a pill, it has never made me feel sick, given me cramps, bleeding, nothing. For every person you just have to weigh the pros and cons with anything you ingest or put in your body. It's too bad there are so many bad reviews on here, but do your research first and if you opt for Mirena and it doesn't work out, have it removed immediately.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):It’s been exactly a week and a day since I gotten my Mirena. I was so terrified because I was told the procedure would hurt. It wasn’t nearly as bad as I thought it’d be. So far I’ve had light spotting, my NP told me it’s be expected. She also told me to expect cramping off and on at least for 6 months as well as the spotting. It’s been good thus far.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena for 2 weeks now. The insertion was extremely painful; it took 15 minutes longer than usual (doctor didn't numb or dilate my cervix and I wasn't on my period). This should not discourage you from getting the IUD but it should convince you to ask your doctor to do something to minimize the pain. I have a very high pain tolerance and I nearly passed out. However! It was totally worth it. Besides cramping the first few days I've had zero side effects and it's a weight lifted off my shoulders. Happy to know I have 5 years of no pills, plan B, or constant worries about pregnancy.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am 5’0 120 pounds, I am also 18 years old. I have never had a child or been pregnant. After seeing so many bad reviews I was scared to get Skyla. BUT IM SO HAPPY I DID. I have only had it for a few days (and will write another review after a month) the insertion process was painful but not that bad. it felt like bad cramps. I have experience some cramps but nothing advil can’t handle. My periods are normally awful, I throw up, and often have to lay in bed. After insertion I started my period (normal timing) and so far it has been so easy. Normally I use like 12 super tampons A DAY but only have gone through 5 the last three days? I have had no mood swings. I feel good and happy!  I will tell y’all how it goes after another month or two!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena place in early March and that was the worst part. Let me tell you the pain that followed insertion for 4 days after was next to unbearable, and I had already had a child, I had figured it would be a walk in the park. I suffered through those first few days with so much pain I felt sick and my period was like something had been killed. But let me tell you what ladies since then I almost forget that its there. I have had small amounts of spotting when I am due for my period and mild to medium cramps for about a day but other than that its been pretty great. No Acne, no extreme weight gain (with nexplanon I gained 65 lbs) I have actually lost weight with little exercise and no diet change. Ladies its all about what our bodies can work with. This birth control was my last option before just using condoms all the time, and so far so good. I think the 4 days of pain is definitely worth the 99% protection for 5 years.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Today marks my four weeks with the Kyleena IUD. The first two weeks were absolute nightmare. I had non stop cramping, it was awful. I got my first period 5 days early. And it lasted 9 days. My cycles are usually 4 days. The bleeding wasn’t to heavy so I didn’t mind. After my period, cramping has pretty much disappeared. The darker spotting hasn’t. But it’s expected to last for a while. One thing I want to note is that compared to most reviews here, my skin has cleared since Kyleena. And I’m not experiencing weight gain at all. I’ve actually lost 8 lbs since insertion. I’m just glad the horrific cramping is gone for now.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my Kyleena inserted the beginning of February, the initial insertion process was similar to painful period cramping but otherwise manageable. Following insertion I had very extreme mood swings for the first two months. I was crying everyday and would fly off the handle for no reason. The first month I did not get a period but for the last four months it's been consistently 10 days long, with spotting the whole month. I've developed severe cystic acne on my back and chin. I'm debating having it removed.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had switched from Paraguard IUD to Skyla IUD hoping for lighter periods. Within 3 months of having my IUD switched I was having a lot of pain, so I went to my OBGYN and found out I was pregnant!!!!! Further tests were done and I had an ectopic pregnancy! I was admitted to the ER and was in surgery within 3 hours. My ectopic pregnancy had ruptured I had internal bleeding and lost my left tube.
