I have increased anxiety, more mood swings, and oiler skin from Kyleena. I also experienced such a terrible smell from down there a few weeks after and I took medicine prescribed by the Dr and it went away. I do notice I get BV more but I insert boric acid to balance my PH when my vagina feels different.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena  inserted a few weeks ago.  Pain wasn’t unbearable but did hurt. Felt like major period cramps. Only about 4 of the cramps. It was QUICK. Also works for 5 years so that’s great.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It technically did what it was supposed to do. I didn't become pregnant. Insertion process was crampy but not awful. After getting it inserted I had a period for the first six months and then I stopped getting a period entirely. I also started to grow hair on my chin and sex became painful. It made it really hard for me to get wet. So yeah, didn't get pregnant, but I really wish I had never gotten it in the first place.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):DO NOT get this birth control. I got the IUD inserted about a year and a half ago and about 3 months into getting it I started getting a little bit of acne here and there. About 8 months into it I started having full fledged breakouts which soon turned into hormonal cystic acne. I thought it was due to stress at first but eventually realized it was because of my IUD. I got it taken out and am now on the pill and my skin has improved a little - still a long way to to. I had never had bad skin before - always perfect skin with no breakouts.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I received the Mirena on February 11, 2019 and it have been causing me issues since I received it. Mirena is extremely painful going in and cause bleeding with terrible cramping. I have been experiencing terrible migraines, nausea, abdominal cramping,  sore breast, and vomiting. However I am scheduled to get it removed in a week and I am excited.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD inserted after giving birth to my son in 2012. I had it for 5 years and it cause a little discomfort (I was cramping with it a lot) but it was otherwise pleasant. I took it out because they cramps increased after sex. I needed to get back on something because my periods were painful and long. I went with Kyleena this time around and it is THE WORST THING EVER. Facial hair! Cramp! Spotting! Severe constipation! Severe acne! Gas! Bloating! WEIGHT GAIN!!!! Breast soreness! My vagina was itching ! It is terribleeeeeee! My doctor suggest about 6 months ago I give it a full year to see if my body will adjust and it hasn't. KYLEENA MUST GO!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have the Liletta for one year now. Anyone who reviews an IUD sooner than 6 months hasn't yet had the full experience of an IUD. Yes, it wasn't pleasant getting it inserted, but childbirth is much worse. I bled for 6 weeks straight after insertion. During the first several weeks I would a random painful cramp that would last around 10 minutes. It was semi regular after that. At 6 months it was so light it was hard to say it was a period and not moderate spotting as only a liner was needed. This month is one year. I would do it again in a heartbeat. I am now 39 and done with children, done with pills, and done with condoms.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got Skyla today at my local planned parenthood. I was skeptical at first, but the insertion was not as bad as I thought it was...It feels more like a strong period cramp, like the ones you get when you first started your period at 10-12. The severe cramps subsided shortly after, but 8 hours post insertion I only feel very mild cramps which is normal. So far I highly recommend Skyla.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for 2.5 years prior to Kyleena but figured 5 years would be better than 3 when it came time to switch. I had constant infections for the 6 months I had Kyleena that would come and go, amongst a ton of other unpleasant side effects. It made my acne really good though with Spironolactone. I have a ton of friends with Kyleena and they love it and haven’t had problems. The only way for you to find out whether not your body will take to it is to try it. If it doesn’t work, take it out and try something else. I really wanted to love it but getting it taken out seemed like the only logical option for me. Ps the insertion and removal doesn’t hurt at all, just take an extra Advil and you’ll be ok (dr said this was fine), though be ready for a few hours of cramps the next day.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted yesterday. The process was quick. I'm not going to lie, it hurt, but it was not unbearable. Reading reviews makes it seem like it was the worst pain of your life—it felt like a few waves of intense period cramps, but for someone who got unbearable period cramps before birth control, it was not the worst pain. I had a lot of cramping after but when I woke up this morning it seems like it has passed.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am 41, have had two vaginal births. The insertion took about 3 minutes. There were two flashes of pain, a pinching, cramping feeling, and it was done. I had been terrified of the procedure, and it was genuinely fine - and I don’t have particularly high pain threshold or anything. I took deep breaths, told myself to remain calm, and it was done extremely quickly. I had cramps afterwards for about 3 minutes - pain was completely gone within minutes, and I drove home. Not a drop of pain after, but some mild (almost invisible) spotting, which stopped by the next morning. So far so good - I wonder why I didn’t do this years - decades - ago. I live in a country with universal health care so I didn’t have to pay a cent. Had I not had a prescription the IUD would have cost 100 Euros. I'm blown away at the costs I’m seeing listed above.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted yesterday and it overall hasn't been that bad. I had pretty severe cramps during insertion and for about 2 hours after. I took some midol and got some dinner and felt a little better after. This morning waking up I had very very minimal cramps, and almost no spotting anymore. I've been back to myself all day and had about a 30 min attack of cramps and that has been it. So far very comfortable  with the IUD and nice to know I'm protected for a good amount of time. Insertion was not as terrible as I thought it would be. Very quick and easy

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I love Mirena as a birth control! Absolute best. Wish I had tried it along time ago and not been so weirded out by it. Insertion was a breeze, felt no pain, but let’s be honest, nothing compares to labor.  I got it inserted after I had my son. No pill to remember, no nasty side effects like cramps or moodiness. Best part is that I’m actually in the mood for sex! Pills always made me feel so blah.  I’ve had it inserted for 6 months and very happy. I can still tell when I ovulate but I do not get a period. Haven’t had one since insertion. Spotting after insertion but disappeared. Strongly recommend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for about 6 months now.  I loved the concept of something I didn’t have to remember to take once a day. BUT I developed severe anxiety and depression. So unlike me and came out of nowhere with no life changes. Cramping increased and I had 2 periods a month! It was a pain in the butt. I had it removed today and hope things go back to normal!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was absolutely terrified to get Kyleena after hearing all the horror stories about the pain. Today I went in to have it inserted, and ladies, it is not nearly as bad as everyone makes it sound. The insertion was an uncomfortable minute with about 10 minutes of what feels like heavy period cramps afterward. My doctor had suggested that I schedule the procedure during my period, as the cervix is more dilated at this time making the insertion easier. I am glad I followed that advice. I’ve spent the rest of my day out and about, pain free.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I took a cervix softening pill and 3 Advils. During/after insertion waves of awful pain came over my whole body- probably similar to contractions (never been pregnant before). This lasted about 2-3 days. My gyno just said to take Advil. On day 2 I had to take a lot of Advil within 1 hour, and still felt like I was about to pass out. Aleeve seemed to work a bit better. For 2-3 weeks had constant spotting. Right away noticed bad abdominal bloating. It was almost non-stop (3-4 good days per month) making me look 5 months pregnant on worst days, and only went away 100% 1 month after IUD removal. I’d have 2-4 days of barely-there spotting with SEVERE cramping every month. After 10 months I started feeling constant discomfort and my uterus, as if the IUD was poking/scratching me. I had my gyno remove it after 11 month total. Removal was painful, because my gyno had to really dig around the uterus to find the string. I spotted for 1-2 days, and my periods were back to normal that same month.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had a horrible experience with the Miren IUD. I had always been on the pill and after baby I tried the IUD. Shortly after I became overwhelmed with anxiety and depression. I was a new mom and couldn’t perform my duties. I was in a dark place. My digestion was so messed up I was in so much pain trying to go to the bathroom I would come close to passing out. I have been Mirena free for 3 months and I’m working so hard to get my body back. The depression and anxiety are gone. My body is very sick still. I have mild digestion issues. I take many supplements to balance it out. I have daily headaches. I’m always tired no matter how much sleep I get. I have a lot of pressure in my head. I still do not know the extent of the damage caused, but I was healthy before Mirena and I can say it has ruined my life and robbed me of my child’s first 7 months. I do not recommend anybody to get this kind of birth control. The risks and side effects are to severe when there are other options out there.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):So I’ve had my Mirena IUD for about a year now I have weight gain which was surprising because I do eat healthy and work out so my weight usually stays the same. Since I’ve been on the IUD I have gained about 25-30 pounds that I can’t loose. My breast hurts for at least 3 weeks out of a month I have spotting and brown discharge I had strong cramps for the first 7 months. I have had my hair falling out too. As far as birth control it has worked for me but these side effects have been hard on how I see my self and I’m not confident anymore. (If you don’t have horrible side effects I’m sure I would love it. )

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got Kyleena put in a few days ago, I have a high pain  tolerance so the I thought the insertion wouldn’t be bad, but  holy cow it hurt really bad. I think it was because I was overthinking the pain. It doesn’t last long though. Many people say that they cramp hard the rest of the day but I just popped some ibuprofen and then I played a softball game and was fine. Still had some cramping in my lower back though.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I've had Skyla since 2015. Replaced in 2018 (when it was due) and couldn't be happier. Take some tylenol or ibuprofen before insertion and you'll be fine. The first time you don't know what to expect, but if your doctor is a professional you won't cramp long. First time having it placed your uterus has to get used to it being there, so I cramped on and off for about a week. Totally worth it. Never been pregnant or had any side effects. I have about 1 light period a year, usually in April. Couldn't speak higher of this product. I love it!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):After insertion, which was much more painful than they said it would be,  I gained back 50 lbs I had lost 2 yrs before. Over 6 yrs I'd asked 2-3 times about removal due to side affects,  Drs convinced me it was not Mirena. Finally,  after 6th year and having horrible night sweats, panic attacks, headaches and basically the worst year ever, I demanded removal.  They still tried to convince me to get another.   Afterwards things got MUCH worse.  I was probably entering perimenopause and my hormones were so messed up by then.  I am now on HRT which has helped a lot but I am still having a lot of problems as I try to get back to normal and will attempt to balance hormones with seed cycling.   Haven't started yet.  Since removal of Mirena I've lost 35 lbs.  I will tell everyone I know not to use that thing.
Mirena (levonorgestrel):Mirena gave me the worst acne and my hair started falling out.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena IUD inserted August 2018. Getting the IUD inserted definitely wasn’t comfortable but it is bearable and worth the tiny bit of discomfort you feel for a short period of time. I cramped a little bit after getting it inserted but nothing that some medication couldn’t fix. I didn’t really get any negative side effects from the Kyleena. I can say that it makes me moody but I was always was moody lol. My period got lighter as months passed and 9 months later and my period is finally gone. Everyone’s body is different but just thought I’d leave my positive experience on here.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for almost a year (2018 is when I got it; now June 5th 2019) and I guess I like it enough. It’s my first birth control and I was nervous about insertion but I got the numbing shot and it still hurt a bit, but not as bad as I thought it would. I was having horrible pains the next day, but I had sex anyway to try and get rid of the pains like I would for period cramps. Bad idea. The following week was hell and I cried often. Mostly when I was trying to relax or go to sleep. I had to press hard on my stomach for the pain to subside and I cried myself to sleep most of those nights. After the pain went away I was feeling a lot better; definitely more like myself. What I find to be the worst at this point is my periods are 2x what they were before I got the IUD. They’re a lot lighter, but they now last two weeks instead of just one. The rating of 6 is due to the fact that it keeps me from getting pregnant and I don’t get horrible cramps anymore.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Mirena IUD for 6 months and am pleased with my choice. Upon getting it, I was sore the next day but functional. I had mild side effects for the first 2 months including spotting, cramps, back acne and general blah feeling. The side effects were mild and intermittent. Within 2 months, the side effects never returned. I stopped getting my period, which became less and less each time until I stopped having one after 2 months. My first period on mirena was heavy and painful lasting about 5 days. My second lasted 3 days and was mild. My third was light spotting and then nothing since. I have not gained weight but I haven't lost any either. My weight seems pretty fixed on this IUD. Once the mild side effects were gone, I truly forgot I even have an IUD. Very happy with this choice and glad I stuck it out the first few months. So, no periods, no lasting side effects, no pregnancy and no need to remember to take a pill... Worth the 2 months it took my body to adjust.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Read the negative reviews and figured that they might be the exceptions not the norm. I guess I was the exception. I am 30 years old, have never been pregnant, was on my period and took a dilation medication 8 hours before the procedure. The pain from the insertion was unreal, it just kept coming in wave after wave, it was so intense actually that I lost consciousness and started twitching apparently, I have never lost consciousness in my life.  When I came to, I was confused, sweating profusely, and in so much pain,  the doctor and nurse were staring at me terrified and called the paramedics. The doctor immediately removed it and the symptoms started to subside. I was still in pain for the next day. I am told it was a vagus nerve reaction due to pain and anxiety maybe? Please read reviews before trying this, I know this is not everyone’s experience, but I wish I had trusted the ones I read, because my experience was pretty upsetting and one I wish I could take back.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I'm sharing for those of you considering! I'll start by saying EVERYONE'S BODY IS DIFFERENT! Especially with online reviews, I notice that people (as per human nature) tend to share their negative experiences and rarely do so when it's positive. I spent HOURS reading reviews online for all different kinds of IUD's... and it scared the hell out of me! Horror story after horror story and I psyched myself up so much fearing that I would be one of them. My experience was AMAZING! I give massive credit to my doctor - it's all about the expertise and skill of how it's put in. 800 mg of ibuprofen few hours before. 2/10 scale of pain/the mildest cramp during insertion. Drove home. Forgot about it a day later. Only light spotting and no other side effects. 3 weeks post insertion, I'm feeling so great!Trust YOUR body and don't comparing it to anyone else's and "what could be." I know I did, and I wish I hadn't.... :) Best of luck!!!!!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Just got this put in today, was the WOrSE pain ever and I had two kids naturally, my cervix was to tight so she had to dilate it, then my uterus was crooked so another painful step, I’m praying this pain goes away!! I go back in three weeks unless I still have pain then need to come back tomorrow for removal, my doctor said you should not have pain or problems as the hours pass of getting put in, will update later

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had to get an IUD because I’m unable to take oral birth control due to the reactions with my seizure medication. The insertion pain was a 7/10 for 45 seconds then intermittent cramping for a few weeks after. For the first year, my periods were long (almost 2 weeks of red-brown spotting). They then became almost nonexistent. I was incredibly sad when I had to get it removed after the 3 years. My new insurance didn’t cover a new one so I opted for getting off BC for now. I started my period a month after and have been regular since. I would recommend the Skyla for sure!  The reasons it’s a 9 is because of the cramping part at the start and the annoying long periods of spotting for the first year.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I switch oral contraceptives to the IUD shortly after getting married. The insertion was very painful and I have a high pain tolerance. Cramping the next few days was uncomfortable but bearable. I’ve had my IUD for a little over two years now and want to switch back to oral pills. I can feel the IUD during sex which makes it painful and the biggest reason I want it out. I also randomly have periods with various lengths and flows. Additionally, I have gotten ovarian cysts which are extremely painful (turns out the pill has hormones in it to prevent those, IUDs do not). Haven’t gotten pregnant though! I would recommend a IUD to a friend but warn them about feeling it during sex and the random cramping.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Liletta for almost two years. I had twins and the thought of having another child was unnerving. My dr convinced me to get an IUD and said Liletta was the best option. I bled for 6 months straight, have blurred vision, horrible weight gain which won’t budge despite diet changes and 2.5-3 mile runs every day, bacterial infections, acne all over my chin/jawline plus my shoulders and back, horrible mood swings, and back pain so bad I can’t even get out of bed some days. My dr kept insisting I keep it in, and against better judgement I listen. But after two years I will be getting it removed in two days and I’m praying everything changes for the better.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After one year I started Melasma (brown patches caused by hormones) on face. Not recommended

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I read all the reviews online and psyched myself out, I was so scared when I went to get the kyleena. I had it inserted this morning, and the pain is a 4/10. It just feels like a bad cramp. I haven’t had any bleeding, but MAJOR cramps all day today. Hopefully it gets better, I can’t wait to not have to worry about birth control for five years!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I chose Kyleena because I thought it would be least likely to impact my mental health. I have major depressive disorder, dysthymia, and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). It is hard to be sure but I am almost positive that Kyleena hasn’t affected my mental health. If anything, I think it has made my mood around my period better. However, there has been some physical pain. Insertion is very painful but quick. Make sure you have a hand to squeeze. I’m a year in now. I get stabbing pains in my cervix  a week before my period. But I have a high pain tolerance and have chronic pain for other reasons, so I am used to it. I use a stress ball to help me when it’s painful and use a heating pad. Also I have some pain after sex sometimes. If this all sounds like too much pain, then an IUD might not be for you. But because I got what I wanted out of this IUD I am happy. Oh also I used to have a pretty normal flow, now I just have red/brown discharge for 2-3 days.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the Mirena in since 2015 I was 18 and no previous pregnancies. After I got it, it was very painful but I didn’t pass out or cry. I had a flight to Florida immediately after so that was the worst! In the beginning I had a period that lasted about 2 months, but It was very light. I’ve always had cramps with my period so the Mirena didn’t make it much worse. Up until now 2019 I started getting a lot of pain and full aches daily and painful sex. Possible increase in my depression & anxiety at the beginning of this year. I'm getting it replaced with the Kyleena which is much smaller and lower dosage so I’m hoping it helps!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have been using birth control since I was 14 years old and I have had a constant battle with getting my periods regular and finding what works for me. I would always mess my schedule up with the pills, the patches would rip off, etc. So I decided to try the IUD "Skyla", I got that placed 5/26/16 and the pain was very intense - my biggest mistake was not taking pain medicine and eating prior to my appointment. Make sure you do that!! After my 3 year mark, I got the Skya replaced with Kyleena due to it lasting 2 additional years. I must say getting the 2nd IUD was nothing compared to getting the first IUD placed. If you already have the IUD try to wait it out and allow your body to get used to the hormone and change of birth control before giving up quickly. I rarely have break through bleeding and quite honestly forget I have it most of the time. Highly recommend!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my kyleena 1 week ago, the pain was bad but it was over quick and I’d definitely do it again if I had to. My period has either been heavy or non existent in a matter just one or two days. I'm hoping the period stops but so far I’m liking it. My sex drive has definitely gone up since I was onmy previous contraceptive the Nuva ring. The Nuva ring gave me terrible migraine and PMS like crazy. But  Kyleena seems to be better even if it’s only been a week.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got it inserted and I was so scared of the insertion. I definitely built it up to be a bigger deal that  what it really was. It took 30 seconds and it was just a tight cramp. It hurt but it is so fast. The cramps after are pretty terrible now. Just laying with a heating pad. Seems worth the 5 year birth control

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I wish I had read the reviews b4 I got the Skyla IUD inserted. The nurse told me prior to my procedure that upon insertion it would feel like a period cramp for a few seconds. In my mind I was ok with  that becayse hey I know how that feels, but it happened to be the worst pain I’d ever felt in my life. (The pain is tolerable). May 10 was the day I got my IUD and I've had indescribable pain that last close to 2 weeks but ibuprofen 600mg every 4 to 6 hrs helped. I'm now to the point I don’t need the meds but I still have pain in my pelvic area. I’ve been bleeding since insertion considering they suggest you come in during you're cycle. I'm giving it another week or 2, hopefully the bleeding stops, if not I’m highly considering removal. I can’t say if it’s effective or not because I haven't had sex with the IUD inside of me yet considering I've been in pain and bleeding since insertion, but I don't think my doctor would’ve suggested it, if it wasn’t effective.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena about 8 months ago, in October. I got it because of my endometriosis which was causing my cramps to be unbearable 24/7. The insertion was just about as painful as you’d imagine but it’s a very short lived pain. I had cramps the day I got it in but other than that I was as good as gold. I never get my period but regardless of the where I would be on my cycle if I did get my period, my cramps are even worse than they were before I got it. The pain of the cramps is equivalent to the pain you have when they first insert it, so very harsh. I’m not sure that this is an experience that anyone else will have, but I think it’s safe to assume that it won’t always help.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I didn't get pregnant with liletta, so it deserves a 3/10 for doing it's job. The side effects are unbearable. While on Liletta, I had my very first panic attack and ended up in an ambulance because I thought I was dying. I had to be prescribed Xanax because of the overwhelming anxiety. From the moment I got it, I had spotting that would last for months and when the bleeding stopped- it probably stopped for a week and then I would spot for another few months. Can't believe I kept it as long as I did.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):22 years old, I have never been pregnant. I was on the combo pill from age 16 to 21, only had breakouts every period & only for the week that I was bleeding. After high school, I had a hard time keeping up the routine with my pills. I was also experiencing migraine with aura, which ended up causing me to stop the pill entirely. For months I was researching what would be the best option for me (Progesterone only). I got the Kyleena inserted two weeks ago (5/10/19). It was definitely the most pain I have ever experienced, aside from migraines. I bled extremely heavily during the procedure & well after. The cramping has NOT let up at all. I'm trying to tough it out until my four week check up but its getting increasingly more difficult to tolerate the pain.  Another draw back for me is that I have been continuously spotting since the insertion, & my boyfriend can feel it. On the bright side, it works.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena IUD inserted in the very beginning of March. it was painful but nothing excruciating! The next day I woke up bloated as EVER. I couldn’t even button my jeans without squeezing my stomach. I bled everyday, some days heavier than others. Like getting my period everyday. at least twice a week I wake up to severe cramping (still, after almost 3 months). Actually, it’s 4am right now and I can’t sleep because of cramps. the bleeding has definitely gotten lighter, I wear a tampon or a panty liner everyday because I never know. My poor vagina is never free! Even when I don't bleed, I still get severe cramping. I’ve been able to have sex with my boyfriend a few times since insertion when the bleeding seems to be at bay, but working up a sex drive is a pain. I read good stories about this IUD and have coworkers tell me they love it, so I'll give it more time, but after the 5 month mark if I’m still dealing with this I’m done and never looking back!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The Kyleena insertion took ~3 min. but the pain level was far worse. The doctor measures the depth of your uterus to ensure the IUD is safe to fit. This process requires a device to be pushed against the upper part of your uterus. HOLY MOLY that was painful - but quick. After insertion, I had BAD cramps for about 1 hour which subsided to moderately painful cramps after about 8 hours. I took 500mg of Aleve 30 min before the IUD insertion procedure & I ate a solid breakfast. The insertion is terrible and hurts, but  it is over very quickly. Be sure to have pain reliever & a heating pad ready. I took it easy for about two days and no work. I had my BF come with me for the procedure so he could observe what I was going through & so he could drive me home. I am now over 5 weeks in & I’ve had no problems with the IUD. I’ve gotten my first period with the IUD & it is so mild. I haven’t gained weight, developed acne, or any of the negative comments you might read. On the plus side, my libido has skyrocketed.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Worked great for 3 years then while going through a divorce I ended up conceiving  twins!! Turning my 3 kids into 5. Ruined my life. Yes you can get pregnant with Mirena and even conceive twins, Thank you Mirena.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena in for 2 years exactly. I found it better and easier on my body & mood compared to the contraceptive  pill, but definitely not a cake walk. The insertion was quick but very alarming to my body as I broke out in a major sweat and got dizzy. My doc had to run and get me a cold washcloth for my forehead to calm me down. I was able to drive home, but had major cramping for about 2-3 days.  At the 3 month mark, I noticed my mood was very apathetic all the time. I had no highs or lows, which is pretty infuriating. I gained 8-10lbs without any diet change, my hair thinned/broke easily, I broke out on my back and chin/neck and my sex drive lessened. To feel like myself, I had to get acupuncture every month to level out my hormones. It helped a little. The only plus is that my period mostly disappeared after 2 months. I would spot once in a while, but only for a day or so. I got it removed (no pain at all & easy) and got pregnant with my first baby easily 3 months later with zero complications.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had my KYLEENA since July 2018 the insertion is a little painful but no worse than a mild cramp from a period! I suggest taking off of from work or school!  I love my IUD. I used to have 11-13 day HEAVY periods now I have 1-2 days super light don’t have to wear a pad or tampon! Still occasionally get a cramp or two but Kyleena is wonderful birth control!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):As far as being a contraceptive with Kylenena I haven't had any issues. I like feeling very confident that it's working and that I don't have to remember a pill every day. My period has stopped, which is honestly very nice to not have to worry about bleeding.  The insertion was horrible, but that's probably because I just had a Paragard removed. My issues have been with the side effects. I believe I'm very susceptible to hormones and I've had a lot of mood issues since getting the Kyleena - increased anxiety, apathy, sadness, numbness, etc. Not unlike my experience on the pill. I also wake up bloated every morning even though I've tried cutting out the things in my diet I know might give me that reaction. My boobs are almost constantly sore and unpredictability swollen. I also have light cramping most days. It kind of feels like I'm constantly PMSing.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Looks like I am one of the unlucky ones with my Kyleena IUD! I'm posting not to scare others away, but to stress the importance that on the day of insertion I recommend having a day off work, a driver, and pre-cooked meals ready prior. I am 39, never pregnant, never wish to be. My doc recommended the Kyleena for endometriosis and moods, it was inserted two days ago and does it cause pain yes the worst pain EVER. (And I have coped with endometriosis, fibroids, and ovarian cysts.) Diazepam and Alleve, but neither touched the pain. My dad drove. I sat in the passenger seat moaning. I may have cried a little. By evening, significantly better, still intense cramps. Different than normal period cramp: short, sharp pain, like someone inside my uterus trying to stab their way out with an ice pick. Still a few, not nearly as bad.  Hoping this Kyleena IUD will help me. Will be really mad if it doesn't! The rating of 5 stars reflects theoretic efficacy of  not getting  pregnant and  I am cautious optimism that this will help my endometriosis and mood problems. At any rate, I don't think I can handle having it out any time soon.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This Kyleena birth control is my very first one I have ever used and it was wonderful because I can have sex without worrying about pregnancy the only downfall for me would have to be the light spotting- I have had this inserted for about 4 months and I am still bleeding constantly( lightly ). I don't like wearing pads and liners every day but I'm crossing my fingers my body will get use to the hormones later this month or sometime in the near future. I should also mention that my partner feels the string so I will be getting that cut a little bit shorter

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 20 years old, never been pregnant. Insertion of Kyleena was painful but bearable, however, the horrible cramping started immediately after. I thought I was going to pass out in the doctors office. Was supposed to go to class later but ended up sitting in a coffee shop unable to move for 5 or so hours as I could not even walk from the pain and couldn't drive myself home. Extremely heavy bleeding immediately after that lasted about 10 days. The main issue is that the cramps have not let up. Never in my life have I experienced cramps like this. It feels like a sharp stabbing pain on one side that radiates down my thigh and to my back and the other side of my stomach. When they first started getting really bad a week after insertion I thought my uterus had perforated and was getting ready to go to ER the pain was so bad. Apparently these are normal according to doctor and will go away. However, I have had it for 5 months now and they have not let up yet, happening almost every day still.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion hurt but I do have a very low pain tolerance. The doctor suggested Skyla because I had never had children and Skyla was the smallest. I was advised to have someone drive me and take Ibuprofen prior to my appointment. During insertion I nearly fainted but my doctor was great and was able to talk me through everything. Before I left the doctor informed me that she had patients faint or say they no longer wanted to get the IUD due to the pain. After hearing that I was pretty proud of myself considering my pain tolerance is zero! My cramps were pretty intense for a few days and I was not able to sit up straight but that all went away.I had it in for a 1  1/2 years before having it taken out (which was a breeze) My decision came to take it out when I started getting periods every 2 1/2 weeks and they would last 8-9 days. I went 2 months like this before deciding it was time to take it out.I honestly loved it and might still have it if it didn't start affecting my periods.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for 4 years total now. Insertion the first time was very painful but the removal and the second implant was bearable. Since I’ve been on it I’ve had 2 periods total, with some spotting and cramping. It’s so nice having to not worry about a period! But it has lead to several infections, cramping and crazy mood swings and anxiety. It’s hard to handle at times, especially since I’ve got the second implanted. I also get sharp pains when exercising or tensing my abdominal muscles too tightly. I would not recommend if you have daily anxiety or depression already.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had the Liletta for 4 months now. I bled for the first 2 months pretty much every day and had been really enjoying no period since then with occasional minimal spotting. But the BIG  downfall for me has been an extremely low sex drive which is NOT normal at all for me. I am very sexual, now I hardly want it. I have also been feeling very lethargic and emotionless, but I don't feel depressed. This has all changed since starting Liletta. So, I am going to get it checked out. I am hoping its all a weird coincidence but doesn't seem like it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was absolutely terrified to get Kyleena put in - I was having panic attacks and kept second guessing myself as to whether  I should even get this. I knew this was my best option (I didn’t want anything to worsen my anxiety, and I didn’t want to gain weight). Anyways I finally did it and the insertion process of Kyleena was NOT BAD AT ALL!!!!! it literally felt like 2 period cramps and that was it. It took (and I kid you not) 2 minutes and I was done. I’m so so happy I did this and I shouldn’t have been so scared to do it in the first place. ITS REALLY NOT THAT BAD!!! Don’t listen to other peoples horror stories!! All the good stories no one bothers to return here to write them, they are just off living there lives, not even thinking of their Kyleena

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my kyleena inserted last July after deciding I didn't want to take a pill everyday anymore. I absolutely LOVE the concept on kyleena and so I am gutted that I'm getting it removed next week. It took me a while for my bleeding to regulate. It would be a 3 day break in between periods until January when I had a 2 week break.  9 months later I finally have regular and very light periods. However, the cramping is ridiculous, I am constantly in so much pain. The only time I am not cramping is the final 3 days of my period.  I have had an ultrasound and everything has been confirmed to be in the right place. I have now have the implant inserted... slightly nervous due to the mixed reviews but hopefully it will mean no more constant cramping!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 20 years old, 5'2" and weigh about 115 pounds. I got the Kyleena inserted almost a month ago. It was a super fast process. The pain is quite intense, but only lasted less than a minute. I had cramps for only a few minutes after the procedure. Make sure you eat before, otherwise you may feel faint. The only symptoms I've had since insertion are heightened emotions and spotting. My sister also got the Kyleena about a year ago because she has Endometriosis, and it has REALLY helped her. I highly recommend the Kyleena IUD--just make sure you have a great doctor to put it in.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena in for a full 9 months.* After 4 months of LOVING the Kyleena (bled for one month then period completely stopped, skin great, no weight gain, normal sex drive), I started to develop severe cystic acne on my cheeks, chin, mouth. I had acne in high school, but skin was clear before the IUD. My OBGYN explained that because I had taken birth control pills for 5 years (I’m 21, began at 16), my body’s hormones were trying to level out and were sent into WHACK. To counteract Kyleena’s hormones, they put me on Sprintec birth control pills (so now ’m taking 2 forms of birth control), Spironactone (med to balance hormones), and Bactrim (antibiotic to stop cystic acne). All this, and still can’t get the acne under control, now 5 months later. I will be going on Accutane or getting it out. People who have been acne prone in the past —- BEWARE! The benefits of the Kyleena are awesome. But not worth the severe acne and loss of confidence for me. Hope it works better for others.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Mirena was by far the worst birth control ever!! I had has side effects of  my hair falling out TREMENDOUSLY, also pelvic pain abdominal pain, then AFTER ABOUT 6 months I got it removed come to find out it was improperly inserted that’s why it was causing me so much discomfort!! Needless to say it still was a very bad birth control to be honest all birth control made me feel horrible just not myself at all but this one was by far the WORST!!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had insertion of Kyleena on 02/03/2019 and since I have been patiently waiting for the side effects to subside. I had bleeding after insertion that turned into a full blown period lasting 18 days. It seems to be common that my period comes the same time every month and still lasts almost 3 weeks. Even when I'm not full on bleeding there's always some type of smelly discharge. Haven't really been able to have sex without feeling insecure about blood or smells. Super annoying, I guess it is effective birth control since you can never have sex without a period interrupting you. I also have the worst cramps and bleed heavier than I ever did on my regular period. I did loose weight, but I have increased anxiety and mood swings. Considered taking out sooner, really wanted this to work but all of the side effects almost aren't worth it to me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have Kyleena for a year now, I had it inserted a month after my second child was born and had no problem with the procedure. I chose Kyleena over Mirena because it has less hormones and you’re supposed to still have your period what I thought to be a closer to natural thing. I bled and had light pelvic discomfort for three months, after that I had irregular bleeding and spotting every single month. In one particular month I bled so much I had to change pads every two hours and the following two months after that I had cramps and spots but no real blood which made me resort for a pregnancy test.I have also experienced very high levels of anxiety and some weight gain, discharges with strong smell, cramping, and some acne.I really want it removed but need to decide the next form of birth control first.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):had the Lliletta IUD in for 2 1/2 months and just this week I started getting HORRIBLE anxiety and my body is so so tired and leaves my head foggy from the tiredness. My muscles felt like I just ran or worked out, HORRIBLE pain from period cramps where I couldn’t move. I started bleeding from insertion for about 3 weeks and then it stopped, now ever since I got  got my period again I’m still bleeding. I’m on my 10th day of bleeding and and I’m still bleeding. I feel hopeless, having nightmares, and I just don’t feel like myself anymore. Hopefully this all goes away after I have this thing removed ASAP!!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):After reading the Skyla reviews before my insertion, I was absolutely petrified as I have a fairly low pain tolerance, and never had children. In the end, the Skyla insertion was so much easier and more painless than I’d anticipated! Just strong cramping for like ten seconds. Given, the week afterward I had pretty consistent cramping, but it wasn’t unbearable. My first period afterward was heavier than usual, but now they’re back to normal. Generally, the side effects stopped after about a month. The one thing I didn’t anticipate was how badly I broke out in acne after I went off birth control. It makes sense why, but I think it flared up worse because I’d abruptly ceased oral birth control. However, now my skin’s fine and I mostly don’t even know Skyla’s there!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So far so good! I got Skyla inserted after taking Nexplanon out, and I am very much still getting adjusted to it, but I am so content! The doctor who inserted my IUD was beyond amazing and supportive. My cervix was tilted and difficult to pry open, but the ladies were so good at calming me down that it was bearable. The pain of insertion was probably a 7.5/10 and I have never had children. I've been spotting on and off and just completed a time (about 4 days) of heavy bleeding, which was just me getting my period. The cramps are tough sometimes, but I'm tougher than them. Also, I experienced some severe bloating for several days after insertion. The bloating has gone away already and my skin is clearing and I am starting to lose weight. Overall, I look forward to my body getting adjusted to the hormones so that the spotting eases off. I love Skyla!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta placed in on 3/8/18 after my procedure was done. I haven’t had any symptoms except mood swings & depression but I don’t think it’s from the IUD. Haven’t gained weight. The only thing I don’t like about it is sometimes when you have sex your partner can feel the IUD.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Put in after 2nd child's birth at my OBs urging in April 2016. EXTREMELY painful to have it put in; I broke into a cold sweat and became dizzy. Checked via ultrasound and said it was in place. Verified again a week later.January 2019 went to the gyno for a reoccurring yeast infection. Told her that I had been unable to locate IUD strings for a time. (None of my doctors EVER told me to check for my strings. Google did.)  She couldn't find them and booked an ultrasound for a few days later. Unable to locate Liletta during ultrasound.She recommends new BC assuming expulsion. I didn't agree and she said I could have an x-ray for confirmation.X-rayed a week later and it was located in my pelvic region. The Liletta had perforated my uterus (probably at insertion) and had to be laproscopically removed in February 2019. Starting to get bills now and it's not beautiful. Would NOT recommend having this put in 6 weeks PP. Fortunately did not fall pregnant during the 3 years I had it.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have only had the Liletta for about 3 weeks.  Insertion was extremely painful.  I thought it was only supposed to hurt during insertion, not after as well.  I felt bloated for the first 3 days.  However, I went and did yoga, ran on the treadmill, and hiked the very next day after insertion.  No problem.  I only spotted lightly for 3 days (not enough to even wear an actual pad).  I have experienced vaginal dryness  during intercourse, which was NEVER a problem.  I did some reading, and apparently this is a common side effect. No mood swings, no weight gain, no depression.  Just a little bit of acne on my chin/jawline, but nothing extreme.  However, knowing that I have the most effective form of birth control (after tubal ligation and abstinence) gives me such a huge relief that I will handle the dryness issue.  I love this IUD thus far.  Will update a few months from now after I have experienced a few cycles on it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):When I was researching IUD's I couldn't find a ton of non horror stories (ie good stories) with just the process, so here I am leaving that comment!Getting it inserted takes about 5 minutes, it isn't terrible, but it also isn't fun. She insert the speculum, and then ask me to cough. Then she insert it, and this is the part that hurts. There was intense pain for about 5-10 seconds, then she waited about 30 seconds and again, intense pain for about 5-10 seconds. After she finished with the insertion it only took about 1 minute for me to start INTENSELY cramping. I ended up cramping pretty bad 5-7 out of 10 for the first day but that was the worst of it. If I'm being honest the cramping was worse than the actual insertion.  So I would recommend taking the day off of work/school if you can because you will not feel super hot. I have now had it for a week and after that first day my cramping has been about a 1-2/10, with a little bleeding. I would recommend this to anyone

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena IUD for a little over a year and a half. The first year has been amazing, but shortly after that year mark, I feel it's changed. I've had a lot of cramping and sharp pains. Recently I've taken 2 pregnancy test because I am having a lot of pregnancy symptoms. I'm fatigued, nauseous, and have had extreme breast pain.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I was hesitant to get an IUD so my doctor recommended the skyla because it's a little smaller and has less hormones. I've never birthed a child, and I wasn't on my period during the insertion. The insertion was a nightmare, it took several tries for my doc to get it in properly. I almost fainted from the pain and anxiety, after four/five tries, he finally said it was good to go. I had to wait in the room after for about 20 minutes before I felt okay enough to drive home. I was bedridden for three days. The last three weeks have been a nightmare, I've had constant heavy spotting and persistent cramps that are sometimes sharp but they're always existent. Nausea every day all day, and very bloated. The skyla IUD is not for me and I'm getting it removed tomorrow.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Got Skyla in December 2018, and bled for about four months everyday. Some days heavy some lighter. I never got pregnant, but I did gain about 12 pounds and got cystic acne which I had never had before. Insertion was horrible. I have had paragard before and actually just switched back to it, and the insertion process is much smoother with paragard. Watch videos on IUD insertions, you’ll then understand why Skyla hurts more. Overall, wouldn’t recommend. Periods never went away, but did get lighter. For me the weight gain and acne just wasn’t worth it. Also had severe cramping for about 2 months. So happy to have it out!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):For me the insertion was not bad at all. I did have the copper one after my last pregnancy and I thought I was going to die with insertion of that one, so I think it depends on your doctors technique as to the amount of pain that the insertion causes. I had mine in and within a few days I did start to develop hives. I kept up with the antihistamines in hope it was not a reaction to the IUD. I do have to add I have a lot of sensitivities. From food to laundry detergent with some medications in that list, but I really wanted this to be the best form of birth control for me. Sadly after the hives continued to progressively get worse my doctor said it was best to remove it and schedule a tubal ligation. The hives are disappearing and I’m starting to feel better. Please remember that every woman is different and while this didn’t work for me, it may work for you!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have always been a firm believe that birth control does not cause weight gain but after losing my pregnancy weight and then getting Liletta at my 6 weeks check up and gaining 65 pounds in 17 months while being active and eating a decent diet is insane. Mood swings were awful! Panic attacks and nightmares were terrible too. My husband and I would talk weekly about my hormone imbalance and how I was a different person. But I just blamed all of this on postpartum depression and stress of a baby but I’ve realized that 18 months later it has to be something else. I got the Kyleena IUD taken out and feel much better already. It’s only been a week

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am a 21 year old never had kids before, that was on the combination pill for 2 years and then the progesterone only pill for 2 years. I can only have progesterone birth control and the progesterone only pill made me spot ALL the time, I really did not like that so I wanted to try the IUD out to see if that would stop the spotting and not have to worry about taking a pill. I’m going to be honest the Kyleena IUD insertion was the worst pain of my life and lasted about an hour afterwards.  At the start I kept thinking to myself this is the stupidest decision ever why did I do this to myself because the pain was unbearable, although it ended up being the best birth control ever, I didn’t bleed after insertion, have only got my period once and I’ve had it in for 4 months and have had no spotting! It’s absolutely amazing, I haven’t had any weight gain, acne, or mood changes! I almost forget I have it in, best decision!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena inserted first but had to get it removed due to severe side effects which were severe agitation, anxiety , very emotional, muscle pain , severe fatigue, weakness, blurred vision, headaches, and joint pain. Went to see my gynae she said this was common and recommend Kyleena as it was less than half the dose of Mirena. Got the Kyleena in 5 weeks ago and have to say the agitation and anxiety decreased but the muscle pain and fatigue is still quite severe I just don’t feel myself very off form , been bleeding on and off for 5 weeks , breasts and under arm very tender and sore I am miserable overall. I am unfortunately one of the few who reacts quite severely to IUD so I am getting it removed ASAP ..

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena in for 6 weeks now. I had my check up with my Doctor and everything is going well. I love not having to take a birth control pill everyday, and there’s no feelings of ‘heaviness’ that the oral combined pill causes. I definitely feel way better. I haven’t had any migraines, which is great. The only down falls are my breakouts. I’ve had quite a few pimples pop up on my chest and back, my face has been more oily than normal, and the irregular bleeding. I’m in a long term relationship so bleeding often doesn’t really bother me, but I could see it being frustrating for someone starting out in a new relationship or single. The longest amount of days in a row for bleeding was 14. I was able to mostly use a panty liner which is nicer than a pad, but still annoying. I’ve been good for the past few weeks now without any bleeding. I definitely suggest trying an IUD out. Especially if you don’t like pills, or in my situation had migraines with aura caused by bc.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted and was told it stays in for up to 5 yrs, and the Dr would have to remove it. 3 months after, it fell out by itself while in the shower.  One of the problems is the Kyleena has a string that hangs down.(for removal). Maybe it was inserted incorrectly?!  I am thinking the use of tampons, inserting and/or removal, can cause the pulling/tugging on the string, which can lead to it falling out. Has anyone else had this issue?

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So, I didn’t get pregnant on Skyla birth control and I lost 20 pounds while on it, but I did want to leave this review cause it’s important to know. Everything was great with insertion and I loved being skinny, but all of those wonderful things that the pill fixes (your acne, PMS/PMDD, cramps, etc) the IUD won't help now. Honestly, because I was on the pill from 16 to 26, I thought those things were teenager problems that disappeared. Turns out the localized hormones are great for pregnancy and weight loss.... but not so good for hormonal problems that I had all along by were being treated by my pill.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my Liletta in for about 8 months. I’m loving it! It hurt a bit during insertion and I had cramps for a few weeks after but it was nothing unbearable. No weight gain, no acne problems... it’s been great overall. The only reason it’s not a 10 is because I still get spotting every few days which is a bit annoying. Overall, I love it. I’ve tried Depo Provera and birth control pills which caused my breasts to ache and chronic mood swings. I 100% would recommend Liletta. I got it for free at planned parenthood too.
Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the Skyla inserted over a year and a half ago, and I am still constantly bleeding.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The insertion of Skyla was a piece of cake for me; felt a bit of an intense cramp for about 2 seconds and that was all. Literally got dressed and I was ready to leave (the Dr was shocked haha). I had cramping for 3 days but I have a high pain tolerance I guess, so it wasn't an issue for me. I had Skyla inserted the very first day of my period and amazingly it reduced the intensity of my period right away. I had irregular periods for 3 months, but I only had Skyla in for 5 months, which I now regret. The only differences I noticed were: loss of words, inability to remember things at times, numbness on thighs for a couple of days, vision seemed to be affected a tiny bit, and stretch marks in lower belly that I did not have for 2 years at the same weight. I gained about 3 lbs in 5 months. No pregnancies and removal was super easy as well. Again, wish my dumb ass didn't remove it but I will totally get it again in the future.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Insertion painful but bearable and recovery time was fine. BUT, Mirena gave my severe acne and pretty bad pelvic, lower back and uterine pain. During intercourse, it would cause nauseousness because I could feel it moving (even though the website and doctors tell you that’s not possible).   I was so confused because all of my friends who had them loved them. Went in for regular and vaginal ultrasounds to test for endometriosis, tested negative. Finally after 16 months decided to get it removed. All of the symptoms listed above went away.I’m not saying to never use the Mirena (no horror story here and many people LOVE it), just if you have gotten it in and are unhappy with it, trust your gut, your body is trying to tell you something. Better safe than sorry :)

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had my Mirena for a little over 2 years. I've been having some ongoing side effects from it (rapid weight gain, monthly, heavy menstrual cycles, acne, irritability, etc) and just went to the Doctor for it last week. My PCP had asked at my last appointment if I have checked my strings. Nobody ever told me that I was supposed to, but that night, I checked. Didn't feel like I was feeling strings, and I couldn't tell if it was in the right spot. Started doing research on my symptoms and saw a bunch of results talking about a misplaced Mirena. Sure enough, at my appointment this last week, my doctor can't find it. They scheduled an ultrasound to locate it for this week. Now knowing all of the very scary things that can happen with IUDs, never again will I get one, and I will forever tell my friends to stay away from them.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena placed 6 weeks postpartum. I’ve had the Skyla before but Dr recommended Kyleena due to better outcomes. Insertion was very painful but I have a low pain tolerance. Cramped for 15 mins and started bleeding immediately. Bleeding lasted for 3 days from start to finish, stopped for 3 days and started back on the 4th. Bleeding is much heavier this time but first periods after postpartum usually are. Cramping hasn’t came back. I have started to gain weight and have headaches a lot but I did with Skyla too and everything stopped after two months or so. Just in the beginning stages but hope it helps.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted around August 2018, the insertion only hurt for a second and then it was over! It felt like a bad cramp but I was completely fine after. I bled for a few weeks and experienced bloating (OBGYN said it was my uterus adjusting to the IUD), and then my periods became regular. I never experienced breast tenderness or sharp cramps while on my period until I had the IUD but it wasn’t unbearable. Up until last month and this month I have not gotten a period but I am still getting PMS symptoms around the time I would normally be getting my period. My acne is only bad whenever these symptoms occur. Initially, I was worried these were pregnancy symptoms so I checked to feel my IUD strings to assure it was still in place and everything seems fine (I recently had bloodwork done so I definitely am not pregnant). Overall, I love Kyleena and it’s so nice not having to worry about taking a pill everyday! The first few weeks of bleeding and cramping sucked but it was worth it

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got the liletta inserted at my 6 week after my baby was born  (Feb. 2019). The insertion wasn't bad at all but the cramping and constant bleeding for months afterwards was annoying.  I have had several bacterial infections causing me to have a very foul smell and needing to take several rounds of antibiotics. I gained a measly 15lbs during pregnancy which I lost right away until I had the IUD placed I've now gained double that back and it's not even been a full 3 months! I'm a raging person constantly, depressed, and have NO sex drive which is odd for me I'm also anxious and get super worried about every little thing!! I have had terrible pelvic pain which the doctors chalked up to post partum healing, but I don't think so! As of yesterday my lovely liletta string got wrapped around my tampon and when removed it came with it so I guess I won't have an expensive Dr appointment to have the thing removed!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my Skyla IUD inserted when I was about 16 and it’s about time for me to get it removed soon because it lasts about 3 years. I wasn’t scared to get it inserted and I didn’t think I’d be in pain but once she inserted it, it was pretty bad. It completely took my breath away and I almost passed out. I just wasn’t expecting it to be that bad. I’ve had ruptured cysts in my ovaries when I was younger so I didn’t think it could get much worse than that but I was wrong. It took a while for my period to go on a normal schedule again but it wasn’t too bad. I still get pretty bad cramps with my period so that’s probably the part that sucks the most. I don’t have acne and it never really made me gain any weight. I don’t really have to worry about anything with the IUD but my boyfriend tells me he can feel it when we have sex and it bothers him a little bit. But I haven’t gotten pregnant yet and we don't use protection, lol oops. But hey it works so 10/10

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I'm 27 yo, have never had children and was recommended this due to my adverse reactions to other forms of birth control and my naturally heavy painful periods. The insertion was one of the most painful things I have ever experienced. It was comparable to the pain I had when an ovarian cyst burst. I had to stay back in the doctors office for 3 hours after insertion due to the faintness and heavy pain it caused me.I had ongoing cramps for a month after insertion. I still get intermittent cramping from the device but due to my incredibly painful natural cramps I've not been bothered by this.My periods have reduced to very minimal bleeding. As someone with particularly heavy bleeds I was very happy with a 3 days of light flow.However I have acne like I've never seen before, I have weird swelling in my lower abdomen that has been impossible to get rid of and I am quite sure it has lowered my mood and caused weight gain (though those two things I can't conclusively prove).

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Everyone's body works differently. So, I just wanted to share my experience. I just had the insertion 4 days ago. I was really nervous coming into it. I did take some ibuprofen a 1/2 hour before my appointment. I also had my NP talk me through the entire process (she is amazing). At first I was really tense and she couldn't get my uterus to open, so she had me sit relax for a moment. After I was relaxed she was able to insert the IUD within seconds. The feeling I had was a lot of pressure and it was a little painful. After the insertion the pain went away. I ended up going to hot vinyasa yoga 2 hours later. I did bleed up until yesterday (but I was on my period) and today it seems clear. I've had mild cramping here and there but nothing painful. I guess I will give another review in a few months to see how its affected me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Overall, I highly recommend Kyleena. I’ve had it for about two years now. When I first got it, the cramps were horrible. Not to mention I completely lost my sex drive. GIVE IT TIME! I still have periods and cramping. I wish it would have eliminated that and it can be felt during intercourse, but it has done its job! I highly recommend this IUD!! I encourage all my friends to get it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm a 29 year old and had been on the pill for 12 years before that. We live a very busy lifestyle. We do not want kids, so thought an IUD was the best option as my doc will not prescribe more than 1 packet of pills at a time, and I wanted a light period. My pain tolerance is pretty high so insertion hurt a little but nothing crazy. The drive home though was a different story. The cramps were terrible. I had spotting for a day and period came 3 weeks later lasting almost 2 weeks. Went back for the regular check up during this time and doc says everything is fine. The long period is normal for the first one. Fast forward 3 weeks and I am on another period of now 8 days and showing no signs of giving up. Along with the longer heavier periods, I have been having cramps like crazy! I never had this before even before starting the pill. Right now, I would NOT recommend this IUD. I understand it will take time, but it just does not work with my life style and I would love to be able to have sex.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Age: 27Kids: 2Weight & height: 132 lbs and 5"10 ishI just keep reading all these horrid reviews and all I can say is that my insertion wasn't even bad. Literally a 5 minute process. Worst part is measuring the uterus. That is an uncomfortably long pinchy feeling. I didn't even feel the insertion. Had a little mild crampy feeling for maybe 10 minutes afterwards. That is it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I almost cried how happy and good it felt now that I have had this taken out.  Its been a week and let me tell you I started bleeding after a day of getting it out its like a period but I have the worst back pain and pain in my stomach area, an aching but I couldn' be more grateful and blessed to be rid of that thing. I look forward to all the new changes that will take place. Do yourself a favor and leave your body alone. Its not natural and you'll save yourself a lot of trouble... 3 years I can't get back wish, I never had it SMH

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta for 19 miserable months until I figured out all the side effects I was experiencing was from Liletta! I got it put in Sept 2017 a month after my daughter was born and thought the symptoms were due to postpartum anxiety and depression!!! Nope, it was the stupid IUD. I found a fb support group for IUD side effects on fb and ladies these things are deadly! I got my Liletta taken out the end of Feb 2019 and even though it has only been 2 months, I feel a lot better. My side effects were: anxiety, depression, hopelessness, anger, liver damage, vertigo, depersonalization and so much more. It was turning me into a completely different person!!!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):5-month update: inserted Nov 23rd, '18. Posted a review on here previously. The insertion process was one of the most painful experiences in my life. I had horrible cramping to the point of keeling over and crying for weeks after. I still get random cramping on and off throughout the week though not as bad. I have gained approximately 10 lbs with no explanation since insertion and cannot seem to shake it no matter what I do. I feel bloated and constipated almost every day with no change in diet, and I've gone up a size in clothing, and activity level and calories seem to have no effect whatsoever. My boyfriend believes it has stabled out my mood, and I've had no issues with acne, but I can't deal with the weight gain. NO periods since insertion other than slight spotting in the first few weeks. For some this is fine, but I'd rather take the size 2. That combined with the random cramping - I will likely have it removed during my annual in the upcoming months and return to the pill or NuvaRing.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had my Mirena removed last week. This was my second Mirena - the first of which I left in longer than it’s effective lifespan (6 years). This second Mirena I had removed after only one year due to side effects. The insertion of this second Mirena was excruciating - maybe that should have been a sign. Following insertion, I felt like I was being poked - pretty severely from time to time - from the inside out. This was despite a completely normal placement of the device according to an ultrasound performed a few weeks after insertion. My partner said it didn’t feel like it was in place correctly - he could feel it more than usual. On top of being uncomfortable, I’ve been down right depressed for the past year - seriously. Maybe it’s not the Mirena, but only time will tell. I’m so happy I had it removed!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):For the first 3.5 months of Liletta my life was hell because of the cramping and pain that I experienced due to the IUD but I stuck it out to see if it would get better as doctors and the internet told me it would. The cramping did get less frequent but a year later every time I get my period (every 2-3 months) it’s still extremely painful for the first two days to the point I get a fever and am throwing up. The pain that I experienced due to Liletta was worse than the contractions I had during childbirth. This IUD also gave me the worst skin of my entire life. There hasn’t been a time when I didn't  have at least one zit. I have never before had cystic acne before this IUD but now I am infested with it all over my face, back, and shoulders. Overall my experience was not great on Liletta but I still highly recommend it. When I’m not on my period it is a dream which is why I have had it for almost 2 years even with these complications. It’s a great birth control, just not the right one for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for just about 4 years now...I love the fact that my periods have completely stopped! But next year I have to remove it as it will be 5 years. I have 2 children already and have not gotten pregnant since so it's working. Insertion was the pits...it hurt badly. I have gained weight and my sex drive is completely gone. Hubby wants to get busy but I have no interest.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Highly recommend Kyleena.  I used for 3 years for birth control with my husband and never used another method- didn’t get pregnant so apparently it worked. Insertion was easy! I was soooo nervous for the insertion because like everyone read the online horror stories. No worse than a pap-smear and took two min. I know some insertions are not easy but for those of you doing research know that some really are a BREEZE!  Minimal cramping afterwards. Period got lighter and lighter over 3 years until the almost disappeared which was so nice. Just got it removed (also easy) because husband and I are thinking about starting for kids, and had my first normal period 4 weeks later and forgot what a pain (literally) periods are. I miss it already!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Kyleena for about 9 months now and yes the periods are described as irregular but so far I have still had a period every month lasting about 2 weeks. And I have a break for about 2 weeks period free but then I get another period lasting 2 weeks. So it always feels like non stop periods. I have had BV (bacterial vaginosis) about 4 times since getting the IUD placed. It is effective in preventing pregnancies but the side effects are not worth it for me. All I have to say is try it and if you do not like it then get it taken out.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for 9 months now and love it!I am a 25 year old woman who has never been pregnant. I have always had consistent and regular periods. I have tried oral contraceptives and they made me bloated/break out.When my Kyleena was inserted, the pain was excruciating. I took 600 mg of ibuprofen beforehand, but it didn’t touch the pain. The pain was so intense that when I made it to my car, I actually threw up, and I never throw up! I experienced some intense cramping for a couple days afterward.  My BF and I have sex at least 3 times a week and I never worry about pregnancy. When I was on the pill, I would get super paranoid about him coming inside me, but I haven’t worried about that for a second since Kyleena!The first 6-ish months I still had a regular period, but it only lasted about 3-4 days. Now I get a tiny bit of discharge and still have breast pain, but not enough bleeding to even use a pad or tampon!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve been on Skyla for slightly under a year. Insertion was painful and the cramps afterwards were pretty intense. Within the first couple months my roommate (sister) as well as my boyfriend noticed my extreme mood swings. I was on either side of the extreme, super happy or super upset/mad/sad, and never in between.  I’ve always been an emotional person so I never looked too much into it. Well, almost a year later I’ve watched my anxiety get worse. I’ve started having anxiety attacks and mental breakdowns on a weekly basis, sometimes for no reason at all. Although Skyla does help me prevent an unwanted pregnancy, I believe it has impacted my mental health substantially and should be taken into consideration if you’ve dealt or are dealing with anxiety and depression. I am scheduled to have mine removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I previously had the Nexplanon implant and experienced on-going bleeding the entire time. My provider suggested Kyleena since I never had any children.  I had it inserted in February 2019 and it wasn't a good experience. I got light headed at some point and had some cramping for a day or 2. I am at the 2 1/2 month mark but I can say that I'm already happier with the Kyleena. I bled for 2 weeks after insertion but it slowly stopped.  I get a period around the same time each month. The down side is they last about 6-8 days, but for me it's better than bleeding nonstop and I have no cramps and some soreness in my breasts but nothing that persists or unbearable. I experienced some body acne but I noticed that that has faded in the last few weeks as well. I noticed I had a lot of mood swings with the Nexplanon and my sister has even told me she noticed an improvement in my attitude (she could have been poking fun however). That's my experience and I know everyone's experience is different.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted January 2018. The insert was very very painful. I spotted for about 6 months after the insertion. Then in June 2018 I had an ECTOPIC PREGNANCY which I had to have emergency surgery for in the middle of the night. With Kyleena I’ve experienced a ton of weight gain, little to no sex drive, and severe depression, and I always have some type of abdominal pain or discomfort. Needless to say I will be getting this removed ASAP.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena put in around thanksgiving of 2018 and I’ve been on it for almost 5 months now. Initial insertion was very painful, I started spotting after two until I got my period and I was bleeding/spotting for 2-3 months and the cramps were so painful that I considered getting it removed. However the fact that this birth control is effective and I don’t have to remember to take a pill everyday made me wait it out. Now my periods are normal and much lighter and less painful and no more spotting. However the side effect that I hate is that it’s given me bad acne on my forehead; a bunch of bumps and some zits. I’ve never had acne before but since the IUD I have been breaking out a lot more. Although, I believe that it has gone down since the beginning. Hoping that it will completely go away in the next few months as my body gets more adjusted to it. I love that I can have sex without worrying about getting pregnant

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I seriously think it was a mistake to read the reviews before getting my Kyleena inserted. I was really nervous, but I honestly think more people that had a bad experience post their reviews rather than people that have a good one so that´s why I am posting mine. I got Kyleena for both as birth control AND to control my endometriosis around a month ago. My doctor spoke wonders of it so I decided to get it since having to take a pill everyday was not working for me because I could never remember to take it.... The insertion was not bad AT ALL it took like 10 minutes, I did felt a strong cramp wave while I was getting in and felt a bit of discomfort the rest of the day but the next day I was as good as new. I did experience some spotting for like 2 weeks but nothing too alarming. I haven't had any other effects besides some acne in my chest and back area but they are not too bad. I hope this continues to be as good as it had been until now.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Honestly I’m just gonna go ahead and say that Kyleena is the worst birth control I’ve ever been on. I have headaches all the time, cramping, and I’ve gained so much weight and on top of it I get acne which I’ve never had before. I’m going to switch this one out, I think it’s terrible.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted today and overall the pain was manageable. My gynecologist prescribed me a pill to insert vaginally the night before insertion and I took 4 ibuprofen one hour before my appointment. I had read multiple reviews about Kyleena insertion being extremely painful. This scared me because I have never had children but in all honestly I thought the pain was not too bad. I felt some sharp pinches but it only took about 2 minutes until the IUD was full inserted. I did experience some bleeding during the procedure, which is totally normal. The cramping afterwards did start immediately but 2 Midol and a heating pad made the cramping go away within an hour. So far no complaints about Kyleena!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my Kyleena IUD put in almost a year ago and I’ve had no problems! Insertion hurt a little bit (I haven’t had any children just as reference) but I got up and walked out and drove home right after. Then as soon as I was home I was good enough to do yard work. It eliminated my period and I have light cramps once a month but that’s it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I will start this review with the fact that I've NEVER been on birth control and I'm 37 years old!.After a lot of research and after speaking with my close friends I decided on Kyleena, me being older my options are less than I realized and I didn't want something that would have too many hormones. So far, I'm very happy with the results. The insertion wasn't bad at all...I went on my lunch break and went right back to work. Yes there was cramping but nothing crazy. I've had a child and honestly nothing can compare to that pain. The only thing I can say that was extremely annoying was the 2 weeks of constant spotting, I worried it wouldn't stop but thankfully it did. I'm very happy with my decision and hope it only continues to be this smooth.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was on Kyleena birth control for one month. I’m 18 and have been on the pill and I also have been on Nexplanon, I switched from Nexplanon to Kyleena because I gained 40 pounds with Nexplanon and thought since Kyleena has lower hormones it would be a better option. I was so, so, so wrong, about 3 weeks after insertion I started getting severe panic attacks and anxiety and depression which I’ve never had. Spiralling irrational thoughts, extreme fear of literally anything and everything. I had it removed 3 days ago and feel a lot better but not completely myself again, I’m praying that soon all the hormones will be out of my body and I will be back to normal again. I’d much rather be pregnant than ever have the symptoms that I had again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion process with Kyleena was totally easy and painless. Felt great for a week with no bleeding, but then after the first week I started bleeding with horrible cramps. It’s been 25 days and I’m still bleeding. Cramps are still bad. Trying so hard to be patient because I was told the first 3-6 months will be pretty irregular, but this is just brutal.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena put in December of 2018. Had it for three months before I had it removed. I had terrible side effects.
