The only negative things I have to say about it is I started getting ovarian cysts (I had 3 after insertion) and my period cramps have gotten a little more painful. Aside from those two things, I love it! It helps with my migraines/headaches, my skin is clear, it’s great birth control and I do not usually notice it. I would definitely recommend Kyleena for women who can’t be on certain types of birth control because they get migraines with aura. The positives outweigh the negatives for me!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Pros:  1.  Loved not having a period!  2. No moodinessCons:  1.  Went to doctor 5 times in a year due to multiple infections: bacterials infections, yeast infections.  2.  No orgasm due to dryness, discomfort during sex and lack of sensation in breasts and clitoris.  After 1 year and 4 months I decided to remove the IUD and bingo everything was back to normal.  Note:  The doctor didn't think my sexual discomfort was due to the IUD.  She recommend that I explore other options (changes in diet, sleep, stress). She recommended lubricants, sex therapy or more foreplay...  None of her suggestions made sense to me.  There were no significant changes in the 15 years that I'd been with my husband.  I was aroused and had plenty of foreplay...  I told her the actual sensation was different. My doctor's medical opinion didn't jive with my experience.  As soon as I took the IUD out, sex was perfectly pleasurable again and orgasms went from 0% to 90-100%.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Acne non stop, mood swings that are ruining my life. I don't even know who I am anymore.  I've gained 40 pounds in less than 7 months. I barely eat and I'm very active. Always have been about the same size, but I'm now bigger than I was 8 months pregnant with a baby on my hip.  Lots of anxiety. I can't figure it out.  Going to have it removed ASAP. I'm scared. But other than that. Not pregnancies and eventually stopped having periods all together

Skyla (levonorgestrel):25 yrs old, 5' 7", 120 lbs, never been pregnant/given birth. Got Skyla yesterday. Insertion lasted 20 min, complications due to tiny cervix opening (I was even on my period). The pain was tortuous, worst pain I have ever experienced in my life (I cried, and I'm no wuss), almost passed out, took a while to recover. I shouldn't have driven home. With all of that said, I hope that this will be worth it for the next 3 years. Good luck, sisters.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena IUD inserted in December of 2017. I’ve had it for just over 1 year now and I couldn’t be happier! In terms of the actual procedure, I took 2 extra strength ibuprofen before hand I experienced a sharp numbing pain, only lasting a couple minutes! Also keep in mind that we all have different pain thresholds. Post insertion, I had medium cramping and a little trouble sitting down comfortably for about 24 hours. I had spotting/ brown discharge for about 2-3 months straight. Since then, I’ve had an extremely light to no period. No change in mood, no weight gain, no babies!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I'm sure by now you've seen a thousand of the reviews about the weight gain, the mood swings, the depression, and the acne that are the hallmark of Liletta users; so I will just say that in the 9 months I've had this BC that has all happened to me (minus the acne, thank god).  I have also had the fun addition of constant nausea that reminds me of nothing so strongly as the never-ending morning sickness I had with my son, where I was constantly nibbling to soothe my upset stomach and ended up gaining 20 lbs in the first trimester alone. I can't trust my emotions because they're ping-ponging between sadness, detached depression, spontaneous bursting into tears, and normalcy.  I used to be even-keeled before this thing was put it.  And my OB said it was just like the Mirena....yeah right!  At least I haven't had a period to speak of since it was installed.  The dose must just be too high for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 19 got Kyleena in January have had it for more than a month. The initial insertion was quick but quite painful and gritted my teeth for pretty much the day (and 3 days after) could barely stand as the cramps were woeful, the bleeding lasted up to 4 weeks, and since have had a UTI on top of that and visited the clinic twice because of severe cramps and weird sharp pain (got misplaced on one of the occasions). Now things have settled - bar a bit of acne and smelling discharge, also weight gain,I don’t know if this down to water retention Or how the actual hormone effects the body but unfortunately I wasn’t made clear of the side effects of the Kyleena was rather given a brochure and have had to do my own research.  I'm getting frustrated as I'm heavily into fitness and have suffered from eating disorders due to bad body image in the past, trying to stick to 3 month mark, is weight gain a common side effect overall for all Kyleena users ? I have gained about 2kgs and with no change to fitness regime

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena in August 2018, I had the mirena for about 5 months and hated it, I gained weight, mood swings, constant fatigue, and had more acne than usual. I got the mirena taken out and I got the kyleena, for the first month the cramps were bad constant but that went away, I don’t get moody anymore or feel tired all the time, my weight is back to normal and my skin is so much better now. The only thing that sucks is that my periods are about 8-9 days but I'd rather deal with that then a bunch of horrible side effects. it’s different for everyone but I really like the kyleena IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted on 10/4/18. Soon after insertion, the blood clots began... almost every day. In fact, my periods were primarily blood clots and horrible cramping/weight gain. These symptoms were manageable.  But, the constant migraines, no sex drive- ever, severe; debilitating anxiety/racing thoughts, explosive anger, insomnia (5-7 days without sleeping) during my PMS/period; WERE NOT manageable. My OBGYN prescribed me Xanax to combat the negative symptoms;  I took the Xanax for only two days and realized the IUD was just not for me. On 2/14/19 I had the IUD taken out and replaced with Paragard. Within several hours of the switch, I felt SIGNIFICANTLY better - the world lifted off my shoulders,  I felt myself becoming more calm, even the splitting headache was gone within 24 hours. Now it's 2/19/19 and I'm back to my calm, level headed, happy, positive self. The past 4 months have been a hideous rollercoaster.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena Dec of 17.   I am a 32 yo mom of 2. My doctor recommended this for me cuz it would take away my periods that were already 5 day perfect light periods wouldn't even notice it was there. The day of insertion the actual procedure was quick and just a slight pinch. But the day after I was in bed with a heating pad feeling like labor contractions. I called my Dr they made me come in and do a sono. It was perfectly placed. My periods after that went from 5 days to 10 days and it was old dark brown thick blood. Due to this I got BV every month after my "period". When I was able to have sex he felt it. It would pinch the tip of his penis and EVEN ripped the condom.  Then I had to get on a mood stabilizer about 3 months after insertion that the Dr swore it wasn't the IUD. I gained 30lbs in 1 year. 12/2/18 I had it removed. On the 1/6/19 found out I was pregnant with my 3rd child. so soon. I miscarried a week later. It was due 2 my recent IUD removal.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD placed around 2 years ago and best decision ever! There's a bit of hate on the internet for the IUD but as someone who was depressed and anxious on the pill, the IUD has changed my life. I no longer get my period and have had no weird hormonal side effects from my Mirena. Only reason not 10 stars is because I did spot (very lightly but very consistently for like 8 months). I also am part of a sports team and thus have done a small scale study (lol) and of 20 of us, 3 have gotten the Mirena and have all had really good experiences with it.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The insertion was extremely painful and traumatic.  The side effects after were nearly unbearable, (including intermittent pain and random bleeding.)  I considered having it removed before I even found out about my pregnancy (it has since been removed.) I had Skyla for 3 long months months before becoming pregnant.  I found out Friday my pregnancy is ectopic.  I am now awaiting my (best case scenerio) impending miscarriage, and (worst case scenerio) surgery, infertility or even death.  I wish I would have listened to all of the "horror stories" I was told by doctors to ignore.  Multiple women tried to talk me out of this device with their own horrible IUD experiences but I didn't think it could happen to me.  I am now very worried about my health, my fertility, my relationship, my safety and my future.  I feel I was tricked into thinking I was doing something positive for myself.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I started using Kyleena in the last week of August 2018. I went for a follow up after 6 weeks and my obgyn said everything looks good. My period stopped in October 2018. I thought it was ok since I was told my period might stop after having Kyleena and then I got pregnant sometime in November 2018. I didn't realise I was pregnant since I didn't have any symptom until Jan 2019. When I had my ultrasound test I was shocked to find that I am 12 weeks pregnant. Kyleena didn't work for me. Please be aware that you can get pregnant even with it in there.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I was really happy with the mirena at first . I've had it for five month's. My periods where very light. I woke up one morning and blood was all over my bed. When I stood up blood clots came out. I went to the hospital and they told me that the mirena had  gone through my uterus.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Got this inserted December 2016, lost a ton of weight, lost my period, worked really well for 2 years. WATCH OUT EVERYONE. YEAR 3 STARTS, IUD SLIPS WITHOUT MY KNOWLEDGE AND BECOMES EMBEDDED IN MY UTERINE WALL. I became pregnant and did not find out until I was 6 weeks along. I immediately scheduled an IUD removal and a surgical termination. The procedure was only to take about 10 minutes, but took ONE HOUR because of my STUPID SKYLA being embedded into my uterus. It was a nightmare! Advice: DO NOT LET YOUR DOCTOR CUT YOUR STRINGS. DO NOT LET THEM DO IT. Check them every month make sure they are where they’re supposed to be. Also never let sperm inside, always use barrier method or withdrawal. I just had to spend over $1,000 because of this little device’s failure. Am going back on the Pill this Sunday. Turned out I was the 0.2% that got pregnant from this thing. It’s not foolproof!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Inserted 11/30/18, after trying four other types of BC. Nexplanon: Suicidal, NuvaRing: Constant bleeding, Pill: ER for Blood Loss, Mirena: Expelled. So now with Kyleena constant discharge that is light bleeding or brown/black discharge. Nonstop from 12/26/18-2/6/19, stopped for 3.5 days, has picked up. Cramping is not consistent, come in waves of agony daily. Fine one minute, uterus is being ripped out the next. Sharp, intense pain and have to remind myself to breathe. More frequent in the hours leading up to a bowel movement. No change in mood, weight, or acne. Libido decreased, due to constant discharge. Insertion was painful, subsided a moment later. It stopped my period the day after insertion (12/1) and I was fine until 12/26. Since then I have only had 3.5 days without period symptoms or cramps. I'll update again if these symptoms subside and my period stops. It takes 3-6 months for the body to regulate, I am starting month 3.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The initial insertion wasn’t as bad as I was thinking, a quick burning cramp and that was it. Afterwards? Holy hell thats where it gets bad. I almost immediately felt like I was burning up, I was sweating so bad that my shirt was wet. Then there was the cramps. They were mild at first, like normal period cramps. Then it was like someone was digging a fork into my uterus. I was crying the pain was so bad. Took some pain meds. Every now and then I’d have almost like a contraction like pain. It would be intense pain then it would go away. So I was fine all day yesterday, I stayed on top of the pain meds so I wouldn’t have to experience that pain again...big mistake. I’m severely constipated to the point that I’m twisting in pain and MISERABLE. I can’t go at all and I have severe pressure in my lower abdomen. At this point I just want to stop being in pain and miserable!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I loved having this IUD. It was very painful to insert and my first period afterwards was very painful, but after that, everything was fantastic. It wasn't until I started getting white patches and ache on my face that I had to remove it. Apparently, I have vitiligo and the IUD triggered it to start up again and spread very quickly. I had to remove it after three months.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the liletta for about 5 days now the insertion was not what I expected it was really painful and I had bleeding for 2 days which is all normal. Also I instantly got a UTI after it being inserted and it still has not eased up or gone away with medication. My cervix HURTS. It feels swollen and just uncomfortable. I got this a year after my son was born I’ve never been on birth control before, I’m calling tomorrow to get It removed Especially after reading some of these comments, I’ve already started breaking out and my stomach is so bloated every night I’m not waiting around for any of the other symptoms to start. I don’t know how else to explain it other than my body just feels WEIRD and uncomfortable. I want It out. The only plus side is not having to worry about popping up pregnant but it doesn’t outweigh the worry of what it’s actually doing to my body. This is just not natural and I don’t like it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena Update!Time of Initial Inserstion: Aug 2018DO NOT be scared of Kyleena. It feels like a slight pinch upon insertion, and is over before you know it. Taking 4 Advil tablets before the procedure aided me, I think.On the day of insertion, many hours later, I was cramping, but not any more than the average period cramp.Now this is where things went awry- when I got my next period a few days after the insertion, it was the WORST period of my life. The pain was excruciating- and the bleeding was heavy. My period also lasted for two weeks or so. This is normal.I am an acne-prone gal, but don’t be discouraged- my skin has not suffered from breakouts any worse than usual. As for the weight gain... it’s been more like a weight loss for me. I am 5’9 and when I got my Kyleena inserted, I was 156 pounds. Now I am 135 pounds months later, without a significant change to my diet or any health issues. It is possible to lose weight on this BC, or even maintain it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It’s been about 5 months since my insertion of Kyleena. Now before Kyleena I had what others would call the perfect period. It lasted 2-3 days of light bleeding. I had no acne, weighed 110 pounds, experienced no cramps, mood swings, or any period symptoms at all really. After getting Kyleena I 100% regret it. Every month I get the most god awful cramps and my breasts get so sore and sensitive I can’t even wear a bra on those days. I experience extreme mood swings that my boyfriend can confirm (poor guy), I get waves of depression quite often and I have gained 20 pounds since being on Kyleena. I work out religiously and maintain a healthy diet, but I still gained a lot of weight. This is by far my worst experience on birth control, really debating on getting it removed soon. I might wait it out until I hit the 1 year mark, but if you’re researching Kyleena I highly recommend you discuss in detail the side effects with your doctor and the possibilities of the negative outcomes.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the kyleena for about 6 months and I did not like it very much. I was kind of pushed into it and it hurt really bad to put it in. They say it only hurts for a month but it hurt me the whole 6 months I was on it. I do not recommend a foreign object to go into any females uterus. It SUCKS!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):This is the first birth control that has truly worked for me. Over the years I've tried four types of pill, and a copper coil, and they were all terrible in their own special ways. The pills tended to decrease my sex drive to pretty much nothing, and make me feel overwhelmed and miserable and like I wasn't myself anymore. The copper coil made my periods unbearably painful. I've had Skyla (or Jaydess) for a bit more than three months now and it's been great. The downsides are that I have experienced quite a lot of spotting (although it seems to have stopped now!), a few painful cramps, and I think my moods have been a bit more up and down than before. But there are more upsides:  I have, if anything, a higher sex drive than normal, and when I say my moods are more up and down I mean in a manageable way as opposed to uncontrollably crying on the pill. I basically still feel like myself, which I never did on the pill. Oh and also I'm not pregnant so it's doing it's fundamental job yay.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I thought the mirena would be awesome so I got it. Worst mistake ever. I had a period 4 times in a month. I cramped horribly and it hurt so bad during sex. My mood swings where crazy. I got depressed and irritated over nothing. I have lost my strings and my doctor didn't tell me any of this would happen. I am getting it removed ASAP and am looking for another method.. Once again.. WORST MISTAKE EVER!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Let me just start out saying THIS IS THE ABSOLUTE WORST BIRTH CONTROL EVER !!! I mean I’ve only had one other birth control and it was the skyla and that was way better than this. It’s killing me, I got it put in, in May 2018 and it’s been downhill ever since. I have the absolute WORST weight gain ever !! I’ve been depressed and my mood swings ARE OUT OF CONTROL! I DO NOT RECOMMEND this birth control at all. Plus I’ve been experiencing the worst migraines and I’ve never experienced headaches before. It 100% sucks. Being put in did not hurt me at all I had cramps that was it but everything from then on I just kept gaining and gaining weight, I need a new birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have been on Kyleena for exactly one year in March, the insertion process wasn’t too bad, I came from work then went back the same day and honestly was fine, I took 2 Tylenol before procedure but again depends on pain tolerance of others, one pro about Kyleena is you do not get pregnant which is the key but I got my period 2/3 times a month, I called my OBGYN asking if this is normal she said yes keep trying and wait until next monthSo I did, I got some blood tests making sure I wasn’t anemic (low in Iron) and my numbers were fine, since then my period has completely gone away for 2 months but I have suffered Breast pain, weight gain, nervousness and painful cramping( almost to the point I have to sit down)Anyways I plan to have my Kyleena removed next month.  Everyone is different so for some it works and for some if doesn’t, this just didn’t work for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted today. The total time took about 5 minutes if that! My doctor was amazing and walked me through the whole process! I would say the most painful part was the actual insertion but it was only about a 4 out of 10 on a pain level. Three hours later and I only feel slight cramps, definitely and amazing choice of birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I got kyleena about 2 months ago. Insertion was *EXTREMELY* painful but only lasted the few seconds it took to place it. I had constant bleeding and spotting for about a month and when my first period came I went to the ER because the cramps were so bad I was certain this thing was ripping through my cervix. They said the pain is normal..still get random intense cramps. I want it to work out but at this point not sure it its a keeper.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I highly recommend Kyleena for anyone who needs a form of birth control they do not need to think about. Not having to worry about taking a pill every day is a blessing and the insertion process really was not bad at all. It was a very intense period cramp that lasted all of 30 seconds at most. After it is inserted, my pain immediately stopped. The cramps continued on and off over the next couple of days but they were tolerable and that was my only symptom after the procedure. I had spotting for 2 days but then bleeding completely stopped and I was back to normal. Of course, everyone’s body reacts differently but I encourage everyone to not let the fear of pain stop you from considering Kyleena. I am very glad I got it.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Acne, acne, and more acne. I’m 39 and after being on Kyleena for just over two months by back, my chest, shoulders, and scalp are covered in painful acne. Awful.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have uterine fibroid just the size of a golf ball. I’ve been having heavy period and painful periods. My gyno recommended the kyleena to keep my from bleeding so much. I had it inserted around September 2017. The insertion was a little painful. And I can handle pain pretty well. My uterus felt tender for a couple days and the doctor said that’s normal. For the first couple months my periods were fine. But after 8 months, I didn’t feel well every time my period comes around. I had ultrasound and multiple tests done thinking it could be something else. I finally decided to take it out. After my new doctor took it out, I felt some type of relief. My back pain went away. Plus 2 months before removing the kyleena I would get my period for 7 days and they were heavy. I have to change my pad by the hour. But after 4 days of my period I would get my period again! That’s 2 sets of period in a month. I felt so sick! My body was rejecting the IUD. I don’t suggest using the kyleena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Birth control pills never really did work for me that well. I missed a pill and I got pregnant. And another time I was taking my pills perfectly and on time and I got pregnant. So I decided it was time for a more effective option, such as a hormonal IUD. The insertion was okay, but the following week or so was extremely painful. Like to the point where I couldn't walk and I had to take Tylenol. Other than that, my kyleena has worked wonders. Lighter and shorter periods, and regulated for once. But I started noticing that I'm getting acne everywhere. It is all over my cheeks and jawline, on my chin, on my forehead, on my back, on my buttocks, and they are starting to become more deep and painful. I have never had acne this bad before, not even in my teens. I haven't changed my diet or my skin care routine. If my acne does not even out, I will have to try a different option. Which I really don't want to do.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was on Kyleena for 5 months. Insertion was easy, but bad cramping for a few days and constipation for a week. My breasts were heavier and sore, and I got hormonal acne on my chin. My very heavy periods eventually got lighter. However, the spotting was every day — light brown to light red depending on the day. Required a liner to a light pad or tampon — every day. At 3 months, my OB suggested to wait another month to see if my body needed more time to adjust. By the 5th month, the spotting continued, so I decided to remove it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I went to my ob hoping to get a solution or ultrasound or referral to another ob. Instead she told me Kyleena would cure my PCOS, I have bad PCOS. I bleed A LOT. I've never had a period, its on and off bleeding and spotting and lighter spotting and then just bleeding again for weeks sometimes months. Its painful, I was very anemic. The day it was inserted by my ob and ultrasound tech guiding her were rough with me. I bled as she re attempted to insert it a total of 4 times then realized my cervix was shorter that she thought. I called out of work for 3 days. 6 months in and still bleeding and still in pain. 9 months in I had an ectopic miscarriage. Severe cramps and disgusting cystic acne on my shoulders, thighs, chin and cheeks I had gained a total of 40 pounds. Let me be clear that I'm extremely strict with my calorie intake and I do crossfit. I'm disappointed. I hope other people have a better experience with their Kyleena. I'm going to a new OB and removing it today.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got this IUD inserted approximately two weeks ago. The comments about painful insertion had me worried ubt I didn't feel any pain. Maybe a cramp? I was ready to go out directly after the procedure without any complaints.  I have been spotting lightly but haven't had any cramps. Excited to test run this baby for real!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I just got my mirena put in, the nurse prior to getting it told me it should only take 5 minutes and be painless. Let me tell you it was the worst pain I've ever felt. Before insertion my Dr. asked if I took ibuprofen or anything like his nurse should have suggested, which she never did.  So if I had taken something prior to getting there I'm sure it would have been less painful. She also told me I could immediately go to work. He told me I needed to go home and lay down for the day. So here I am at work with severe cramps because I couldn't call in that last minute.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had a great experience with Kyleena so far! I’m 24 and I have tried multiple birth controls before this (including the pill and the Nexplanon implant). The other birth controls made me extremely depressed so I was nervous to try Kyleena (it’s not exactly easy to remove). I’m not going to lie, the insertion was *extremely* painful. I almost jumped off the table. Thankfully it lasted not even 2 minutes. I cramped for several hours afterward but the pain went away completely after that. I’ve had Kyleena for several months now and I have to say it is completely worth it. I’ve experienced no bad side effects— no mood swings, no depression. I also haven’t had a period since the first month, so that’s a plus. If you’re on the fence about this, I would go for it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got my Kyleena put in 4 days ago so I can’t give a review on it long term but I wanted to post about my insertion and how my body reacted after because I hyped myself up way too much going into it. I expected it to be a 10/10 on the pain scale. I was wrong, the visit lasted maybe 10 minutes and the only thing that was even slightly painful was when she was dilating my cervix and she told me exactly when I was going to feel slight cramping before it even happened. After she dilated my cervix, she said okay it’s in. And I was like the actual IUD is in??? I felt nothing.  I’m not gonna lie, I’m pretty sure I have a vagina of steel because getting a Brazilian never even caused me to wince but little things like burns and papercuts are the end of the world to me so I can’t rate my pain tolerance. After insertion I had light bleeding on the first day and bad cramping on the second day but everything is back to normal now & I haven’t noticed and weird side effects yet

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am debating getting Kyleena removed. I am 26 years old. I got Kyleena in October 2018. Three months in - I have SEVERE constipation and I cannot help but believe it is from Kyleena. I had to go to the emergency room it was so bad. I was fill of poop right up to my rib cage. I had to get it pumped out with hydro colon therapy but two weeks later and basically only eating raw fruit and vegetables - the severe constipation is back. The past three months I have had bloating, constipation, extreme cramps, and gas unlike I have ever had before (it basically just comes out as a bunch of air). Because of all of this, I do not feel like myself and it has made me depressed. I find my sex drive has been lower because I have become self-conscious about my body. These are things I have NEVER experienced before. I give Kyleena a 5 because it IS effective in preventing pregnancy which is my ultimate goal - but at the risk of no long feeling like myself? I am unsure if it is worth it.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve used Skyla for 6 years and should need a new insert soon. I started taking it because the pill caused me to have near stroke signs when I would exercise. I get migraines so I was told to switch to the IUD. I really have liked not worrying about pills.  I barely get periods  just light spotting and some cramps so don't have to be buying many tampons or pads. I enjoy sex and exercise without worry. The insertion hurts only when put in like a pinch and cramping goes away after an hour or two. I also like that it’s 3 years so I can change my mind if I want to try to have kids later.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted in August prior to leaving for college because I was looking for a very effective birth control that removed my human error in taking a pill. I had a guided ultrasound for insertion (highly recommend) and the IUD insertion was mostly uncomfortable and much less painful than I thought. After insertion, I was very happy with my IUD. I was devastated when I found out had become pregnant with the IUD in the following January. After going to the gynecologist, I found that I had an intrauterine pregnancy while the position of my IUD was perfectly in place. I write this just to remind other women that even though the IUD is 99% effective, there is a women that does happen to get pregnant with an IUD and it is a very emotionally painful process to comprehend. I am planning on getting another IUD after I have had an abortion. It is important to consider and think about all effects of using a birth control and to remember that an IUD is not 100% effective.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The insertion of the Skyla was not bad. First the doctor inserted the speculum, next he stabilized the cervix which pinched. Then he measured my cervix which felt like a long sharp pressure, and finally went ahead and inserted the IUD which felt like a more pronounced long sharp pressure. I definitely don’t think it was comfortable, but it also was in no way unbearable. I’ve never had children so I’m sure my cervix was a little less pliable in general. Cramping is most severe for the first 5 minutes post insertion, and then starts dissipating altogether after about 2.5 hours. Ibuprofen helps and I took 0.25 mg of Xanax prior which I think helped me a lot with relaxing. Bottom line, it is probably not wise to reading all these reviews about worst pain of my life etc, as these only made me anxious. Everyone perceives pain differently and I do not think I have a high threshold by any means, but this is NOT unbearable or even worth stressing about.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I have had the Kyleena in for about a year now. I’m 23 years old, never had kids and this was the first birth control I’ve ever been on. Before I got the IUD, I had the most awful cramps. While the IUD has helped tremendously with my cramps and periods, I have an appointment to get it taken out this afternoon. About 6 months in, I started feeling depressed all the time without an explanation. I’ve been having scary thoughts and strong feelings of fear. I have always been known to be so positive and happy all the time. I also would get anxiety at random times which I have NEVER had before the IUD. I just haven’t felt like myself in a long time and at first I didn’t know why but I strongly believe it’s the IUD after other reviews I’ve read of girls feeling the exact same way. This is not for everyone! I tried justifying the way I was feeling for so long but have come to the conclusion that the IUD is not worth the complete change of personality I have experienced.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Iv'e had the mirena three times now, all at different stages of my life. The first time it worked really well, mind you was only 21 at the time. Second time round I had it when I was 24 and it was completely painful and in the wrong spot so I got it removed after only  2 months. Now 29 I have only had it for just over 3 months and I'm getting this one removed on Monday. The headaches and migraines are horrible, the weight gain is also their along with bloating, tired and zero sex drive. Not to mention the week before and on my period the cramps and aches and pains are not worth it, also my entire body aches and I don't have to do anything and I'm in pain.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena inserted after using Paraguard (which was a nightmare). Pro: as a birth control, little to no period. My regular periods before this weren't very heavy and I've never had terrible cramps. I will occasionally have back aches and cramping but not unbearable. Cons: insertion is fairly painful, I got lightheaded during insertion and it feels like the worst cramping you could imagine. Also and the biggest thing for me is the weight gain. I had stayed around 151-157 for about the last 10 years. Since getting the Mirena I have steadily gained weight. I'm now around 167. I used to just be able to clean up my eating and lay off the junk food when I noticed I was putting in a few pounds and be back to normal. Not anymore. I'm really considering having it removed. I feel fat and bloated pretty much all the time.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena IUD back in Aug 2018. Now, please do not decide what type of birth control you get based on someone else's insertion story. Honestly all insertion stories are like birth stories or IV stories. Not everybody has a good experience. It depends on your body and the experience of the provider. I didn't have a good insertion story  but having changed to Kyleena I would gladly go through it again. The first 3 months were unpredictable for period length and frequency. I also broke out a bit on my chin. But after 3 months the hormones started to settle down and as my body got used to it my periods got less and less heavy! Now I only spot for a few days. I feel like I have my life back :)If you are thinking of getting a Kyleena just remember two things: Everybody's body is different and it responds to hormones in different ways. Secondly, if you try it and and decide you don't like it you can always take it out. Give it a fair chance (at lease 3-4 months) and see how it goes! Happy decision making!
Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got skyla about 2 years ago and it's been pretty good so far. My only complaint is that it made my period cramps worse.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m a 24 year old and never had children, I switched from The Mini Pill.For the first few days I had no bleeding after insertion, however my experience was that I bled nearly every day afterwards for 9 weeks, most days was spotting with about 7 days of a light/ medium period bleed. I’ve had 3 weeks now of no bleed and I’m hoping that after this it might continue with a monthly cycle or reduce completely. I hope this helps some people. I was really getting stressed about the constant bleeding but I hope that it has finally settled. Best of luck to anyone considering getting it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena in March 2018. It was so painful during insertion and after for days. And I have a high pain tolerance. I didn’t get any periods while I had it in but my breast would get very tender and I started getting bad migraines. And the past 3 months the migraines were 3-4 days a week. On top of it all I was severely depressed. I am going through a lot so I  pretty much put it off on that. I started isolating myself very badly the past 5 months and depression worsened. Also at 32 I was getting acne. On 1/25/19 I got it removed and I feel like I got poison removed from body! Seriously!!   I will never chose hormonal birth control ever again!! Everyone’s body is  different though and you gotta weigh out the pros and cons. I can already tell l will be so much more happier without it.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got skyla after being on the pill for about a year and a half. Immediately after, I got a ton of under the skin acne on my face and back. Over time I gained weight which may or may not be a side effect of the BC. Anxiety went through the roof. It was nice to not have to think about takign regular contraception, but was not necessarily right for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I ended up having an ectopic resulting in emergency surgery. The ultrasound found that the kyleena was in place. My surgeon seems to think my Kyleena was faulty and never worked to begin with given my history.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Severe painful side effects. Got pregnant (!) despite using and I had even had an ultrasound ensuring good placement. Led to miscarriage. String disappeared, had to go deep to retrieve. Would never recommend. Should be banned.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I love Kyleena, but it made a lot of things unpredictable for me. I’m 18 years old and my periods used to be 7-9 days, cramps so bad I would curl up and cry or even pass out if it was really bad, and my flow would be extremely heavy, like bleeding through super-plus tampons after 3 hours heavy. I’m a very paranoid person and I haven’t gotten my period in 5 months. I got a really long period after insertion (July 2018), lasting roughly 3-4 weeks. I get random cramps throughout the day and most of the time they go away within a few minutes but sometimes they linger. Other than that, I love this! Pregnancy? Nope! I love that I don’t have to freak out and panic.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kyleena recommended instead of Mirena because I was 17 and it was meant for a pre pregnancy female. I have a high pain tolerance and although I didn’t enjoy the experience of insertion, it was fast and bearable. Had minor cramps and bleeding for the next week after. HOWEVER. Almost a year later, my periods have not stopped, my PMS has been wicked worse than before and I have more pain during sex and only 2-3 times a month I actually enjoy it. I also bleed after sex almost every time. I will get the worst random cramps to the point I need to curl into a ball on the ground. I always had severe cramps so I’m not sure if this is due to my body’s natural way during my period. Other than that, it’s not terrible. It does the job but sometimes it’s questionable to keep in or not when I want to die from the pain (and I have a 9/10 pain tolerance!!!)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I love it! Putting it in was painful. But only lasted for a few minutes. Then I had cramping for a few hours. The worst part is getting it taken out!! I cried for hours while it was happening and after. Hurt so bad. But I never had periods and the five years it was in I had no problems.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena to help with excruciating period pains and have a reliable source of birth control year round. I had it placed in April 2018. The instertion was uncomfortable but not unbearable. I didn't spot/have irregular periods for the first 2/3 months, and have since had no more periods. I still go through monthly cycles such as slight ovulation pain and breast swelling but it's not accompanied by bleeding which is great. I don't think I experienced weight gain, as I sit at 145 but fluctuate up and down a few pounds through out the year. Overall, I highly recommend as it helped with my pain, I haven't become pregnant and I haven't experienced any side effects.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the IUD inserted a few weeks ago. Based on people's experience, I thought that the insertion would be horrible. My doctor was surprised when I didn't even flinch during the procedure. There was a slight pain but then it was gone. I started bleeding afterwards and she put some type of medicine up there to stop the bleeding. The medicine caused weird discharge to come out for a few days. I had mild cramping bit nothing worse than dull period pain. All-in-all I really had no problem with it and I don't have to worry about taking a pill everyday.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Without a history of blood clots, I don’t know why anyone would use this for birth control. I had Kyleena inserted today. So while this review is early, I can speak from experience with other methods of birth control, being 34. I've had cervical disc surgery and have chronic radiculopathy, and the Kyleena insertion pain was at least as bad as rupturing a disc and getting a spinal epidural.  I think worse because it doesn’t go away. I had nausea and had to stop the ob-gyn at times to take a breath. All day I’ve had the worst cramps of my life. They are unending. Nothing is helping with the pain. I would never recommend this product to anyone who could use something like the Nuva ring, in my opinion the best contraceptive. Not to mention for Kyleena insertion you get nothing to help with the pain; it seems unconscionable. No way I can sleep tonight like this. Even if the pain eventually stops in a few days, this is absolutely not worth it if you can use hormonal birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted today, and I’m pleased to say that none of the reviews referring to agonising pain applied to me. It was uncomfortable for a very short while, and felt a little like sharp period pain for a couple of seconds but then it was done. During the procedure my blood pressure dropped a little so I felt really hot very suddenly and a little nauseous but I work in a medical profession so I was not phased by this. Afterwards whilst my blood pressure recovered my legs were a little shakey, but I got myself home, took pain killers and jumped into bed for a nap. I feel absolutely fine now - 8 hours after insertion. Everybody’s body copes differently :)

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got my mirena inserted on 9/14/18 and weighed around 120 lbs at the time. I’ve checked my diet logs from before I got the mirena and was usually between 115-120 for the previous years. It’s now been 4 months and my weight has gone up to 133 lbs! My diet hasn’t really changed and now on top of weight gain I feel puffy and bloated most days of the month. I’m debating whether to get it taken out because it works and I don’t really have a period anymore, but I don’t like the way I look and feel.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I LOVE this IUD. Side effects, minimal. Period, minimal. Pregnancy, none. 100% recommend to all my girls trying to find a great contraceptive ;)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Before I got the IUD, I spent a lot of time worrying about how painful it was going to be. I’m 19 years old, I have a low pain tolerance, and (at the time) I wasn’t able to swallow pills. My doctor prescribed one cytotec to take before bed, 800 mg ibuprofen, + one Xanax to take 30 minutes before insertion. I also had the procedure scheduled on the 3rd day of my period. I was finally able to figure out how to swallow all of my pills which helped immensely! Because I was on my period and I had managed to take the pills, the actual insertion was not as painful as I had feared. It felt like a weird twisting cramp and then it was done! The only bad part about my experience was the cramping afterwards. They honestly felt like the worst cramps I had ever experienced, but if you have a heat pack and a lot of ibuprofen, you will be just fine! Please don’t worry yourself too much (like I did). It’ll all be just fine.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My experience with Kyleena has been absolutely AWFUL. I'm 20 years old and I got my IUD in September of 2017. Sometimes my cramps are so bad that my legs go numb because I'm in so much pain. But the real kicker for me about Kyleena is that about 8 months after insertion,  it has caused me to have UNBEARABLE anxiety and depression. I will jolt awake in the middle of the night not being able to breathe. It's caused me to have spiralling thoughts, fear about everything and completely not myself. This has continued to this day and I still have crippling anxiety and cramps. I've been prescribed anxiety and depression medications to help and I'm going to therapy and talking to my gynecologist and I'm not getting any better or getting any help. I will wake up feeling so anxious and then within an hour I will start cramping so bad. They always coincide with each other. I am on the verge of getting it out. Has anyone else had this experience with Kyleena?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):WORST. EXPERIENCE.Awful insertion pain and I have VERY high pain tolerance, left me in bed for 2 days.I work on my feet. If I work more than 5 hours, severe cramping. Can’t wear skinny jeans for more than 7 hours. Work time in skinny jeans? 3 hours.3 months in- weight gain after starting a healthy diet and regular exercise.I’ve had 3 yeast infections in 4 months, which I’ve never had before.Month 2- severe depression which I’ve never experienced before.Had contraction-like cramping the other day that sent me to the ER. I thought it was coming out but it was in place. Doc said it’s probably worsening my normal cramping pain and I need to follow up with a doc to be examined more thoroughly.Sooooo $1,800.00 for 15lb weight gain, worsening acne, depression, the fact I can’t wear my favorite jeans, and this cramping? Yeah. This sucker is COMING OUT, the mind ease of not being pregnant is not worth it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for about a month and it’s been kind of annoying. I switched to the IUD after being on the pill for two years and experiencing bad cramps and irregular periods. The IUD insertion was very painful but it was also really fast. Since I got it I have had discharge ALL OF THE TIME! It’s expected though because my body is getting used to it. I also am having bad cramps. But I feel that all of this is worth the effectiveness.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted in May 2018.  I read reviews online and was pretty nervous.  The insertion was incredibly painful - honestly like nothing I've ever felt before but it's quick.  Unfortunately mine fell out and so they had to insert it twice.  I was a bit lightheaded and nauseous but I feel like a lot of it was mental.  Experienced cramping and pain for a week or so but it was tolerable.  I like not having to take bc every night but I get a lot of spotting and breakthrough bleeding. Makes it feel like my period lasts weeks.  Also developed some ovarian cysts. I'm going to see if the side effects go away but so far a fairly tolerable experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted in July 2017 and for the next year, bled or spotted 90% of the days. Sometimes it was just a bit of blood when I went to the bathroom but sometimes it was enough to need a thin pad or tampon. After the 1 year mark though, the spotting became almost non existent and I now have a light period that lasts about 5-6 days each month. The most annoying side effect is that I have more discharge now than I did before kyleena so I tend to wear a pantyliner every day. The extra discharge and lubrication is apparent and obvious during sex, which is my main complaint after have this for a year and a half. It’s annoying but I’m glad I put up with it so I don’t need to worry about condoms failing.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena put in November 2018. I’ve had it two months and I’m so happy with it. I was always forgetful about my pill so it’s freeing to just know it’s there. It was extremely painful going in. It was through doing this that I found out I have Vaginismus. It makes any sort of penetration extremely painful and difficult. However I powered through and the residual pain was manageable. Since the insertion I had an awful first period, but I have been able to explore my sexuality. Since then I’ve gotten a boyfriend and it means I don’t have to panic about whether or not I’ve taken my pill. Now, I have recently started to get acne and my sex drive has increased massively. I don’t regret getting it, but it’ll take a couple months for my body to adjust.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was put on Kyleena more for my dysmenorrhea (painful periods). Now 10 months post-insertion and nothing but good it say. I never felt pain during insertion, just mild pressure. For the first 3 months my body had to get used to the IUD; lower back pain, spotting between periods, etc. But after that, I had no problems. I still get my period every 26 days, but it’s very light, and no way as painful!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena coil fitted in August 2018 for heavy periods. I was informed that it would NOT cause weight gain. The insertion was really painful. Immediately I had major contraction pains which took my breath away. These went on for nearly two months. I also had an insatiable hunger. This lasted for 3 months and then every 2 weeks thereafter. I also bled seriously heavily for the first 3 weeks and then had light bleeding every day. Back and hip pain was also a permanent fixture from day 1 of insertion. I also had mood swings which made me feel very anxious and angry. My stomach was ALWAYS bloated and really uncomfortable every day with mild and sometimes severe cramp. I weighed my self. Despite not putting on weight in 3 years previous to the Mirena, I'd gained 12 pounds within 4 months of having the coil fitted. It is now January 2019. I've just got back from an appointment to have it removed. My stomach pain has already disappeared. Please think very carefully about having one of these things fitted.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had this IUD for three months now. And I'm getting it removed ASAP. I had previously been on Mirena, but my doctor found a way to get me the Kyleena for free so I thought, "why not give it a try, it's free and has less hormones?". Even before I started taking birth control, I never had cramps and I only had a few zits throughout my adolescence. I am now 25 and after having Kyleena inserted 3 months ago, I have the worst cramps ever AND I have horrible acne. I get super emotion right before and during my period, which also never happened to me.  I gave it two stars because it has prevented pregnancy, and the insertion wasn't that painful (it was uncomfortable, but that should be expected). Every body is different so some people may actually enjoy this IUD, but I did not. The reason I am writing this review is just to let people know that if they are considering switching from Mirena to Kyleena, think twice!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had the kyleena IUD for about 7 months. I am 18 years old, and was almost 18 when I had it inserted. I was on the pill since the beginning of my period due to very heavy bleeding and bad cramps, but I switched to kyleena due to a clotting disorder. The insertion was not unbearable pain, just very uncomfortable and felt like bad cramps. However, I did faint and have cramps for about a week. My big issue is when I had kyleena inserted, I weighed around 145 lbs, and I now weigh 175-180 lbs. I have not changed my diet or exercise and had always kept a constant weight, so this weight gain has thrown me for a loop. Hopefully something can be done for this, but other than that its good!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So I was completely terrified of getting the skyla placed, just due to the horror reviews I read prior to my appointment (horrible mistake). Before my appointment, I took a pill to open my cervix, along with 2 ibuprofen. The insertion was easy, and hardly painful. A few small cramps here and there, nothing horrible. But that pain usually depends on the person

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got Skyla on November 1, 2018. I honestly love it. its only been a few months but its the best birth control i've ever used. I had been on the pill for years and I wanted something I didn't have to worry about. I tried nexplanon and hated it, I bled almost every day for a year and a half. The insert for Skyla was not bad at all. It was just like cramps. The Nurse Practitioner who inserted it was really good as well. I will admit that I had some anxiety going in, but she was so professional and talked to me about my concerns. I honestly believed that since I became relaxed, the insert wasn't as painful. I drove myself home from the appointment too. My periods are lighter now, I really don't use tampons anymore, even pads feel a bit too heavy, usually a panty liner will do the trick now. My sex drive came back too. The pill took that away from me lol. Ladies, don't be afraid to try it, if it doesn't work for you, you can always get it removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Most painful experience of my life. I threw up multiple times and fainted - thought I was going to die. Had to stay lay down in the doctor's office for an hour before leaving. Then the pain was fine ( totally gone within 2 hours). However, I feel like my acne has increased and my sex drive is ... totally gone. I'm trying to figure out if this common, it happened to me on the pill too (great contraceptive, but a bit sad)!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I just got my Skyla removed after a full three years of having it and I wanted to wait all the way until removal to write a review. All I can say is this was such a good decision, and I have never regretted getting it put in! For me, the insertion process was very bearable and I would rate it a 7/10. Over the course of the 3 years, my moderate-to-heavy periods were reduced to spotting, which was usually a dark brown discharge rather than bright red blood/lining. I did have pretty heavy mood swings 2 days per month but they were regular, so I knew how to monitor and alleviate them. Removal was fine, too, and felt like a general pap smear. I did get Kyleena inserted today, immediately after the Skyla removal, because Kyleena is the same hormones and dosages but just last 5 years instead of 3. Overall, I am so happy with Skyla, but even my roommate had a very different experience on it, so it is still a very variable drug woman-to-woman.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I'm just going to give the details. I'm not trying to trash mirena, this is just my experience. For background, I'm 21 and I am also on a 40mg daily dose of fluoxotine.I got mirena in May 2018 as my first form of birth control as an adult (took lo Loestrin for a short time in high school for bad periods). In the week after insertion, I developed a yeast infection and a UTI - never had a yeast infection before, but since getting mirena I have had quite a few.  I bled lightly off and on (mostly on) for 3 months after insertion along with sporadic cramps, sometimes intense and sometimes not. I am 5'7 and have always hung around 130 pounds. It has been 8 months since I got mirena and I currently weigh 170, still gaining weight every week. Even with drastic diet improvement and exercise increase I have continued to gain a massive amount of weight. I'm getting mirena removed next week. I'm looking forward to trying another form of birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):As a 22-year-old who has never had children, the insertion process caused such severe cramping that I almost fainted while driving home from the doctor's office and proceeded to lay in bed curled up in a ball for a day and a half afterwards. I bled lightly but consistently for a couple of months after insertion. From then on, I got severe cramps each month before my period (before an IUD, I never got cramps). I still get cramps each month, but they aren't so severe where I feel nauseous. I also started to (and still do) get acne before my period each month. I haven't experienced significant weight gain or loss, but I do have severe mood swings where I'm depressed for the week leading up to my period. I had to choose the Kyleena because of a blood clotting disorder, and while I haven't gotten pregnant, I don't know if the side effects are worth the efficacy of the IUD.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I've had Skyla for about 2 years now. The insertion was easy, but I'm someone who has a very high pain tolerance. The cramps afterwards were no fun but thankfully subsided within a few days. Everything about this IUD is great except the toll it has taken on my mental health. I never used to be emotional around the time of my period but with Skyla I'm a wreck every month and my periods are light but last 2 weeks. I cry all the time when I'm on my period and my moods are like a roller coaster. I had to up my antidepressant dose after getting this IUD just to feel somewhat normal again. It certainly gets the job done but sometimes I feel like it's not worth the emotional damage. It is however, a nice estrogen-free option if you're someone who suffers from migraines like myself. After leaving the pill for Skyla, my migraines decreased substantially, so there are a lot of pros and cons.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am extremely happy with Mirena. I had it  inserted  after having my baby as birth control. There was inconsistent spotting in the beginning and cramping that would come and go. But all of the pain stopped after 3 months. My periods are very light now and no pain during periods. Because there is no pain, my mood stays good overall.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Do not let other reviews scare u from getting an IUD! The procedure didn't hurt that much for me, all I experienced was a lot of pressure and discomfort. It only lasts a matter of minutes and then it’s gone! I only experienced slight cramping during and afterwards but now it’s gone and I got it inserted today

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for over a year and it was rough at first. The first 6 months were unpredictable but my body eventually adjusted and I didn’t spot or bleed anymore. I don’t even know it’s there at all. I had a painful insertion because my cervix is very tiny and that had a lot to do with the bleeding and pain. The only problem I’ve had after those 6 months is the ovarian cysts. I had them for a while and now, they’ve disappeared. The only thing that’s weird now is my breasts are sore. I’ve never had this on Kyleena so I’m not sure what the deal is but they hurt really bad. Other than this, I’ve been fine. Nothing too serious. I’ve spotted maybe 2 times in the past 9 months and I’ve been doing great. I do recommend getting this IUD. Not everyone has the same symptoms so don’t let reviews scare you.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I chose Kyleena because the pill increased my mood swings and I wanted to "set it and forget it". I highly recommend Kyleena to anyone in a similar situation. I'm 25 years old, in a long-term relationship, and I'm a busy (i.e. too lazy/forgetful to take a pill everyday at the same time). It was painful when inserted but only for a day and my doctor prescribed me some high-dose ibuprofen. I used to get bad cramps during my period but they have lightened. The first two months I lightly but consistently bled. He can also occasionally feel the strings when we have sex, more so the first 6 months. Occasionally I get sharp cramps in what feels like my ovary or uterus. I don't know if they are cysts or the IUD poking my uterus but it never happened before my IUD. It could also be menstrual cramps but those are my theories.  Otherwise I love my IUD! It gives me peace of mind. I love that my boyfriend and I don't have to use the risky "pull-out" method and it makes sex so much more spontaneous!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kyleena February 2018. My doctor highly recommended it due to the fact that I had no children and he told me that  my awful periods would stop. I went in and knew it would be painful. Honestly, the pain was about an 8 on a scale from 1-10. I cried and shook in pain. The pain didn’t subside for two days. The bleeding was horrible for the first 3 months. I did gain weight. About 15 pounds. The worst part of it all was a burning sensation I would get in my thighs. I was very curious to know what could cause it. Having PCOS, I talked to my doctor and he did a few exams. Apparently, this IUD caused my small cysts on my ovaries to almost triple in size. It also caused massive constipation. I went to the ER with contraction like pains. I have never been in so much pain in all of my life. Every few minutes it was like my uterus was trying to drop out of my vagina! Turns out, my constipation was causing pressure on the IUD.  I finally had it removed in October of 2018.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My wife’s gynaecologist recommended she get Kyleena. The insertion caused no pain, but then she started bleeding very heavily for about a month. She was also experiencing severe lower back pain. We took her back to the doctor. He said all ok. After the first month, the bleeding did stop, for a week, then came back for 6 weeks, without stopping. There was also a constant mucus discharge. At the same time she started to develop severe acne along her hairline, down past her her ears to her chin. Nothing visible at the surface, but deep and painful bumps that she has never had before. After 6 months of bleeding, acne, back pain and mood swings, we went back to the doctor, who said all this is expected up to 6 months, and is about to taper off. We tried for another month. Nothing changed - constant bleeding, discharge and acne. In September she had it removed. The lower back pain stopped on the same day. The bleeding stopped within a week. The acne cleared up  within two weeks.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had the Skyla birth control for about 4 months now. It is a good type of birth control, but there were two downsides from it though. The first downside was that I was not able to have sex for 3 of the months that I had it but, that was expected. The second downside was that I had unbelievably painful cramps to the point where I would be crying and curled up in the ball under my heated blanket.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The insertion was the most pain I've ever experienced. I had cramps and nausea for three days. I'm 40 with no kids and 130lbs. I've never had problems with birth control pills so I don't know why my provider suggested this. Cramps and nausea woke me up in the middle of the night. I had stabbing pain when I went to the bathroom. By Day 3 I looked in the mirror and realized I was not being responsible for my health. I used walk-in clinic hours and had the damn thing removed. If I was in my teens or 20's I would have believed my provider and kept suffering needlessly for months or years. I had a surgical abortion 20 years ago that was less painful and traumatic than my experience with Kyleena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After having a lot of issues with the mirena and liletta  (headaches/body pain/mood swings) I decided to switch to Kyleena because of the lower dosage. Best decision ever! Insertion was your typical heavy cramp for a split second... I took 800mg Ibuprofen before insertion. I’ve had it for almost a month now & I feel great.  My energy level has actually peaked and I feel well rested in the morning! Its been easier for me to stay on routine and get my daily workout in. I haven’t noticed weight gain and my first period was a bit lighter. Overall I am pleased to have a birth control that is working & not making me feel like I am sick or crazy.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 24 and I decided to get the Kyleena inserted in September 2018 right after having an abortion under general anesthesia. After reading many reviews, I was terrified of the side effects but decided to try it out, especially since I wouldn't have to go through the pain of insertion. I experienced light spotting and cramping for two weeks and then resumed my regular monthly period shortly after with minimal cramping during the time of the month. No other side effects in terms of weight gain, mood changes, skin changes (surprisingly, as this is my first form of birth control). So far I am happy with my Kyleena and glad to have a peace of mind. Just remember everyone's experience will be different and you just have to find what works for you. Good luck if you decide to try the kyleena!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Had it inserted. Worst pain I’ve ever experienced. Next day, cramps beyond explanation. Back to the doc. They couldn’t find the strings to the IUD. LONG STORY SHORT ... IUD traveled from uterus and wedged behind appendix and intestines. Ended up in emergency surgery. They still can’t figure out how it got there!  Back on depo shot!!!  Don’t like being a rare statistic!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just got it today. I have the best pain tolerance so wasn’t nervous at all, have got multiple piercings, blood draws, shots, and broken bones and I have NEVER cried in one of them. This pain was unbearable, I almost passed out, I’ve never been in so much pain in my life, if I would have know how painful it was going to be I would have never got it. Hoping all that pain will be worthy it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted four months ago. I have two children, both c sections. I found the insertion fine, with minor cramping for two days. I bled for these past four months every day minus about two weeks. I expected this. I did not gain weight. I finally stopped bleeding about a week ago. I have just lost a considerable amount of hair. More than the loss that occurs after pregnancy. Most of my loved ones have noticed. I am having the IUD removed in two days. I went to a dermatologist and now need to supplement with vitamins and over the counter products to try and stimulate hair growth. I had a thick head of hair and no other reason to have lost this much hair. The IUD is effective, easy but I may need a wig now. Who can say?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 39 yrs old and before Kyleena I was on the Mirena. I switched due to lower hormones suggested by my Gyno.  The insertion was painful and I've had it now for 3 months. I'm comparing it to the Mirena because that's what I am used to but the Kyleena is painful especially when your due for your period. I stopped bleeding but during that time of my suppose period I get bad cramps and a really foul smell. Also, my acne is bad I have never experienced bad skin until now.  My mood swings are unexpected and frequently.  I'm giving it another month perhaps my body needs more time to get used to it but so far it has been a bad experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Getting Kyleena inserted was a terrible experience. The pain was awful, I almost made them stop completely. After getting it, I spot almost everyday and it has been 2 months. I have been experiencing a lot of weight gain and believe it is from the Kyleena. I also have been breaking out much more than usual. Hopefully these side effects soon go away.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla inserted February 2018. I was very scared to get it prior to having it inserted but I went through it anyways and it actually wasn't that bad. However fast forward to 2019. I have gained 35 lb on Skyla. I had my last baby in July 2017 and I lost a lot of weight after I had her and continued to lose weight up until the insertion of the IUD. If you are very sensitive to birth control as of I am I would recommend the good old condoms. I feel like the IUD has made me go emotionally crazy and experienced a lot of weight gain. I had the depo shot in 2015 and it was far worse than Skyla. I had experienced a lot of weight gain and I was hormonally  off balance severely. Anyone that is sensitive to any sort of birth control like I am I wouldn't recommend anything.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I mentally prepared myself for insertion, thinking it would be the worst pain ever based on reviews. I was wrong... I’d rate it a 2/10 at most. Literally barely felt it. I have a high pain tolerance, but it was a complete walk in the park for me. However the cramps that followed were UNBEARABLE and nonstop for about 10 hours after. The next day I was fine cramp wise, but starting then began to bleed lightly nonstop for about 6 weeks. After this, no period at all. At first I thought all was well but then began to experience pretty severe depression symptoms. Going to have it removed ASAP because I can’t stand feeling this way. Really sucks because it’s an amazing BC method in theory and totally removes any paranoia associated with pregnancy... 10/10 when it comes to preventing pregnancy for sure, but just can’t deal with the depression.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am so glad I have read this forum. I have been suffering for months and thinking I was going round the bend with my mental health. Suffering from awful panic attacks, anxiety, arm and shoulder pain, sickness, headaches, heavy bleeding and more. I had my mirena coil inserted May 2018. After he contraceptive injection and pill failed to work for me. Since then I really haven't been the same person. I can not wait to have it removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):*UPDATED REVIEW* I've been on the Kyleena IUD for about two years and its been great to me. The insertion wasn't painful at all, and the recovery time was very minimal (probably like a day but I got it on a Friday so I took the whole weekend to relax). My periods are non existent but sometimes I get spotting with mild cramping for a few days before it goes away, but the cramping is much more tolerable than when I wasn't on any birth control at all and felt like dying whenever I was on my period. It's given me a little bit of acne on my chin but really not anything super noticeable. I haven't had any "accidents" unlike when I was on the pill. My partner says he does not feel it in me either so that's a big plus too. It also hasn't messed with my emotions either which was a big problem when I was on the shot and it amped up my depression/anxiety making me borderline suicidal. I have nothing but good things to say about Kyleena and plan to get it again when this one needs a replacement.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am almost done with my second Skyla IUD. For the last almost 6 years I have LOVED it. I did have a lot of bleeding in the first month. Which is common. I have not gained weight, had unusual mood swings, acne, etc. It is a little expensive, but the second go around I found out you can get a grant from the government to pay for it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had kyleena for about 9 months now. It was quite painful for me getting it. And I had a lot of cramping for a week after. Also was very bloated. Since I've gotten it I've gained 10 to 13lbs within a few months. I only bleed very lightly once every 2 months. I don't get regular periods anymore. I did also start breaking out on my face and chest when I've never had issues with that before. I get light cramps here and there. But I guess it's effective because I haven't gotten pregnant yet. When I was taking birth control pills I never had side effects of acne or weight gain. So its been a weighing up of pros and cons for new. If i gain more weight i might get it removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for a full year now and so far I have had no complications with the actual IUD itself. It is also the first birth control I've tried that hasn't caused depression! I am giving it a 9 because it is very effective at preventing pregnancy however I have experienced some side effects with it. I never used to really get cramps and when I did, they were easy to deal with. After getting the Kyleena IUD, I almost always get pretty bad cramps before my period but nothing I can't fix with some pain killers. I have also been experiencing yeast infections for the first time in my life that have been on and off for the past 6 months, I heard IUDs can sometimes cause yeast infections so I am not sure if it is from Kyleena or some other reason. Other than those side effects, I think Kyleena is a great option for many people!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 22  (weight of 100-105) all of my teen years I had terrible periods that lasted 2 - 3 weeks. I was underweight and became very anemic. My cramps where unbearable and eventually kept me from working. I spent almost 2 years in total pain everyday, regardless of me being on my period. I finally went into a women's health institute where I was told I needed to be on a form of birth control. My gynecologist recommended the  Kyleena. The insertion was indeed painful. In fact I passed out on my way home, thank goodness my husband was driving. The first 4-5 months I bled randomly but I was used to it. After about 6 months of having it, my body began to accept the IUD. My everyday cramping went away. And my period normalized to what a normal woman should have.  I've had the IUD for almost 2 years now and I am so happy. To help with the onset anxiety I gained with the IUD I take herbs and fish oils.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD almost 2 months ago... other than spotting (which I was told is normal for the first 3-6 months) I am super happy with it! I was terrified to get it after reading all of the horrific side effects that people have had.. but I haven’t had any!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the Skyla IUD inserted 3 days ago. The pain during and for about 6-10 hours afterward was easily top 5 worst pain I’ve ever had. I was not at all prepared for that. I thought something was wrong and went back to the doctor that same day to have them check it. They said everything was fine. I’m still having pain from cramping now but it’s more mild. I’m not used to that because I’ve never really dealt with cramps before. I’m hoping they will go away. Before I had this IUD inserted I was on the mini pill. Skyla is a lower dosage so I’m hoping that helps with some of the issues I was having. So far I’m just want the thing taken back out but I’m trying to push through hoping it will get better.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had mirena for 3 months. I felt no pain during insertion and had no cramps or bleeding immediately afterward. Then one week later I started cramping and spotting and that has lasted on and off to this day. I get breakouts on my face that I never got before. I have gained 4 pounds and dieting isn't getting it off. Before I could just clean up my eating a bit and the weight would come off and that's not the case now. I have absolutely NO interest in sex anymore whatsoever. But other than that I haven't had any real problems with it. I'm hopeful everything will even out in the next few months and my body will get used to it and these side effects will go away because other than that it has been a great birth control

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD in February 2018 and it’s been the best birth control I’ve tried. I’ve gotten no acne from it, maybe a little weight gain, and the only pain I experienced was from insertion and some after. Insertion was rough for me and I had cramping for a couple of weeks after. Then my periods would come and go but got lighter and lighter. Around the 8 months mark I had a period that was very light but the cramps were bad. I’ve had the IUD for about 11 months now and my period seems to have stopped all together.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Rated this a 5 because it does do its job which is prevent pregnancy. It’s super, super effective in doing that BUT I gained over 10lbs, my depression/ anxiety got worse, bleed during intercourse, my legs would go numb and cramping was almost unbearable. Everyone body reacts differently but this was my 2nd time trying the IUD and they’re just not for me. Good luck!!!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Don’t listen to the horror stories. If you know this hormone type works for you birth control wise GET IT!! I was on depo for years before this until my gyno forced me off and I had to make the choice to do this because I knew I would forget taking the pill. Seriously ladies, do it, worst part is insertion after that I had zero symptoms and didn’t feel a thing. On year number 2 and loving it. Don’t even have periods. No cramping. Nothing. You don’t even know it’s there. I know that progesterone only birth controls work for me. If you haven’t taken a progesterone only bc then for sure DO NOT choose a 3 year method!! You need to make sure this hormone combo works for you before you sign up or you WILL be miserable like everyone complaining. Will definitely get again once I have children.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for a little over 4 months now, and I am deciding to get it removed. After putting up with symptoms for much longer than I should have, I feel that the benefits do not outweigh the risks. I am 20 with no children. Insertion wasn't too bad, being that I usually tolerate pain pretty well but I have to admit that it was 3 waves of extremely strong cramps, which is exactly what my gyno told me to expect. Post-insertion I bled for 2 months straight, basically like having a period everyday. I also had terrible cramps every day that had me keeling over in pain, which I had never experienced in my life. I decided to put up with it for at least 3-6 months because I really wanted to give it a chance after everything my body had went through already. I also gained 10-15 lbs which I can't seem to lose no matter how much or how little I eat. I already have a hx of depression and anxiety and Kyleena only made it far worse. I didn't, and currently don't feel like myself at all.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I loved this IUD. It really serves its purpose. I've had it for 2 years and the only complaint is that it clogged my pores very severely. Facial and body acne has appeared mostly around menstruation.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I got the Kyleena in April, it was an uncomfortable cramp feeling for me last two weeks. All was well I had the period for the first while then it was over and it was really awesome.But then I started gaining weight, growing facial hair and excess body hair and had cystic acne, I had to get a pelvic exam done which aggravated the IUD and then caused cramps and a period, later on in the fall I started getting back aches and continued gaining weight and more acne lots of chin hairs and other hairs in places I had never hadI had it removed my skin is almost cleared up and I have lost some of the weight I gained. Doesn’t hurt to have removed either But I have been on different birth controls for years and it was horrific to have all the loss of control. Wouldn’t recommend to many Good luck picking an IUD!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):As far and the initial procedure, I cried. I have a low pain tolerance anyway but if was enough for me to decide not to get another IUD when this one expires. The pain went away quickly though.About six months after, I ended up in the ER with an 4.6cm ovarian cyst rupture. The pain was so severe I could not move for hours. I've had two cyst ruptures total in the year I have had Skyla. I also experience breast fibroids often leaving me with very sore and swollen breasts.My period went away until my first rupture and now its very irregular. When I do get it I have horrible bleeding and immobilizing cramps.I have finally had enough and am getting mine removed and going back to my low dose pill option.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 26. Never had children. I've had Kyleena for 6 months now. The procedure to get Kyleena placed was easy and not painful. I took 800mg of ibuprofen before my appt and didn't feel anything except slight pressure. The day after insertion I tried to work but ended up in tears because I was having stabbing cramps. The first 3-4 months I pretty much bleed constantly, but it was light. My cramps increased and would be so painful I would be toppled over crying in pain. I have had depression and anxiety that I never had before this. My sex drive has decreased, and my orgasms have become almost non existent.
