Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Positive experience: I just got Kyleena 3 weeks ago and I have to say insertion is uncomfortable but hurt less than Mirena. It’s quick. So far just the normal spotting and day of cramping, which have both subsided. I was on day 1 of my cycle. I have had 3 Mirena in past. My 1st and 3rd Mirena I hated, I’m thinking because I was postpartum (weight gain, spotting, hormonal). My 2nd placed due to fibroids, I loved it once I got past the initial side effects. I removed it after 4 yrs to have a baby. I didn’t want the blood clot, BP risk or any of the other side effects with pills, I’m 38 so now I opted for Kyleena over Mirena due to lower hormones to prevent some of the side effects. And it’s been great. No weight gain, no mood swings, no acne. But I’m watching my weight just to be sure. Every one will react differently but to give your body time to adjust. Knowing what to expect helps.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I do not recommend this to anyone who does not have issues with birth control pills. I got kyleena (23yo, 125lbs, no children) simple because I wanted to eliminate estrogen from my birth control and not take pills each day. My doctor placed it when I was on my menstrual cycle, and she gave me a cervix dilator the night before so it did not hurt. I had break through bleeding often and when my real cycle came it lasted 8+ days. My breasts seemed to shrink and my sex drive was lacking for my age. I ended up getting vaginitis twice, and then started bleeding during sex. My doctor recommended removing the IUD because I had no complications with birth control pills. It has been removed for 4 days and the amount of bleeding convinced me to go the the emergency room. They did not warn me that I would be passing large clots and heavy amounts of blood for days to weeks after removal. Seriously not worth it. Hoping the bleeding doesn't last too much longer and I can go back to normal on pills.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got the Skyla yesterday 12-27-18. The pain of the insertion was definitely more than I thought it would be. I’ve tried pills the depo shot, and the nuva ring. The shot was a horrible I bleed for months and had to use the pills to reverse those effects. I stopped using it and switched to the nuva ring which was decent, however my partner would hit it during intercouse. Taking the nuva ring in and out during sex was annoying and I wanted to try something different. I can’t give much detail on the Skyla because I have only had it for a day. However the pain while receiving it was top 10 but quick. I had my mother come with me and having her there definitely helped because she held my hand. Afterwords I felt like I had one large cramp over my midsection and it ended a few hours later. My advice is too bring a trusted family member or friend, take medication(Motrin, Ibuprofen) before insertion, and go while on your period.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena has been the worst birth control I’ve tried, and I’ve tried a lot. It’s rated a five because it is effective, however I’m struggling to decide if I want to remove it or not because the side effects are awful. I have acne all over my cheeks now, I’ve gained about 5 pounds in a month, and I have intense cramping during my periods which I never used to have before. However I like the safety of knowing it’s effectiveness, so I am torn.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted about two weeks ago. I’m 20 years old, had been on the pill for about 5 years before, and have never been pregnant. The insertion was pretty painful; however, it only lasted a minute and was worth it to not take a pill everyday anymore. Just remember to take 800mg of ibuprofen before! After the insertion, I had heavy brown discharge for a few days but it has lightened over time. I feel zero cramping and my acne has improved so much! It doesn’t even feel like anything is in there. This IUD has been one of the best decisions!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is my six month update! Getting it in was no big deal- honestly I don’t even remember it being painful anymore! However, the chronic cramping has not let up, and has become more of a burning and sharp sensation in my lower abdomen. Sex (the limited times I’ve had it with this in) was painful afterwards, and exercising became really painful afterwards as well. I get yeast infections 1-2 times monthly, and experience a very inflamed vulva area (which is unusual for me). The constant sticky, stringy brown discharge was just an annoyance over time. I’d honestly rather have a period at this rate! Perhaps this is just due to me being a smaller girl, and never having kids. Maybe I’ll try it again after I have kids, but for now I’m removing it. I gave it a good go for 6months.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena was inserted 1 month ago and I can’t wait for my check up for them to take it out. I’ve had a Nexplanon implant for the past three years that I adore. Though, my insurance won’t cover it anymore so I had to try Kyleena. It’s so bad that I’m willing to pay for my Nexplanon. I have never cramped in my life, before kyleena my periods were a ray of sunshine compared to my friends. I just really hate Kyleena. The insertion was the most painful thing I’ve expirenced. I’m bleeding non stop and developing all these other vaginal problems. I’m constantly cramping and irritable. Definitely would NOT recommend.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I was on this birth control for 2 years. The insertion was very painful (I won’t even lie) I came off the table I was on - it was so bad. I also had a vasovagal syncope attack after (which is normal for me) I cramped badly after for about a week. But after two months my periods were super normal/ light. My acne was nearly GONE! I did gain about 15 pounds, but other than that I felt very protected and secure and happy. That is, til I read it can make it harder to have kids. I read sooooo many people saying that so out of fear I had it removed. I wish I hadn’t , but the weight did come off immediately within a week. Now I’m on the hunt for something that won’t make me depressed or anxious and will help my periods. So far mirena has been the best aside from the extreme pain to get it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Horrible BC method! Most of the reviews on here are only about insertion and have only had kyleena for a day or so. I had kyleena for 14 months. I personally didn't have an issue with insertion.  A month after kyleena I started gaining weight rapidly despite not changing my diet or exercise routine. I started feeling tired all the time, I felt depressed, anxious and just genuinely not myself. A few months went by and I started loosing a TON of hair. Fast forward to 12 months post insertion.  I missed my period and the next month I started developing SEVERE cystic acne. I have never had acne like that before. I went to the doctor and they kept telling me there was no way it was from kyleena (eye roll). They checked my blood, did ultrasounds and all my labs came back consistent with a woman with a PCOS diagnosis. After 2 months of removal EVERYTHING has improved. Kyleena was the worst decision of my life!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had it in for almost three years now and it has served its purpose well! I have not had any issues and it has made my period so much lighter. I love it and will probably get another one when the time comes around

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My initial story was much longer, but characters are limited so I will just talk about the insertion process.During the actual insertion, (~5 mins), remember to BREATHE! Otherwise your muscles cramp & makes it even more painful. I tried to imagine my lungs filling with air, & surprisingly it helped & my doc noted that when people stop breathing, it makes it more difficult & more painful for them to insert it. I’m not saying you don’t feel it, You feel it for sure. You feel your body start to cramp & all you want to do is keel over & hold yourself, but literally just breathe. Tell a story if you have to. Everyone is different but you have to find what can help keep you calm when your body is literally screaming at you & at the doc. After the insertion, do not try to sit up!  The first 20 mins after you can get lightheaded & dizzy. I got a cold towel under my neck & stomach & really glad I did! Definitely helped a lot with the initial pain

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the Skyla inserted today and was quite nervous after reading a lot of scary reviews about painful insertion. I took 800 mg of ibuprofen 1 hour ahead of time and received lidocaine injections in my cervix. The procedure ended up being entirely painless, much to my surprise (I’m a wimp). I have had 3 pregnancies, so that may have helped, but I do think the lidocaine and ibuprofen made a huge difference. So far, minor gas-like cramping and bleeding lightly. I just wanted to share a positive review so others go into the gyno’s office a little less nervous.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have been looking at these reviews for a while to help ease my nervousness about getting the IUD & thought now  I could help someone else. This is only my experience on the procedure since I just got it done today. I got the Kyleena & overall, it went super smooth. I just had a baby 7 weeks ago & I had a c-section so that could have something to do with it. The whole entire procedure, from the time the doctor came in until it was over was no more than 10 minutes. For me, the most uncomfortable part was when they put the speculum . I didn’t feel any pain when the actual IUD was inserted. But I also took a 800 mg pain med so I recommend doing the same! I felt no dizziness and no nausea afterwards either. It’s now two hours later & I can’t even tell I had it done. If you’re nervous about it like I was, I promise you’ll be fine. It’s over so quick that you’ll be like that’s it? Otherwise I’d say it’s worth it and the pain is 100% bearable.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am in the health care profession and would consider myself knowledgeable about IUDs. My doctor told me I couldn’t get the copper IUD because I hadn’t had kids yet. I wanted the paragard because it has no hormone. With the kyleena, I was hesitant because of the hormone levels, although low, still hormone. Soooo.. It ended up being the scariest experience of my life. I began feeling very depressed, worsening in anxiety, and began having feelings of fear. I expressed this to my doctor and it was blamed on my underlying anxiety. This is and was different.. I know how to manage my underlying anxiety, but this feeling was bigger than me. I got it taken out after multiple consults and ultrasounds. I developed cysts, terrible left sided abdominal pain, constant bloating, and discomfort. Decided to get it removed and it was the best decision. I know it works for others so if it does, awesome. But if not and your doctor or anyone is trying to persuade you to keep it in.. follow your gut!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was terrified to get an IUD but once I  finally did, I   was so happy! I was taking pills for 2 years and got sick and tired of it. If you have a high pain tolerance, getting an IUD is so worth it, for me the insertion process felt painful. I   panicked held my breath in and got very dizzy. But after 20 minutes I was able to get up and leave. This is when the real pain started, I had intense cramps for 3 weeks but now all is good and I love Kyleena its so effortless and sex is simpler now!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My experience with Kyleena isn't the greatest. I have had it inserted 7 months ago, as a 27y with no children. Insertion was quick but strong sharp pain. For the rest of the day I wasn't able to do anything, had to take a day off. Pain went away next day when my periods came and lasted for ever. Anyway since then my bleeding is week but long, I have got cystic acne all over my chin, which I didn't have before, having sharp cramps very often. Sex drive decreased and I am thinking Kyleena is just not for me. Every body reacts different.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had Mirena for over one year, this year is the most awful year that I've experienced as a married woman. During this year I've had the chance for having sex just for 10 or 12 times at all, because I have heavy bleeding after inserting Mirena and till now after one year and one month!!! The insertion was very painful, I needed my husband to take me home, and I needed to rest for one day after insertion. I had terrible cramp in my abdomen and pain in my bones, legs and hip, irregular mc and longer than usual for 14 or 20 days. Doctors told me that it gonna be alright after a year and be patient, but there is no sign of adaptation on me... Now that I review the users experiments I want to get this thing removed from me and back to usual life.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had my IUD for only about 4.5 weeks now. I'm 34, never had children and had been on birth control pills for years. Both the fitting and the insertion were equally brutal. The intense pain subsided shortly after, but the first few days I was extremely sore and achy. Since then I have had random cramping almost every day with lower back and abdominal pain radiating down my thighs and legs, sometimes so intense I keel over and start crying. I've also had dizzy spells, bloating, constipation, and a few cystic pimples but no full-on breakouts. I am due for my period this week but have not had ANY bleeding since insertion. I go for ultrasound to check the positioning at next week. If the cramping doesn't improve within the next few months, I might have it removed. The pill never gave me this much trouble except random spotting. Everyone is different, but based on the insertion process alone I'm not sure I'd recommend it to others. I'll report back after some more time. Good luck, ladies!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I've been on Skyla for two years now and I was in love with this style of birth control up until a week ago when I was visiting my OBGYN. I had mentioned my worry for being on antibiotics for a year and a half to help control my acne. I have never had acne before, let alone cystic acne until 6 months of the Skyla IUD. That was when she brought up that cystic acne is a side effect for women who have the Skyla insertion. I am beyond eager to have my Skyla removed a year early, tomorrow, so I can hopefully feel confident with my skin again. I do not believe that this happens with everyone but I wanted to share my story to help those who are looking into this. Besides the acne, the Skyla worked like a charm, my heavy periods turned into very low flow periods and I never got pregnant! However, not worth it to me to be breaking out this tremendously.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Pt 1.I got Kyleena Sept 2018. Shortly after every ovulation and premenstrual cramping was so severe I was bedridden unable to sleep with constant diarrhea. I had ultrasounds confirming I developed ovarian cysts. Which the treatment for is contraceptives so I had that covered. I continued to get ultrasounds every 3 months just to be sure of placement due to the horrendous pain.February 2018 I developed heart palpitations, like thundering heartbeats, flicking feeling in my heart and racing so fast I gasp for breath because I can't get air. Went to emergency 7+ times, ECG and monitors confirmed multiform PVCs and PACs. Saw an internal doctor put me on beta blockers. I did a 24 urine test with no excessive metabolites of norepinephrine or adrenaline. And beta blockers did nothing but made me dizzy due to having good BP already. I had ECG's, halter monitors, blood work(×15?) and an echocardiogram with nothing wrong with my heart.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted on July 3rd, 2018. I absolutely hate it. I got it right at my 6 week check up after having a c section. The insertion was nothing compared to the c section, but enough to keep you on your toes. I have made an appointment to take it out for next month because I have been bleeding non stop. I gave it a 6 month trial period and I really wish I made the appointment to get it out sooner! So disappointed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena last year. My periods were terrible  I would pass out and throw up all the time when I would take the pill. Getting the Kyleena was the best thing that ever happened to me.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got Skyla inserted in May 2018. So far I haven’t had any issues with cramping or heavy periods. Sometimes I have small breakthrough bleeding a few days a month but it’s nothing too concerning. I have noticed an increase in acne around my chin area (hormonal acne). I’ve eliminated dairy and started using an AHA/BHA exfoliant and it has actually helped quite a bit. My breakouts are way less severe than they were. Other than that I have no complaints! Lots of unprotected sex and no pulling out and I’ve yet to have a pregnancy scare so I’d say Skyla does it’s job pretty well!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena put in since April 2018.  The first 6 months my periods were pretty heavy and lasted 8-10 days.  Since last month, they are now lasting around 6 days.  It's getting lighter and shorter but it's taking a while to get there.  On the plus, no weight gain with this.  My hair is falling out more than usual but nothing insane.  I have more acne and my skin is greasier.  I feel way better though on this than on the pill.  I get headaches during my period but the headaches are milder than when I was on the pill.  I like not having to worry about taking something daily.  Overall, I'm satisfied with my IUD.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve been really happy with my Skyla IUD! I’ve tried the shot and the pill and hated the side effects from both (weight gain, mood swings, acne, cramps). I got my Skyla inserted in the middle of October this year. The initial insertion was definitely painful but once it was in I didn’t have any pain, just a little soreness. Immediately after I left my appointment I went grocery shopping and then went to work since the pain was so mild. The first month I was definitely moodier than normal and had spotting but everything seems to have balanced out now that it’s mid December. I’m not moody anymore, only cramping one day out of the whole month and I’ve actually lost weight since getting my IUD. I think it really depends on your doctor who does the insertion how painful it will be, do your research on your provider and find someone you trust :)

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had the Skyla for almost 5 months. Prior to that I had the Paraguard 4 years.  I was so fed up with bleeding for 8-9 day very heavily so I decided to change to skyla. I have had nothing but health issues since.  Insertion hurt and I continued to have horrible back pain for about a month, and now once a month. I started getting cold sores (never had) during PMS and my period, nausea, dizziness and fatigue. After two months I got my first stomach ulcer (never had) which took a whole month to start getting better. After that I started having diarrhea and stomach cramping and it’s as if I am allergic to everything I eat! Two week ago I had my annual eye exam and was told my optic nerves were swollen (never been told that before). I’ve had two bladder infections since I’ve had the IUD and lots of hair loss. This thing is coming out in 3 days and I couldn’t be sooner. Please don’t ruin your health with skyla.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had kyleena for almost exactly a year. When I got it inserted I was 18 and it was the worst pain I've ever experienced. I had to stay at the doctors office until I stopped shaking, and the drive home was brutal. I almost turned around and had them take it out! I bled/spotted for around two months after getting it and then I started having my normal cycle, but it wasn't much improved. It still lasts 10 days, though it is a bit lighter than before. Other than that, now I get excruciating cramps on the right side mostly, so bad I often feel nauseous or like screaming. I also began to get a ton of cystic acne. And I gained about 10 lbs. Kyleena is very effective in preventing pregnancy but sometimes I wonder if the costs outweigh the benefits. As of now I'm planning on keeping in just because no other birth control helps my PMDD besides kyleena. But damn I am excited to get this thing taken out in 2022.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Had liletta for 3.5 years, had it removed and replaced with mirena as I had met the deductible for insurance this year. Liletta is pretty much the same as mirena in terms of hormone release per day.1st insertion - large dilator, cramps, bleeding for about 3 months - then - no more heavy cycles, improvement in cramps. no mood changes or weight changes and the best - no pregnancy scares. Then on to the replacement  with mirena - liletta came out easily, few big cramps with dilators/insertion, all manageable with ibuprofen. I  took the afternoon off from work to watch bad soaps with a heating pad. Back to the gym the following morning with no pain or cramps. Now I am good for 5 years with the most reliable contraception out there.  Will never go back to the birth control pill with this available!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I've had the IUD now for 2 weeks and so far it's seems alright! I feel more tired and a little foggy but it's hard to determine if that's just the time of year (work stress!) or if it's do with the IUD. Haven't had a period yet! And no spotting. Some thicker discharge to what I'm used to but I don't consider it a problem. Get some mild cramps every once in a while but they don't come to anything and not bad enough for painkillers. I'm trying to keep an eye on my mood as I feel more irritable. But hoping it's just my hormones needing to settle. Haven't had sex with it yet! But orgasms are more intense, and I feel more sensitive down there again which was my concern with the combined pill. So far so good!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Okay, so I’ve had the kyleena for over TWO years now. Insertion was painful but not unbearable. For the first 2 weeks I bleed about the amount of a normal period or less, I suffer from very irregular periods, and I have all of my life (I am now 21). Now since being on kyleena, my periods have completely vanished and I haven’t had a menstrual cycle in over a year now. Sometimes I get occasional cramping. I also gained 20 POUNDS in about two years but now I’m slowly starting to lose the weight. As well, I suffered with acne a lot of my life, after insertion my acne was a lot worse, but finally now it’s pretty much gone. I’ve never gotten pregnant, so it’s working. Also during the beginning my hormones effected my mood but it took about 8-12 months for that to even out.  I also experienced mild depression and anxiety which may or may not have to due with my hormones. It’s been two years now and everything seems to be normalized for me, besides the minimal cramping. I hope this helps

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I also figured I’d share my positive experience since there are so many recent negative reviews. I got Kyleena October 19th and, again, insertion is so variable between people. I found that focusing on your breathing in order to relax your muscles was super helpful, and so the insertion wasn’t much worse than an intense period cramp. I had cramping for the first few weeks where I’d have to sit down to breathe through it, which was annoying, but after my first period, I haven’t had any at all. It’s like it’s not even there. Also, for those experiencing acne, I suspect a large part of that is from going off of the pill rather than on Kyleena - I experienced acne for a few months after going off the pill 2 years ago. As of now, I’m loving it and plan to keep it in the full 5 years.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This has so far been the best birth control I’ve tried. I broke out a little bit at first and I’ve been spotting on and off. Insertion wasn’t even painful at all I’ve never had kids or anything. It was a little uncomfortable but I’d rate it 3/10 on a pain scale. Overall it’s been amazing and I love that I don’t have to worry about taking a pill or getting a shot or anything anymore

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena removed after 5 weeks. The insertion of the device wasn't as bad as people had described. It was  was bearable pain. However, the day after insertion, I had very bad cramping, and as the weeks went on the cramping became worse. I would be doubled over in pain. I also bled consistently for 5 weeks, with no let up. Sex was also incredibly painful, it became on fire with pain after I would orgasm because of how intense my uterus was contracting against the Kyleena. I would lie there withering in pain after sex. Needless to say, I never wanted to have sex, (which defeated the purpose of purchasing the Kyleena in the first place). I was always under my heat pad, I couldn't workout, and I basically could do nothing without fear of excessive cramping, so eventually, it became a quality of life issue, and I decided I couldn't continue to live like this, so I got my Kyleena removed. No regrets!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):24 no kids. I took some pain killers 1 hour before the insertion and I did not feel it at all!! It was a slight pinch (think about getting a flu shot) when they were measuring the uterus. I jokingly asked the doctor if it was done yet, and to my surprise she said it was done. I had read this thread beforehand and was expecting the worst pain of my life, but I barely felt anything. I'm a person who passes out when getting blood drawn and who is very scared of needles, and this was totally bearable. Everyone might have a different experience but don't be scared by other reviews. Side effects: daily bleeding. It's not terrible, just enough to be annoying; somewhere between spotting and a full blown period every single day. I joke to my boyfriend that Kyleena is 100% effective because you can never have sex. No cramps though! I did have some joint tingling and tiny spots of chin acne. I recommend it for now, will update after the 3-6 mo. settlement period.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Worst birth control I’ve ever used. I had it placed 2 months after my last child. I had it in for 11 months. The worst 11 months of my life. I had a constant yeast infection. I hardly produced any natural lubricant. I started having severe ezcema on both of my hands about 2 weeks after insertion. Despite HIIT, spin 1 hour 3 times a week, and healthy portioned eating, weight refused to go below a certain amount. I had constant bloating, terrible headaches, extreme water retention, depression, constant body aches (like flu) and so much more. I had the IUD removed  and I have gradually started feeling myself again. I’ve had it out 3 days and I’m down 4 pounds. My hands aren’t as swollen and the eczema has started to go away. Never again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had my Kyleena in for about two or three months. I bleed basically all the time right now. I gained 7 pounds initially, (and I NEVER gain weight) but I am now dropping the weight. The hormones did affect me, and still do, but I haven’t gotten pregnant! It does its job! Just be sure to pay attention to your body. It can be frustrating, and yet affective.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I was put on the skyla after forgetting to take the pill so much. The insertion was painful afterwards. No period for 6 months after insertion but then my periods came back and started get even worse. They would last at least a 9 days with horrible cramps. I’m planning to get skyla removed finally after 26 months.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m 18 (no children) and since I was 13 I’ve been having awful periods. I have a common bleeding disorder called Von Willebrand’s Disease and my doctor has suggested the IUD since I was 15. I’ve always been very hesitant about it, however, my periods were worsening after the second year of taking the oral contraceptive called Marvelon, which is why I decided to get the IUD. The insertion was the worst pain I have ever experienced and although I’m used to extreme menstrual cramps, the pain is simply unbearable. I was shaking from head to toe and couldn’t move or communicate for about 20 minutes due to the extreme pain and nausea. When I got home, the extreme cramping lasted about 5 hours. It’s the day after the insertion and I’m still experiencing cramps and discomfort. I’m hoping that this helps my periods and works as a good form of birth control, but the pain overall doesn’t seem worth it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I wanted to wait and post my review later on to see how it works in the future but I refuse to let all the recent negative reviews on Kyleena stop anyone else's decision to get it. I got kyleena put in over a month ago, the pain was sharp but TOTALLY bearable and lasted maybe 10 seconds. The cramps after were very bad but they went away after a couple days. I took 4 aleve and an evening primrose pill to soften my cervix before I went. Coming from someone with depression and GAD everything with me is perfectly normal, I actually feel better after getting the IUD! It takes on average of 6 months to one year for your body to settle down and get used to it, PLEASE give it time! I had hormonal acne but so far my face has been clear. Cramps are gone already. I used to get frequent migraines and I haven't had any. I am a teenager and have had positive outcomes, some people need to give it longer to settle in. I mean it is a foreign object in your uterus. You have to give your body a chance.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena in September, at first things were great, only one period and some slight cramping every few weeks. But after about 3 months, I started getting numbness and tingling. Around the third month my body went numb and I passed out, the ER could find nothing wrong, thinking it was neurological. 2 weeks after the first incident not only did my body go numb but I had heart palpitations, went to the ER again and they could find nothing wrong.  The only difference in my diet, lifestyle, stress etc is that I had got Kyleena. Yesterday I got it taken out and now a lot of the numbness and pain has gone away already. But I am going a  listtle hormonal crazy, I am moody, emotional and have an intense headache that will not go away. I would caution everyone to be very wary when getting Kyleena and pay close attention to how your body reacts

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had my liletta inserted a little over 2 months ago. I’m 20, healthy BMI & had it inserted a day or two before the start of my period. I went to planned parenthood & I was SO anxious before hand knowing that it causes a lot of pain but it was nothing more than a slight* pinch & super quick! I had some slight bleeding the day of but didn’t experience my normal period & haven’t since. I bled for maybe 3 full weeks after (more like spotting, nothing awful, maybe 2 days of a normal actual period), had some back & breast pain for a few days, my belly button also randomly cramped up a couple times but just in the first 3 days & ever since I’ve been fine. I’ve experienced no weight gain or acne (I’ve always struggled with acne & don’t exercise), sometimes have random pelvic pain that only lasts a few seconds & then will disappear for a few weeks, I MAY have experienced some mood changes but that might be stress. Will update if anything changes but so far it’s been great!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have never had acne in my life aside from one or two tiny spots per month around my period. Got Kyleena inserted and a week later my entire left chin/cheek area was covered in cystic acne. My routine and diet did not change at all, nor did any of my products. Got it removed a month later because the symptoms would not go away and I couldn’t wait it out per my doctors advice with such painful acne. Now I have scarring that is slowly fading. Thanks Kyleena!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got this implant in while I was on my period so it didn’t hurt as much as I thought it would. I’ve had this implant in for 6 months and it was rough just in the beginning. My cramps would get bad but my periods weren’t as heavy as before, it was much lighter. I was 142 now I’m 150 pounds. I don’t go to the gym. At the time I was taking these vitamins for hair growth and the implant made me breakout. I thought it’s probably the vitamins so I stopped taking them and my face got cleared.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the Skyla for 2 years before having it removed. After having the IUD for 11 months, I started breaking out in chronic hives daily. After visiting my PCP, Dermatologist, and Allergist several times, no one could tell me what was causing the hives. I would get hives from exercising, cleaning, cold weather, and stress. It was a daily occurrence for me and I changed everything from switching to organic foods and reading labels to any products that had chemicals. I did everything possible and the only thing I could think of that I hadn’t changed was having my IUD removed. It has now been 2 years since having the Skyla removed and now the only time I break out in hives is when it is really cold outside. I have read articles that state it can take up to 4 years before your body rids you of the toxins from the IUD. When I mentioned this to my OB-GYN she stated she had never heard of such a thing. My next checkup she told me she had another patient with similar issues.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had no notable problems with the liletta IUD. I have gained weight maybe 20lbs but that is probably my own fault from stress eating and such. My periods got lighter then after a year and a half went away. I was not a fan of birth control pills they made me moody and made my periods heavier. This will be my preferred birth control for the rest of my life. Just put it in and forget about it for a couple of years. It’s like nothing is there and nothing is different. Perfect for a 20 year old like me who wants to wait a few years to get everything in order before having kids. I am glad to have found a birth control that works great for me. Sadly everyone is different so don’t let others bad stories turn you away from it, different things work for different people. The only way to really know if this will work for you is to try it yourself. And to me the idea of 3-5 years of birth control with no effort is worth any rumored and rare side effects/ concerns.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Phew this IUD by far has been my worse form of contraceptive! I got it inserted July 31 if this year. The insertion was horrendous & unlike any pain I’ve ever felt. The first month on it I bled the entire month straight. Each period after that lasted for 2 plus weeks & I spotted in between periods. It made it nearly impossible for me to be intimate. And my sex drive was pretty much non existent. I get it removed in the next week & Im ready for this night mare to be over!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 26 and this is my first IUD with no children. I'd been on the pill for 10 years and wanted something with a lower hormone dose. I found reading these comments useful so thought it's worth writing one myself. I got it fitted 3 days ago and found it a little uncomfortable but totally bearable! About half an hour later I had really terrible cramps, the same type of cramps I used to get when having a very heavy painful period like I used to get before being on any birth control. But once I'd taken some painkillers it was fine. Had one or two very mild cramps since and a small amount of spotting. Now waiting to see if my period appears with stopping the pill the day the coil was fitted. I will update in a few months. But so far feeling fine and worth that little bit of discomfort.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my kyleena inserted 4 mo ago. First of all, I love it! I was on the patch for 4 years and also loved that and never had any pregnancy scares with it. But my doctor suggested switch to kyleena for the lower hormone and my increase in blood clot risk. Was told to take 3 ibuprofen 2 hours before appointment. I expected more pain for sure but it really wasn't that bad. It was so quick, just a sharp pain with some cramps. Unfortunately, I got sweaty and nauseous after it was finish but I am prone to nausea anyway. Had cramping for a couple days, kind of severe, but after a week it got better. Since then I have only had spotting and no other side effects I've noticed. I would totally recommend getting an IUD, I was afraid to get one for so long but I am so glad now that I did!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Hello everyone,Just wanted to leave a good review because prior to getting Mirena I nearly let all the bad scare me out of getting it! I got Mirena on Nov 27/18. I was on Day 3 of my period.  The insertion was quick but pretty uncomfortable

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had two mirenas over ten years. Age 23-33.  As far as effective birth control it was perfect. Never had one pregnancy scare. I already had two kids. I stopped having a period after the third month, had normal cramps the first year off and on. My husband said he noticed it at first, but after awhile he  got used to it. Those were my positives. The bad side was painful insertion the first time and some mild weight gain. The worst part was the acne!!!! It took me awhile to realize it was the birth control. I got cystic acne badly. It started after the first year. I tried everything and I do mean everything nothing helped. So when it was time to get a third IUD, I switched to Skyla. It has less hormones and my doctor said it might help. She was right it did. My acne cleared up in the first month. I still get an occasional zit but nothing life altering like with the mirena. Overall it's an effective birth control with one side effect I could not live with.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion at the time wasn’t too bad, later that same day I experienced a lot of pain - but only for that day. ( This is my first IUD and I’ve had no children.) I had a regular period for a month after, then for about 6 months I bleed more than normal for periods and they were closer together. Now, at a year I haven’t had a period since. I have no discomfort, my partner has never complained about feeling the IUD either. I would highly recommend, adjustment period did suck but that’s expected in any birth control. I will be planning on getting another one inserted after my 5 years is up!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got this IUD inserted about 2 months ago after being on Lolo (an oral birth control) for about 1.5 years. I stopped because I was gaining a lot of weight and my acne was worsening from the oral contraceptive. The insertion process was painful but bearable, really similar to a really intense menstrual cramp, however, I took two extra strong Advil’s beforehand. The first month I did experience spotting practically everyday. It was coupled with mild cramps and it was pretty annoying. The last month though the spotting stopped, my period was super light and I didn’t have any pain. I’m also not experiencing any symptoms of weight gain or acne at all. I feel so much better than I did before! I did have a very painful yeast infection and my doctor told me it’s probably a side effect from the IUD. That was a downside. However I’d recommend the IUD as it is a long term commitment and requires no upkeep -do your research beforehand though!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my IUD inserted in November 2017 and it was super painful for me (I was 23 w/ no children). I had terrible cramping for about 2 weeks afterwards and my cervix continued to be sensitive for about 3 months after insertion making me unable to have sex without severe discomfort. After this, I didn't have much issue for a few months and was happy with the IUD other than occasional cramping when I was supposed to have my usual period. I had minor spotting but never had an actual period after having my IUD inserted. About 4 months ago, I began having severe pain almost constantly on the left side of my body (lower back, pelvis, leg, ankle, etc.). When talking to my gyno about it, he sent me for internal and external ultrasounds which came out normal. My doctor put me on antibiotics and two anti-inflammatory medications for 3 weeks and hoped it would clear up. After that round of meds, my pain wasn't as constant and I was able to have sex with only minor discomfort. Now my chronic pain is back and in full force. Some days I can barely walk and I am essentially living in anticipation to take my next dose of pain relief because it barely works anymore. My gyno still doesn't have any idea what it could be except for my IUD not reacting well with my body (which he claims he's never heard of) so he suggested me having it removed. After further research, it seems that younger women without children are prone to pains such as this, which had never been mentioned to me. My doctor continues to tell me that my pain and experience is very rare and that he isn't sure why it's happening but with a little more research, I've heard about many people having an experience typical to this but being told it "wasn't the IUD". I'm hoping that once it's removed (my doctor has scheduled me to get it removed a month and a half from now, ugh) that this chronic pain will go away and I will be able to function normally again. I'll update this when I do!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’m 27, got Skyla February of 2017, so I’ve had Skyla in for over a year, the beginning 6 months were rough! Crazy insane cramps & bloating ! Now periods last 2 days or so & cramps aren’t so bad. BUT the side effects... So before Skyla I weighed 125lbs. Today I weighed in at 135lb. I've always worked out, no red meats & small portion sized food! Nothing has changed.... but some how I just keep putting on weight ! Oh I've also noticed my acne increased ! It’s taken much longer for the acne on my face to go away, it appears, then blemishes & I'm stuck with it for months. I got skyla because I just got married and was not ready for kids ! But this battle of weight and acne is really depressing I’m trying to make the decision of removing it ahead of time, needless to say this IUD does do its job but the side affects are starting to be more long term than anything. Super torn

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The worse side effect I have had from my Skyla is terrible acne. I am 28 years old with acne like teenager. I kept thinking it was stress causing my acne. I tried almost everything to get rid of my acne. I tried Proactiv, over the counter face washes, Spirinolactone, Curology, etc .  Nothing cured it. Then I thought it was my diet. I changed my diet. That didn’t work either. Finally 2 years after inserting my IUD I had a hormone test done and my progesterone levels were high.  The Dr told me they were high due to my IUD and the progesterone caused my acne. Another side effect are my mood swings. They are crazy!! Just like the acne, at the beginning I blamed stress or I was overwhelmed. But after realizing that in any  situation I get continuous mood swings and I’m not PMSing ,I knew it had to me my IUD.  After much consideration, my husband decided to get a vasectomy so that I could remove my IUD!!  The Skyla did it’s job,  I  didn’t get pregnant, but the acne alone was not worth it

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had Mirena for five years. I did not get pregnant while on it however I did experience many side effects. For the first year my period was normal and by year two my period became extremely light and lasted for only three days.By year three, my period completed stopped. I experienced a 70 lb weight gain, severe mood swings, insomnia. anxiety and also was diagnosed with severe depression. This lasted until I took the IUD out.  Immediately I experienced a 25 lb weight loss and thankfully am no longer suffering from depression, mood swings or depression. I am a south Asian woman in her late twenties.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The first day of the insertion, was very painful, when it was It was inserted I had a very sharp pain, but no different from any other bad mensural cramp. I spotted on and off for about 2 months.  I had some really bad cramps on and off also, but after the 2 months those are done and I couldn’t be anymore happy I got the skyla. It hormone  are low so my mood is amazing and my acne is completely gone. My face cleaned up amazingly. I have no acne.. my mood before on birth control was so up and down I thought I had bipolar but the skyla seems to have cleared that up, also I have no period and no cramps it’s the best decision I ever made I’m completely happy.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Skyla was my 1st ever birth control used I have had it for close to 2 years now. I have had many side effects. Random cramps, long cycles, short cycles, a cycle every 2 weeks, normal monthly cycles. I literally never know what is going to happen down there as far as aunt flow.However, I have no desire to take this out. The whole point of Sklya for me was to not get pregnant and as of today I am still not pregnant. I was aware of the changes and the side effects prior to the insertion so I had mentally prepared myself for it.If u want a birth control where u can set it and forget it and have no side effects good luck. But hey if u do find it please let me know.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got pregnant 2 years into having this "3 year birth control". The IUD was perfectly in place when the surprised  doctor examined me (as she assumed it had fallen out) and I had to sign a form, basically saying I understood the high risk of a miscarriage and that the doctor would not be at fault if I miscarried after the IUD was removed. I had to have a sonogram very soon after to check for signs of ectopic pregnancy and my high deductable insurance wouldn't cover a penny of the necessary appointment. I miscarried  less than a week after having the "perfectly placed" IUD removed. I do not recommend this birth control. And I really don't think it is only 1% of woman who take this get pregnant. I'm on the pill now and appreciate the lack of risk to my body and my future babies if I were to get pregnant. I am still paying off the medical debt from this miscarriage and it was 8 months ago.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Insertion of the IUD was the worst pain I’ve ever felt! I am shocked by how many women have said it wasn’t that bad....but maybe it’s because I have never had kids. The doctor says you will feel two pinches the first one will be a little pinch followed by a bigger pinch, then it’s over. The first pinch hurt but wasn’t terrible. Then came the bigger pinch and I pulled up on the table cringing from the pain. It’s like when you get a piercing and they say take a deep breath and as they push you feel the needle punch through the skin except in your ovaries. I almost passed out and an had really bad cramps after. My period never returned, I had frequent yeast infections, my breast were extremely sore and had terrible acne. My doctor prescribed me Spironolactone which didn’t work for me  :/ IUD removal was a breeze felt a little more uncomfortable then removing a tampon. I’m going to try the mini pill next.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 23 - no kids. Kyleena is my first ever IUD birth control. The first day of the insertion, it was very painful for me. I had bad cramps & felt very bloated. I still went into work later because it was managable. The next day I felt way better. I'm not bleeding anymore but I do get a little bit of brown discharge. I'm on day 5. I feel good, I don't even remember that I have the IUD. No cramps since the first day I got it inserted. So far liking it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hey guys. So I’ve had the Kyleena since April of 2018. The only problems I’ve seemed to have since then is cramping about once a month and during vigorous exercise. I’ve spotted maybe once or twice, but other than that, my periods have completely stopped. This device is EVERYTHING! I love it, so much better than Depo!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I started with Skyla. The process is kind of painful. Skyla lasts 3 years and I had no problems with it. A month before the removal date it moved by itself. I didn’t notice. I asked my doctor for my check up if it was ok. Ultra sound showed the IUD was no longer as effective. She recommended Kyleena saying it was the same just with higher levels of hormones and a longer life. The insertion was worse than usual since I was not on my period at the time and had Skyla removed and then had kyleena inserted. It’s a lot of pressure and a big pinch. After kyleena was inserted I got a week-long period. With both IUDs my periods were heavy flows with normal cramping. Some weird side effects of kyleena was the cystic acne. I have never had this before. I have not had major cramping and I have had semi-normal periods. If I were to recommend one I would say Skyla because there’s more info on it and it has less hormones aka less side effects.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):update- 18 w no kids, iud inserted 10/8/18Had my followup appt. 11/5, everything went great and looked great. I'm still bleeding. I'm on week 7. Nothing to complain about really except for the constant bleeding (that seems to be slowing down at the moment!) I've had a few random days of bad cramps but not consistent and not for awhile now.  I will update again after 3 months <3

3RD UPDATE -I have had Kyleena for almost 4 years now. I posted previously but for me insertion and cramping 2–3 days post were nearly unbearable but everyone is different.Since then -pros: No period ever since insertion. I forget what it’s even like to bleed which is awesome. Haven’t bought a box of tampons in years. Never had any issues with expulsion, weight gain etc. Cons: Cramping around certain time periods can get intense to where I feel ill. Cystic acne on back hasn’t gone away since getting it around insertion.I will 100% be getting it replaced in a year because of the effectiveness. I am nervous about removal and reinsertion but it is worth it. I recommend trying Kyleena.

I got my IUD in September & now it's almost December. The main purpose was to help with my cramping & to have a consistent birth control. Thus far, nothing helps with cramping & honestly these cramps are making me cry, vomit, & can wake me up out of a dead sleep. I'm miserable & almost always in pain / cramping. I still get periods that are pretty heavy (going through a box of super+ tampons in less than 3 days...)  I'm scared that I'm going to pass out behind the wheel or at work because of the blood loss & the light headedness.

I was super nervous for my Kyleena IUD because of some scary reviews I saw.  When talking to people in person, I had heard that the insertion was painful like brutal cramps.  Others said it was a piece of cake other than a little bit of cramps.  I was told to come in when I was on my period.  I would definitely recommend this because it makes everything lubricated and softer when the doctor put the IUD in.  When I got it, I barely felt anything  until she started to put the IUD in. Before that she checks the size and shape of your uterus and numbs it.  The insertion was painful, but not intolerable.  Once she was done, I had a slight crampy feeling but nothing like what the scary reviews said.  I’ve had my IUD for three days now and I don’t notice it at all.  Definitely happy I got it.  Don’t let the reviews scare you — trust your body! If you think it’s something your body can handle, then it’s worth a try!

Hi. So I got Kyleena on Tuesday (4 days ago). I have never used hormones before. Only condoms and creams. I am 26. It hurt like anything for few moments and I have bleedings every day. One night I have really bad cramps. And also I am crying everyday. I have no idea how it will be after some time but I am really scared. I am hoping for the best because it is expensive and if this is not it last step is sterilization. But I am really scared of side effects I read here. And also I hope it will adjust soon because bleeding for 3 or 6 months would be unbearable for me :/ Wish me luck. I will write here again after few months :)

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had Liletta for Past 1 year and 7 months and nothing seems normal anymore. I have gained 30lbs despite eating clean and working out, absolutely no sex drive at all, sex is very uncomfortable and the bleeding after sex is very scary. I get my periods anytime sometimes twice a month, it’s very heavy and lasts anywhere from 6-12 days. I have become a different person always very moody, angry, very depressed and just don’t want to leave my bed- I’ve never felt this way in my 40 years! I’ve discussed this with my gynecologist, ultrasound shows the IUD is displaced and needs to be pulled out ASAP! My fibroids have increased in growth and size and MD is quite concerned. I will have it pulled out on Monday 11/19, Am hoping things will get better after this..

Mirena (levonorgestrel):29 yo female, no kids. I have been on progestin only pills for the past several years. I had Mirena inserted a week ago and I am very happy with it so far. I didn’t have a ton of pain with insertion but I took 3 ibuprofen before the procedure, I also had stopped my period about 5 days before. The cervical clamp was less uncomfortable than a Pap, and the only pain I felt was when my uterus was measured and when the Mirena was inserted. Both times felt like a strong period cramp, a little sharper but it was over in 10 seconds. After that it just felt like normal cramps that came and went. I had my husband drive me and I was glad I did because I almost passed out during the drive! Not because of pain, I have a history of vasovagal syncope after invasive procedures. A heating pad and ibuprofen were essential over the next few days but I was ready to go back to work after the weekend. It’s been a week and I feel totally normal, so far so good!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I used to be on birth control pills for over 5 years. I tried different brands and types but always seemed to experience negative side effects such as weight gain, mood swings, dry eyes, aggression and worst of all Migraines. When I started experiencing severe migraines on Yasmin I was urged to try Zoely - after a month my migraines went from being a monthly thing to becoming a daily problem. They were so severe that I had to stop working and wasn't allowed to drive anymore. My doctor then suggested Kyleena. I had my kyleena placed while on my next period - insertion was really painful but it only lasted a minute or so - the first day after insertion I experienced some cramping but haven't had any side effects ever since. Choosing kyleena is by far one of the best decisions I've ever made. I haven't been on it for long now, but I'm absolutely loving it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted 2 days ago. I’ve never had kids or anything so I was terrified, I was literally shaking in the chair. Honestly if you’re worried don’t be! It was a little uncomfortable and a pinch or two but nothing bad! I haven’t had any side effects so far! I also went through the Arch program and got it completely free!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 18 with no kids, and was on depo for 3 years until 9/10/18, and I just got my kyleena inserted yesterday (11/13/18)! The insertion process was horrible. The instruments used to measure the cervix caused a very painful, sharp cramp, and the doctor assured me that would be the worst of it. When the IUD was inserted the pain was the same. Immediately after it was placed I got sweaty, hot, nauseous, and dizzy, and almost passed out. I couldn't drive home and I certainly couldn't go to work (I called off). After that the cramps I had were so painful and intense I couldn't move. I threw up once from the pain. I took Tylenol and ibuprofen and the pain only SLIGHTLY subsided. I tried my best to fall asleep and hope it would go away. I only woke up once throughout the night with pain. In the morning, about 16 hours after insertion, I feel fine. Absolutely no pain or cramps. I'm hoping that was just the first day effects. As of now, I am very hopeful this will work well for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted may 2017. The actual insertion was overall easy, mild cramping but nothing out of this world. The first 6 months were rough. My period cramps were awful, the kind where your have to pause when the wave hits, the kind where 3 aleve do nothing. Over time they went away and now my periods are light and manageable.  I have noticed a decrease in sex drive which is problematic to say the least.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I been on Kyleena for a year & 4 months. Insertion was painless maybe because I took 4 ibuprofen prior to going as directed. I also took 2 more when I left because I was not trying to feel any cramps. After having kyleena inserted my monthly cramps started to feel like I would die at any moment. My flow became heavy & after 7 months I was still spotting everyday. My doctor said it would take 6 months for your body to adjust & mine is just taking longer. Now every time I have sexual intercourse I bleed, doesn’t matter rather its rough or gentle. I talked to my doctor about it she said it’s the penis size, which couldn’t be true because my boyfriend & I didn’t have this problem before kyleena & I've been with the same person this whole time. I’ve come to the conclusion that I should get it removed. I still give kyleena a high ranking but it’s time I moved on from it . It’s dreadful knowing I’m gonna bleed every time we make love . I hope after my removal the bleeding during sex will end.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my Kyleena since January 2018 and I’ve loved it. The insertion was a small pinch of pressure, nothing worse than a minor cramp and just slightly uncomfortable. Cramping afterwards was pretty intense but nothing too bad. Now my periods are almost nonexistent and I can wear light tampons or even just a panty liner that’s how light they are. The only thing I will say, in July 2018 I ended up getting pregnant, but it wasn’t a viable pregnancy. My doctor called it a chemical pregnancy which means your body never ends up creating a Sac for the baby to grow, then the fetus or the lack thereof is absorbed into the body to rid itself of the pregnancy. My doctor told me I was the only patient he had in 10 years of placing thousands of IUDs that ever got pregnant. I had been ovulating the day I got pregnant. I ended up keeping the IUD in and have had no issues since. I’d do it again

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion was not as painful as reviews led me to anticipate and it only hurt for like 2 minutes. After a couple of weeks I started getting bad cystic acne but that cleared up after about 4 months—I just had to get a little bit more diligent about washing makeup off at night.  During month 2 to 3 I also experienced noticeable hair loss. Now, I’m in month 6, and I’m really happy I stuck it out during the first few months. Hair grew back, no acne, light periods every couple of months, no change in sex drive.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena back in June. I had not been on the pill for 6 months prior due to the weight gain I was experiencing. I usually get pretty heavy periods and some mild cramping. After insertion I was in so much pain my whole body ached and I couldn’t walk or let alone drive. After an hour I was perfectly fine. A couple weeks later I got terrible cramps again and a pretty heavy period for 8 days. I figured it’s just because my body is getting use to all the hormonal stuff going on. Then a month later from insertion after leg day with my trainer I had intense cramps so bad that I was curled in a ball and so nauseated that I was sure I was going to throw up. Turns out I had an ovarian cyst form and burst. I have continued to have ovarian cyst on my both sides. It has now been month 4 and everything has calmed down. No more pain. I’ll cramp a little bit but then I’ll start my period and it goes away. Not sure if I’ll continue with the IUD once my kyleena is up.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):For anyone scared for the insertion: I'm 18, no kids, and I got it inserted,  hurt pretty bad, but for 5 years of birth control, it's worth it. Some cramps and pinching the next day and very mild cramps the next.  I had the nexplanon implant and it made me gain 30 lbs and made me emotionally unstable basically,  so I decided the lowest hormone IUD which is locally absorb should be fine. Good luck!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had my kyleena for a little over 8 months and overall have had a positive experience. I was on birth control pills for approximately ten years before switching to kyleena. The insertion was painful, but only for a few seconds, and I haven't had to worry about it since then. My periods are much lighter and less painful, yet more irregular than on the pill. However, I have noticed that my acne has gotten much worse and I've gained a lot of weight (~35lbs) since the insertion without any dietary changes.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After the insertion I began to cramp really bad and I put a heating pad on and was in bed all day. I had to call into work. Two weeks later I made appointment to get it out my anxiety and depression was crazy high.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had this for over two months now and I've had about a regular tampons worth of bleeding every day. For 2 months. I'm pretty annoyed as I switched from the copper IUD to the Kyleena precisely to not have my period. Will give it one more month and then may remove. Anyone else have similar experience and can make me feel better?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted on 10/10/18. Insertion was extremely painful for the first day and week following. I experienced spotting for about 6 days after it was inserted and then it stopped. I began to experience very incredibly sharp cramps about 2 weeks after it was put in and throughout the rest of the month I had it. I decided to get it removed because I don’t feel that it was normal to experience that amount of pain and was not willing to wait 3-6 months for symptoms to subside. Other than the pain, I felt that my mood stabilized, my skin was clear and I lost a little bit of weight. I am happy to have it out, but wish it would have been a better experience for me so I could have kept it for longer.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I chose Skyla because of great reviews from friends and to have one less thing to remember each day. Birth control. The day of insertion, I thankfully worked from home. At the appointment, I didn’t expect the pain that I was about to experience. It was HORRIBLE. After, I was hoping to have little to no period. Wrong. I get a very heavy period every month. What’s worse, the pain I experience every single week of the month from excruciating cramps. It’s shooting pain through my abdomen and back. I was hoping it would get better but this was not a good experience for me. Definitely going back to the pill.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I found that the mirena was not a good drug for me to use. I only had it in for about 5 months before I had it taken out. I suffer for chronic migraines but the migraines I got while on it were the worst I ever had in my whole life. I could not function I was in so much pain. With in 4 days of it being removed all my symptoms were gone and have not returned. I do not recommend it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had mirena for 1 year. After having the device put in I had mild cramping etc. side effects that came after were terrible, I had extremely bad mood swings, depressed and my hair became brittle and falling out! I have always been a good weight but in a year gained. I was 120lb and by the end 140lb ... I couldn’t get the weight off. I also had terrible pain in my uterus, fever and chills and very tired. I then got it removed and feel way better!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my Skyla in almost 2 and a half years ago. I got it when I was 17 and I remember I was so nervous to get it inserted because I had read such horrifying reviews but I took 3 advil before my appointment and it wasn’t that bad. The doctor talked me through and it and the insertion process only lasted 2-3 minutes. I remember the last part of it was a sharp pinch and immediately after I was very crampy. I had bad cramps for about 2 days after but I was still very much able to do daily things. I spotted just a little big for 2 weeks following and at the same time I stopped spotting I began to get really bad cramps again. I thought that maybe the IUD had been moved or something but it just turned out that I was getting my first period with the IUD. My periods were a lot more painful and heavy. After 2 months I completely stopped getting my period which is great! Being able to not have to take a pill or use a condom with my boyfriend is amazing!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my kyleena about a year ago now and it has never stopped giving me sharp pains on my periods. I got kyleena because I wanted a birth control I wouldn’t get my periods on without taking a pill, my periods were very painful. My cramps now are even more painful. Instead of just a dull ache they are incredibly sharp and consistent, sometimes hurting so bad I get sick or can’t speak through them. I have gone into my GYN multiple times since it’s insertion and I’m told that they’re just cramps and they’ll pass. No one has taken me seriously or wants to take it out so I am stuck being in pain every day for a solid week. Would not recommend to an enemy, or friend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kyleena inserted in March of 2017. The process was not as bad as I thought. However, it did take longer due to my cervix having a curve. I was ecstatic to know that I didn’t have to remind myself to take a pill or get a shot. As time progressed my periods were heavier than normal, but I eventually got used to the. Fast forward to August of 2018 through October 2018. My period cramps grew worse. I’d wake up in the middle of the night in pain. To my surprise... 10/23/2018 my IUD expelled its self. Completely shocked. I’ve now been bleeding since. Needless to say I won’t choose the IUD again.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had my mirena inserted in 2008. The first couple months I had bad cramping . The cramping and bleeding subsided after a few months. I had my IUD in for a total of 9yrs before having it removed in 2017( yes the same one) I had no period the majority of time while it was inserted.I  have been trying to conceive for a year with no success. My period came back 2 weeks after having my IUD removed. I have a regular cycle every month about 26/27 days long. Fertility may come back for some right away but not all. If you are planning on trying for a baby in the near future please consider how long you had your IUD inserted and your age. I'm in my late 30’s so this can be playing a role in my fertility. I wish I would of had it removed at least 3 yrs ago , my chances of pregnancy would be greater. I have always suffered from acne so I don’t really know how much of a role mirena played in my break outs. Now that I had it removed my face is 90% clearer.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’m hoping my experience can help others. I’ve had the Skyla since February 2016 so almost two years. I had never been on birth control before (I’m 32) and had always just used condoms but decided to try an IUD. Insertion was nothing, just had some moderate cramps the day of, not unlike a bad menstrual cramp. I had some more moderate cramping and spotting for about two months then everything was awesome! No period, very mild weight gain, no mood swings and no pregnancy! About 5 months ago though, I started having pretty severe pelvic pain. I finally saw a doc last month who prescribed antibiotics for PID but that didn’t help. I got an ultrasound and turns out I have two uterine fibroids and one ovarian cyst, all benign. Doc doesn’t think they are the cause of my pain though and is advising taking out the IUD. For me, Skyla was worth the negatives and It’s not going to be easy to re-adapt to another kind of birth control.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have been using the mirena as contraception since 2003.  I am about to have my fourth one.  It is the best thing I have ever done.  I fell pregnant three times on contraceptive pill (tried many different ones).  I have not had a period since the first insertion and my hormones are well under control.  The only issue I have is weight gain.  I did put on about 15 kg but am slowly loosing it with exercise and diet control, however, I was overweight when I started using the mirena.  I think it is something definitely worth considering, especially if you have completed your family.  I think it is something that you have to try in order to make an informed decision about it.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my first skyla inserted October 2015 insertion is very uncomfortable you feel a cramp across your cervix. Made my period cramps worse the first couple of months but it now a lot better. Just had it removed October 2018 and had new one inserted at the same time.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had kyleena for about 3 months now. I’m 24 with no kids and was on the depo shot for 5 years before switching over. I was off the shot for about 6 months before I got kyleena. The insertion was uncomfortable, but I took 2 Advil and prepared myself for the worst after reading some horror stories online. I worked myself up over nothing. It was a pinch and a lot of pressure but nothing I couldn’t handle. I was pretty uncomfortable and crampy the remainder of that day and was glad I took the day off cause I just wanted to sit around and watch tv.  Aside from light spotting on and off and some cramps every so often, I don’t feel any different. No acne, no weight gain, no mood swings. My partner can’t feel it during sex and I check once a week to make sure I can still feel it and that’s it! Simplest birth control ever and doesn’t have the long term side effects like the depo. Best decision I ever made.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):So I just had my liletta removed after a year and half of having it. I had it put in after my 3rd baby as I didn't want to take a pill anymore. So insertion was pain free. I got cramps like labor. I was also breastfeeding which the IUD affecting my supply. Dr says no but I know my body. I became really depressed, angry, moody, gained weight, migraines, vision not clear, suicidal, etc. My family begged me. We all agreed I changed. Removal was pain free. It has only been 3 days since I got it removed. The bad part they don't tell you after getting it removed is that your period is like a hurricane so be prepared  get heavy pads like overnights. Worse then after I had my baby. Things I liked were no pill everyday, no periods, and no worries. I well not recommend liletta or nexplanon (in the arm implant) to anyone. Currently my older daughter is going in the same direction with the nexplanon as I did with liletta. NEVER AGAIN!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 18 never had any kids and got kyleena put in 10/8/18. The insertion was uncomfortable mostly. I was on my period during it. I took 2 aleve before. wish I hadn't been so freaked out about everything I'd read online. It is just a few sharp pains and the entire thing was over in like 3 min. Not bad at all. Just sat up and went home! I had cramps in the middle of the night that night but none really after that. I'm on 2 antidepressants so I was sure to ask my doctor about the hormones and she said it should not interfere. Sex was normal my boyfriend and I didn't even notice it! the only annoying thing for me so far is the constant bleeding. I will check back after my ultrasound 11/5 <3

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my IUD in for about 4 months now and most day I completely forget about it. I had extremely mild periods before the getting the IUD and my periods have completely stopped but instead of a period I have 3-5 days of the worst cramps imaginable. I would compare them to contractions. My IUD is in the correct spot and nothing is technically amiss. But the cramps are the worse I’ve ever had in my life. Once they start I have to come home from work and take the strongest muscle relaxers I can find just so I don’t scream from the pain.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my IUD inserted on 10/23/18! I was previously on depo for 3 years and started to experience bad side effects the longer I was on it. Also, my doctor told me the depo was too strong for how petite I was and didn't want me to run the risk of a bone density deficit. I was extremely nervous before my appointment because I had read so many mixed reviews of other woman's experience. The insertion was PAINFUL. Being on depo, I haven't had a period nor remember what cramps felt like for 3 years. It felt like an intense cramp that radiates throughout your whole body but only last for a few seconds. The measuring/dilating of my cervix hurt more that the actually insertion of the IUD. Since then, I haven't had any cramps or spotting! I even had an intense leg workout the day after and felt amazing. Overall, I feel great and have high hopes for Kyleena! Will update in a few months!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my first Skyla (my first ever BC) a little over 3 years ago. Took some Advil before insertion to help with pain, and yes it was painful but nothing like the dehabilitating cramps I’d get with my heavy periods every month. I spotted every day for the first 30 days. My periods got lighter right away and the pain was minimal. Even though they were still consistent (I’ve always been consistent), my periods now lasted 3-5 days longer! That was weird. That lasted throughout my entire 3 years. I got my new one inserted this past summer and now my periods are even lighter and shorter. Must just take me a looooong time to adjust. I haven’t noticed any weight gain or mood swings directly related to Skyla; it actually helped clear up my acne on my chest and shoulders (but that has since had a resurgence for some unknown reason). It used to be way worse without Skyla. Overall I highly recommend it, but of course talk to your doctor and decide what’s best for you.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I just had the IUD inserted a few days ago.. and the pain during insertion was WAY more than I had anticipated. It was much more severe than some mild cramping like I had read online. I almost fainted 3 times during my visit and I have a high pain tolerance. But I have never given birth which could be a reason it was so painful for me. But be prepared and definitely ask for a prescribed pain killer that you can take before hand. If I could do it all over again I would have.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got skyla implanted in May of 2018 and so far it’s been great! I was expecting horrible pain with insertion but it was nothing like people make it out to be. While the insertion was uncomfortable and I cramped for the rest of the day, by the next day I felt normal. I thought the cramps the day I had it inserted were terrible, but I had never had period cramps before that point, and a friend of mine said to her it just felt like normal period cramps. I have been spotting since I got it, so I can’t tell if it’s improved my periods or not yet. A few of my partners have said they can feel the strings slightly, but nothing that bothers them. Overall I would recommend it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kylena on 23rd April 2018, so almost exactly 6 months ago.The Pill for me: depression, weight gain, migraines made worse, low sex drive, emotional, paranoid, anxious The Kylena first 5 months all becoming less frequent with time: cramps, headaches, emotional, bad skin for about 2 weeks.Now: occasional cramping, possibly period related. Period is just very light spotting now.Mood, weight and sex drive have been unaffected. The Kylena IUD is quite an investment but so far it's been worth it. I had a few months of mild discomfort and now don't have to worry about contraception for 4 and a half more years! I'd recommend anyone who has it to wait 6 or 7 months for symptoms to calm down

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve been on the Skyla for about a year now. Getting it in is a painful experience. After being on it for a few months I noticed a significant change in my weight and my pants weren’t fitting at all. Fast forward to a year of having it in I’ve gained over 20 pounds and the acne is just horrible. I wish I never went on it. I’m 20yo btw.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have been on the birth control pill for 5 years but wanted something more effective due to me forgetting it sometimes. I had Kyleena inserted at the end of August 2018. The doctor prescribed me a cervix opening medication, along with taking a small dose of Advil. The insertion was painful, but not as painful as I had first imagined. I could compare the pain to a very, very sharp cramp. The following 30 minutes after was horrible! I felt very hot, dizzy, nauseous, and terrible cramps. However, after the 30 minutes my symptoms disappeared. The symptoms I have experienced are: bleeding, weird cramps, ACNE, and oily skin. Acne has been on & off in terms of severity; however, I have dealt with cystic acne my whole life. So far I definitely recommend it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had my IUD inserted a few hours ago and I wanted to share my experience because I know there a lot of mixed reviews about getting it inserted and the pain level which scares off a lot of people. My experience wasn't bad at all! I'm 21 no kids. It was uncomfortable but nothing you can't handle ! Was so quick even if it hurts it really is only for a few seconds then your cleaned up and out. I have cramps now, nothing different from normal period cramps take Advil  and use a heating pad. We'll see how it reacts with my body I've seen mixed reviews about weight gain weight loss, acne, no acne. It's hard to know until I experience it and I really think you just have to try it if you're seriously interested because everyones different, you can't base your choice on a side effect review by someone else! But as for getting the procedure done - easy as pie and done in a blink of an eye.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was pretty nervous to get this procedure done because I knew from reading everyone's experiences it was going to be very uncomfortable. I'm 25yrs old and have never had a baby. The procedure was NOT as painful as you'd think. Really. Of course, pain is subjective because everyone has their own pain tolerance threshold, but I must say, there is no crazy-sharp-stabbing-pain-bloody-murder going on here. There IS an uncomfortable cramping that occurs during the insertion and, yes, it made my toes curl a bit, but it didn't last long, and it was definitely bearable. The pain can easily be compared to a bad period cramp. For some woman who have been on the Pill for a long time and therefore haven't experienced bad cramping in a long time, the pain from the insertion might come off as more shocking simply because they are not used to that level of cramping. That's just me trying to justify why some woman are saying they threw up and passed out from the pain..... really, it's not that bad!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena May 1, 2017.  I felt pressure during insertion, but no pain. In the first couple of months, I had a lot of spotting, which was unusual for me. Eventually I stopped getting periods.  However, I gained 30lbs in the 10 months I had it. That was my reason for getting it removed. My weight was stable before, and stable after. My biggest complaint now is that I've only had 1 period since it was removed 7 months ago.
