I have a pretty high tolerance to pain AND I was prescribed something to soften my cervix, but it still hurt like anything! The pain lasted until 5 seconds after it was inserted and I was fine. Minor cramping and spotting. I have been spotting off and on since but I expected that. Sometimes I get contraction like cramps but nothing a little Ibuprofen can't fix. So far I like it a lot. I forget I have it most of the time. My bf felt it the first time we were intimate after insertion but hasn't since. Overall I think Skyla is and will be a good fit for me! We will see in the next few months!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the kyleena fitted just under a week ago and was very scared about the insertion. Took ibuprofen and paracetamol beforehand.  It was pain free and I am a big wimp. I was expecting lots of pain and the doctor said why are you worrying it was done about 30 seconds ago! A few cramps afterwards but that’s all. Have had slight spotting and a few little pains but nothing to shout about. Hopefully my experience stays positive!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 19 and I just got the Kyleena inserted two days ago. The build up to the insertion was very nerve wrecking. I was told my cramps would inhibit me from working a night shift on my feet and things like that. Now about the actual insertion... it was painful but deep breaths and relaxing your uterus really helped. It was over before you know it and I had minor to not painful period type cramps after. Two days after insertion and I have no cramps at all. Hopefully there will be no bad side effects. I really recommend the Kyleena for girls my age and I will update on how I'm feeling in 6 weeks. I'm currently on the pill until then to ensure that I do not fall pregnant. But do your research before making any decision. I spent 2 months researching the coil before I decided to get it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted 3 days ago.  I have a high pain tolerance, but having it inserted was one of the worst pains I’ve felt.  I had cramps for the whole day after that about dropped me to my knees.  Made me lightheaded and sweat all day long.  The next day I had little to no cramps and was feeling fine.  Now that I’m on the 3rd day I don’t have any cramps what so ever.  The only thing I feel is a slight pressure from where it is and I’m experiencing a little more discharge than normal.  So far so good and hoping this works out!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):It’s been almost a month since insertion— super uncomfortable feeling, but took no more than 5 mins to do. First week and a half I had no spotting or bleeding, but now I’m wearing a pad or sometimes a light tampon as my doctor predicted I would. Cramps were never an issue as I took pain meds the first 48 hours after the procedure. No side effects, wondering how it’ll affect my attempts at weight loss.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I don't recommend Kyleena to anyone .  Every since I got it , it's been non stop pain. The bleeding stopped which is good but the pain is so unbearable . I've had it since October of 2017 and I've had nothing but bad experiences and now I've decided I want to get it removed . DON'T GET THIS STUFF ITS BAD FOR YOUR BODY!!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've gotten this bc after I gave birth to my 2nd child. The procedure was painful yet bearable  to a certain extent depending how you can tolerate pain. The first couple of months was great and I was happy with it. Very effective until my almost 3 month mark of having the blasted thing. My whole persona changed.  It started to affect my sex life negatively, my emotions and don't get me started on the 50 lbs weight gain that is still hard to shed after having it removed due to it triggering my migraines for some odd reasons. After having it removed I got my period the following week and strangely another one the week after but shorter. This is my second month since having the IUD removed and nearly 2 weeks late on my period. All of my HPT (home preg test) came a negative but there were still no signs of my period showing up. I assumed it could be my body still adjusting to not having the IUD and taking it precious time returning to normal.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had been using an oral birth control for about 9 years and decided to switch to skyla because I had been forgetting to take the pill. A couple weeks in I started experiencing significant hair thinning and hormonal breakouts on my otherwise clear skin. Needless to say, the experience has been pretty awful so I scheduled an appointment to get it removed next week.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for 1 month now. I decided to go with an IUD due to severe migraines with auras and the risk of stroke associated with the pill. Insertion was painful for about 10 seconds (felt like a strong period cramp) then went away immediately. After about 3 hours I had severe cramping to the point I was almost in tears.  A heating pad did help diminish the pain as well as Advil. Over the next week or so I had severe cramping randomly and light spotting. By week 2, I had a pretty bad acne breakout on my back, shoulders, and chest. I also got my period during week 2, which was much heavier than my average period, again with severe cramping and lasted about 10 days (Advil has been a life-saver). I'm now into my 4th week and have had consistent spotting and another heavier period. All in all, it has definitely been an adjustment but it hasn't been too bad overall. I would definitely recommend having tampons/ pads with you at all times, since you never know when you might spot.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for about 3 years prior to getting Kyleena in January. Before having birth control I was pretty petite and I didn't gain much weight with Skyla but I have gained a considerable amount of weight with Kyleena. I had it inserted in January and it just seems like I gain weight quicker and its more difficult to lose it, even while eating healthy. I plan to get it removed and see if thats the reason behind the weight gain.Also, my period used to be irregular. After Kyleena, I've been getting it on a regular basis but I've been having terrible cramps and my period is light but lasts about 7-9 days... its dreadful compared to my previous 5 days.Besides that, it's been pleasant. Everything else is pretty normal and I'm not pregnant so thats a plus lol

Mirena (levonorgestrel):21y old. 5'11". 160lbs I got Mirena to start a job in a pharmacy. I didn't feel like asking my coworkers for my sprintec monthly.Remembering back, insertion was a very deep pain felt intensely for 4 seconds, light headedness for 15-20 minutes, and BAD cramping for 2 hours. Periods: STOPPED as soon as inserted.Weight : I LOST 25 lbs in the few months after. That could have also been due to my new job. My job included standing and no time for eating.My mood: Haven't had swings like I would with sprintec and when I was getting periods.So how about 11 months in now?I have ACNE again. Like 5-8 pimples at a time. That has started in last 2 months.So that is my 11 month update. Worse complexion is my biggest complaint. Having my one year check up in 2 weeks. Think I'll get a Rx to fight acne.I have had a different experience than most of the women on here so that's why I felt like sharing.Finding the right BC is HARD, but I think you can do it. I did.Good luck sister.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have mixed feelings about Kyleena. I'm 20 years old, never had kids, and for several years I was on the pill (Orthotricyclin Lo). It messed with my head, and I had migraines with aura, so my doctor recommended I try an IUD instead. I went with Kyleena because it's lower in hormones, but I was worried about bad periods with the copper IUD (oh, the irony! -- read ahead). I've had it in since late May 2018. The insertion was the most painful thing I've ever felt. I was in a lot of pain for 3 or 4 hours, and was lightly sore for the rest of the weekend. I spotted for a month. I never had painful periods growing up, and on the pill they were never bad. My periods now are super painful and crampy for the first 2 or 3 days. What's nice is that I don't bleed much, I'm not pregnant, and my sex drive is fine. My mental health has improved a bit, too. My migraines did not go away. If the bad period cramps don't go away by the end of the semester, I'm going to go get it looked at.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena was my first form of hormonal birth control, I have had it for 3 months and am getting it removed tomorrow. I opted for Kyleena because it is low maintenance and contains the lowest amount of hormones. Insertion was extremely painful and I almost passed out afterwards, but I thought the pain was worth it at first. Later in the day after insertion, a wave of extreme depression came over me and lasted for weeks. This came with debilitating anxiety, panic attacks, and mood swings. Throughout the entire time of having this IUD I have become way more emotional and have been experiencing random hot flashes all the time. I went to the doctor and asked if she thinks all of this could be caused by the IUD and she said no and prescribed me antidepressants, which made me feel worse. I am starting to believe that the hormones in this IUD are playing a role in the extreme mood changes that I have been experiencing. I am getting it removed tomorrow and I hope that it is the answer.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had Mirena inserted a little over a year ago only as a birth control option. Before I got it I had never had a single cramp as a result of my period. I had never had any PMS symptoms at all up until I got the mirena. It was incredibly uncomfortable to get it inserted, and I bled for 3 months straight after with little to no breaks. After this ended, the following months were fine...however whenever my period came I would get excruciating cramps that lasted 1-2 days non stop. Not to mention my period occurs every 2 weeks now and lasts 2 weeks long as well, so I only have 2 weeks in between every period and it’s absolutely miserable for me. I have also almost completely lost my sex drive (keep in mind I am 20 years old). I have tried libido supplements for women of many brands but nothing seems to work. I cannot get turned on whatsoever and I really do believe it’s the mirena acting adversely with my body. I’m calling to get it taken out as soon as possible.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had my Kyleena for almost three months now and I cannot say enough good things about it. Insertion was uncomfortable, but unlike some of the reviews, it was more like an intense cramp rather than any horrific pain. It went away almost in about seven seconds. I’ll be honest, the cramps the day of were enough to make me sit down and I think I cried. After the second day, I only got an occasional bad cramp maybe once every three days for the next two weeks. I spotted for about two months and I’ve noticed it’s starting to reduce a bit. My periods are notably lighter, lasting maybe two days. The only drawback has been the brown discharge that happens every time I have sex. It’s not major but it’s embarrassing, but most times it’s too lightly colored and not very much there so my boyfriend doesn’t see. I no longer have severely long periods, I don’t have to remember to take a pill. Getting the Kyleena was probably one of the best decisions I’ve made in a while

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):32 years old and had it in for 1 year 3 mo.Pros:+ After the first 6 months, my periods stopped completelyCons: + Decreased sex drive+ Painful insertion-be prepared for intense pain if you have never given birth+ HUGE increase in painful cystic hormonal acneI would advise any women who already struggle with hormonal acne to stay FAR AWAY. I have had hormonal acne since age 25, but with the help of taking Spironolactone daily, it was under control and I always got compliments on my beautiful skin. After Kyleena was inserted, my acne gradually starting increasing again. After 1 year, I was having painful, deep, cystic acne around my mouth like I had never had in my lifetime. I started to get expensive facials to get this acne extracted, and purchased expensive beauty creams, but the acne would continue relentlessly coming back. After everything you go through to get Kyleena in place, the last think you want to do is get it removed, but in the end I had to.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the liletta for 9 months and have gained 50lbs. Other than weight gain I have had no issues. My husband however HATES the string it’s not a sting like the dr tells you. It is a WIRE. It gave me anxiety to even feel it when I checked it so I just leave it alone. I’m having it removed in a few days because I can NOT deal with this weight gain.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Had kyleena fitted 4 days ago at a sexual health clinic. I have had no children and was quite nervous about having it fitted as as read other reviews. The pain for me was intense when they measured and fitted the IUD, I really had to take some deep breaths. However the pain was for a short amount of time, probably only lasted 15 seconds. Afterwards I had faint period like cramps and then stronger cramps every so often (these left me keeled over each time, even after taking paracetamol and ibuprofen) the next day I just had odd pains here and there throughout the day and the day after I felt back to normal. I’ve had no bleeding at all so far. The short pain was definitely worth it for up to 5 years of contraception. Fingers crossed that I am getting on well with it still in a few months time

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena inserted over a month ago and the insertion was remotely painless- with a tiny bit of cramping for the first 5 minutes of having it in. I had read other reviews and I walked into the office expecting to pass out during insertion and I left the room laughing and feeling perfectly fine. Just take 600 mg ibuprofen and you'll be good to go.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):inserted May 4th 2018. Insertion itself wasn't bad but had some severe cramping for a few hours after (was sore for 3 days). If it continues to well I plan on to keep using until menopause but I'm going to give it a full year before making that call and I'm 35 yrs old now. I haven't seen any reviews that show a month by month account.  I will share and maybe that will help someone in adjusting of 3 to 6 months if they aren't one of the instant no period group.Pre-IUD - 6 to 8 o.n. pads for 4 to 5 days with no spotting in between1st cycle with 4 to 5 overnight pads for 4 days with 16 days of spotting. 2nd cycle 2 to3 overnight pads for 4 days with 14 days of spotting. 3rd cycle 1 overnight pad a day for 4 days  with 14 days of spotting .4th cycle 1 pad for 1 day with 12 days of spotting5th cycle on currently- pantyliners only 6 days of spotting so far.At this point the only thing is for duration to make this any easier. But so far I'm pleased especially since I don't have to remember anything

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Worst decision ever!!!!  I bleed pretty much every single day and have for over 6 months.  I've been back to the Dr twice and they've checked it out and sent me for an ultrasound and everything looked fine.  It's taken a huge mental toll on my life and has taken a toll on my relationship as well.  Clearly not having sex if you're bleeding all the time!  Beyond frustrating, I'm over it, it's coming out next week.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the Kyleena in for a month & it’s been the worse birth control I’ve ever tried. Since the day of insertion (which was the first day of my last period) I’ve had my period. My cycle just came on & it usually lasts 5 days & I usually only cramp on day 1 or 2.  I’m on day 5 and I have cramps & pain in my vagina. God knows how long this period will last. My plan was to leave it in for 6 months to a year but at this rate I doubt I’ll leave it in another month. Additionally, putting in the Kyleena was also one of the worst pains I’ve ever felt! It was horrible & I wouldn’t get it in ever again! Birth control pills were a pain but I’d rather go back to them than to put up with the Kyleena & it’s side affects.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena in July of this year 2018. My experience with it has been great. The insertion process to me wasn't painful at all. I experienced mild cramps afterwards but nothing unbearable, I even went back to work to finish my shift and felt fine. I haven't had any complications with the Mirena at all.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my Kyleena inserted yesterday, so this is a review about the insertion/the days following. I am 19 and have never had a baby. I read some of these reviews in the days leading up to my insertion, and I was so scared after reading them. My doctor gave me medicine the night before to soften my cervix, and I took Advil the morning before. The insertion was more of a cramping pain versus a stabbing pain. There are really 2 big cramps with the measuring of the uterus and then the insertion. It only lasts about 3 minutes in total, those 2 cramps lasting a few seconds each. I used a heat pack and stayed on top of taking Advil so that the cramps never got too bad. Some people cannot do anything for the rest of the day or the day after, but I felt completely fine and my cramps are basically nonexistent! Do not let these reviews scare you, everyone is different, and my doctor said that for all the bad reviews, there are double (if not more) positive reviews that people do not post about.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):In October of 2017 I gave birth to my youngest daughter and discussed birth control with my doctor . He suggested Liletta and told me it worked great and I wouldn't have any complications and my periods would either go away or be very light . In December of 2017 I got the Liletta and the process of inserting it was.....painful but bearable ! Over the next few months I had no periods (YAY!), I became very angry most days , my sex drive changed , I had a miscarriage , and I was very depressed everyday. My husband noticed these changes and asked why I was being that way and all I could think of was the birth control . After calling my doctor and begging him for about a month , I was finally told that he would take it out for me . The day I got it taken out , it was like a HUGE weight was lifted off my shoulders and I could smile again. Now I have cysts on my ovaries and other medical issues.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had a miscarriage in March 2018, and soon after I got the liletta and I have been extremely constipated and having to drink mirlax everyday. My emotions are all over the place, and all I do is eat and I'm so lazy now and always just feel heavy. I have cramps and back pains, my sex drive has completely went away and my boyfriend is not happy about that at all. I have a doctors appointment tomorrow to have this thing removed so I can get back to my regular life.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion was seriously the most painful experience I’ve ever had. Then terrible cramping for weeks. Had called my Dr- she thought i was fine. I ended up just making an appt. Long story short, she perforated my uterus when inserting. I ended up in urgent care after was told that I expelled it- nope! It was there.. next to my bowel. Ladies- listen to your body. If something seems wrong, get it checked out. And insist on an xray! They couldn't find mine on ultrasound. I'm awaiting an appointment for surgery to have it removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had myself so worked up over the pain that was supposed to be expected at insertion today I was in tears. Was it painful on the table, yes, but once you give your body a minute to adjust to what it just went through I was able to get up and walk out just fine. Cramps for about 2 hours after I left. Took 4 ibuprofen an hour before my appointment and am taking two every 6 hours so far today (just in case) bleeding is already almost done. Loving it so far during day one.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):First, I got this inserted 6 weeks AFTER I had my son so the insertion process was not hard or painful for me. I will not be able to share my experience on that because it was painless. After I got this IUD inserted, I gained almost all of the weight back that I was losing. My weight rose from 200lbs to 235 lbs... AWFUL. I have had depression and anxiety ever since this was inserted. I have felt like a psycho woman and my fiance has noticed it too. This has been the worst birth control ever and I would never recommend to anyone but everyone's body is different so, to each their own. The only good  thing that has come out of this birth control is not getting pregnant but honestly I would have rather gotten pregnant again then experience what I have with this BC. I got it removed about a week ago (also painless to get it removed)  because of this experience I have had with it and already feeling better. Giving it a 4 because it did actually prevent me from getting pregnant with unprotected sex.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After having paragard for 3 years I just got it removed due to consistent bleeding the past 6 months. My Dr recommended Kyleena to see if my periods would return to normal. Here I am 30 mins later and everything is perfectly fine. Don't stress yourself about the insertion.  It's not as horrible as you think. I will post again in a few months if I notice any side effects.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve been using the IUD for almost 9 months now  I’m 24 years old I got it inserted 01/2018. My c oworker has the Mirena and said the insertion was not bad at all, although I read up on it and people said it was very painful... I went in for my appointment expecting for the worse and it was the worse pain I felt , I ended up flinching and asking to stop but my doctor said almost done  and has soon as she was finished I immediately felt light headed and nauseated. I had a few tears lol I did cramp for a few days and spotted for a few weeks to a month. Fast forward to late August I’ve noticed when I’m ovulating I get sharp cramps to the point it literally feels like a contraction and I have to hold onto something/ hold my breath. My periods are regular and before I had it they were irregular and lasted 7 days moderate bleeding. Now I would say about 5 days maybe and light- moderate. I will say the IUD is convenient but I’m contemplating if the cramping is worth it...

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This review is based solely on the IUD insertion, as I just had it done a few hours ago. The night before I was prescribed to insert cytotec into my vagina to help soften my cervix for IUD insertion. Thirty minutes before the procedure I took 600mg of ibuprofen. The IUD insertion was not bad! It wasn’t comfortable, but it was a few waves of intense cramps that lasted 30 seconds and some pressure. From start to finish insertion took less than 10minutes. As I was driving home I had bad cramping but that only last for about an hour. I am feeling great now! No pain, no cramping.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for 3 years. It has been amazing. My periods stopped almost completely except for one or two days of spotting that occurred maybe two times a year. I recently had it replaced. Yes it hurts like the worst thing but if you have an experienced gyno, it should only take 5 mins or less. It’s very bad concentrated pain but that only lasts during insertion for me. I cramp for a day following and then it stops and no more periods or pregnancy. I highly recommend but all women react to it in different ways. My experience has been amazing though.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had Mirena inserted after birth it was a C Section so I went back to my Gyno one month after birth for the procedure to be honest it did not hurt and I did not even feel cramps.  But it’s been two months now and am bleeding nonstop which is of great concern to me because am anemic from birth and it is so hard having to take care of myself, my baby, the extended family work and school is a big challenge for me. Am thinking of calling my gynecologist tomorrow already so frustrated.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had Skyla for 18 months now. Getting Skyla inserted was very uncomfortable but the procedure lasted less than 10 minutes. Skyla was recommended because I have never been pregnant. I went back to work right after the appointment. I had moderate cramping for the first week which gradually lessened and went away. Initially my partner reported being able to feel the stings poking him but that also went away after about a month. My periods have stopped completely. In the past I have used the pills and Depo for several years and Skyla is the best birth control I have been on.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Don’t really know what to rate this, I came upon this website after I had my Kyleena inserted about 5 hours ago. Just wanted to let everyone know that my experience was the worst. It was super painful, I’m only 18 and never had a child. I fainted, had hot flashes, threw up, and almost pooped myself. After 45 minutes those symptoms went away and I haven’t had any cramping or bleeding, yet.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD 4 months ago and I have been spotting for 90% of the time since. It’s very frustrating and am trying to wait it out till the 6 month mark to see if it will level out, also because I’ve tried other hormonal birth control and it made me very irritable. The procedure itself was one of the most painful things I’ve experienced and I cramped occasionally for about a month after. My sister has one too and stopped bleeding very soon after so it depends on the person but I’m too scared to get it taken out because of how terrible it was to get in. Hopefully I can wait 2 more months and it will pay off.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skylar for 8 months. I have to say insertion was a little painful but not to bad. I got it on Jan 4 2018 and removed August 24 2018. Through out the whole 8 months I did not  get my period. I did get mild symptoms cramping, nausea and breast tenderness. However in 8 months I gained 50lbs. And I also notice my hair thinned. And I was retaining a lot of water.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena about an hour ago and it was honestly a breeze. After reading all the reviews I had myself worked into tears because of how scared I was. I was expecting excruciating pain and intense discomfort after. I took 2 extra strength Advil’s an hour before my appointment. I went in and the insertion wasn’t comfortable of course but it wasn’t unbearable. There was a pinch and some cramping but as soon as the clamp was out everything felt normal again. I’m now home and I still feel no pain. It was easy and now I don’t have to worry about birth control for 5 years! Would recommend so far!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had Liletta for a year. I had Mirena for the 5 years prior but switched jobs and my company would not pay for IUDs anymore. My doctor suggested Liletta ($700) bc the out of pocket cost was less than Mirena ($2,000). The insertion was the same- painful but bearable. I did not have any issues with Mirena and went on initially due to heavy bleeding and severe cramping. I stopped a period all together for about 4 years with Mirena. Since Liletta, I have had: 1. Break through spotting and severe cramping 2. Panic attacks each month while PMS'ing 3. Severe PMS mood swings: emotional outbursts to raging anger. I never had these symptoms with Mirena or previous BC. My gyno doesn't think they're related but my onco believes it's the hormones from Liletta. I 100% agree. I don't feel myself. My husband has seen a change in me over the year from personality to sex drive. It's coming out this week and I'm reporting the symptoms to the FDA

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my 1st Skyla in Mar ‘15. I was 22, no kids, and had used the contraceptive pill for years. I also tried Implanon but had it taken out after 3 months due to continual bleeding. Skyla insertion was very painful but my doctor was great and the whole procedure was under 5 minutes. I had cramping and spotting for a few days following. My periods stayed regular, but I did get worse cramps during my period. I kept my Skyla for 3 yrs, 6 months and I never lost my period that whole time. I use a cup instead of tampons and it works fine with Skyla.I got my old Skyla replaced with a new one last week, Aug ‘18. Insertion was just as painful, but again my doctor was great and it was all over within 5 minutes. I felt a little dizzy and looked pale, so they gave me a heating pad, crackers and water. I relaxed for 10 mins and then drove myself back to work. That was 4 days ago and I have had no cramping or spotting. I will continue to use Skyla because it releases the least hormones of any hormonal IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just an update: I got my Kyleena 10 days ago. Today is the first day I’m having what I call bad period cramps from the IUD. In all honesty they are manageable and I haven't noticed any other symptoms. My libido was increased which many users say the opposite but this is just my experience!

Norplant System (levonorgestrel):I had the norplant placed in 1994, shortly after giving birth. I had just turned 18. At 19, I was diagnosed with severe fibrocystic breast disease. No one on either side of my family has this. I have always struggled with this disease, and absolutely have to have IM depo injections regularly to reduce swelling and to decrease extreme pain. I am now 42, and still need depo. I've always wondered if the norplant caused this issue.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Everyone’s experience is going to be different. My insertion was very painful. My doctor gave me pills to dilate my cervix and I took Advil. I’ve never had children & I used BC to skip my period for about 9 mths before that. I had a lot of pain for a week and it slowly got better. After 6 mths my cramps started to ease and after a yr. I still get very painful cramps once and while. It doesn’t matter to me because I had cramps w/o birth control. Also, this gives me the freedom I want. When on other kinds of BC I didn’t have a sex drive, I have it back now. There isn’t as high of a hormone level that some birth controls have which is why you still can get PMS (which I do) and it doesn’t help with acne. Even with the massive pain, I would do it again in a heartbeat. Remember that everyone’s situation is different. Be prepared for anything. When my cramps get bad I take a combo of Advil and Tylenol. We do what we need and choose to do- no option is perfect.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):8 weeks after the birth of my second child I had the Mirena inserted. I bled for the entire month after insertion; not just spotting, full blown period bleeding. Out of frustration I went to have it removed. My ob suggested the kyleena instead; as a last attempt at trying an IUD I agreed. The insertion was a breeze (but this was 12 weeks postpartum) and the bleeding actually stopped the night I had it inserted. I had a few days off and on of very slight sporting and one actual period so far. I love this IUD, I wish I went with it from the start.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I wrote a review yesterday about kyleena and going to the obgyn and my fear came true the IUD was in my cervix and we had to remove this second one again. Now the next option is to look at the other options I will try the Mirena IUD. My doctor says it could either be my body just rejecting or the kyleena itself because it is so small it does not hold the T shape in my uterus and that is why. She said to try the Mirena IUD because it is a little bit bigger so going to try that in a few weeks wish me luck haven't had the best of luck but really hoping this works. Will be updating in a few weeks.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I got Kylenna inserted just over a month ago and I've had a GREAT experience with it! I was super anxious about it but after the time has passed it's been really great. So the first day I got it, it wasn't that it was painful, it was just A LOT of pressure. If you've gotten a PAP , it's like that but 7x stronger. The first day I had it, insertion was painful but it lasted like 10 seconds. After I was fine. I had cramps the entire day after insertion and I went to bed right when I got home! After day 1, I had cramps for a couple days but then they went away & now I rarely get them. I've had a great experience with kyleena and I love it! I don't have any other side effects from the IUD aside from the cramp here and there. Extended health did not cover it for me

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have gained 35 pounds in the years of using this product in the first six months I gained 15. I finally don't have periods.  It is extremely hard to lose weight and when I do I can never lose more then ten pounds without gaining them back. I have been working out and eating well and nothing helps.  At this point I would rather be pregnant then keep gaining weight that won't leave

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got it inserted yesterday, I was terrified of it being painful but it was similar to a pap, with just a couple seconds of cramps (not going to lie they were painful) but then it was over and the whole thing only took five minutes. I felt completely fine, drove home. A couple hours later I started to get cramps, similar to what I get on my first day of my period. I had taken two advils and as the night went on the pain did get worse, it came in periods of it being terribly painful and feeling like I was going to pass out to like a steady pain. I took a bath and put a heating pad on and that seemed to help. I woke up & felt completely fine. As today has gone on though I've noticed the cramps coming back but I haven't taken any pain medications yet so that will probably help. I should also mention that yesterday I was on the last day of my period and I was spotting. After the whole thing was over I went home and was bleeding a lot at first, but so far the bleeding has stopped!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted on July 17th.  I was extremely nervous about the insertion process. I read reviews and researched and scared myself to the point I wanted to back out. I’m glad I didn’t. The insertion process lasted all about 5 minutes. She did a ultrasound before the insertion, then it just felt like a normal Pap smear. Just slightly uncomfortable. No pain. There was a slight cramp right as it happened. I was able to get up and go home immediately after. Definitely not what I had expected. So don’t stress over that!The worst part for me is the cramping honestly. I had a period that last for almost 3 weeks. And the spotting occasionally. But the cramps. Holy. Moly. They are unbearable. To the point it brings me to my knees. The dr said it’s normal for 3-6 months but I’m not sure if I can last that long. Unfortunately this is my only form of birth control because I have Lupus. I will say, other than the cramps, I love it. Hopefully they calm down soon.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I made sure to take a  max strength aleve an hour before I went to get the insertion and I felt nothing! Honestly the worst part was numbing the cervix, and that was just uncomfortable. I didn't realize he had inserted the Liletta until he was wrapping everything up! Such a breeze, and I've never had kids, which I heard makes it worse, and it didn't

Mirena (levonorgestrel):So I'm 34. Had it inserted 5 months ago. Never had kids. Most painful experience ever  almost passed out. Heavy bleeding for 3 months off and on. Now my period is lighter. Cramps not any better and I get spotting and random cramps. Personally when my 5 years are up (or before) its coming out especially if things get worse. Random cramping in between and mood swings. Very annoying.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Updating: Previously I had updated this type of birth control to be a 10/10 but it was the complete opposite. I know I can only speak for my self and this is my own experience each person is different so that is something to keep in mind. When I ended up getting my first IUD in I was having a good experience until I realized that the IUD was expelling and was half way in me. I had to have it removed and I decided to try again. As well as I had had the first one for about 8 months. Now with this second one I am going in for my one month check up and it has either expelled or is absorbed in my uterus. We will find out tomorrow 8/23. I unfortunately was one of the unlucky few who the IUD expelled. I had primarily used this to not have any babies in that case the IUD did it's job. Will be looking at other options like the nexplanon if this does not work. Really wanted to love this type of birth control but just not for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):EVERYONE WHO IS SCARED TO GET THIS FORM OF BIRTH CONTROL: Don’t be! After reading all of the negative reviews regarding a painful insertion, I was scared of absolutely nothing. I would cry thinking about how painful it was going to be while reading horror stories of people passing out, bleeding their guts out, and blinding pain. While I was on the table getting my insertion, yes, I cried. But not because of the pain. It was because of the pain I expected. I felt nothing but a pinch, and I have a low pain tolerance. I took 4 Advil tablets an hour before my procedure, and a couple hours after my procedure, the bad cramps have yet to come. I cannot speak upon Kyleena’s long-term results, but my review is just based on insertion. Please don’t be scared. I was, and I was scared over nothing.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena June 14th 2018. I started bleeding two weeks after insertion. Insertion felt like contractions and I had to lay in bed for the day. I still have a normal sex drive. It cured my dry skin and no acne. I also dropped 3 pounds in a month. I started bleeding June 27 and stopped bleeding Aug 17. At the beginning I was bleeding enough to count it as a period. The next 2 weeks were casual amounts of light period. It was enough to switch out a liner twice or three times a day. Then there was a week of only one liner a day. Then there was a week or so of only bleeding when using the bathroom. I naturally have bouts of severe depression and generalized anxiety. After taking Kyleena I've noticed that the depression comes in shorter terms. Where I used to have 3-4 months of depression now it hits for a week and then fade. My anxiety got a little worse but manageable. If you're still hurting 3 months in it is time to go get a check up to make sure it's in the right position.
Skyla (levonorgestrel):When I first had my skyla implanted in 2015 I would have sworn by it. March 2016 (implanted for 8 months) I found out I was (5 weeks) pregnant. I miscarried within the week.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got the Liletta  inserted six weeks after the birth of my baby so the eginning of Jan 2016 I didn’t feel any pain on insertion and it was a relatively quick procedure ,once in I forgot all about it. In Dec  I got it checked to see everything was Ok and looked good.  I have gained about 50 pound since then and have been working hard to get it off.  I’m not sure if it has something to do with the birth control ,in a couple of months I will have it in 3 years .It seems a reliable form of Birth Control and I think I have been happy with it .

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I'm 26, never had kids. My doctor proposed an IUD as an "easier" alternative to a hysterectomy. Honestly? With the amount of pain and bleeding I have experienced, it would have been better to just get the hysto.The insertion was EXTREMELY painful. I have a pretty high pain tolerance but I was literally screaming with tears flowing down my face during insertion.I then had debilitating, truly debilitating cramps that 24/7 max dose ibuprofin couldn't ease. I was in bed from the pain for about 2 weeks. It's now been another 3 weeks (so about 5 weeks post-insertion) and the pain has subsided, but I have literally been bleeding nonstop since insertion.The constant pain and blood has made sex basically impossible. I'm also extremely exhausted and depressed. Liletta is wrecking my life. They say to wait 3 months to give your body time to adjust, but if things aren't way better by then I'm just going to have this removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got mine inserted July 10 and the insertion felt like a normal period cramp for me. It’s so freaking annoying though after insertion my period was on for three weeks and I kept getting sharp pains almost everyday and it’s been over a months now . So I’m thinking about taking it out, this one isn’t the one for me .

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my skyla inserted today. If I had to do over again I would have never done this. The insertion was the most painful thing I've ever experienced, and I have a lot of tattoos/piercings -  so before I did it I figured it wouldn't be so bad. I have never had kids before though. I was wrong. The doctor took 30 mins for the whole procedure. Kept having her assistant go grab different sized tools. They jabbed me in the cervix at least 5 times with different things. At one point she got one of the tools stuck inside of me and said "ohh its stuck" and kept yanking on it. She finally got it in place and cut the strings. I couldn't drive home. I puked as soon as I got home. And have had severe cramping ever since.............. do not recommend

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Hi everyone ,  I took pain pills hours prior to the procedure. I tried to calm my nerves by breathing in and out. Everything my doctor did hurt ! Cleaning the area and measuring the area. Hurt !!! All was awful but the worse was when they put the IUD in . I was screaming , was dizzy, bleeding , extremely hot , had a weird taste in my mouth , and had the urge to have a bowel movement. The doctor said that’s all normal all nerves are connected. Her assuring me it was normal didn’t help me. I was in the worst pain ever! I had the IUD in for a few minutes. I told them to remove it . I still had the urge to have a bowel movement. The urge went away once they removed the IUD.  DON'T GET LILETTA !!!!!! The insertion is horrible .  Everyone’s body is different but from personal experience don’t do it .

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Mirena for almost 2 years now. The insertation was quite painful for me. I had serious cramps for a couple days and a heavy period that lasted about 2 weeks. After that, it wasn’t too terrible. I’m 28 and no kids so it’s purpose is working. I haven’t noticed much difference in weight, sex drive, emotions, etc although I do still have anxiety. The past 6 months I’ve been getting regular periods but slightly less cramps than before I had it. My acne has been TERRIBLE so I had to go on medication to keep that at bay. I’ve also had bad GI issues including passing blood that comes and go every few weeks. I had a colonoscopy and all sorts of blood work but they have not discovered the cause. I’m removing my Mirena soon so I’m hoping some of the issues clear up. Overall, it was ok. I didn’t get pregnant, but between the regular periods and other issues I’m having I just want it gone to rule out this as a cause.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleen inserted in October of 2017 and I’ve been miserable ever since the doc keeps telling me to wait it out until after a year insertion was painful but that was to be expected. I had cramping and spotting for 6 months my libido is non existent it hurts every time I have sex. I have gained 30 pounds but my weight is just now starting to go down. I have nipple soreness bloating and it had no effect on my acne because guess what I still have it. The only good thing about it is I’m not pregnant... but lol I think kyleena reduces that risk even more because I never want to have sex. I do not recommend.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've talked to some women that love Mirena and others like myself that had horrible side effects. There were no side effects initially but after 5 months of having it I started having the following symptoms: Mood swings, irritability, anxiety, heart palpulations, cystic acne on face, arms & backNone of these systoms are normal for me. I had the IUD removed and instantly felt better. I will not get Mirena again.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Horrible experience. The insertion hurt like hell and I could barely walk when I got home. Painful periods and nonstop bleeding for months. After 8 months of bleeding everyday and ruining every pair of underwear, my period stopped for a week and came back. Awful contraction like cramps that happened every single month. Switched to Liletta and the same thing happened, but with slightly less bleeding and more regular periods. It works with some people but not me. Cramps stopped as soon as I took the IUD out. I'm now trying the implant. 3 rating because I never got pregnant, but the side effects were too strong to handle and effected everyday life. Everyone is different though.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena put in 3 months ago. Insertion was fast but as a small person with no children it hurt a LOT, like the worst period cramp on fire, even on ibuprophin. If you’re like me I suggest asking to have your cervix numbed. After I felt weak but OK to take myself home. More painful cramping began about 30 minutes later and lasted on and off for 2 weeks without any bleeding. After that cramping was only during my period or after sex. I thought something was wrong but after an exam and ultrasound I was cleared as just sensitive and to give it time. 2 more months passed and sex doesn’t hurt as bad although I have to be careful. My period cramps calmed down a bit and are about as bad as they were before getting the IUD (I’ve always struggled with painful periods) and bleeding is light but lasts 2 weeks. Overall I’m not sure it was worth it, but I’m going to stick with it now that I’ve already started. At least its nearly impossible to get pregnant.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had the skyla IUD for a month now and I love it! Insertion was quick and definitely not the worst pain I've ever felt just 2 quick cramps and then it's in! And I have the worst pain tolerance ever. I have no kids either. I had a little bit of light bleeding for the rest of the day and some light cramping but went away that evening. I have no symptoms and have more energy then when I was on the pill. My husband says he doesn't feel a thing either. I've had a little bit of breaking out but nothing a good face wash can't control. All and all I love my skyla! Would recommend it to my friends it's just so easy and convenient!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hi everyone! Before getting my KYLEENA I searched the web for stories and was terrified after. I thought to myself are they lying? Is it really gonna hurt this bad? No. I got mine implanted yesterday and I felt pressure for about 3 seconds tops. Didn’t hurt a bit. Please don’t freak out this is something so simple that doctors do all the time. Whoever said it was the worst pain they ever felt must not have a good pain tolerance or the person inserting it wasn't very good. Maybe make sure the person who has going to insert it has a lot of experience. I have had minimal cramping and I haven’t noticed any symptoms. I will update if anything happens. Light spotting and nothing to worry about! Don’t be nervous!!!!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had this IUD for 5 months and just had it removed! Finally! I have had constant cramping since it was inserted 8 weeks after having my baby. My periods have been very heavy (worse than the bleeding I had after having my baby) and long lasting 2 weeks sometimes longer. With the Mirena I never had this issue or the cramping, I didn't have a period after 2 months with the Mirena and no cramping at all after insertion. This thing is so not worth it and I should have stuck with what I knew worked.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I recently got my IUD a couple weeks ago. I had a baby 2 months ago. So they suggested the Kyleena. I wanted the IUD. It’s been great EXCEPT I’ve had my period since the day after I’ve gotten it. LONGEST PERIOD EVER. I feel like it’s never gonna end ..

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the mirena as for me it sounded like the best option, not having to worry about it for 5 years and it has less hormones than the pill. Before I went in I had 2 ibuprofen and an oxy. I got it in just as my period was ending as the cervix is generally a bit more dilated and to minimise bleeding. For background I am 21 with no kids. The procedure was fairly painless and just felt some slight cramping as the doctor put it in the cervix. The day I got it in (Monday) I couldn't get out of bed for around 5 hours after as it was just serious cramping which is normal and is your body adjusting, Day two was normal period like cramps and slight discharge. Day three (Today) no cramping and no discharge and feeling great. Don't be discouraged by one persons negative experience always try it out for yourself, you may love it and its not really a big deal to get it taken out if you don't.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Let’s just start with I got the Kyleena IUD put in to help with fibroids which it immediately helped with. I def recommend it for anyone who is considering it for that. I got the IUD put in 6/17 and of course insertion was painful for the first time ever having my cervix opened. First few weeks were okay besides the cramping but then after the hormones decrease came months of spotting. It lighten but after 6 months and then I just had light long periods (7/9 days) never really had to use anything more then a regular tampon 1 or 2 days out of it. But then a year hit and the hormones decreased again. I think I might just be hormone sensitive but for the past 3 months my boobs swelled up for 2 weeks, nipples super sore, extremely bloated and bad cramps. Oh not to mention the now 2 weeks+ of spotting every month. I’m just hoping I get adjusted to this hormone change soon. I have gained 20lb since I got it but mostly in my boobs and butt. It did not help clear up my adult acne either.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):My Gyno recommended Skyla after having my baby since I’m bad with remembering to take pills. On a scale 1-10, pain of insertion was mostly uncomfortable but I would say a 7. I’m bad with pain. Especially when you see the tools they use. However, insertion is pretty quick.I do suggest taking Tylenol before going to your appt. & you should be fine. I felt some heavy cramps & back pain but it was gone by the time I got home & I did bleed for about 8 days. Ever since then (5 months ago) I have not gotten a period at all. Everything has been very smooth. I will say that I do get cramps sometimes & I feel like it’s my period coming, but it never comes. Then cramps go away. Overall, I would recommend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I haven’t been on hormones in ages due to a DVT (deep vein thrombosis) from Yaz, but had several paragards fall out and was tired of the heavy bleeding. I had kyleena inserted while sedated to remove a polyp today. I don’t remember the insertion and don’t have any pain now. If you are having a lot of pain a few weeks out, please have your doctor do a 3D ultrasound (not a cheapie 2D)- I had a lady not realize my uterus was tilted and perforate my muscle at the beginning, they kept telling me to wait out the pain. If you hurt long after or during sex that’s not always normal. Doctors can put you under to place them in the proper spot if needed. Will update in 6 months re: mood, skin, weight, etc
Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had bad cramping for 1 week and then it spontaneously went away. The mood swings lasted 4 weeks but then went away quickly as well.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The insertion was maybe 3 minutes long. I took 800 mg of ibuprofen before coming (no cervical block) To be honest it wasn’t that bad AT ALL. The most painful part for me was the measurement of my cervix beforehand. After feeling that pain I knew what to expect and when the IUD was inserted I put my hands on my pelvis and pushed down which helped me. It feels like the worst cramp of your life for a couple seconds and then it’s over. I literally hopped right up after it was done and went home. I will not lie to you the cramps the next few days were really really bad. My 1st period post insertion was 2 weeks long and my mood was awful.  My 2nd period after my insertion I didn’t have any mood swings and the cramping was normal. As the months go by the side effects become less and less so I think honestly it’s worth it. I  haven’t gained any weight which I did like crazy on the pill (ps if you find yourself getting BV more than usual remember semen can also throw off your pH.)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena 2 weeks ago and it’s been pretty miserable so far. Insertion was the worst pain I’ve ever experienced. The cramps from insertion lasted a couple days. I’ve been very bloated and have painful cramps that come in waves. I’m also experiencing some constipation and loss of appetite. Some back pain, vaginal discomfort and discharge with spotting on and off as well. I’m fatigued and can’t do a lot of excercise. If these symposium don’t clear up, I will consider removal. I’ll write another review in a month or so for an update. Wish me luck :(...UPDATE: My pain got worse the day after writing this. Severe contraction-like cramps. I went to emergency and had them remove it. Turns out the iud was causing an infection. This may work for some women, but obviously my body wanted the thing out. I’m feeling better after removal. Too bad. I really wanted it to work for me.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta inserted 6 month after giving birth to my second child. Soon after I started having constant yeast infections as well as vaginal bacterial infections. They would prescribe gels, problems would go away and come back. I felt pain during intercourse. Finally, I was diagnosed with STD. To this day it's a mystery. I decided  get the device removed. I took antibiotics for the STD that and it went away even though my husband never took any treatment for that and we had sex soon after w/o any issues.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The insertion was uncomfortable but the aftermath was awful. The cramps put me in tears, and I have an extremely high tolerance. I did not take any medication before the procedure and cramping started almost immediately after. I was nauseous, cramping, and sweating, I was extremely dizzy as well. The cramping became tolerable about 2 hours after procedure but lasted for 3 days plus back pains. I’m going on my second month and I have not stopped bleeding once. I have a brown like discharge and heavy flow.  I have not been able to have intercourse the entire time and the flow continues to get worse, apparently this is normal for about 3 months. My emotions are haywire to the point I feel like I’m insane as I’ll be very happy then angry for no reason. I cried over the mail the other day and have no idea why. As of right now I completely regret my decision to get this. The only plus side is that I don’t have to remember to take the pill everyday.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got the Kyleena inserted in 9 August  so it’s only been a day. The insertion was painful. There are 3 different parts to the insertion, which all give a cramp. They said the 3rd one was the worst one, but in my experience, it was the 2nd. Some doctors give you 2 pills to take to help dilate your uterus which helps a little so I’d ask about them if your doctor doesn’t mention it. I usually have really painful period cramps so the pain after was a bit worse than what I usually deal with. Today’s day 2 and I’m still in some pain. Not a lot but it comes and goes and I feel bleh..my vagina literally feels like I have a super, dry jumbo tampon in that’s stuck and can’t get out (almost sure I have endo which is why my periods are horribly painful). Hoping this will be a good choice. I will update as I go. The reviews are scary, but I still went for it. Definitely don’t want to have sex for awhile. Nothings going up there

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I would seriously not recommend this!I had been using the Evra patch for almost 15yrs.  I had a benign tumour removed from my ovary Oct ‘17 and some endometriosis, so I decided maybe it was time to change. I got the Kyleena inserted a week ago today! It seemed like the best option as it was a low hormone dosage and I haven’t had any kids, but OMG I have so much pain (not cramps) actual PAIN! Insertion was ok, didn’t have to get measured,i t was painful for 2 0seconds but got worse.  Several calls to doc & changing pain meds it wasn’t easing so I got it out yesterday, pain still hasn’t stopped! The doc said it looked fine etc but maybe my body isn’t accepting it & I'm off work again because I can’t walk with pain! Doc said give it 48 hrs that the inflammation will go down! I’m taking ponstan, Celebrex and paracetamol every 4hrs I’ve read so many threads ppl saying stick it out etc but don’t if your in pain ur body is rejecting it, I hope this eases or it will be A&E trip the weekend for me

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Having lots of bloating and weight gain. I am active and watch what I eat, very moody and have highs and lows. Also spotting after sex. It's been 4 months hope it gets better :)

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had the implant for 10 yrs but started getting more frequent heavier bleeding. GP recommended the Mirena as I'm 99% sure I'm not having any more kids plus they work better than the implant in older women (30+). I've had 2 kids but by c-section so was warned that insertion could be difficult. GP referred me to a gyno since I had to have a colposcopy and biopsy anyway so asked if he could do it all together. GP also prescribed me diazapam to take the night before and morning of to help relax my cervix. Insertion was uncomfortable and felt like a sharp cramp but no worse than getting the implant. Gyno was lovely and we chatted through the whole thing. I did flinch when the clampy thing to open my cervix went in!  4-5 hrs post-insertion and I've still got some period-like cramping. Had very light bleeding, which has since stopped. I'll wait to see how it goes over the next few weeks/months but so far not as bad as some of the experiences I've read about on here, thankfully!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):My period is just out of control I haven't stop bleeding for a month already! I would love to keep it but if my period never ends I'm sorry it has to come out, Sadly that's my situation.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted today. I found the insertion pain to be similar to a very bad menstrual cramp. The pain only lasted for a few seconds and I had very small cramps for about 3 hours afterward. I also had some bleeding shortly afterward. It has been 7 hours since the insertion and the cramps have stopped and the bleeding is very light (likely because I’m on the last day of my period). Otherwise, I feel absolutely fine.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had my Mirena inserted less than 48 hours ago (Tuesday morning... it is now Wednesday night), so I can only review insertion. I wasn’t on my period but it was so easy! I am 22, never given birth. I took 800mg ibuprofen about 2 hours before insertion. The anticipation was the worst part!  Once I got into the room, it took no longer than 5 minutes. The doctor gave me an injection in my cervix, which was only a small pinch. She wasted no time getting the IUD in and it was over before I knew it! The insertion was quick and relatively painless, felt like a short, intense cramp for about 2 seconds. I got up and felt completely pain free. I had some bleeding for the rest of the day, not super heavy but I had to wear a pad. Only started feeling period-like cramps about 2 hours later, but nothing too bad. I haven’t felt any pain for over 8 hours now and bleeding is basically gone. I can confirm that insertion is NOT painful for everyone, so don’t freak yourself out for nothing!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the IUD placed in January of this year. During the procedure, I was told I will feel mild cramping and experience light bleeding after. It ended with me having diarrhea immediately after, then my feet went numb. I wasn’t not able to get off the toilet and get  out of the bathroom. The doctors literally had to break into the bathroom, the lifted me off the toilet, and had to wipe me. I couldn’t do it myself. I ended being dizzy, having a headache, and vomiting everywhere. I couldn’t even drive home afterwards. My husband had to leave his job to come get me and our daughter. I have experienced headaches everyday and cramping almost everyday. My mood has gotten worse and so has my depression and anxiety. No weight gain, or weight loss. I’ve been the same. I have been trying to have this thing removed but my doctors keep pushing back my appointment. I have seen so many sad stories about this thing and I want it too be removed. I would like to avoid any further issues and warn others.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted about 1 month ago. I've never had kids, so I had to be dilated and that PLUS the actual insertion of the IUD was dizzying and super painful. I was spotting and cramping for the next two days consistently then after that, spotting and cramping every other day for the next two weeks. 1 month later I don't have any spotting or cramping and the strings have softened so my bf doesn't feel them anymore. I used to be on Levora for 3 years and switched because it was making me extremely moody and sensitive so I thought the Mirena IUD would be a better alternative and I was right. I am completely balanced in mood, no weight gain, and no acne outburst to date.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):So happy with my Liletta IUD. Yes, the insertion hurt badly; however, the pain (cramping) and bleeding only lasted a day. It has now been 2 months since my insertion. I have a 3-4 day lighter brown/red period every 2 weeks ish. Sometimes less or more. I also have little to no cramping. I got this IUD because of my horrible, crampy, excruciatingly painful periods, and it is definitely doing the job! and even better, I can have sex safely too

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted about 6 months ago. I researched a lot about all the different types of IUDs and myself and my gyno both agreed Kyleena was the best choices, as it is the thinnest and best if you haven’t had kids (which I have not). The insertion was not difficult and was about 3 minutes long, it felt like you just got hit with really bad cramps and that lasts for about 1-2 hours after insertion and then slowly dies down. An IUD was right for me because I’m in my 20s and remembering to take the pill everyday was too difficult and condoms aren’t ALWAYS available. Do your research, talk to your doctor and think about an IUD, it’s worth it if you ask me.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got this birth control thinking it would be the best one for me. I’ve tried the shot and the pills and wasn’t a fan but at least with those, I didn’t have as nearly many problems.Since getting the IUD four months ago I have been experiencing pain. Turns out I have a cyst in my right ovary, pelvic inflammatory disease, and countless yeast infections. I feel nauseous all the time with back pain. I wish I never got it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had all the normal things that everyone else experience, but I also had a few extras that no one else has mentioned yet.  I went through about a month and a half of hot flashes, like menopause style.  I also noticed a tremendous amount of hair loss.  Like super thin hair now. Has anyone else have this happen and how long before it goes back to normal?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Now, I have had 2 babies vaginally, both times inductions. The speculum was weird feeling, but not painful. They inserted some brown soap (iodine?) on a giant q-tip to clean my cervix. My doctor and I chatted while she did it, with her interjecting now and then to tell me what she was doing/touching. I felt a slight twinge (you may feel some cramping) as she measured and then again as she actually inserted the Kyleena. It was over in less than 10 minutes and there was no notable pain at all. Like I said, a little twinge.  The rest of the day I spotted very lightly (the pad was honestly probably overkill) and had very slight cramps and some back pain, all of which I could completely forget about if I was just doing something, as opposed to sitting around or driving. Today I’ve had no cramping or anything, just some mucousy discharge.  No ibuprofen or Tylenol.I haven’t had a period yet and since I’m breastfeeding who knows when that will actually happen.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Today marks one full week since my insertion. I must say, I was terrified and expected the worst pain on the day of my appointment, DON'T LET THE COMMENTS PUT YOU OFF. My insertion process took less than 3 minutes and I barely felt pain, just a 5 second cramp when the doctor was opening my cervix. I took 1000mg tylenol (extra strength) before going in so I think that may have helped.  I felt normal immediately after the procedure. There was some bleeding immediately I stood up but it stopped about 3 hours later. Since then I have not had any bleeding/spotting/discharge since that day. I only have minimal cramping every other day. Don’t let reviews scare you off, like I almost was. Everyone’s body is different and I just wanted to share my pleasant experience
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I absolutely love kyleena! Best decision I ever made! Aside from the discomfort during insertion it has been amazing. I recommend kyleena to all of my friends.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I got the Kyleena inserted in June 2017, and have had it for about a year. I was never good at taking a pill everyday and I am terrified of needles, so this seemed like the best choice. I spot once a month but never have a real period. I cramp if I’m in a squished sitting position for a long time like white water rafting or long car rides. The only downside is the severe mood swings, lack of sex drive, and the excessive weight gain. I’ve gained 25 lbs!!! I work out 4-5 times a week, which I started in April 2018, and have focused on what I am eating a little better with no luck in losing anything! Trying to decide if I should get it removed or keep it in.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):*10HRS POST INSERTION*18 and have never had sex. Took something 3hrs prior to soften my cervix with light cramps and took 600mg ibuprofen 30min prior.First OBGYN measured my cervix which was the most painful part because of cervix angle, but we communicated and she adjusted. Measuring tool felt like a stinging cramp. IUD felt like a large, dull cramp. I then got dizzy, so gyno had me lie down until better (~2min). Cramps started ~20min later. Eventually felt like heavy period cramps. I have a pretty low pain tolerance and was ok. Spotting EXTREMELY lightly.Recommendation:-Plan for day off.-Have someone drive you. -Keep up with ibuprofen.-Take reviews at face value. Kyleena is not for everyone, and those who had a negative experience are more likely to review it. -Communicate with your gyno. Mine told me Breathe and let your knees drop because it keeps you from tensing up.Hope this helped!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for 4 months, starting at 4 months postpartum. The insertion was uncomfortable, but quick. I had some intense cramping on and off for the first few weeks, as well as spotting. Now I have pretty much no symptoms. My period has not returned, but I am still breastfeeding. My milk supply has not suffered one bit, and I have no weight gain. I am actually below my pre-pregnancy weight. Time will tell whether it's effective (so far so good!) But so far I'm quite happy with Kyleena.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’m 23, no kids, been on the pill since I was 18. I switched to liletta May 18. it’s now Aug 18.The insertion was one of the most painful experiences.  The next few days I had discomfort but more on the crampy side. I had spotting after which they said would be normal the first 3-6 months. It only got worse. The discharge was to a point I was changing liners 2-3 times a day. It eventually calmed down but I’ve repeatedly have it. I don’t want to have sex cause it feels gross and looks discussing. . I’ve never had a yeast infection until now with liletta. I tried Monistat for the first time and it calmed down the discharge but still having it.  Although part of me assumes it’s the thickening of the cervical mucus (which they said would happen) Besides the discharge the only other side affects I’ve noticed is the cramping but can be helped with ibuprofen.  I get discomfort occasionally, severe loss of appetite, drop in sex drive. I love the effectiveness of the IUD otherwise.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I am 23 years old, never been pregnant and never been on birth control. I wanted to try this type because it lasts 5 years. The procedure didn’t last more than 10 minutes to be inserted, yet there was a lot of pain. I did not take any meds prior to the appointment. It’s day 5 and I still have cramps. My periods before we’re normal and never had cramps, now I have been cramping since I got this IUD and I’ve been spotting. They said this was normal. I’m just hoping these cramps go away soon and the bleeding doesn’t occur too long because I can’t stand wearing panty liners!! Other than that I do hope this IUD is good for me and the cramps/periods go away for good.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for about a week now, insertion was the worst pain I’ve ever felt like really bad cramps I came out crying. Through out that day I had horrific pain I couldn’t move I just laid in bed all day and even not doing anything the pelvic pain wouldn’t stop (took Tylenol 1,000) still nothing next day still random pelvic and back pain but I could go on with my day and go to work. Through out this whole week I’ve had random pelvic pain it feels like you’re bloated with cramps. I was on the Nuvaring before and had no side effects like these (just killed my sex drive which is why I changed it to this) I will be scheduling an appt to see If there’s anything wrong with it or me.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):So I've had my mirena coil  in for 5 years and is due to come out. This is my second one. I've developed an infection from it as and I am on antibiotics. I'm just wondering has this happened to anyone else

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got Kyleena three weeks ago. Was previously on Depo, Nexplanon, and Mono Linyah (pill).Insertion: The pain was UNBEARABLE. Got dressed so I could go puke after insertion, and I nearly passed out by the gyno toilet. When I came back the nurse gave me snacks and Advil and let me lay there, but I didn’t trust myself to drive home. The pain was severe and came in waves. This lasted for 11 days.My period had finally come and the cramps are, once again, a nightmare. Also much heavier than my usual periods. Good thing I have a diva cup so I don’t have to deal with a squishy tampon every hour.Still better than childbirth, but just barely

Skyla (levonorgestrel):August 2018 marks 1 year of having the Skyla IUD. I have an appointment later this month to have a check. 4 out of 7 days of the week I have pain. Sometimes it feels as if I had inserted a tampon sideways and my body is trying to push it out but it is stuck, causing stabbing pain. Other days I have pain towards my ovaries which I have a feeling might be cysts (common side effect of IUD). I frequently find myself holding my lady bits because they just hurt. I have moderate depression since insertion. Have had acne still well into my 24 year life and have not noticed any change, good or bad.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Liletta is not great for me. I had it inserted months ago and have bled EVERY day since. The bleeding ranged from heavy to spotting but there hasn’t been a day without blood. Also, I have random cramps all the time, abdominal and in my back. I feel bloated in my lower abdomen and I’m holding on to so much weight depite working out 5x a week and eating clean. Ive also had bacterial vaginitis (BV) twice since getting it and I’ve never had it before that. Wouldn’t recommend this to anyone.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):After having my daughter I've tried two other birth control methods, before trying the IUD skyla. Did the shot it was terrible, tried the pill it made it worse. I kept losing weight with both until I got on the skyla, people tell me that it hurts when they put it in. I felt a quick pinch and I was done I made a joke out of it.  ( at least it was not as bad pushing a baby out of me) and they all laughed. The first 6 months I was bleeding non stop it was terrible but then it went away. I never got cramps or anything. I did gain 20 pounds , but thats about it other then them not finding my string when I got it checked out. I had get and ultrasound and they found it.  But everyone is different and sorry to hear women go through that. I know because nothing else worked for me if this didn't work then I had to do the implant .. I hope this is helpful to somebody that needed it

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had liletta for 5 months and I love it. Insertion was very painful and felt like being stabbed in the uterus. I went home and took Tylenol for the pain. I had cramping for a few hours afterwards which was treated with a hot pad. I’ve had only two periods since which were slightly longer than normal. I have not had a period for three months now and the cramps and irritability that I had before getting liletta are no longer there. I do notice that around my period time my breasts get tender but I would rather have that than the pain and bleeding I had before getting this IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted about a month ago, and wanted to get it done before my wedding. I am a virgin. The insertion process was not painful, but I took 2 ibuprofen in the morning and 2 again just before insertion. I went back to work, felt a little weak, but finished the work day. That night I had trouble going to sleep because of cramping. The next day I had cramping, felt nauseous and faint. This was the worst of it. I called my doctor and she told me it was not uncommon, take Ibuprofen, rest and call her tomorrow. I felt a little better that night. The next day the cramping was gone. I haven't had cramping since, except if I ate something bad that upset my stomach. I have had a little bleeding every day. Online it says I could have bleeding 3-6 months. I'm on my period and feel fine. So far I'm feeling good and I think this is a good birth control option for the next five years, or whenever we want to have kids.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had Skyla BC for about 8 months now.  IT HAS BEEN HORRIBLE.  Such a painful process to get inserted as I was 20 and had never had a pap done or had a child.  Almost passed out after.  I figured I would give it some time thinking that the horrible cramps (that felt like knives in my uterus) would go away, but they haven't.  I have developed PMDD since being on this BC and I get extremely depressed before my period....like, its bad.  Have had to switch depression meds and keep getting the dosage upped.  My husband and I have had issues in our marriage cause I have had NO SEX DRIVE since getting it. Also I have never weighed this much in my life. Have put on 20 pounds since then. I can't get rid of it either. All the doctors say that none of these things are a side affect of the BC.  They say my depression is just a part of my "mood" and same with the sex drive.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got this because I was going back to Uni out of state and didn't want to worry about being on the pill. Getting the IUD inserted was the worst possible thing. It hurt so much because I've never had kids. I was in a lot of pain for about a week or so but once that past it was only slightly painful. That being said, I would get random bursts of pain for about 2-3 weeks. After that though, I was completely fine. Its been about 3 months and I haven't had any complications thus far. The only thing that's come up is that my boyfriend could feel it during sex but as time went on, the strings have softened.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I had Kyleena places on July 24th.  I am 21, never had a child. The insertion was painful for me and took two tries. After it was placed I felt fine for about 30 minutes then the cramps started and they were debilitating! I laid in bed all day with a heating pad. The cramps slowly got better but I immediately had brown discharge for a few days and then I started my period. I’ve always had bad period cramps, but with the Kyleena I was on the living room floor crying I was in so much pain. I’ve been on my period for over a week now. It’s almost been two weeks having the Kyleena and for the past few days I have had horrible shooting cramps different then normal cramps. I am really hoping things get better because I don’t know if I can take this for a long period of time. My follow up is on August 21st. I will update on any new information.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My experience has been brief (I've had it in for about 3 hours now) but so far so good. The insertion wasn't comfortable, but my Gyn was so quick. The whole procedure took about a minute and a half. 30 seconds of that was intensely painful, but it's over so quickly it wasn't really a bother. Also, I had some brief cramping for about the first half hour, but they are completely gone now. I'm honestly super happy with my choice.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):**Its been one full week.**. My cramps are on and off. They're very mild and only call for a hot bath or a 500mg Tylenol. Much less severe than my normal period cramps. I'm still a bit bloated but the spotting stopped after the 2nd day. During intercourse my fiancé said he couldn't feel the strings and that if he had, it wouldn't bug him since the strings are soft (they've softened since the insertion). I am due in 3 weeks for my check to be sure everything is in place. So far, I haven't had any issues but I will update once my period comes to give you my personal experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena on December 2017, the first months it was amazing there was only the brown discharge. Moving forward to June 2018 where I had gained 17 LB!! I got it removed at the end of June and I've lost 10 pounds since, not changing any habits. Also I never really had  skin problems for the IUD but with the IUD my skin was bad 8/10 of the time. Great birth control tho, wish my body had adjusted to it better.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta placed in May.  This is July.  I have not stopped bleeding since it was implanted.  I feel like an animal always bleeding.  You can't have relations if you are always bleeding as well.  The procedure itself hurt so bad.  It felt like a tasser gun was being used inside of me.  The cramps were horrible.  I called the doctors and talked to a nurse, and was told that this bleeding was normal for the first 3-6 months.  This is crazy.  I had it put in because I am going through menopause and had severe periods.  I got on BC pills and got blood clots in my lungs.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Ok, so I got the Kyleena hormonal IUD inserted yesterday at around 3:30pm. When she inserted it I really didn't think it hurt that bad but I gave it about 30 minutes and I was having terrible cramps, like almost bringing me to the floor. But it just felt like bad period cramps. After taking some advil and laying down the cramps went away in about an hour. Today I still some discomfort but not much. Hoping for the best!
