Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Upon insertion, my Kyleena made me pass out and I was incapacitated with pain for several hours after. Then, the worst of my symptoms started. My periods worsened dramatically. My cramps made standing impossible, some days — all I could do was try to sleep the pain away — and I would vomit until I was horribly dehydrated some nights. My periods were completely fine before insertion — they lasted 2-3 days, and I had a light blood flow with no pain.But the worst part of this was that I completely lost control of my emotions. I started crying once a week, twice a week, until my symptoms made it so I was upset nigh-constantly. I had panic attacks, I was diagnosed with acute anxiety, and my trust for my fiancée completely vanished, leaving only paranoia and fear in its wake. Kyleena made my periods debilitating, my life a terror, and made me not trust my own thoughts, or emotions. And upon removal? My symptoms completely went away. Don’t get an IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Well just had the Kyleena put in 30 minutes ago.  I thought I was in the clear pain wise until she inserted the IUD.  I have never felt pain like that.  It was intense cramping and lower back pain for 20 seconds and now very painful cramps and lower back pain.  I hope this pain gets better soon.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My insertion was like a mild cramp and for the rest of the day I was good. The first few months wasn’t bad at all and I actually loved it until time went on. I have been on Kyleena for two years and a few months. It was recommended by a doctor at my campus clinic. She made it sound so great, so I went with it. I was excited to know that my period would either decrease, drastically, or it would stop. Well, two years have gone by and I completely hate it. I am bleeding A LOT more than I normally would without it. However, my periods are still on time just longer than I normally were, before my periods would be 3-4 days and now they are a full 7. I go through so many pads, tampons, and messed up clothing it crazy. The only good thing is that I have no gotten pregnant. I’m going to continue with it until the time is up, but it won’t be something I get back on.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the mirena coil fitted 6 weeks ago. Sorry to have to post this up but it was the worst experience of my life I passed out twice.  I was told I would have a light bleed /spotting  for a few weeks. I've since been back to the A&E I'm bleeding terribly and passing clots, it hasn't or doesn't seem to be getting any lighter. It's worse than a heavy period.  I'm getting married in two weeks and I don't know what I'm going to do I'm afraid to have it removed with the initial experience Is anyone else out there the same as me please share .

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Placement: 6/28/2017INSERTION: The insertion was quite painful. I am not sexually active (currently) and the speculum was the most painful part. The actual manipulation involving the cervix was painless. The procedure took less than an hour.PAIN: For the first 6 months I had severe abdominal cramps in different areas of my abdomen mainly in the umbilicus. I was misinformed by the physician that kyleena shouldn't cause pain so I was concerned that I had to go back to the OB for placement confirmation after 3 months because the pain was so severe I thought I may have had a rupture or tear. After a year, I still have occasional abdominal cramps but not as often or severe as before.SPOTTING: The first months also caused me to have spotting. Its almost 4-6 months of non-stop period or spotting. My OB said kyleena will stop my periods altogether but its been a year and I still get my periods albeit lighter than before insertion.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I switched from pills to the arm implant Nexplanon in college. I had it 3 years and I bled every 8-16 days. So,  I talked with my gyno about an IUD since I liked the convenience of no pills and knew I didn’t want kids for at least 3-5 years. We picked Mirena, to help my bleeding infrequency/stop my periods. Honestly, insertion didn’t hurt as much as I was expecting based on reviews. It did hurt getting it put in, like bad period cramps, but after 2 days I felt fine. My arm hurt more from implant removal than the IUD insertion pain. I had just one period a month after insertion, and haven’t bled since. I’ve had it for a 1.5 years, halfway through my 3 years. My only criticism is I have trouble finding my strings on my own, which my gyno could have cut too short. I still check that they are there, but only through my husband as he can feel them in there when we have intercourse (it doesn’t stab or hurt him, he can just tell they are there and not a natural part of me).

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):During insertion, the speculum/measuring definitely felt like a mild cramp but the actual insertion of the IUD was about a 6/10 on the pain scale (did not take painkillers). For the rest of the day I felt moderate to severe cramps and bloating. I was also spotting. The spotting continued for about three to four weeks - improving in colour and amount week by week. The cramping stopped after maybe 3 - 4 days, improving drastically each day.I am on my 3rd month of the Kyleena now and everything has been great. I experience some bleeding sometimes during sex with my partner and he can feel the strings of the Kyleena (though he says that it does not hurt him). Make sure to check if the strings are still in place at least once a month. My periods are gradually getting lighter and the flow is so much better than it used to be (as someone who used to have quite severe periods). Cramps are very manageable and are usually only evident on Day 2 of my period.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I am 18, with no kids, this was my very first form of birth control. I have had a very good experience with the Liletta IUD so far. I have only had it for a little over week now, but have had no side effects that were bothersome. When I had it inserted there were cramps and discomfort, but I have always had bad period cramps so maybe it just didn't bother me. Afterwards I had some back and stomach cramps but the next morning I was completely fine. I've had some brown discharge but that only lasted for a couple hours the next day, and for the last couple days I have been 100% fine! I definitely recommend it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):INSERTION REVIEW: I had Kyleena inserted 24 hours ago, I'm 22 years, was not previously on birth control, and have very normal/not crampy periods. The experience really was not bad at all! I took advil before. The insertion process took about 4 minutes. First you feel a pinching feeling, which to me was the worst part, and then you feel a cramp; it was more uncomfortable than painful. I will admit I almost passed out afterwards (but I pass out at every single doctors office, so this is a me problem.) I was completely fine the rest of the day and today as well, no cramping at all, just some bleeding!
Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am SO happy with the Skyla. Hardly any side effects and no more period!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted on the 20th of July (2018). I took some meds prescribed by my doctor to soften my uterus the night before. The day of I took 400mg of ibuprofen 1 hour before. The procedure didn’t take long, but it did hurt, a lot. I had the nexplanon put in and didn’t get numbed all the way and felt some of the cutting on my arm but I think the IUD pain is worse. However the intense pain during the insertion did not last more than 10 seconds.  Afterwards I was cramping and that was fairly painful for me ( typically my period cramps are very light and sometimes I can’t distinguish them from a light stomach ache). The it has been four day and I am still cramping, the worst cramp day was definitely day 3/4. I have immediately started releasing brown discharge, but it’s only a little bit. I read it’s normal though for the first 3-6 months. I hope it turns out better than nexplanon because I was on my period for 8 months with it & EXTREMELY moody and had a lot of weight gain.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Mirena IUD inside of me for one year now, I am 34 years old, never had kids. My periods had been very light until last year they started getting very heavy and almost daily.  Other birth control pills didn't help so doctor suggested this IUD. She had lied to me and told me it was an easy procedure that wasn't painful. Wow that was the most painful experience ever. I even yelped on the table as she was inserting and she told me to calm down. I managed to get a cab home and passed out from the pain. I was in pain for weeks.  It has been one year since I've had this thing in me and I'm still bleeding, almost daily and my strings are lost. Another doctor recommended for me to keep it in for the "benefits" because trying to find my strings and removing it will cause more pain. I bleed so much that my boyfriend this past year has lost interest in having sex with me. I will be getting it removed in the next month and hopefully will find something else to stop the bleeding.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m 18, and I got the Kyleena IUD just yesterday, July 23, and it wasn’t so bad. It wasn’t even painful, just uncomfortable and it felt like pressure. I thought it would hurt. I didn’t even take painkillers or any form of medication before the IUD. I felt cramping the first day, but not so bad where it was unbearable. This is the second day with Kyleena, and I feel fine. I’m hoping Kyleena works wonders for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Review on insertion only. I had read and heard a lot of scary things about the IUD insertion process. Mine was super easy and not very painful. There were two big pains. First when she was measuring and the second when actually inserting the IUD. Each lasted maybe 5 seconds and it was all over so fast. It’s only been about 6 hours since my appointment so, like I said, this review is of insertion only. Don’t be scared, it’s really not that bad! I did take ibuprofen before and have not had to take any more since.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Late twenties and never pregnant. The initial appointment to have the Kyleena inserted was painful for me. It took my OB/GYN 3 attempts to get it into place. I experienced almost like pinching cramping. It radiated throughout my body. The first day was painful. I noticed the cramps more when I was standing instead of sitting. I’ve had the Kyleena for about 2 weeks now and the pain is almost unbearable. The cramping is different than period cramps and over the counter pain medicine does not put a dent in the pain. I’ve read the first two weeks can be the worst. I’m hoping that the pain reduces soon or it is coming out.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got this inserted about 2 weeks ago. The insertion was very painful and uncomfortable. Right after insertion I felt dizzy and light headed and had to lay there for about 30 minutes. I was able to drive myself after. I felt fine until my next period. My period was awful, my cramps were worse then ever, and it lasted for over 8 days. I also felt nauseous and dizzy some days. Since starting Kyleena my acne had gotten worse, I feel bloated and uncomfortable.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Update on my skyla (inserted 3/21/17):4 months in, I hardly have a "period"! When I do, it is very light bleeding. I have noted a slight increase in acne, but nothing horrific. Keep it clean, treated & under control! Sex is spontaneous and i never need to worry about a certain time to take my pill! Very to little cramps. I use pantiliners only or light tampons. I have maintained my "average" weight so I have no issues with weight gain. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Mirena for almost four years now. It was been pretty great overall for the four years. A few months ago though, my periods started becoming very long. They would have one to two days where it seemed like it was done and then it would come back and just be light for about four more days. Mind you, I’ve never lost my period, it’s just been shorter and like clockwork and lasting 5 days only. Now it’s lasting double that if not longer. From what I read this is rather common and may mean it’s time to be replaced. But anybody else feel the dread of having to go through the insertion process again? Cause damn, I’m not looking forward to that.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Take at least 600 mg of ibuprofen beforehand. I took it at 1:55 pm before my appointment at 2:30 pm. My doctor told me everything she was doing which was nice, she first felt the direction of where my uterus points, then she inserted the speculum, used iodine on a cotton swab to wipe my cervix (it tickled) (make sure you are not allergic to Iodine), then told me I would feel a cramp when she went to measure how far she has to insert the IUD. In total there are only 2 bigger cramps you should feel, one for her to measure, and one for her to insert the IUD. My twin sister told me that I was going to feel a strong cramp that travels down to your tailbone. She was right! My doctor told me to keep taking deep breaths through it. When inserted, the pain lasted for a quick 8-10 seconds. She said I was welcome to lay there for 10 minutes. When I got up, I felt fine. Overall the cramps went away within an hour. I felt totally fine the rest of the day. I have not had any spotting yet.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got the Liletta IUD in July 2017, at first it was great but I started noticing a little weight gain a few months after I got it. No big deal because I was only 119 a few pounds didn't bother me. Fast forward to a year later I am now 150 pounds, I feel sluggish, constant cramping, no sex drive and the list goes on and on. Let me remind you never in my life have I been more then 125 pounds. Even when I was pregnant I stayed down to about 150 pounds. I finally got it taken out! I'm excited to see if I lose the weight.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is an insertion review only! I have only had it for about 13 hours. I'm a 20 year old with no kiddos. I did not take any aspirin before hand like I maybe should have. I was also on the last couple days of my period (this means that the cervix is a little squishier so its easier to implant). So, the insertion was about as painful as I expected. There were 2 distinct pains. One was while she was measuring the depth of my uterus, the other was the actual insertion which was much more bearable. The whole procedure took less than 5 minutes. It took about an hour for the cramps to show up. Taking 600mg of aspirin is the easiest way I've found to keep the pain at a stand still. My bleeding also got noticeably heavier. All in all though I'm very happy that I got it. I'm a pretty forgetful person so the pill never worked out for me. I'm glad I don't have to worry any more. I will probably be back in the next 6 months to give an updated review.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted about two months ago and was absolutely terrified going in after reading the reviews. However, my experience seemed to be a lot better than most. I’m 18 have never taken birth control and have never had sex so it was definitely a little uncomfortable. I set up my appointment on the 2nd day of my period and was given a pill to take the night before to open my cervix. I also took lots of ibuprofen the morning of. Overall the insertion took about 3 minutes and only hurt for a few seconds. What I’ve been having issues with, though, is the spotting and cramps. My periods always have me horrible cramps so I didn’t expect them to go away, however the spotting and cramps are pretty frequent. I know I t takes awhile for the body to adjust to new hormones so I’m hoping these will go away soon.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I could not be happier with kyleena as my form of birth control. Before I got this inserted I tried lo loestrin (pill), and the nuva ring both of which killed my sex drive. The insertion process was easy for me, I cramped for about a day and had some light spotting but other than that I was 100% fine.  I got it put in about a month ago and have had a few random days of spotting but no significant bleeding.  Best of all my sex drive has recovered and I don't need lube any more.  10/10 would recommend kyleena to anyone looking for birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I chose Kyleena because of the material it’s made out of as well as the hormone levels. It also lasts 5 years but can be removed at any time if you decide you want to conceive which is something that me and my partner were really enthusiastic about. The only downfall of the IUD is the insertion. I had it inserted at 10 am and the process itself was miserable. I got up and went home but the next day I couldn’t even stand up. After 3 days the pain was completely subsided. My period has actually become super light. My cycle lasts about 6 days with one day being heavy and I need tampons. Other than that, it’s panty liners all week. I don’t cramp much at all and when I do it’s more just discomfort than an actual cramp. My partner has felt it during intercourse, but it causes him no pain or discomfort because of the material it’s made out of. I haven’t had any issues with displacement or it imbedding like I saw others had (other iuds). This was perfect for me in the long run.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla inserted for a year now and for the last couple months I’ve debated getting it taken out. I love how convenient and effective it is but I feel like it’s slowly making me crazy. I already suffer with depression but the mood swings I’ve had with Skyla are insane. I haven’t had any issues with spotting...or cramps. I barely have a period at this point. My skin isn’t terrible but I already have super oily skin and this definitely hasn’t made it any better. But mood swings and the depression is definitely a major con and I’d rather have my sanity back than leave it in. Anyone else suffer with crazy mood swings?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It's been one year since I had my IUD inserted...BEST DECISION EVER. I absolutely do not regret it one bit. I remember reading these reviews one year ago absolutely terrified by some of the horror stories I had read. The day of my appointment I did take 3 or 4 Tylenol beforehand. My doctor asked me what classes I was taking this semester, and before I could finish answering her she was already done! I barely felt it. I didn't have any pain following which surprised me considering what others have experienced. I have to admit, your period cramps with an IUD are PAINFUL. I had never experienced cramps prior to getting an IUD and they took the wind out of me sometimes. That is the ONLY con I have with getting an IUD. Also, my periods are almost a full two weeks now even after being on an IUD for a year. They are very light, but last a long time. I justify the IUD by telling myself cramps are better than going through childbirth. I recommend Kyleena to everyone.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena placed in December of 2017, I had no issues with insertion except deep and dull cramping while it was being placed. During sex, my boyfriend can feel the strings and describes it as a "stab", (side note: if he can feel the strings, you can get them trimmed). Before Kyleena, I took the pill first, and the the depo shot second. I forgot to take the pill multiple times and I reached my 2 year limit with the Depo shot. I also never got cramps with either of the previous birth controls! Since I have had Kyleena, I get headaches almost every day. I also experience bleeding after sex and also experienced bleeding while on Depo. I now have some of the worst cramping. While the Kyleena IUD is a good transition, it has still left me wondering what is happening to my body.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 49 and have had 2  sons (now adults) by c-section and had a tubaligation 18 yrs ago. I got the Kyleena for the purpose of hormonal issues. I got my insertion on July 10th.  The was very scary. I took ibuprofen and Tylenol before the procedure but I still felt the cramps. There were 3 all together and they got stronger as we went along.  My doctor suggested a muscle relaxer afterwards and that really helped that day and the day after. I  did have some spotting and cramps for about 72 hours. Now I have bloating and gas, some acne breakouts and leg cramps. But no more camping thus far. I hopeful everything will even out as the days go by.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD inserted April 9th. I was not been on any birth control for 10 years prior. I have PCOS & a tilted uterus. Since I have not had children, insertion was EXTREMELY painful like hands shaking about to throw up painful & I was very sore & cramping/spotting for 3 days. Then I got my period and after that I have continued to bleed. I have to wear a pad or tampon daily. I cramp & get random pains in my uterus. I haven't had intercourse since insertion. I had a recent outbreak of acne but it could be attributed to my recent increase in activity. I honestly can't say that I have had an actual period outside of that one because I bleed & it's more like a light period mostly there when you wipe. They gave me Progesterone treatments for 15 days 2 months in a row to help my body adjust. They had lots of horrible side effects but did nothing for the bleeding. I plan on keeping it for at least 6 m - 1 y to really give it a try.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had very irregular bleeding prior to getting Kyleena. I had the insertion in Feb 2017, which was very painful for me after a failed attempt one month prior. Apparently I have a smaller than average cervix. They had to use an ultrasound machine to guide the IUD in. I passed out and vomited from the sudden intense pain, but it only lasted for a few moments then bad cramps for about 15 minutes. For the next 6 months I had minimal cramping but almost constant bleeding. It was like a normal period with a week of spotting-light bleeding before and after my period with only a few days of no bleeding between them. It took about 9-10 months but now I have regular flow periods exactly 28 days apart with very mild cramping. The insertion and first several months of Kyleena were tough but now I get to enjoy regular periods and easy birth control for 3.5 more years. Definitely worth it, especially because most women are not going to have nearly the trouble I did and I’m still a fan.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):This was a horrifying experience with birth control. The insertion was so painful that I had thrown up immediately after the procedure and cried all night until I finally fell asleep from exhaustion. From then on I began having periodic pain that felt soul crushing and debilitating once a month. Went to four different OBGYN docs and got the your strings look fine speech every time. Exactly 1 year later after removal I found out that one of the arms of my IUD was bent upon insertion and had been digging into my uterus ever since. Only good thing about this BC is that I never ended up pregnant.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I chose Kyleena because it was smaller/less hormones than Mirena, but lasted longer than Jaydess(Skyla). The insertion was pretty painful, but only for about 20 seconds. Cramped up for about half an hour afterwards, but then I could ride my bicycle home no problem.I was unlucky and had bad cramps every day for about a month, not just normal period cramps, I mean bad enough to need to carry around a hot water bottle and stop what Iwas doing. A month later, the cramps just stopped. Now I only get mild ones a few days before my period. One downside was that my boobs shrank down a cup size, but I also lost weight - not bad.On the plus side, my mental health is WAY better. No more depressed/hopeless moods for no reason like I had on the pill. Also the 'strings' (more like fishing wire) tucked up around my cervix straight away and my bf can't feel them.Overall I love my kyleena and not having to stress over taking the pill every day. Totally worth the discomfort in the beginning.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My 16 yr old daughter got pregnant 3 Mo the after getting Kyleena. It was in perfect position. I’m not mad, I’m a grandma!! At 36!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just last month, I just had gotten over a really bad case of the stomach flu. I just had orthodontic braces inserted so I was barely eating already. My period came 5 days late (probably because I was severely sick). I thought great now I need my IUD inserted; the nurse wanted to make sure I wasn’t pregnant (the stomach flu did scare me to think I was at first)... crazy me got the IUD 2 days after I had just started to feel better. It was sooo painful immediately after I stood up from the clinic bed. Maybe it was because I was already weak... the cramps were so unbearable my bf thought I was dying. The cramps lasted for 2 days before getting slightly better. I just got my first period after the insertion and my cramps are still just as bad. I’ve taken 800mg ibuprofen and that didn’t help at all. Then I tried vidocin which also didn’t help. I really hope these cramps go away soon because I enjoy having unprotected sex with my partner. So glad I got it

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I only had Skyla placed for about 4 months, which isn't that long to have your body adjust to the hormones. I switched to this IUD after having taken birth control pills for about a year and 3 months. I wasn't a fan of this IUD's side effects. My skin isn't perfect, but I never used to have major break outs. With skyla, I started breaking out in areas that I never used to break out in around the time of my periods. I was spotting sporadically for the first couple of months, so my skin would just continue to break out. Also, I never used to get terrible cramps, but they just went from a 2/10 to an 7/10 on the pain scale (10 being unbearable). I also experienced intense cravings around the time of my period, and vaginal dryness. Lastly, my periods went from lasting 4-5 days to lasting 11 days, but they were light periods. Because my periods were so close together, all of these side effects would just essentially continue throughout the whole four months I was on it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):The first 2 to 3 months there was a lot of dark brown discharge. So much I was beginning to get irritated because it was like a never ending period. But, my doctor gave me some antibiotics to stop the discharge. Also, I would feel some mild pain in my ovaries. The pain was more prominent the 1st 2 months and has since went away. I love Kyleena now. There was no weight gain. I have light periods and I don't have to remember any birth control.  I would definitely recommend

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted yesterday so my review is just based on insertion and the day after. I will probably come back and review after I've had it 6 months to a year. Insertion wasn't as bad as I expected. I am a 21 year old and I've never had children. I took two extra strength tylenol about 30 minutes before my appointment. The most painful part was when she dilated my cervix, it felt like two strong cramps but that was the worst of it. During the actual insertion it just felt like some pressure. Afterwards I was fine for about 10 minutes and then during the drive home I had some pretty intense cramping and lower back pain. I also had some light spotting. It's been over 24 hours since insertion and my cramps started off pretty mild. They got a little more painful during the day but were very manageable. The cramps eventually went back to being mild and I haven't had any spotting today. So far, it's been a lot better experience than what I've read online.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Inserted 7/5 @ 3 pm on day 2 of period. No kids, on pill for 12+ yrs. Took 4 Advil before appt. Light flow, noticeably heavier after insertion. Insertion was VERY uncomfortable, but not unbearable. Worst part was opening the cervix but it took <5 minutes. Had cold sweats and felt lightheaded for a few minutes after. Brought my husband to drive home and I'm so glad I did! Experienced cramping right away which escalated to the level of intense menstrual cramps. Advil every 4 hours and used a heating pad. Day 1, a dull ache with some waves of stronger cramps and light spotting. Advil every 4-5 hours. Day 2, cramps and spotting were virtually gone. Advil every 8-10 hours. Still feel light aches and very minor cramps w/very light spotting. Something I didn't know before deciding on an IUD, the doc will advise no tampons for 3 days and ~1 week to become fully effective. So far, I'm happy with my decision to switch! Will update again when I've had it a little longer!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):When I first got skylar I had about a month of pretty intense cramping and then after that I would cramp each month when I ovulated and then on my period. I had a lot of break-through bleeding and spent about half of each month spotting. I also found myself having pretty severe anxiety while using skylar. It actually got to the point where I got the device out after about a year. My mood began to improve about a week after removing the device and I lost about 10 pounds in the first month after stopping use. I would not recommend this device, it was a nightmare and caused quite a bit of unnecessary pain and cramping.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 20, got the kyleena in this January as I was tired of taking a pill everyday at the same time. Insertion wasn’t bad at all. A slight pinch feeling while measuring the cervix but no pain during actual insertion. Everything was great for a while and my period disappeared completely. 6 months later and I’ve gained 10 pounds and my acne has been the worst it’s been in my life. I’m getting mine removed as soon as I can.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am a 19 year old, non-mother, in a long term relationship.  I received this birth control on June 29, 2018. The procedure though efficient was very painful. It lasted for about 5 minutes but it was enough to take my breath away from the cramps... The following night I had the worst pain I’ve ever experienced. I was not warned about this so it took me by surprise I figured I would be cramping BUT nothing like this. If I knew what contractions felt like then that would be how I’d describe the pain. It was immobilizing and came in waves of extreme pain and then my uterus would relax. I have above average pain tolerance plus I have a heavy flow/ painful periods typically so I know what painful cramps are like. It is July 8th and I am still experience intolerable cramps. I take  a lot of Tylenol back to back and that is what it took to take the edge off the pain. Side note: be careful when having intercourse I gave it a try and the string stabbed/cut my boyfriend.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Although it's worked well for a couple of my friends I had a bad experience. I had horrible cramps. A shooting pain down my right leg and a bacterial infection. I had it checked out and all seemed okay but was told that it sometimes happened. Something I didn't anticipate was bleeding gums. Although I have never seen it listed as a side effect I didn't have a problem with my gums until using Skyla. I'd be at work and my mouth would fill with blood. It was awful. The doctor assured me that it wouldn't cause that but once I got Skyla removed it was no longer an issue. Be careful. It's not for everyone and get a good doctor. Mine pretty much laughed my problems off.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Got this in at my 6 week appoinmentt after having my son in 2016. There was some cramping and spotting, of course, but that was to be expected. After that, periods resumed as normal..[my] normal timing, [my] normal flow.. Now, at almost 2 years, I think my periods have stopped completely. I'm not complaining though. As long as it does the job, I'm fine. Also, I will note that I haven't had any unusual weight gain or anything outside of my normal mood swings that come right before my period since having this in. It's almost like it's not even there, to me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This comment is purely about the insertion and few days afterwards. Unfortunately my doctor did not have any openings in her schedule so she had to place the IUD right after my period. Because of the time in my cycle and because I’ve never had children, my cervix was tight and she had to go in three times to place the IUD. The procedure was uncomfortable but certainly not unbearable, and I experienced two major cramps which then subsided in a few minutes. I wasn’t lightheaded or nauseous following the procedure, but I was crampy and had spotty bleeding for several days afterwards. So far so good. Take ibuprofen, hydrate, and eat a good meal before hand, and try to relax through it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Mirena for 3 1/2 years.  It was very painful to have it put in but I haven’t had a period since - well up until 2 months ago when I started cramping and bleeding.  I went to the doctor who told me this is normal and nothing to worry about.  Now I have my period every month for a few days again like clockwork but lighter and shorter than before I had it put in.  I have recently started gaining weight (could be age/diet/activity) and I have always dealt with anxiety and depression which hasn’t increased or decreased on it.  I wish they would have the warning that you can get your period again after so long so I knew not to freak out.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I tried this form of birth control as it was highly recommended by my doctor.  The first month my bf complained about feeling it.  Went back and had it trimmed by the doctor.  The very next month I couldn’t feel it so I went back to the doctor.  Turns out it turned sideways and I actually became pregnant.  They had to pull it out as it prevent my cervix from fully closing.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I love caffeine and alcohol, I never had an issue with it until I started being on skyla. Apparently the drug also increases your hypertension and cholesterol so I had to get rid of this birth control. I was having a-fib after only drinking one bottle of light beer which is 12 Oz. And whenever I ate a small piece of chocolate or drank my favorite Starbucks, I started having palpitations. Caffeine and alcohol never effected me before until now. Plus it messed with my heart and I'm only in my mid-20's. If you can't tolerate alcohol or caffeine anymore, or if your cholesterol levels got high, drop this drug immediately.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had the Mirena in the past for 4 years had it removed and successfully conceived my daughter just 4 months after removal. After I had my daughter I decided I’d try the nexplanon (implant in the arm). I had that for about 7 months and no joke I hated it! I bled for what seemed like the whole time, I was extremely moody, and gained about 20 pounds. So I decided to take it out and at the same appointment I agreed to get back on a IUD and decided with liletta this time. I’m so thankful I did! I’ve had it for about 9 months now and I love it! The bleeding from the implanon stopped 24 hours after having it removed and having the liletta placed, and I haven’t had any bleeding or spotting since! I have no mood swings, no cramping, lost the 20 pounds I gained, and my sex drive is great. The only side effect I do have is that my breast are sometimes tender for a few days but only last a few days! I highly recommend liletta.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had 7 children previously. Insertion was painless and easy. I can imagine, though, if one never had a child, it would be painful, probably, as that's what the Dr. indicated.  IUD's do cause me to have horrible acne...no way around it sadly. But they work well. Only use with condoms though. No method is 100 percent and you don't want to risk a baby's life with an IUD in.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena IUD 3 days ago and it honestly was not as bad as so many of these reviews made it out to be. I wouldn't consider myself to have a high pain tolerance, and I felt like it was essentially what everyone says - a decent amount of pressure and two intense period cramps that each last for like maybe 10 seconds each (if that). It went by super quickly! I almost cancelled my appointment because I was so nervous, but I'm so glad I didn't. All BCP that I've tried have either given me depression or made me super anxious/angry all the time so I'm hopeful that this won't happen with Kyleena.  As far as recovery goes, I'd say the first day I just felt like I had a bad period, the second day I got a lot better, but still felt crampy, and now I just have this full/bloated feeling with super mild cramps. I will update this post as time goes on!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Out of all the positive reviews on here, I greatly underestimated the pain of Kyleena. The procedure itself is painful at certain points like the measuring of the cervix, uterus, and the insertion. But the extreme cramping started after I got home. Like writhing in pain, I could not lay still and was crying from the pain. I had taken ibuprofen an hour before as recommended but that did nothing. We are a week out and I still get random contractions that take my breath away for about 30 seconds to a minute throughout the day. Some days are better than others, but overall I would not recommend if you haven’t had kids. They did not give me medication to dilate or numb at all like others have reviewed. I only got this because depo made me gain 40 pounds in 6 months, so if this doesn’t make the pounds drop I’ll have it taken out.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Had Kyleena inserted about 8 hours ago. For reference, I’m 19, in a long term relationship, never been pregnant or on birth control. I brought my mom with me for support (highly recommend!!). As for the insertion the pain was WAAAY less than expected. Granted I am on my period, was given numbing cream and had an ultrasound done to ensure the IUD was placed properly. I would say it wasn’t painful, just felt like one dull cramp. I had never had a Pap smear so the speculum was the worst part for me. After insertion, I rested on the clinic recovery beds for 15 minutes before heading out. I managed to go shopping, get lunch, and do errands for about 3 hours after before the cramps came. I‘m up to 7 Advil today and now back at home in bed the cramps are slowly subsiding. I won’t lie, they are the worst cramps I’ve ever experienced but overall, I‘m optimistic and can’t wait to be back rock climbing, hiking, and hitting the gym.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the Liletta inserted a year and a half ago to replace Mirena. I've had a LOT of side effects with this and they continue to get worse as time goes on. The positive: it's effective and I've had no weight gain. The negative: NO sex drive. I mean none at all. When my husband and I do have sex it is quite painful. I also have cystic acne and I've never had this before. The breast tenderness/pain is pretty bad. As another reviewer mentioned, even being in the shower I can't bear to touch them. As far as my periods...it's different every month. Some months I have one lasting 5 or 6 days but it's old blood and that honestly grosses me out. Other months I have 2 or 3 periods lasting 3 or 5 days. The cons by far outweigh the pros for me so I'm having it removed soon. No more IUD's...the insertion process has been really painful both times and I don't care to go thorough it again. Back to the pill I go!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the kyleena for about two months now , I got it because my nurses recommended it over the mirena , the first two weeks or so was perfect. I spotted the first 3 days after that  it was normal sex was perfect, then my first period came and every since I haven’t stopped bleeding. Some days it’s light some days I have to convert from a panty liner to a pad . I hate it . I’m trying to stick it out but my husband isn’t too fond of the blood lol . So I’m creeping on to month 3 with still bleeding . Idk what to do but I’m hoping it’ll stop soon cause it’s uncomfortable.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I chose this mirena as a birth control to be inserted 8 weeks after I delivered my 1st child. To have it inserted was a BREEZE! My doctor recommend to take ibuprofen 30mins prior to my appointment because of the immediate cramping that follows. I just so happened to be on my 1st period after pregnancy which makes the process a whole lot easier for the  doctor.  No pain or discomfort, just slight pressure. I was perfectly fine talking and laughing. Took 3 mins to be inserted. Immediately I felt a slight cramp in my upper abdomen so I was glad for the ibuprofen. So far, I've had slight cramping randomly, 2 heavy migraines, and slight mood swings. I've read HORRIBLE articles about the Mirena prior to getting it but I made sure to be educated by my doctor of the possibilities of what could go wrong and only being recommended for 1st time mothers. I return for a 2 week check up to make sure my body hasn't rejected it and its still in place properly.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Today I just received my Kyleena IUD placement. The biggest thing I wish to share is you should find someone experienced!!! I can not say that enough. I am a 22 year old female and last year I had my first pap by a general doctor it hurt so bad and I bled for 3 days afterward. This time I went to a nurse practitioner who had placed over 1,000 and was very knowledgeable. She not only guided me to kyleena versus other forms of IUD’s by explaining the differences in them. She also was quick and very gentle. The process of getting them in is you take medication to dilate your cervix, you also do the placement during your period. Once there they open everything up spray a topical numbing agent and then measure and place. It didn’t take long and it was crampy and hurt a little during placement it subsided in a minute. She warned me before each part and it went very well. So far I am just a little crampy today but not in a lot of pain and I don’t even feel it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion of Kyleena was painful- two distinct moments of pain followed by dizziness, faint, and vomiting. I was really faint all day and had to take the day off to rest and felt mild cramps for the next couple days. Was back at work the next day. It's been about a month now, and I've had some spotting, but am back to exercising and doing my regular routine. Overall, really positive experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena exactly 1 week ago.  I was scared because I started watching YouTube videos. I was told I will only be in the worst pain during the insertion (by the way I’m 21) once I got there my doctor was so nice and talked me through it and was there for me when he started it wasn’t really much pain but then the worst pain of my life hit me. They kept telling me to breath in and out I started crying it was horrible it felt like the longest 1 min of my life. When done I was okay and I even drove myself home but when I started walking to my driveway that’s when everything hit me. I couldn’t walk I had the worst cramps and then I had to go to work. After that day I was fine for the rest of the week No bleeding no cramping nothing I had little spotting but that’s it. I even had sexual intercourse with my man and he said he can feel the string. But it was fine. I got my period again yesterday and it wasn’t a good feeling . Cramps are back and I’m bleeding so much pain .

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had Kyleena for over a year now.  For the first 6 months, saw a lighter and more regular period but more spotting in between.  Minor cramps that lasted about 9 months.  At this point, I no longer have to worry about spotting and cramping regularly.  The only complaint I have is that I spot during and after sex, which was never an issue beforehand.  Otherwise, I am happy that I don't have to worry about taking a pill or using protection.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Thought I'd share my experience on the Kyleena. I've had it inserted last Thursday so I can only talk about the insertion and the couple days after. The insertion was not as painful as I expected it to be. The Kyleena was placed during my menstruation. Beforehand I took 2 ibuprofen and that worked perfectly fine. I was told I would feel 3 pains / cramps and I only felt them for a few seconds. The insertion took around 5 minutes and with a few deep breaths it was very bearable. Don't be scared about it. Every body reacts differently but don't be too nervous.After insertion I felt fine. I drove home by myself. That evening I felt little cramping but decided not to take painkillers as it was bearable. I wasn't sure if the cramping was from the Kyleena or from menstruation. Now 2 days after I still feel fine, the cramping is gone, my menstruation is almost gone. I am happy with the Kyleena so far. I'm very curious to see how my body reacts the coming weeks.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena worked perfectly at preventing pregnancy and virtually got rid of my periods. However, I got horrible acne and cystic acne all over my body. Within three months it was full blown all over my body. I waited it out over a year but it never got better. Within two weeks of getting Kyleena removed everything is fading and I have yet to have a new breakout.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is a review about insertion only! I've read so many negative experiences about insertion, so I wanted to share my positive one. I am 19, have never had children, and went in when I was NOT on my period. I took ibuprofen beforehand, but I was still so nervous. I was really expecting something horrible, but it was virtually painless for me! There was a slight cramping sensation that to me felt like a normal period cramp, and it was over in less than 10 seconds. I know everyone is different, but I thought I'd let everyone know that it is possible to have a positive experience and it's worth it to give it a try.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted almost three weeks ago! Yes, putting it in is painful but it only lasted maybe 7ish minutes. And that’s better than being in labor which lasts longer! I had slight cramping day of and have been spotting here and there! But other than that it doesn’t bother me. I initially went in to get the Paraguard, then got talked out of it because of all the side effects. And I’m SO glad I did! Everyone’s body is different!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted one week ago. Never given birth, was taking oral birth control before. The insertion was EXTREMELY painful. Laid on the table for 40 minutes shaking, sweating, feeling nauseous and faint while having extremely painful cramps. I had bad cramps before but not to this extent. The day after was still having pretty painful cramps taking 800mg of ibuprofen EVERY 4-6 hours. Only mild cramping 2-3 days after. Now I’m starting my period and the awful cramps are back. Hoping after my period the cramps subside if not I don’t think I can handle this. May visit the dr sooner than 4 week check up if the cramps continue to be debilitating. This sounds like a horror story because it is but this is just my experience only one week in.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Do not get if you are prone to vaginal infections or have any STDs as it will make them flare up.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is mostly just about the insertion of Kyleena because I have only had the Kyleena in for a week. As far as the insertion itself, it wasn't that bad. I took 4 Advil before and my doc told me everything that was happening and it was just two big pinches. What hurt the most was the aftermath when I stood up. I laid down for 5ish minutes before getting up, and when I did I was having the worst cramps of my life. But they stopped after 2 hours with some rest and heating pad.  After that, they just became regular period cramps occasionally. After the first day, I felt fine and was just spotting. I've started to bleed the past few days and have bled through my pants a few times not expecting it! So be careful and wear pads! So far, I'm pretty happy with it. Don't let the negative reviews make your decision because the pain is different for people. I will come back and review after longer on it and see how it goes!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted in early April  2018 after having a scare on the pill as well as severe cramps and heavy bleeding during my period which lasted about 10 days. I didn’t take anything beforehand. I felt a slight pinch when inserted and a wave of nausea but after laying on the table for a few minutes flat on my back I felt fine. I was on my period during insertion. Had no problems leaving the office. Only slight cramping and way less bleeding then a regular period was for me (I could go through about half a box of Super Plus tampons on the heaviest day of my period and sometimes I would still bleed through from bleeding so heavy). I have had acne issues on my chin prior so no acne worries. I don’t feel greasy. Sometimes I will get large painful pimples random places but only one. My bleeding has got lighter and lighter and it’s now June 2018 and I would have had my period by now, it feels like I’m on it but no bleeding. It’s like a phantom period. Overall I love it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Let’s start with a disclaimer- I’m 19, no kids, and got Kyleena today. Granted, they prompted me before hand that because of that, it would be a little more painful because the opening of my cervix had never really been stretched. The insertion was one of the weirdest pains I’d ever experienced. Some people say it feels like cramps, but I have really bad cramps every month, and that’s not exactly what it felt like. It felt like getting poked up there with something really pointy (they had to use a plier- like object to stretch and measure my cervix), and then she inserted the IUD, which also hurt. Long story short- I screamed. Like yelled bloody murder. But overall the entire process took about 5-10 minutes, I had cramps for maybe 5-10 minutes after that and it’s been about three or so hours. I was well enough to walk about a mile and a half back to my residence, and the only sign of anything was a tiny bit of blood. I put a pad on and so far so good. Hopefully it works out!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got mine to ensure I can do my whole post secondary degree with out worry about birth control.  And it's amazing.I'm not going to lie it hurts a little going in, but it's nothing you can't handle. The pain in is a split second and hurts less than the dentist.  The risks are so minimal and its cheeper than pills in the long run.its absolutely worth it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just had the Kyleena inserted an hour ago. I'm a mom to a 5 month old and I felt absolutely no pain. No cramping, so pinching, I did take two acetaminophen beforehand. I think this is a GREAT option for new moms! It was painless, there was some blood, but I was in and out in less than 10 minutes.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve been on the liletta for a little over two years, much longer than I should have! I love it for the convenience but that’s the only good thing about it! I’ve never in my life been overweight but since I’ve got this thing I’ve gained 30 lbs!! This is the heaviest I’ve been all my life. Aside from that I’m constantly moody, angry & depressed. I’m in constant fatigue, and feel like I need a nap everyday. I didn’t think these effects were because of the IUD, but with further research I found that there is a ton of women with similar experiences. I will make an appointment to get this thing out of me ASAP!!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got mine August of 2017 and so I've had it  10 months. Getting it inserted wasn’t too bad I felt a pinch and a cramp and then it was done. A few minutes later the cramps were so bad I couldn’t move they were so bad. To this day the cramps I get are immobilizing and over the counter meds don’t help. My Kyleena has also given be 3 yeast infections. I still have my period and the cramps during my period are even worse than before I got my IUD.  It is effective definitely but the pain I go through is terrible. If this comment gets to anyone I hope you take what I said to heart and try to find a less painful option for yourself.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I didn't take any meds before insertion.  It is was quick. I did feel a pinch.  Afterwards cramped a few times.   Lasted only about 30 minutes.  Spotted for a few hours. Was able to drive home.  I have had it for 1 year.  No complications. Still have a menstrual but not my normal 8 days.  Now it's sometimes 3 sometimes 4. It doesn't bother my sex life.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got mine inserted today but the least they could do is tell you that it hurts really bad.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So I'm a little over year 2 of having my skyla inserted. I have birthed 4 boys my youngest being 3 now. I loved this IUD but in the beginning my husband would complain that he could feel something poking him which kind of killed our sex vibe. I had them trimmed by my OB and his complaints  didn't happen as often. One thing that I realized which after reading some comments on the skyla is that, I don't want to say I've gained an excessive amount of weight since my last kid but I find that I'm having a hard time losing weight. I've been going to the gym almost 5x a week for 1 hour and changed my eating habits and I expected to lose a little bit of weight and I haven't. I'm really thinking about going to have it removed and just plan on getting my tubes tied. I still have my period but some months its super light and only a few days and others its normal. Has anyone found since having the Skyla that losing weight is hard?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted today and I'm not even going to lie to you.... that pain was no joke. The doctor pinched my cervix to get it to open for insertion and it felt like my insides were pinched with super sharp tweezers. I took 2 ibuprofen, but that feeling was so intense it made me jerk back. The actual insertion of the IUD basically felt like the same super sharp feeling and then I had pretty intense waves of cramps the rest of the day. My boyfriend also almost fainted so pick wisely who you bring with you haha. It's been nearly 12 hours since insertion and I'm feeling a lot better, it just feels like mild menstrual cramps now. I don't know if I have a low pain tolerance, but I've had my nipples pierced and a rib tattoo and this definitely hurt more than both. Though the experience wasn't a good time, it's only one uncomfortable day of my whole entire life and I'm protected for 5 years, so that definitely makes it worth it!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion was painless and quick for me did not feel a thing but, keep in mind all woman are different because my cousin said she felt extreme cramps. The recovery was terrible for me. I had irregular bleeding for 6 months and pelvic/ cramp pain. Meanwhile my cousin had no irregular bleeding and her period stopped. After recovery my period was back to normal came on time every month and they were lighter and I notice no more cramps like I use to get with my period before the IUD. I do sometimes get mild pelvic pain and that’s because a foreign object is inside the body. It just reminds me oh yea I got an IUD haha. Sex is the same only thing different is my partner can feel the strings depending on the position. Skyla must be doing it’s job though b/c I’m not pregnant! Skyla for me was worth it after the recovery.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had my Kyleena for 5 weeks now and I love it! I had Mirena previously for 2 years (moody, lost sex drive) and then I was on Yaz after. I have no children and my doctor thought the insertion might be better with Kyleena than Mirena due to the smaller size...it was NOT easier. But, I have not bled at all, I have lost some weight, have a better sex drive, no more headaches (caused by Yaz). My skin is more oily than before, but I have adjusted my skin care routine and it is not a problem. When I had my Mirena, I was terrified of it poking my boyfriend, so I asked my doctor to cut the strings quite short. I actually think this made it worse for my boyfriend, as when he did make contact with it, it was with the sharp ends. With my Kyleena, my doctor left the strings longer and they are curled around my cervix, so when he does feel it now (very rare), it is the softer side of the string, so it is less painful for him. Overall, insertion sucks but it is soooo worth it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kyleena placed in me in October 2017. I did not have pain as insertion took place. I do have a very high tolerance for pain.It was uncomfortable but was not at all in pain. I bleed for weeks. I spot monthly but as of late, I've been spotting consistently for over a week and now I noticed I have dark spots on the skin of my inner thigh ( spotting has been usually 3 to 5 days). As of late, I, as well have been getting what I describe as pressure pain. I've had it less than a year. But now it definitely makes me uncomfortable to even have relations with my boyfriend so thinking there is no point in having it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion review:Everyone’s body is different! My insertion was an absolute breeze and a great experience (I have no children and I am 18. Find a good doctor!!) . It certainly wasn’t comfortable, but was NOT as painful as expected AT ALL!! I took deep breaths, talked to my OB during it, and the most uncomfortable part lasted maybe a minute.After:Definitely had some cramping after. Totally expected tho. I’ve had it for two days now, and honestly I’m noticing a positive difference. I’m happier, and feeling more intimate towards my boyfriend than I had been on the pill. And it’s only been two days!! I’m hoping this is an awesome choice for the whole five years :) Overall: I’m extremely pleased! If your pills aren’t working, please consider this, especially if you’re young!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I just had my 2nd IUD removed today and a new one placed. I had 3 children before the first was placed and have found placement and removal to be no big deal. Just quick cramping feeling. I had no adverse side effects and love having no periods. Good luck to anyone trying it, hope your experience is like mine

Skyla (levonorgestrel):This IUD, sadly, didn't work out for me. I had it taken out 2 days ago. The only reason I give it a 2/10 is because it did prevent pregnancy, which was nice not to have to worry about. However, it wreaked havoc on my body in almost every other aspect. I got terrible acne, random sharp pains in my abdomen, periods that lasted up to 2 weeks, severe mood swings, gained weight, and  had absolutely no sex drive. Look, don't get me wrong, I think IUDs are a birth control option worth exploring, but if you are at all sensitive to hormones in birth control like I am, I'd steer far away of this and look into the copper IUD.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have had the mirena IUD for nearly 5 years now. Due to be removed in 10 days time and looking forward to the end of this chapter in my life!Here are some issues I have had with the Mirena IUD. I've gained over 20kgs since having the mirena IUD. My self confidence is at rock bottom. Lethargy. Zero energy and cannot get enough sleep. On top of looking frumpy, and feeling tired - I developed horrible cystic acne. As a teenager my skin wasn't even this bad. The acne began around the 2 year mark, and got consistently worse over time. I tried remedial facial products, healthy eating, lots of fluid - unable to clear the acne, get the weight to budge. Only recently have I linked it to having the Mirena IUD.I haven't had a period which has been great, but not worth the side effects that slowly creep up on you. Cannot wait to get this out!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is just about insertion. I took 4 ibuprofens beforehand, I felt discomfort the whole time. I had 2 sharp pains but they didn’t last very long. I did bleed more than I thought I would. The cramping stopped being bad about 30 minutes afterwards.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m 19 and had recently went to see a gyno as while I was on the pill I had strange side effects like unexpected bleeding and headaches. The pill just didn’t work well with my body so she recommended Kyleena to me as it was everything I was looking for.  I had the insertion today and honestly if you are scared about getting it I would say just go for it. I took painkillers and the two cervix softener and the insertion itself would have been 2/3 minutes with a slight bit of pressure but no pain. After I had the same cramps as I would with a painful period but nothing that painkillers couldn’t make manageable would definitely recommend if you're on the fence

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Mother of three who chose to get Kyleena as my birth control method. Being that I had 3 babies within 6 years I wanted to get something that would prevent me from getting pregnant again. The insertion part didn’t take long. I got the IUD put in April 6, 2017 so it’s been over a year now & I’m scheduling to get it removed because I still have my cycle and have cramps occasionally. Overall I heard that IUD isn’t good for women’s bodies. I’ve seen stories of women who had an terrible experience while using an IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I read a TON of reviews before my appointment and was extremely anxious that I would be in debilitating pain when I got home and not be able to go about my normal routine. The entire thing took 2 minutes and I would not say it was painful. There was slight pinching and pressure, but never pain. My doctor told me what she was about to do and I would take a deep breath and was focused on that instead of what she was doing. It did not hurt. There is cramping almost immediately after the doctor finishes. For me it was only slightly more intense than first day of my period cramps. I went about my normal routine when I got home, and then for the rest of the evening I did have a heating pad on me. Woke up the next morning feeling great. I've had it since Friday 6/15. I would recommend Kyleena, don't let the reviews freak you out!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'll have had Kyleena for a year come September.Cons: The insertion was very painful for me. My boyfriend nearly lost his hand in my vice grip and I was in a ton of pain for about 2 weeks after, with occasionally bad cramps for 2 weeks after that. Personally, I was constantly paranoid about perforation or ejection, but luckily none of that happened.Pros: At this point, I can say Kyleena is extremely effective at preventing pregnancy as it claims it will do. My bleeding has stopped and I only very rarely have discharge of any kind. No more pads or tampons for me! Whoo hoo!Overall: If you're willing to take the plunge, just relax and get it over with. It's worth it in the long run.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I am 19 years old, maybe 5-10  pounds overweight and overall healthy minus the horrible periods I had been getting for years (the pills didn't work for me...they messed with my thyroid). I got the Liletta yesterday. Impressed so far. I took misoprostol (cervical ripening pill) 3 hours before, ate a good meal, and took 600mg motrin about half an hour before insertion. Yes, it hurts. I hate pain but I could deal with it. Feels like a horrible period cramp for a few seconds, maybe 1-2 times. I was able to drive myself home right after. Cramps were painful and my back ached for about 6 hours after insertion. Had some diarrhea but that could've been because I ate Thai Food before. I was barely spotting too. Today is day 2. Cramping is very light and I don't really need advil. Bubble baths, yoga poses, and heating pads are working just fine. I am used to horrific period pain, so maybe this just isn't bad for me. Hoping everything will continue to go this way!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had my Sklya for almost 9 months. I love it. My experience with Skyla has been great. Insertion was not bad at all (24, no kids). It went very quick, was slightly crampy and then it was over. The months following were also not bad. I get a regular period, but it is VERY light, to the point where I am using panty liners or light tampons. It comes at the same time every month and lasts for 4-5 days. The reason I gave Sklya 9/10 is for a couple reasons. 1) Acne. I notice I struggle with acne more often than I ever have. 2) Cramping. Even with a light period, I still cramp way more than I ever have. Sometimes they are deep cramps that I have to pause and breathe through. Occasionally, I get cramping in between periods, but for the most part the cramping is either the week before my period or during my period. However, those two things don't keep me from loving Skyla. I love the convenience of it. I also love that I don't feel hormonal, or moody as I have on other birth controls.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I am 32, tall, slightly heavy, never had children.  I had liletta inserted in April 2018.  It is now June 2018 and I've been bleeding nonstop the entire time.  The insertion process was honestly the worst pain I've ever felt in my life.  I chose an IUD because I wanted a method of bc that would be consistent without my having to take a pill everyday.  I've never had strong menstrual cramps before, but with liletta in, I experience cramps continuously.  I've had the heaviest flows of my life, mood swings, my sex drive has vanished, and I have acne worse than I had as a teenager, especially on my back and shoulders.  I'm looking to get this thing removed in the next week or so and just use condoms because it isn't worth it to go through this discomfort and pain.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had posted my experience before when I first got this IUD inserted. Fast forward 6 months later I LOVE it. Yes, it had it's up and downs but I kept with it. Well my body was adjusting I bleed for sometimes 2 straight months which yes is a lot and was about to get it removed but I rather put it up with it. Now going on with the 6th month I have yet to get my period which is normal from what I have read. As well as I have yet to go for the month check up due to not working at the time but I could feel the strings. Just some information about myself, I'm 21 no kids and not wanting any at the moment. Before I got this inserted I had read the comments DO NOT LET IT FREAK YOU OUT like I was - each person is different. As far as side effects some acne but minimal to a couple but that is nothing that has bothered me, no weight gain. Of course I understand each person is different this is just my experience. Will update after a year. Overall at the moment 9/10

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My experience with Kyleena has been nothing but a struggle. I had debilitating and nauseating cramping for nearly 12 hours after insertion. I’m almost 9 months into having this. My periods are still wildly out of control. I bleed for 10-12 days straight (my periods were 5 days in length prior). I got the Kyleena because of my horrid cramps, and it hasn’t helped at all. I have acne worse than when I was a teenager. I’ve set an appointment to get it removed. Nothing is worth this hassle.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 21 and have never had children. I was very worried about the insertion procedure after reading others bad experiences. I took 2 Advil prior to insertion. The procedure took maybe 3 minutes tops. When the Dr. inserted a probe to check the size/location of my uterus I felt a very strong/painful cramp that subsided after a few seconds. Then when the device was inserted I felt a similar cramp that also quickly subsided. Overall, the insertion process was not bad at all and nothing I think anyone considering the kyleena should worry about :) Immediately after insertion I began spotting very lightly and had very mild cramps. Other than that I felt 100% fine and was able to continue on my day as usual. I did notice that I felt very exhausted that evening. I have now had the kyleena for three days and have had no bad experiences. I still have very light spotting and a few minor cramps.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Skyla wasn't for me. I will say though, you should give it a try if you are looking to switch birth control methods. I had my Skyla in for a little over two years before I decided to have it removed. The insertion process was extremely painful to the point I almost passed out. After it was inserted I experienced cramping like never before in the weeks to come. Super sharp localized pain in my uterus that I would have to lay down with ice packs and take Advil. My periods went from always being 3 days to literally 7-9 days. Cramps were unbearable for nearly 2 weeks of the month. Sex eventually started to hurt and it's like I could feel the IUD inside me. I didn't experience other symptoms such as weight gain or acne. For me, the intense cramps, long periods and painful sex finally made me decide to get rid of it. Removal process was also a bit painful and I felt so much relief once it was out.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):After experiencing complications with the Nuva Ring, I decided to switch my birth control method to the IUD. I had a choice between copper, hormonal, and non hormonal. I chose Liletta based off of the list of side effects/risks I was given for the different types. The doctor who inserted it for me explained that it is normal to bleed irregularly for 3-6 months after insertion, so I was not too concerned when I bled irregularly (only slightly heavier than my normal flow) for about 4-5 months. She also explained that it could increase my flow, decrease my flow, or that my period could eventually stop. She also said that my cycles between periods were likely be thrown off and/or would become longer. I spot (for a day or two) every 6-8 weeks now, compared to my original on-the-dot 5-7 day long, moderate flow period every 3 weeks.I have a feeling my periods will stop altogether soon, as my periods have lightened immensely and my cycle is starting to lengthen.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Honestly, not sure how to rate this. I have had it for 6 months and up until recently been doing fine with it. Insertion was worst pain I've ever felt. But afterwards cramps that were easily controlled with Ibuprofen. I stopped having period a few months ago and no cramping which is great since I suffered every month with severe ones. But, the problem is I think it has caused my ulcerative colitis to flare up first time in 5 years. Also, my lower abdomen is growing and no amount of dieting is changing this. I'm not putting on weight, just watching my abdomen grow and not get smaller at all even first thing in morning. When I mentioned this to my husband, without mentioning Liletta as a concern of mine, he said that he has seen a difference in my mental state since having it inserted. He says that I lack joy and seem unhappy. I agree that this is how I feel and I have zero sex drive. I just want to be left alone. So as for being a good contraceptive, I give it marks for that.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hello! I got my Kyleena IUD put in last September and the initial insertion wasn't bad. It felt like a sharp pain and the it went away. Reading the pamphlet my dr handed me beforehand is what almost made me faint lol. Afterwards I had on and off spotting (which was kind of annoying) BUT after some weeks it STOPPED! When my period is supposed to start I have a little bit of cramping and barely any spotting which I assume will completely stop in a few months. Sex is no different than it was before! Your supposed to check your strings once a month but after my first month I couldn't feel mine so I went to the Dr and he said it's fine. But as soon as you have persistent pain that won't go away go back to the Dr.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):INSERTION STORY:I got Mirena inserted yesterday at my local Planned Parenthood. The insertion was VERY painful. I would rate it an 8/10, with 10 being "pass out" pain. Luckily, it lasted for about 3 minutes total. I admittedly cried and broke out in a cold sweat uncontrollably on the table, but remembered to breathe which saved me...remember to breathe!! I had to stay laying on the table for about 5 minutes after it was done because I felt dizzy. Honestly, I think my reaction was both a combination of pain and nerves. I read A LOT of horror reviews online before that appointment. Word to the wise: Don't psyche yourself out for an experience that could be drastically different from someone else's. For a few hours post insertion, I experienced a couple dizzy spells, and for the past 36 hours I've been spotting and cramping mildly. Would I do it again? I'll update at the three-month mark to tell you how it's going!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my Kyleena inserted yesterday. I’ve previously had a cervical biopsy and Loop Electrosurgical Excision Procedure (LEEP), so I was expecting the pain to be comparable to that. It’s actually a lot easier which was a relief. I took the pills to soften/dilate my cervix because I don’t get a period on the pill. Insertion wasn’t pleasant but pain only lasted for a few seconds. It’s not sharp, but more of an intense, deep cramp. I was able to get up and walk right after. The worst part for me was the drive home. I forgot to take pain killers before the procedure, so the bumpy ride had me in tears. Once home I took pain killers and was fine.The day after insertion I experienced nausea, headaches, and excessive sweating. These are all typical period-like symptoms for me, doc says it’s just my body adjusting. I was told it could take 3 to 6 mo. before everything "settles." Hopefully it will be sooner!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena in February of 2017 and had it removed in April 2018. This worked pretty well for actual birth control, but it gave me horrible side affects. I have never had bad acne and after a few months with this I was seeing about 20 pimples on my chin at once. It also started to make my hair fall out. I was scared to wash my hair because I knew so much hair was going to come out every time. It also gave me yeast infections ( which I have never had before) and changed my pH balance so much that the skin down there would sting and bleed. I've had it out for a couple of months and my body is still trying to get back to normal. I was excited to try this out, but it all it did was make things worse.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla IUD inserted in late June 2017. I have mild PCOS and irregular periods. I went on Skyla because my period was lasting sometimes 14 days at a time. It was light, but it still felt too long. I chose Skyla because I wanted a low-dose hormonal birth control. I've done at least 4 or 5 different oral contraceptives in the past and Nuva Ring. I had not been on birth control for over a year before Skyla. The insertion wasn't bad. I felt nauseous because of the local anesthetic and had some cramping the first month  after, but it was easily controlled with ibuprofen. I started spotting frequently and sporadically only to realize that those were my new "periods" that have lasted sometimes 23 days. I kept waiting for it to normalize but it didn't. The spotting continued. I am switching to Kyleena today, and I don't know if it will be any better than Skyla, but I hope it will. It has been a year and is showing no signs of regularity.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted about 2 weeks ago. I've never been pregnant and this is my first time on birth control. The insertion was extremely painful and uncomfortable. I felt faint, nauseous, and had extreme cramps immediately after insertion (much worse and uncomfortable than my normal menstrual cramps). I continued to have excruciating cramps every day for a week following insertion. Finally, finally, finally the cramps have subsided. I still have occasional cramps but nothing like that first week. I have spotted everyday since insertion, but it gets lighter everyday. My partner does feel the strings during sex (painful for him) and I plan to talk to my doctor about getting them cut a bit shorter to fix this. Although it's started rough I'm hopeful that symptoms will continue to fade away over the next couple months.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have now had the Liletta for 6 months and will be getting it removed  in a few days. Since insertion I have experienced a plethora of side effects. Insomnia, cystic acne, anxiety, breast tenderness, weight gain, brain fog (I can't even remember what I had for breakfast), headaches, mood swings, hot flashes and night sweats. It is just not worth it to me anymore. I have done some research on the Paraguard and have decided that I don't want to risk  using it either. I will stick with condoms and planning around my cycle. My family doctor was reluctant to schedule my removal and claims that these side effects are not related to the IUD. I 100% disagree. Please do some research and some serious thinking before choosing this option. I look forward to getting my body back to normal, sounds like I will have a bit of a uncomfortable detox before that happens.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve only had the Kyleena for about a month now. Period started May 14th, got it inserted the 17th of May. It is now June 11th. I do realize it takes about 3-6 months, depending on the person, for symptoms to start laying low. But for some background about my period, it was super regular, super light, and I never experienced cramps. If I did have cramps they lasted maybe one day out of my entire cycle, super small cramps. Ever since I had gotten the IUD kyleena, I have been bleeding ever since my period started and after the insertion. Super heavy and annoying. My cramps are like nothing I have ever experienced, back pain like no other, my depression is through the roof. The IUD was my last resort, every other BC made me gain weight and made me a nasty person. Bleeding for weeks straight has put a lot of stress on my body. I’ve lost weight and have no energy to do anything but sleep and go to work because I have to. Being 19 and extremely sexually active this is super irritating

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Don’t do it. I can’t believe I let the doctor talk me into getting Skyla; I originally went in for the copper but she talked me out of it because I’m 17 and I haven’t had any kids. It has the same hormones as the nexplanon basically: progestin. When I had the arm implant a year ago, I had it for 7 months and attempted suicide, had hair loss, and my acne returned (even after being on accutane for 6 months), and I gained 15 pounds. I took a break from birth control and switched up to Skyla and it is the dumbest decision I have ever made. It’s only been a month and I’m always crying as I can feel the depression already sneaking its way back, whenever I comb my hair or run my fingers through I get about a dozen strands coming out and my acne is, once again, horrific.  If you are already on Skyla and going through this, you are not alone.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for 2.5 years before I finally had it taken out. The insertion/ removal were both fairly painful. After insertion, I spotted for a month & felt generally uncomfortable. The random cramping and bloated feeling never went away. Sometimes I would cramp really badly and be doubled over in pain- but this would pass in a few minutes so it wasn’t a deal breaker. I dealt with all this because I loved having a birth control that didn’t make me nauseous for once. The deal breaker was that I gained 10 pounds.
