I work out 5 times/week, follow a healthy diet, and no matter what I did, I kept gaining weight. My doctor denied this had anything to do with the IUD and instead blamed my getting older. Well, I listened to instinct and got it removed on Wednesday. It is now Saturday. I have lost 5 POUNDS in 3 days. I’m not saying everyone’s experience will be the same, but listen to your instincts and remember you have a continuous medicine in your body. I am SO THANKFUL I finally did.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Hate this IUD. Got it put in almost 3 years ago. The pain from insertion was bad but not the worst thing I have experienced. However, I now have terrible cramps every time I have my period (never had cramps before) and my periods have gotten progressively longer and longer. I'm currently on day 11 and I'm ready to rip my hair out. The only upside is that I haven't gotten pregnant, but part of that could be because for 2-3 weeks of every month I'm on my period and don't have sex.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had 2 Mirena's and recently switched to the Kyleena.  I took 3 Ibuprofen prior to the visit.  I had the Mirena removed and the Kyleena inserted and I had minimal pain which I would say was more like discomfort.  I am not sure if i just have a high pain tolerance or if it was the Ibuprofen, but I have never had the painful experience that I am seeing from some of the others here.  I normally do not write reviews, but I want to make sure that people know it is not a painful experience for everyone.  And if there was a little pain, it is so worth it.  I have not had any cramps or any bleeding since the day of the procedure. I have loved the Mirena for the past 10 years, mostly not having periods for 10 years and I am hopeful that I will love the Kyleena the same.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I definitely should have checked reviews before I decided on Kyleena. Insertion was not that bad for me. The only discomforts were the placement of the speculum, and the when the actual device was put in. There was a serious cramp for less than 30 seconds, but it felt like my normal period cramps since they're always debilitating. My periods were ALWAYS regular, and I only had cramps day one and heavy bleeding day two. They never lasted longer than 5 days. NOW after Kyleena I have been bleeding and cramping everyday since insertion. My breast are swollen, my moods are shifting, and my weight is going up. It's only been 3 weeks so I'm waiting until my 6 week check up to see what happens with the symptoms, but I plan to get it removed if they don't subside. The daily cramps are too much for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got it about two months ago. The insertion does hurt but it’s nothing out of ordinary and the moment where I felt pain lasted less than a minute, it felt more like a sharp pain than a severe cramp. My first period after the insertion lasted for 11 days (usually it’s like 5) and I have been a bit more hormonal and tired than normal but I guess it’s just my body accommodating. Two weeks after the insertion I saw my doctor for a check-up and she said my IUD had moved farther up than where she placed it, don’t know why but apparently it’s nothing to worry about. I did feel pretty odd in the beginning,  but now I feel completely normal and I don’t have to worry about taking a pill every day and feel confident about it’s effectiveness. You can have a rough couple of days but it’s worth it, and if you’re scared remind yourself that all those bad things happen very, very, rarely and that usually people who had a good experience don’t take the time to write up reviews.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena today, since it's recommended to go when you're on your period. I took Excedrin Strength an hour before going. When I was getting the IUD inserted I felt like I was going to faint. And for the hour after I felt very uncomfortable and nauseous. I waited 4 hours until I could take 2 more of the Excedrin Strength, and went to work. Was perfectly fine and able to work. Hopefully I don't experience any bad side effects

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted a week ago today, and so far I love it! My doctor prescribed me a medication that was supposed to soften my cervix. I also took Tylenol about an hour before my appointment. When my dr came in, she put an ice pack on my stomach to ease the pain a little bit. The insertion process only took about 5 minutes, and it did hurt. It felt like the biggest period cramp of my life, and that’s saying something because I have always had bad cramps during my cycle. The biggest issue for me was relaxing. Once I was able to relax, the pain almost disappeared completely. The cramping lingered for about 4 hours after the procedure, and I’ve been completely fine ever since. I have been spotting pretty much every day since the procedure, but I heard that that’s normal and should go away shortly. The first two or three times I had sex afterwards, it hurt pretty bad! I wasn’t expecting that, but it feels totally normal now. I love my Kyleena and would recommend it to anyone!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got the kyleena inserted today so this review is really just about the insertion, however it was the easiest insertion ever. I didn’t feel anything maybe because my period cramps are always super bad so this was nothing compared to that. Also I have had two kids and it’s pretty small so could be why. However so far so good no cramping and no bleeding. Will update back in a month or so once it’s settles in.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This birth control IUD has gone really well for me, insertion was kind of painful but not as bad as I was expecting. The first day I had cramping pretty bad, but after that no bleeding or cramping from insertion. My period hasn’t really changed either, my mood hasn’t changed, and I’m glad I don’t have to worry about it every day, weeks or months.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is about insertion ONLY. I'm 21, and was on Yaz (a birth contol pill manufactured by Bayer as well) for 3 1/2 years and the on Alesse 2 1/2 years before that. I haven't had children and I had Kyleena inserted the first day of my new cycle. The insertion process we very painful. It took them a little bit to find the top of my uterus (a me problem) and that felt like moderate level cramping, then once the IUD was inserted I felt an extremely bad cramp for about 1 minute. After that, I didn't experience any severe cramping. That day and into the next morning I did feel a little crampy- nothing I couldn't handle thanks to tylenol. I did however experience some major moodiness.I haven't experience anything negative so far. The cramping and moodiness went away on the second day, I did not feel bloated. I haven't experienced any weight gain, I lost a few pounds. I didn't develop acne. I still feel the occasional weak cramp but it hasn't been that long. My sex drive remains the same.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am 18, I was a virgin, I had acne and horrible mood swings WAY before I got the skyla IUD, I got it  because of a natural  hormonal  imbalance. So I got the skyla and it wasn’t painful at all, no kids nothing, I didn’t bleed the first 2 weeks, I was due for my period and only spotted lightly (not even enough for a pad or tampon I would just put a little piece of toilet paper in my underwear it was that little) and that was it. So far I’ve had it for 3 and a half weeks and I’ve only spotted for like 2ish days, sex was fine he couldn’t feel it we did however wear protection (we’ve been together 2 years both of us were virgins and we made sure we were both tested and safe, and literally waited 2 years to have sex in case someone wants to judge). Anyway so far I love this I’ve had a tiny bit of cramping, nothing serious at all. I haven’t had it for long but so far I really like it a lot.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is just insertion!! I have never had a child before and I get really painful period cramps. I am so happy I read some reviews because I was not able to drive afterwards. I was nauseous and in pain. The cramps were so much worse. And insertion took about 15 minutes and was quite painful. Which I think is because I have never had a child. I came home and took about a 4 hour nap and still a little bit of cramping but feel soo much better. Will write another review in a month or so explaining if I like kyleena. But so far so good!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted on Jan 19th. I was on the pill for 7 years before and loved it but didn’t want the hassle of remembering a pill everyday. Insertion hurt but bearable. I puked afterwards - I think just the shock of it on my body and cramped bad for 4 hours. After that didn’t spot and had random cramps. I had 3 pretty regular periods and by month 4 I just had cramping during my period time but no bleeding. I had a string check in April and my strings are very short so I cannot feel them. Biggest thing I’ve learned is to just trust your IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I forgot to take any pain reliever before insertion, but the pain wasn't too horrible. I did experience cramping before and after for a while, but then I was fine for a couple days after. However, I'm starting week 3 on Kyleena and I have been spotting everyday for about a week. I have also been getting random cramps throughout the day, and it can get pretty painful. I've never spotted before or have had awful cramps, but I heard this is expected for the first 2 weeks. Regardless, I'm still happy I got it, since I kept forgetting to take my pill. I have been more sensitive lately (I've become a crybaby), but I'm confident in my decision.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena was recommended to me by my OB-GYN, I did my research on it and ended up going with it. The insertion wasn’t painful at all, but afterwards I had bad back pain and cramping. I chalked it up to common side effects and I was accepting of it. But I didn’t know that it took away your sex drive almost completely. When my husband and I are intimate, if he goes too far back it feels as if I’m being stabbed in the cervix. It feels like he’s pulling on the actual IUD. My OBGYN has checked on it twice with a sonogram but nothing is out of place. I’ve never had any other issues and it’s obviously extremely effective birth control, but the lack of sex drive and pain during intercourse has made me seriously consider going back on the pill. I just don’t want to risk getting pregnant by accident again!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I liked the Liletta for its convenience - not worrying about periods or pills anymore was amazing. I found that I experienced some pain for about a year after insertion; just mild cramping. Insertion was painful, but not as terrible as I've heard it described. Like intense, bad cramps for about 5-10 seconds. Unfortunately, I was one of the rare cases that developed an ectopic pregnancy while using Liletta. Fortunately, it ruptured very early and actually resolved itself without intervention, but was still painful and scary. I guess I'm giving a mixed review. When it works, I think it's great. But nothing is 100%.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After having the Kyleena for 4 months now I can honestly say that it is great!!! The insertion was intense due to me having the Kyleena insertion three days after my period. I had to be excused from work for one day and returned the next. I suffer from endometriosis in which I have very heavy periods. A month into having my Kyleena my periods are very light just spotting and I only bleed for up to 4 days. Even though I experience some heavy cramping during my periods.... to not experience HEAVY bleeding means the world to me. I'm still waiting to become period free but until I'll just be happy with joy that I am experiencing right now with my Kyleena.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I was on the pill for years, and wanted something different. I tried the ring and hated it, so I decided to get over my fears of the IUD. Honestly, the insertion wasn't as bad as what I read. It felt like the worst period cramps and I couldn't do anything about it, but it didn't last long. I had some spotting for a few days and slight discomfort. But after about three weeks I completely forgot it was there. My periods have been light and a little late but I'm still only two months in. I will get bad lower back pain once my period is coming but it's nothing that I can't deal with. Overall, there are some drawbacks, but compared to other birth control methods this is definitely something I recommend and will be keeping.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just wanted to share my experience with Kyleena, before getting it, I had excruciating periods, like missing work because I was throwing up, pain. Since I used to painful cramps, getting it put in wasn't that painful to me. I did take Tylenol the night before, and afterwards, I did have slight cramps that day, before but was still able to go about my day, even went to a haunted corn maze haha.I had pinching feeling cramps when I’d get my period with kyleena for about 6 months, I’m at month 7 now and no longer have a period so I’m incredibly happy with it and have zero regrets in getting it. Best decision of my life!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After reading these reviews on Kyleena, I feel really lucky. Insertion was certainly somewhat painful, but manageable. My doctor had me place a heating pad on my lower abdomen for about 30 min prior to the procedure and I think that helped. I had light cramps and spotting for about three days after, but beyond that, absolutely no trouble. I've only had it about a week, but so far, I'm really excited. This may be the best thing I ever did.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I’ve always had really thick hair so the first and second year my hair was thinning I really didn’t mind, till about the 3-4year I noticed a front bald spot. Losing all my hairline fuzz. And not to mention the acne. And finally the worst 5cm cyst.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ll get to the point. For my experience there was no pain felt at the insertion time, it felt like a normal pap check up to me. I had a recent c-section and got this after the baby I’m now 3 months post partum  and still bleeding due to the IUD but no pain and it is starting to taper off and now it’s spotting but it’s every day. I was told I would not have any periods while having the IUD but I’m still hoping that can be true. Pretty ok experience for me I’m just hoping it works over time. No meds on the market work for everyone so I’m not in any pain and as long as I don’t get pregnant any time soon we are good to go!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So after reading a lot of negative reviews, I thought I would leave a positive one. A little back ground, I am 28 with no children and no prior history of an IUD or implant. I was on the pill for a while but it got to the point that I was forgetting to take it on time; so I looked into Kyleena. I had mine placed about a week ago with no issues. Insertion was painful however, it only lasted about a minute and then it was over (thank goodness). Since then I have not had any problems at all. No cramping, bleeding, or spotting. I made sure I took my aleeve an hour prior to insertion and then four hours after and laid on a heating pad just in case. Time will tell how it will continue to work but as for as insertion and the week after, I would recommend it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for about 2 weeks now and my insertion process wasn’t too bad. There were 3 major cramps during the procedure and small cramps after for a couple of hours. I bleed for 2 days but nothing major just spotting. But going on my 2nd week of having it I started my period and it is heavier than my usual and also longer. This is very disappointing being the fact I just had a child and was bleeding for 5 weeks after that so to turn around and start bleeding again is a miserable feeling to say the least and the fact that it is heavier and longer than my usual period just makes matters worse. I’m going to try to stick it out for at least 3 months to see if there are any changes with my period but if not I will be getting it removed.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I decided to try Skyla because I was sick of having my period and can't get pregnant. Getting pregnant could seriously could kill me with my high intracranial pressure and small veins in my brain. I have been so pleased since insertion. I have had it in for 8 months now.  I had spotting at first and my Ob Dr told me to go back on the pill for 1-2 months and it helped all the spotting to go away. I have not had a single period in the 8 months I have had it in place.  I am planning on keeping Skyla in place for the full 3 years. I may even opt for another one since I have no symptoms. Insertion was painless but I have had 2 children already so that is probably why.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I LOVED IT!!! Best decision I ever made. I’m young, very active, involved in sports & go away a lot. So taking the pill was always bad for me. The insertion only felt a little crampy. Then they gave me a shot to ease the pain. I went in for 2 different check ups & everything was perfect! Most days I forget it’s there. No reason to worry about the pill. I haven’t experienced any weight gain or acne. Which is great!!! My last periods have been GREAT! No cramps, less flow. The only thing I would warn is you WILL spot quite a bit for the following 2 months after insertion. That is TOTALLY normal. And then it goes away. I feel so great & love having painless periods. I would recommend this to anyone! Young or old. Whether you've had kids or not. It’s the best ever!!! Plus it last 5 years! The best thing!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Okay I’ve had my Liletta for a year before I got it taken out (today). For the first three months I bled nonstop. After that I felt fine. Then the side effects slowly but surely hit me one by one.  After the non stop bleeding for 3 months I then started to get reoccurring yeast infections/ bacterial infections every month. I also gained 50 pounds, had horrible hot flashes, blurred vision, brain fog (TERRIBLY) , literally every symptom you can think of. I had it real bad and it's like every month that goes  past the side effects got worse and worse. My moodiness, NO sex drive, and low energy (VERY LOW) almost cost me my relationship and job. I literally didn’t feel like myself anymore. At first I did like it but then I started to get alarmed I didn’t feel like myself but the crazy part of it is, what really drove me to get it out is the HORRIBLE SMELL I WAS GETTING IN MY VAGINA. It smelled like something crawled in and died I couldn’t bare it anymore. I felt like people could smell it through my clothes.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I thought I would leave a review for kyleena... I just had it placed in an hour ago so this is insertion only... I read so many horrible things online about it I was sooooo nervous to get it done I barely slept the night before. The procedure started with a pap test, then she located the opening to my cervix. I didn't feel a thing until she measured and when that happened I felt a cramp for maybe 5 seconds (not even a bad cramp I just knew someone was in there) and then she placed it in and I felt a very small pinch when the arms where released and she placed it in... that was it. I would hardly even call it uncomfortable. I do have some cramps now but it's not different than the period cramps I experience on my first day. No 10/10 pain, no fainting, no vomiting. Just a slight inconvenience and that was it! If I have negative side effects that come up I'll post again!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena for four months and now it was (finally...) taken out. Really irritating four months. I had a lot of bleeding or at least a lot of spotting every day, except for two weeks running and a few single days. I could not even  tell when I had my "real" period. I also had a lot of period like pain. At the end the pain was daily. For the first three months I also had some kind of patches of rash in my forearms, which I don't usually have. As a "bonus", I physically felt almost nothing during the very few times we had sex. So, Kyleena did NOT work for me. The doctor who took it out reckoned my body did not like the extra item in my uterus and tried the whole time to get it out. Hopefully the experience with Kyleena can be a lot better for someone else. Personally I can not recommend this type of birth control. (I have given birth once, two years ago.)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had to have Kyleena inserted twice. Both times, the insertion wasn’t bad. Just felt like a bad cramp but if you take some ibuprofen before and just breathe through it, it’s fine. (I’ve never had kids before). So the first time around I used my diva cup after the insertion and I think it might have caused it to partially expel. So I had it removed. Let a month go by, then I got it a second time. It’s been two months since I’ve had it and honestly...no problems really. I spot from time to time but nothing unreasonable which is nice since I used to get VERY heavy periods. However, I have noticed that the cramps are worse and they happen outta the blue. It’s manageable though, I just carry some Advil on me. Overall, I’m super happy with this Kyleena. I had a month of feeling bloated after getting it but that levelled out once my body was a bit more adjusted. I definitely recommend this to others.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had my Kyleena inserted about an hour ago. The insertion was the worst pain I’ve ever felt in my life!! Driving myself home was terrible, too. I had no idea how painful this process would be. I felt like I was going to faint and when they pinched my uterus I almost jumped off the table. Once I got home, though, I took some Motrin and I’m starting to feel a bit better. I’ll update once I’ve had this for a few weeks!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted over 2 weeks ago. The pain was excruciating, yes. I took ibuprofen 600mg before the procedure and I really think it helped alleviate the pain after. For 7-10 days after I had bad intermittent cramps. I usually get horrible horrible cramps with periods,  so this was nothing in comparison.Since then, kyleena has been great and no problems, no infections, and no pain. I hate hormonal birth control due to side effects (acne, weight gain, bloating, depression). But with kyleena, its been fantastic. Very happy I got it!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have been on Liletta for 3 months now.  The insertion was painful but not unbearable, be sure to get it inserted on your period and take some pain meds before you go. So far I really like it. I don't have to think about BC when I have sex. As for side effects: 1. The spotting was horrible! But I fixed that with some Advil (research ibuprofen to stop IUD bleeding). 2. I do feel extra moody or sad sometimes but nothing too crazy. I feel moody right before my period. 3. I do get odd mild cramps every now and then, but again nothing crazy. I tried 3 different BC pills before which gave me crazy side effects within months 1-2. I used to use the caya diaphragm which was all natural but too much work. I like this IUD so far. I gave it a 8/10 as it has only been 3 months. I do still get my periods-which are now 10 days long! I hope my period regulates in the months to come.
Skyla (levonorgestrel):Non stop bleeding with Sklya!!!! Interfering with my sex life. Random painful cramps. It gets the job done though soo I guess it's ok.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for almost the full 3 years. There was some pain at insertion, but nothing you can't breathe through. Deep breaths helped and it was very quick. I went to work immediately after, with mild cramping throughout the day. Afterwards, my period was regular, with maybe slightly more intense cramping on the first day. I didn't have any other side effects (I've taken other birth controls that make me an emotional mess - not so with this one). It's been great to not have to take a pill every day. I recently had Skyla taken out and have replaced it with Kyleena (it lasts for 5 years) so we'll see how that goes.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had my six week check up after getting Kyleena and I think it was the best decision I could have made for birth control. I’m going to be up front, all the reviews I read scared  me bad but it wasn’t as bad as I imagined! I went in terrified! Yes it did hurt but I also have a high pain tolerance so don’t go in thinking it won’t hurt because it does. Normally during periods I have terrible cramps so it just felt like my normal period cramps that wouldn’t let up but my DR did it pretty quick and once she was done the cramps calmed down. I had bad cramps for a few days but still went to work and did my daily routine. I haven’t spotted but two days out of the six weeks and I’ve lost 7 pounds since getting it put in. Everyone is different so you may not have the same experience as me but don’t be terrified by all these experience!! Remember in the long run it’s definitely worth it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 27 years old and have never had children. I have only had Kyleena for about 1 week, but wanted to share my insertion experience. I took 50mg Tramadol 1 hour before my appointment and it was still awful, but my doctor was pretty quick and let me lay down for about 10 minutes after until I felt okay to leave. I wish I had asked someone to drive me, as I had to pull over on my way home due to intense cramps and dizziness. I had veryyy intense cramps for the rest of the evening, although hot water bottle helped a little. I still had pretty bad cramps for 2 days after, but they are finally getting better. I have had no bleeding, but have had a brownish discharge. I had sex 3 days after insertion, once the cramps were better, and it was fine, just slightly uncomfortable at times, but no bleeding after. I will update my review after I have had it for longer, but so far the insertion has been the only negative.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my Skyla about a month ago and so far I’m not pleased. I did take 600mg of Advil  before. I was not on my period during insertion. It was like having the worst cramp ever for about 3 minutes. The cramps after and for the rest of the night were the worst I ever had in my life. It would come in waves-I’d end up on the floor in tears. The next day was not nearly as bad- I thought it was over. 4 days later I started my period and it lasted for 11 days w/ bad cramps. Normally I go for 2-3 days. I saw my doc for a check as I’ve been having sharp pain on my lower left side here and there and spotting. He said everything looked good but didn’t do an ultrasound. Cramps again after his exam and the next day I started bleeding again! Having some bad cramps and off and on bleeding 4 days after the appointment and I’m starting to feel helpless. I was expecting some symptoms-I’ve had difficulty with hormonal birth control in the past but nothing like this. May have it removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had kyleena for about 6 months now. Having it inserted was horrific as was the cramping about a week after but I got through it. I thought I was over the worst of it after about a month when the cramping stopped but then I started having a whole bunch of other weird symptoms. The worst of which is the back pain. I've been getting back spasms unlike anything I've ever experienced. They've caused me to become almost bedridden for 3 months now. I am nauseous all the time and have no sex drive anymore. Drs have told me this should probably go away by the 6 month but it is all getting worse. Going in tomorrow to have this horrible thing removed. I don't want to knock anyone from trying it cause some women love it, but I was on depo for 3 years and thought it was so much easier and less invasive. I only switched cause my dr told me I had to, I won't be going back to that dr!!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the skyla and made sure it was in the right spot every time! Check during showers and scheduled appointments when I was told to, to make sure it hasn't moved. I found out 6 months before it was going to expire that I was pregnant! It was in the right spot but I still got pregnant. I ended up having a miscarriage right before mother's day of all days to have one!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Ok so I have had Liletta a little over a month...but the insertion wasn't awful like I scared myself into thinking it would be, I mean anything being put up there is likely going to hurt and someone's pain tolerance can be a huge factor on how much it hurts...but for me it wasn't bad. I got it put in the second day of my period and it literally stopped my period by the next day. I have had no spotting, no cramping, or any other issues and when the next month came due for my period no period and no pregnancy either as I took a couple tests just to relieve my mind. Personally its been great for me and my husband has loved that it seems to have given me a better sex drive as well since that was a regular problem with other birth control before switching to this. Obviously everyone will have different reactions to any medicine, but I really recommend giving it a try if someone is looking for a more long term birth control that they don't have to think about as much.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Keep in mind Kyleena or IUDs are NOT for everyone. Here is my advice. If you experience real pain during your annual checkups with the smallest tools, avoid this. I tried to get it and the truth is I am too small. She went to measure my cervix and only got part of the way in before I was screaming in pain. In fact the pain was so bad she refused to do. She didn't even get to my cervix. If you try and the pain becomes unbearable right off the bat... stop. There are other alternatives like nexplanon. It's an arm insert and it does everything the same as Kyleena except arm instead of cervix. I know some people its great for and they feel no pain. However if you are smaller inside unfortunately like me it is a bad idea.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):This is a review on the insertion. I just got Skyla inserted yesterday 5/18 and I had minimal pain. My OBGYN told me to take ibuprofen before hand (which I did 1000mg). I felt a slight pinch and some pressure but nooo way as severe as other people have experienced. I haven’t had any cramping since insertion ( been about a day so far). Some slight spotting but that was to be expected. I am experiencing some slight bloating going on for some reason but nothing too bad. So far I have no complaints. It feels great to be released from having to take a pill everyday!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had a great experience with Skyla. It is removed now only because I had it in for a full 3 years. The insertion process was discomforting and I had minor pain the day of insertion. After that, I had a little cramping from time to time. But my period went down to very little. I only needed to wear a panty liner during my periods and they were reduced from 5 days to 3 days. I really liked that part. No discomfort during sex. I recommended it to a friend and she got it too after having issues with Mirena. She loves it more than me. We both had children prior to inserting Skyla. I love it and highly recommend it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I just had my mirena 2 and half hours ago for the first time.  I didn't search or had no idea that I will be in such pain while inserting it.  Up to now as I am writing this I still feel cramps and bit numbness on my arms.  It is a weird and painful feeling.  After couple of hours I will have ultra sound as the doctor recommended. We will see how it goes. Hopefully my body will get use to this because I'm freaking out about all the side effects  that I have just read.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena inserted four months ago and I can tell you it is a great investment! Insertion was very painful, yes, but it was tolerable and short. Cramps following for the next two weeks, but I think it was WELL worth the few weeks of pain and meds for the five years of not getting pregnant. So far, no major side effects -- light cramps here and there, very light and easy period, a few changes in acne but nothing crazy or not worth it. Sex is much better for myself and my partner, although my sex drive tends to fluctuate. Don't let the fear of pain and insertion stop you from getting this IUD -- it is one of the most effective BC methods and has little room for error. Try it!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Hello! I am 22 years old and got my Skyla IUD January 2018 at a planned parenthood. The insertion was not as bad as I thought. It felt like a very sharp and localized period cramps. It was definitely an unpleasant experience but focus on breathing to relax. The month of February was kinda brutal in terms or cramps and spotting, but honestly I didn’t focus on it too much so it didn’t really bother me. By March my cramps were gone and so was most of my spotting. I checked my strings pretty frequently and got checked at the doctor twice just so they saw the strings but ladies DON'T freak out over the length of the strings. My periods are on time + 1 day, and I have noticed they’ve gotten longer (7 days) but lighter blood flow. Don’t get the Skyla if you get unsettled easily about your body experiencing unexpected and more persistent things like cramps or spotting. If those things don’t bother you that much, definitely get an IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I need to remind everyone that although there are horror stories about IUD insertion. My experience wasn’t painful at all. I went through stories of how bad it was for most women. Mine felt like a mild cramp when they measured my uterus, but the insertion was absolutely painless for me. Everyones bodies are different, my uterus was measured before and my doctor said it was 10cm long. So I guess it’s big compared to average size. Don’t let other peoples story change your decision. I think the  IUD is a great option for many women. Do your research and good luck!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Just an update!Have had Kyleena for over 1.5 years now and am so happy. Worst side effects I experience are back acne from not being on estrogen (not directly caused by Kyleena, caused from previously being on the pill which surpressed it) and occasional GI discomfort / cramps.I recommend this to anyone. Everyone is different, yes, but I haven’t had my period since insertion (rare but more common with prolonged use) and never have to worry about pregnancy or tampons. Amazing IUD!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Was so scared to have Kyleena inserted because of the reviews but I had absolutely ZERO pain. 2 hours before the procedure, I took a long hot bath and 1 hour before procedure, I took ibuprofen and rubbed Clary Sage essential oil over my uterus area. I had a male doctor but he was very professional and kind about my being so nervous. Afterwards, did have a bit of bleeding and MAJOR cramps the next day. I also have endometriosis so the cramps were nothing new to me. Took about 3 days altogether for the cramps to go away completely and now I forget it's there. Do have spotting still but nothing that a panty liner can't handle. I wanted an IUD after practicing Natural Family Planning for a year because it's much easier and more reliable for me. Will update after 3 months! For now, would say don't be scared by the reviews!! Everyone is different. Prepare for the worst but hope for the best!!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I recently had the Skyla inserted after having baby #2. I almost didn’t get it because of the horrible reviews regarding the pain. My OB used some sort of liquid for numbing... not quite sure what it was but before I knew it he was asking me about summer vacation and he was done. I felt nothing at all. I will say I’m going on month 2 and I’ve been spotting since I got it. I’m going to give it another week or so and call my OB to see if there is anything I can do to stop it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Hi,  I am 20 years old and have had Kyleena for almost 3 months now! My experience with getting it inserted was great! I was so worked up and nervous about it hurting but I didn’t even feel a thing! I worked a few hours later and was worried about cramping. I ended up have very light cramps which wasn’t bad at all. I do cramp every couple weeks and it’s usually when I get ready to spot for a couple days. I don’t have a regular period, just spotting every now and then. When I cramp, it’s always on the left side of my utuerus which I thought was a little weird but they aren’t anything I can’t handle. I’ve noticed that I have actually lost some weight, and my sex drive has increased quite a bit! I haven’t had any issues with acne and I actually feel like my mood swings have died down and I feel like I’m almost always in a good mood! Overall this birth control has helped me tremendously!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Before I had Kyleena inserted (April 9th) I read these reviews and was absolutely terrified. I’m here to tell you about my amazing experience! I was on Yaz for six years, but got changed to the generic form Nikki which made me SO moody and emotional. I was mostly nervous about the pain and what side effects would come with Kyleena. Yes, there was some discomfort during the insertion, but it was quick. It wasn’t painful for me, just more uncomfortable. For me, the hardest part was the cramps afterwards. I was really crampy that day (couldn’t go to work type of cramps) and then pretty bad cramps for my next period. I cramped and spotted for less than three weeks and it has already stopped my period (second cycle since I’ve had it in)! My sex drive is normal, NO mood swings, and I haven’t broken out or gained weight. I was incredibly nervous before, but now I keep saying how I wish I would have done it sooner!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got the liletta to help with inflammation in my uterus and heavy painful periods. Insertation was painful but didn’t last long. Spotted on and off for the first couple months. It’s been 9 months now and for the past 2-3 months I’ve had the brown old blood / discharge constantly. I can’t wear light clothes or go without pantyliners. No sex drive but when we do have sex it’s uncomfortable. I want to have it removed. Not sure the constant brown old blood is better than the heavy periods!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion wasn’t fun because my doctor struggled so I broke out in a cold sweat. I experienced cramping for that day and spotting for about a month. After that it’s been smooth sailing. It’s been 2 years since I had it inserted. My partner does say that the strings hit him sometimes but it doesn’t last long. My periods became lighter at first and at the 1.5 year mark basically disappeared, which is normal. The freedom Skyla gives me is amazing. Also  before I had skyla inserted I suffered from ovarian cysts so bad I couldn’t walk and although I sometimes still get them, they are significantly less painful. I highly recommend it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I would not recommend this birth control. Next month makes one year with it, and I have hoped it would eventually get better.... going next week to get it removed. My side effects are-adult acne -weight gain- ovarian cysts-abnormal periods (sometimes every two weeks then two months will pass and not have one and pretty bad cramps with each period) - bleeding after intercourse Insertion was difficult for me because my ob/gyn found out I had a tilted uterus. Instead of just a few minutes to insert, it took them about 15-20 minutes. It was VERY painful. The only thing I enjoy about this is not having to remember to take a pill every day.  :(

Had IUD inserted during last period. A week or so after my period was finished bleeding  then started again. Have now been bleeding medium to heavy for 15 days. Also began to have symptoms of what felt like a severe yeast infection. Nurse practitioner told me it didn’t look to be yeast and tried to tell me it isn’t the IUD and maybe was just due to my age (40). Ya right.  I had it taken out. After some research I’ve come to the conclusion that I am having an allergic reaction to the device or the levonorgestrel. The pain, swelling, itching, mucousy discharge have been insane. Yeast meds are not working and pads/tampons are a no go because it makes everything so much worse. Have been wearing skirts only for 2 weeks now. Have tried aloe gel and cold packs which seems to be helping a tiny bit. I guess it’s going to take time for the meds to drain out of my system. Hoping this won’t go on too long.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got this put in around 5 hours ago and it seriously was the worst pain I have ever felt in my life. I was shaking, sweating, and virtually screaming. I don't know if I'm just a wuss but my appendix bursted last year and I can tell you getting this thing put in hurt so much worse.  5 hours later I am in bed still crying and don’t want to move. I was on my period during the insertion and took advil 30 minutes beforehand. Honestly considering going to the ER because I don't know if I'm okay.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Had mirena then kyleena ...both have terrible cramping and consequences but if I had to choose between the 2 then I guess mirena (but vcf (Vaginal contraceptive file) or foam probably would have been just as good and way more comfortable)

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Before Skyla I tried 2 other forms of birth control. Tried pills- which are hard to keep track of. I tried a birth control ring- ok but very expensive. I really wanted birth control for the obvious reason... not to have a baby. I mainly needed help because my periods without were crazy! Insane heavy periods- I’m talking hemorrhaging. Anyways I opted for Skyla because it was something I could forget about and lighten my cycle.The insertion of the IUD almost made me puke, but it was over with pretty quickly. For about 3 months I spotted AND THEN No periods at all! It was great! By month 8/9 I noticed I was spotting again and cramps were back. They range from mild to sharp pains on either side. I had check up after check up to ease my mind. I’ve had this IUD for about 2 years. My acne is worse than high school & my hair thinned out. The last few weeks I’ve spotted one week, off for one, and right back to spotting. Today I’ve scheduled a gyno visit and I’ll have this removed.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had a great experience with Kyleena thus far. I will let you know, though, that the insertion will be painful. I had 800mg ibuprofen prior to the procedure. I also requested my gyno to prescribe an anxiety medication, so I took that prior as well. It’s a good idea to have someone drive you, especially on anxiety med. The insertion will take only a few minutes, and the few seconds of pain is totally worth it. After the procedure, I didn’t feel pain, only felt bloated. However, I still took tylenol. So far I have had Kyleena for a month. Before Kyleena I was not on any form of birth control. I feel empowered to know that I don’t have to worry for the next five years. Anyway, my three friends also have IUDs and they Iove them too.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena almost 3 months ago. The insertion process was painful for me, I almost passed out due to the pain. I would describe the pain as really severe period cramps (like the worst cramps you ever had in your life). I felt like this for probably 3 days after the procedure. Since then my periods have been unpredictable. It comes whenever it wants and I bleed for a long time (this month was 9 days and this feels like an eternity compared to my 2 day periods when I was on nuvaring). I'm hoping that within the next few months my period will become short and light again. Other than that its been fine. PMS is down to a minimum, sex drive has increased.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla placed on Aug.15, 2017 after the birth of my first son (June 29). The placement wasn't bad, but my midwife did have to dilate my cervix again. Had some pretty good cramping for about a day and bleeding for about a week.At the end of Oct. 2017, I missed my period but figured it was the IUD has I could still feel the strings.   Late Nov. 2017, I checked for the strings and couldn't feel them. I waited a day to check again but still came up empty. I called my midwife and was put in for an appointment two days later. My midwife couldn't find the strings either and ordered an internal ultrasound to check placement that very day.    I found out I was almost 10 wks pregnant (ZERO symptoms) and the IUD had moved into my uterus, It wasn't safe to remove.  I'm CURRENTLY 33 wks pregnant with baby #2 and have had no issues with this pregnancy relating to the IUD.  I would STILL recommend, I was the FIRST person the past COUPLE OF YEARS to get pregnant on the IUD at my hospital.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I LOVE my Mirena IUD. It honestly has been such a relief to me. Before I had gotten it, my periods were extremely irregular since I started when I was thirteen. I wouldn't get periods for two to three months at a time. So I tried the pill but I had to get taken off of it due to my migraines. I was seventeen when I first got my IUD. Now I have a high tolerance for pain so getting the Mirena placed was a breeze. They used ultrasound and were finished in less than five minutes! About a half hour after I left the office I had extreme cramping. Most painful thing I have ever felt, but it only lasted about two to three hours. After that for about three months I had light spotting. Now I don't have any bleeding after having it close to two years,  but I do get the occasional cramps here and there, but nothing significant. It really just depends on the person and what is right for them, but I always suggest the Mirena to all of my friends and family members!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the skyla placed almost 3 years ago. I'm due to have it replaced in a few months. I had the Mirena previously and it caused so many cysts I had it removed and went with the skyla. Insertion was painful! I had to be dilated to have it inserted and I've had two kids.  I experienced some cramping and spotting for about a month on and off after having it placed. After that I regularly had a light period or no period at all some months until it became completely nonexistent. Overall I feel like this is a great birth control. It has done wonders to help keep my endometriosis in check also! I have experienced the acne, weight gain or mood swings/depression others have mentioned but everyone reacts differently. I would definitely recommend this IUD. I just wish it lasted longer than 3 years!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):The insertion was really painful. I was in pain the whole day. The next day I was better but I was cramping and felt lazy and dizzy. The day after that I was back to normal until I had sex. The first time he didn't feel it as much to where it bothered him. The 2nd time he hollered because it pinched him. I'm getting it removed this week and get the pill

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):It has been a breeze . Have it 5 months now and the best decision I have ever done . During insertion it was slightly uncomfortable but after that it was great . Has no affect on sex life . Once you check your threads you're in the clear

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Okay so I got Kyleena placed on 5/2/18 the placement wasn't bad I took 4 Advil an hour prior. Bleed for 2 days then was spotting brown. On that Saturday (5/5/18) starting at midnight I started to feel such bad pain mostly like pressure down there. Pain killers weren't helping and I was bleeding so much I was changing my pad twice an an hour until the next next at 10am it stopped bleeding so heavy.  And let's not forget the size of blood clots I was passing !!! Then today comes 5/7/18 I woke up at 5am with pain again didn't go away medicine wasn't helping, 2 hours later I felt something come out of me. A blood clot with the IUD inside of it !!! Probably the worst feeling ever,  I've never used birth control before this was my first method but I will not be putting another one of these back inside me. Worst experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Okay so I've had problems with all birth control so going with this big decision seemed the smartest.... so I thought. I've been on kyleena for about a month now and let me tell you I can handle pain pretty well. But when they clamp your uterus wall I died. It was the worst pain I went through and I took 2 extra strength tylenol and it did nothing. That whole day after getting it inserted I couldn't leave my room. I was in so much pain I took so much pain killers and it did nothing. Still to this day I have severe pain where I have to leave work cause I can't stand up. On the bright side I've lost 16 pounds. And my ache is amazing!!! But this pain I get I can't take it anymore. I can't lay down, or go to the gym anymore cause if I do any sort of exercise It makes me in so much pain, and I can't even have sex cause it hurts during and after when I do. I thought this was a good idea but this pain is too much to handle.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got my liletta inserted January 3rd and I’ve had it for almost six months now. I absolutely love and recommend it. I have no acne, no weight gain, no mood problems, only about two periods, no problems with spotting. I only get cramps around the time I usually have a period and a bit after sex. Insertion was during my period, it was just a big cramp and then some throughout the week. Don’t let scary reviews scare you out of it, I’m 18 and this was one of my best decisions. Everyone’s body and experience is different.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had Kyleena in since mid January, and currently it is early May. The insertion process is very uncomfortable, and I had cramps for like 4 days after. It was a painful first week, but since, my sex drive has increased exponentially, and I haven't had a single period since. I do get cramps when my period is intended to be, and I've developed a small amount of acne on my chest. I had nipple soreness as of late, which was quite shocking for someone whose never experienced the feeling before.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am on my third mirena (12 years since first insertion). I just love it! Haven’t had a period since one month after my first insertion. No cramps, no mood swings. Insertion is not a pleasant experience but totally worth it for five years of care free bliss.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got my Kyleena inserted about 6 months ago and the procedure went quick. It was going great until around 4 months since I got it, I got pregnant. No joke. Went to the ER because I had minor pains and come to find out baby was in the right spot. Kyleena was still in place but took it out when I found out about the pregnancy. Didn’t know I was pregnant because I thought having no period/spotting was one of the side effects but nope! & I broke out on my back. One of my friends friend had the Kyleena also and hers fell out.
Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had liletta inserted April 24 2018 I hated it after 10 days of insertion I had the worst cramps imaginable I've gained some weight I wouldn't recommend to any one TRUST ME

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my Skyla inserted today, so this review is on the insertion process. My doctor suggested I get this done one my cycle, it is day 3. I've read these reviews and I was so scared, I took a 800mg ibuprofen before the procedure. Then pain wasn't that bad a very sharp pinch when she "sounded my uterus " which did make me break out in a cold sweat.The entire process moved along smoothly. I was back at work right after. I would suggest having the rest of the day off because I am cramping really bad! Hopefully this isn't for too long, but I love the idea on not having to take  birth control pills for 3 years!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This review is only about insertion! I just got the kyleena inserted on Tuesday. I was extremely nervous but I took it like a champ. The whole procedure took about two minutes. I consider myself to have a high pain tolerance but I took two Advil before the visit just in case. During the insertion itself I didn't feel much pain, just lots of pressure. Once the IUD was inside I did cramp a bit but then it was gone. I went on about my day and then I started getting really bad cramps. I took more medicine but it was too late. That morning I hadn't eaten any breakfast so my stomach was empty. I began feeling nauseous, and started vomiting. The pain became unbearable so I ended up in the ER for pain management medicine. They gave me a shot and nausea medicine. Asked me to go home and eat and drink lots of fluids. For the past two days I have been taking Aleve every morning because I don't want to feel cramps anymore. My recommendation is definitely eat before you go to your visit and take medicine.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted yesterday and now I'm in the emergency room because of the pain. I'm someone who could break a bone not know it but I'm literally crying.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I recently got the Kyleena inserted today. Could not take the pills anymore because they were causing blood clots and my body just didn’t handle the progesterone only pills well. I am 20 years old. When asking if this was going to hurt I had a lot of people tell me that it would feel like a little pressure and a small cramp. I’m not exaggerating when I say that it was probably the worst cramp I have ever had. I lost all color in my face and almost passed out. I even took Advil menstrual before I went because that is what usually helps with my cramps but felt it did not help at all. I then had an hour drive home and that was the longest drive. The cramp stayed constant and so bad I felt nauseous. The dr instructed me to go home and use a heating pad. I slept for a few hours. I’ve had the kyleena in for about 12 hours now and I’m still in a lot of pain. Just hoping that it goes away soon

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Awful experience! I am 23 years old. I got on the pill when I was 15 years old because of a 2 month long period. I decided to give Kyleena a try because I had a problem with my sex drive and was told that an IUD is supposed to help with that. I got Kyleena in in November of 2017.  Since then I have broken out all on my back and chest. Before Kyleena I never had bumps or a breakout. My sex drive hasn’t increased at all. The pain was TERRIBLE when I got it put in. I was dizzy and almost fainted. I have also lost a lot of energy (not sure if that is due to Kyleena). Anyways, I’m calling today to set up an appointment to get this thing out!!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got it today and the procedure was very uncomfortable but it didn’t take long. I will say I’m in a enough pain that I couldn’t work today. I’ll try to work later, the cramping is bad. I ate this morning and took two acetaminophen 45 minutes prior but it doesn’t feel like I’ve taken anything. I really don’t consider myself a wuss so, hopefully the pain will only last a day.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was nervous about insertion as I have never had a child. Took 4 Advil and Xanax and didn’t feel a thing! Got on it because I’ve never had regular periods since puberty. Haven’t had any side effects. My periods have gotten lighter and shorter, hoping they will completely stop. I do get migraines all the time, but I’ve been on a form of BC for 10 years so maybe it’s my body mixed with the chemicals and not kyleena itself. But I love it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena 2 weeks ago and the insertion was perfect. There was a minor pressure but not real pain like others say. I've had spotting ever since but not terrible. I originally got it because I wanted birth control since I had just gotten a boyfriend but Kyleena has completely ruined my relationship. I was so hormonal after this. I had PMS x1000 and he couldn't deal with it. I wasn't myself so now there's point in  even having it. Now I have cramping on and off when I have never had them before so that sucks. I guess I'll have to wait a couple more months to see if everything goes back to normal. I don't want to get it removed because I did spend about 150$ on it after going through my plan.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is ONLY a review for the insertion. I just had the insertion of Kyleena done today. I know that there are a lot of horror stories about this part of the experience so I wanted to share a positive one. I’ve had Mirena IUDs twice and hated them both times so I’ve been back on the pill for the last two years. I’m 28 with no kids. The last two IUD insertions were nightmares (I have a very high pain tolerance) so I was having MAJOR anxiety about today. I took three 220mgs of Alene (I’m 5’6 165lbs- just for reference, I wouldn’t suggest taking that much if you’re smaller) I explained my anxiety to my doctor and she also suggested freezing my cervix. Well holy moly did that make a difference!!! My last two insertions were a 9/10 for pain and this one was so minor, maybe a 5/10 at the worst of it. IF YOU'RE NERVOUS OPT FOR THE FREEZING!! It really does help! It’s been about an hour now and I’m having minor cramping but nothing I can’t handle.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted January 22, 2018. Like most of the reviews the insertion was quite painful, I even took 2 of my own muscle relaxers before doing so. I had very little side effects within the first two weeks after getting it, but after that my body did not like me. I had severe cramps that sometimes would last for hours or even days causing me to miss a lot of work. I had the IUD checked, and everything was fine. The cramping now only occurs during the time I'm supposed to have a period (which I only spot a little and have a little discharge). When I do cramp, mild abdominal workouts help me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Only rating this a 6 because of a rare experience I had with Kyleena. I am part of the 4% of women who experienced expulsion. I had kyleena in for about 3 weeks, and after the first time trying it my doc told me that I shouldn’t be so paranoid to check the strings everyday, however I was. One day after having sex which was somewhat uncomfortable at one point, I checked my strings and felt a hard rip protruding from my cervix. Long story short it was halfway expelled and was not effective according to my doc. I got another one inserted a couple days later and same thing happened. It halfway expelled so I got it removed altogether and got the Nexplanon implant instead and as already 1 month in and happy with it. The IUD did lessen my period cramps. If it weren’t for the expulsion, I would have rated it a 10, but however I was that small percent. I URGE YOU TO CONSTANTLY CHECK THE STRINGS PLEASE. If I never checked it, I could have been pregnant by now.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I recently had Kyleena inserted about a week ago and it has been amazing so far. I was on my period when it was inserted and had no pain at all. I have slight cramping here and there but nothing terrible and so far no spotting!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):When I had the IUD inserted I was in a great deal of pain. My doctor warned me that it would be uncomfortable, but this was excruciating, it’s also important to note that I was in pain for about a week and a half afterwards. After about 4 months on Kyleena, I developed ovarian cysts and that is by far the worst pain I’ve ever felt. The cysts come monthly & according to my doctor there’s really nothing they can do for me. I have also developed the worst adult hormonal acne, and I haven’t been able to control it. I’ve been on this birth control for over a year now, and originally I was hoping my body would adjust to it, but that hasn’t happened, and I plan to have it removed. I would proceed with caution when considering this birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I see so many bad reviews on here and wanted to give a good one so people aren’t scared off. In all honesty the pain was two second of pain! Think about it,  Our bodies were designed to push out babies so no matter how bad those seconds are, just remember women can handle way more than a tiny plastic thing. As for the cramping and bleeding it really isn’t he nightmare people make it out to be. Just keep a constant stream of Advil and just know that this is short period of time compared to the five years of worry-free sex.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone, yes women react differently, but overall it has been an awful experience and I wish I read reviews before I had it inserted. My self esteem has plummeted because of this. Yes, it’s awesome not taking a pill and it’s super protective against pregnancy, however... I’ve never broken out so badly. My face is covered and so is my neck and back, chest even shoulders. I thought it would go away but it hasn’t. Also the pain was horrific. I can tolerate pain. I've always had TERRIBLE period cramps. I went to emergency becauseI  thought something was wrong. The pain was so bad it threw me out of my bed while asleep onto the floor screaming. I had blood work done to see if I was pregnant, and an ultrasound done to see if it has moved. Nope. All was good. Just a horrible product.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Excellent experience with Kyleena so far. I was very apprehensive with all the negative feedback I have heard about IUDs however I decided to give it a try. Insertion was a breeze, they froze my cervix so I didn't feel a thing. Had mild cramping for a few days afterwards but nothing major. I did have spotting for about 3 months but it stopped and my periods are now lighter and less frequent. Has made my skin glow, no weight gain, no mood swings, no cramping. Definitely regret not getting it sooner.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted today! Up until today I had been on the pill for over 7 years. I was ready for something I could just forget about. I have a pretty high tolerance for pain and well....the procedure of inserting the IUD was much worse than I expected. It was painful and extremely uncomfortable. The nurse had to keep telling me to breathe. It only took a few minutes but those few minutes felt like forever because of how miserable it was. I felt really hot and flushed and lightheaded. Once it was over they gave me a cold bottle of water told me to just sit and relax for a few minutes. The cramping was almost unbearable but within an hour of having it inserted the cramping just seemed to vanish. I’ve spent the past 3 hours out cutting grass - you’d never know I had it inserted this morning. Very painful having it done, but so far so good. I’ll post again in a few months to update with how it goes and see if I am still happy with it!! But so far, I would recommend!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I found the insertion experience painful but not unbearable. I took some ibuprofen beforehand and I think that helped. The cramping after was really painful but more ibuprofen helped. I have been cramping on and off since and have been spotting since insertion (it’s been about 3 weeks only). I noticed someone else mentioned experiencing cramping on and off, and mostly in the evenings (7-8pm). I have been experiencing this too and am wondering if anyone else has had a similar experience of having cramps mostly in the evenings?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got this in August 2017, first type of birth control I have used. I took 2 Advil before I went in. I had never had any exams before so had some pain with the process but found talking to the doctor and having her pace my breathing really helpful. Overall, fast insertion and pain was less intense and briefer than anticipated. Was able to go back to work right afterwards with only moderate cramping. I did bleed for a couple weeks straight after insertion, and had some bad cramping in the first 2 weeks as well as occasional spotting for the first couple of months but now get a very light period only every few months. No problems with effectiveness, no weight gain, no acne. Would do it again for sure.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):July 2017 I started kyleena, now 10 months in I've gained 17 pounds!! Yes I work out faithfully not to mention I went from having 3-4day cycles until I can't stop bleeding. Soon as I started the IUD I started bleeding 3 weeks straight then it stopped. After a month my cycle came back and stayed on for 7 days instead of the normal 3-4 days. I'm officially over this BC. But we all know each individual body reacts differently so don't knock it until you give it a try.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD on January 9th and have now had it for a little over 4.5 months.The Procedure: The procedure itself took no longer than three minutes. I took ibuprofen beforehand to help with the pain. The insertion felt like a pinch, similar to an ear piercing. Overall, it was slightly more painful than I anticipated, but was over much quicker than I thought it would be, only lasting around 30 seconds to a minute. Symptoms: Immediately after insertion had some cramping and back pain. The cramping would come and go for the next two weeks, but the back pain lasted about two months. I have a job where I am on my feet, so this could have contributed to the pain. About a month after getting the IUD I started experiencing spotting that lasted about 4-6 weeks. About a month in, I had a few small breakouts on my back, but they subsided quickly. Overall: I highly recommend the IUD to anyone wanting to go on birth control.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had been on the Nuvaring for 5yrs before deciding to pursue getting an IUD.I have been using Mirena for 1yr now and I love it. I wanted something that was care free. I had read many reviews b4 getting the mirena, I was so scared of how much it would hurt. The day I went in for the insertion I was in the room for a total of 5 mins. It hurts for the second that it passes through the cervix. The following few hours and days, you get period cramps periodically, just like a regular period.Then through out the next few months I would have cramping randomly (mostly b/c my body needs to get used to the hormones and stuff).The first few months I needed to use day liners for about 1-2 days,no divacups, or tampons needed. I now don't even need to use liners at all. I still get some spotting that may need a liner for 1 day but that is all. I haven't had any weight gain, acne at all. I would recommend the IUD to anyone who forgets about pills or just wants to not have to worry about taking pills on a regular basis.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Oh boy, I would rate this zero if I could. I had mirena for 8 months. I started to get heavier bleeding and worse cramps around 5 months in and thought my body was still struggling to adjust. I finally got into my doctor and an ultrasound and now I have two ovarian cysts that are 6cm and 3cm in size. I am now back on my old birth control pill. It’s not worth having to get laparoscopic surgery.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion was painful, 8/10. It made me light headed and dizzy for 15 minutes. I even took 800mg of ibuprofen beforehand but it barely did anything. It subsided quickly though and I went back to work the rest of the afternoon.3 days later, my period came and I had the heaviest, chunkiest flow ever. I had medium flow for 45 days after. The whole time, I had cramps and back pain in the afternoons.  I managed it with ibuprofen, heating pads, and period underwear. Yes the bleeding does stop.The unbearable part came 3 weeks after insertion. I started losing my sex drive and felt anxiety, agitation, and cried for no reason. I also got painful cystic acne, dry skin, and I've been having trouble sleeping.I've had Kyleena for 2+ months and I'm getting it removed. I cannot deal with the mood side effects any longer. I feel like a crazy person. Even if the mood problems go away, the lack of sex drive and vagina dryness is not worth it. I feel like I don't even like my bf anymore.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I only had Kyleena inserted yesterday and I will try to remember to post an update in 3-6 months. I was extremely nervous for the insertion. I’m known to pass out, get dizzy, get lightheaded, and nauseous and I’ve had vasovagyl syncope in the past. I took 800mg of ibuprofen at 1 and my appointment was for 1:30, probably inserted around 1:45. The pain sucked, I imagined a 1-5 second pinch...it was more like 30 seconds. I was texting to attempt to take my mind off of it and my doctor said I did great and didn’t even flinch. I sat up immediately prior to insertion and felt no lightheadedness, dizziness, or nausea. I had mild (nothing out of the norm) cramps and proactively medicated myself with 400-800 mg of ibuprofen every 4 hours. I did take the day off and laid on the couch and watched tv all day but was able to make myself dinner.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Terrible. Insertion was ok. I ended up keeping it in for 2.5 years because I thought things would get better. From the beginning, I got horrible cramping (that hurt so bad I would cry in pain and miss work), and developed terrible acne.I give it 2 stars because I didn’t have a kid.... but honestly, I broke up with my boyfriend of 2.5 years after 6 months on the IUD. 6 months later, I quit my job of 3 years. 6 months after that, I had full blown suicidal depression. Almost a year later, I regret not having it removed in the first 4 months. Ladies, give it 3 months. If you don’t like it, get it out. Don’t be like me.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD inserted in 2013 when I was 20 years old. I had 3 months of light spotting on and off while my body was adjusting to the hormones. This was the first and only method of birth control I have had. I kept it in for the entire 5 years. I gave it a rating of 8/10 because it did its job in preventing pregnancy. However I developed acne, depression/anxiety, gained weight (went from 128 at time of insertion to 158). I was able to lose weight this final year with the IUD and currently weigh 143. However this was not easy at all! I had a strict diet and hiked 3.5 miles 4x per week. I felt like I had to work twice as hard in order to lose some weight. I had continued to get a monthly period for the entire 5 years with Mirena. Doctors just said that I was part of a small percentage of women who continue to have normal periods. Insertion and removal were both very painful as I had never given birth

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My doctor suggested this because I wanted to get rid of periods/cramping. Today is April 23rd, I got the Kyleena on the 20th. I took some Aleve about 30 mins prior to insertion. I have a pretty high pain threshold and let me tell you, this was no walk in the park. The clamping device hurt, I flinched a bit and had to take deep breaths until it was over. I immediately felt really hot. For about an hour after insertion I felt really hot, very bad cramps, felt gassy but did not have any gas to give. After that hour, everything seemed to mellow out. I've been having occasional cramps. The first time I went pee after insertion, I noticed some light colored blood. The next time I used the bathroom I wasn't bleeding anymore and have not since. I will update in a month or so to advise how my body has adjusted.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I'm about a week away from my 6 month mark with Skyla. The insertion was painful but bearable with 800mg ibuprofen & really deep breathing. Cramped for a day or 2 but heating pad really helped - felt just like heavy period cramping. My first period after insertion was VERY heavy (I had been on the pill for 10yrs so I had grown used to short, light periods) but the next few periods got lighter and lighter & stayed fairly regular (but now last closer to 7-8 days). I do still get spotting - in fact my period just ended 4 days ago & today just started spotting again. I'll get the occasional random cramp but nothing unbearable. My acne got really bad during the first few months on Skyla, but has now levelled out, & thankfully it's doing its job as I haven't gotten pregnant! Generally I like it, the side effects are less aggressive than the pill & its nice not having to remember to take one everyday. The biggest downside so far has just been the random spotting

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena about 6 months ago. Since insertion I’ve been happy with the birth control side of it but I’ve experienced terrible hormonal side effects. I gained about 10 lbs, which was too much for my body and I got stretch marks, not even stretch marks I can be proud of, like those you get from carrying your child. This are because I got fat... cool. My acne is going out of control and my period cramps have become worse than they were before. I would suggest the IUD for birth control, but some of the side effects have made me extremely sad and self conscious. Be aware that it does take a toll on your hormones and there is no saying how your body will react to it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had my first child and decided I did not want another one any time soon after so I choose to go with Mirena. I had suffered from some  vaginal ph imbalance prior to my pregnancy. During my pregnancy the pH imbalance and 3/4 months after giving birth it was gone! But as soon as I started using the Mirena, BV started taking over my life. The method was effective for birth control but also I was not having much sex due to the constant BV. I would treat it and it would come right back within a few days! I tried several different treatments but then I finally found other reviews from women with the same horrible issues. It’s something about the string that created the bacteria and creates a biofilm. So Mirena is not a good method for women who have sensitive pH systems.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The insertion was not fun, but bearable.  It feels like the worst period cramp you've ever felt, short and condensed and sharp.  The worst part, in my opinion, was the hours after it was inserted.  It was inserted around 4pm and that night I had the worst cramps of my life.  The only thing I could do was lay in bed in a fetal position. Ibuprofen didn't help at all!! Your uterus is used to being a sterile place, so when you get the IUD it wants to get it out, which is the reason for the cramps. That night sucked, but the next day I had minimal cramps and now (a week later) no cramps!! Yay! Be prepared for the cramps after the insertion.. They are something serious!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Doctor inserted IUD and one of the arms didn't come down laterally. Because my uterus was contracting, the arm kept jabbing my insides and the pain was INTENSE. Doctor had to pull it out. Couldn't take the pain. It was so horrific, I threw up everywhere. Bad product. Bad experience.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):So I got my liletta in May of 2017 I just had it removed in April 2018 due to the fact every time I turn around I was cramping so bad and it felt like I was being stabbed or by being in a certain position it felt like it was coming out which it wasn't.  I had major mood swings ,it was horrible. I wouldn't recommend it to anybody with how much pain I was in for most a year. Most people have different experiences but mine well it  was like I was doubled over in pain all the time, so I had it removed for my health.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted on April 6th, 2018. It hurt extremely bad, I screamed 3 times. I'm sure It didn't help though that I've never had a kid, a pap smear, wasn't on my period & didn't take the medication that helps soften your cervix. Afterwards I was in a pretty good deal of pain for over a week, I still have some awkward pains here & there but it's better. I do a string check every day & keep track of how high or low my cervix is hanging. I didn't bleed at all until 5 days after insertion & I've been spotting a bit but not enough that I've needed anything more than a panty liner. For those who didn't know, like me, when you get your period your cervix hangs lower so the strings may float down lower. This freaked me out since I didn't know about it & I thought it was being expelled. After two weeks I had sex for the first time & had no issues or pain. So far I'm really glad I got Kyleena but until my body finishes adjusting its gonna suck a bit. I go back in two weeks for a checkup.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So, I just got Kyleena almost a week ago. I get some random spasm cramping that goes from  little more than a very dull pain to one that makes me almost paralyzed.I freaking envy those who had very little pain. I almost felt like I was being impaled, and a nurse had to come in to help me stay still. I was screaming so loud they could hear me from a closed door.I have been fairly moody, but I understand that it's just what's to come at first with Kyleena as I did just get it. My gynecologist recommended it due to conditions such as diabetes, since my family history of high blood pressure. I don't currently have it, but he felt it would be far more effective and necessary as the oral contraception form gave me a higher risk to blood clots.But, my experience will likely not mirror yours. My uterus just really hates me.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the skyla for the 3 years and when it came time to have a new IUD put in my doctor recommended liletta. Of course the insertion was awful. I had 1 period during the 6 months I had it and around the 4 month mark, I started having awful headaches and needing to pee at all times. At the 6 month mark I started freaking lactating. I immediately made an appointment with my doctor and they did blood test and urine test for pregnancy ,  those were negative. They did an MRI for a brain tumor and that was normal. He concluded that it was most likely the liletta so he removed it and less than 3 weeks later , headaches were gone, no more excessive urinating, and no more lactation!! I never had any issues with the skyla, and now I have paragard and love it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena IUD inserted just over 1 month ago. I am 18 years old and was not on any birth control prior to this. Insertion was painful like most women say, but it only lasts a minute. I had moderate period-like cramps the rest of the day. I did not bleed until my first period came two weeks later, and I haven't stopped since. It's light, but it's a hassle. As for acne, it has made my life miserable. I have never had a problem with my skin until now. My whole face has broken out. If it doesn't get better within the next few months, I may have to get it removed. It is however very convenient birth control which is why I still have it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I love Mirena! After having my daughter, I went back on Alesse that I had used for years before and started experiencing a bunch of side effects such as mood swings and weight gain. My doctor suggested Mirena and I absolutely love it. The insertion wasn’t nearly as bad as I thought (a couple of minutes of discomfort, plus a couple of hours of light cramping afterwards), and I have had zero side effects on Mirena. Love not having to remember to take a pill every day!
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted about a month ago and the insertion was not bad at all! I do now realize my  hormones have been CRAZY...  Worst part of it is the constant spotting..

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):After talking with my doctor, I decided that Kyleena would be the best fit. I went in to get the Mirena but thanks to a lower dose of hormones and less side effects in Kyleena, I chose to go with this one.
