She instructed that I wait until I start my Menstrual Cycle to be inserted. The insertion of Kyleena was both uncomfortable and painful. Not a feeling I’ve ever felt before. I became nauseas and light head for the first few minutes after insertion. For the first few days, the cramping was consistent but bearable. I started spotting in the mornings, about 1 week after insertion. Week 3 post insertion, I started heavily bleeding and have continued to bleed every day thus far (now on week 5). If the bleeding does not stop by month 3, I will talk to my doctor about it or possibly get it removed. Other than the bleeding, it has been great. Have had a few breakouts around my chin area, which is no big deal. I haven’t gained any weight nor have I felt any mood changes.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had the kyleena for 6 months and let me tell you it’s the best birth control ever! No babies, no discomfort, cystic acne that I obtained from previous birth control diminishing. I would give it 10 stars but my only problem is 1) although I PMS a lot before my period, with kyleena  it’s super intensified . I find myself being sensitive, crying and being extremely  moody but like I said ONLY before my period so it isn’t that bad. 2) the insertion was awful! They should work on a better way of inserting this thing, come on, it’s the 21st century. Besides those two minor issues, I love my kyleena. Let’s hope the next 4 1/2 years left are just as great.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kleena because all the pills I was put on would work great then the pharmaceutical companies would discontinue them. I have had it for almost 2 months. My Dr said try it for 3 months enough so your body can adjust to it. The procedure wasn't bad, the cramps where a bit uncomfortable felt like all I was going to do was bleed to death, got really hot. Nothing usual for me I had cramps that when I wasn't on the pill. I have no kids and it was tolerable. Only problem is my face breaks out, I have seen a dermatologist before any IUD he told me to stay away from the mirena cause that was bad for breakouts. He did give me topical stuff to use but they don't work half the time. Really don't want to have the IUD taken out I love it .  I haven't had a period nor bleeding since it was placed. I need to look into something for my breakouts before I decide to go back to the pill.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I really wanted to love the Mirena. I was nonstop spotting for about 2 months, but my period stopped after that. It did a great job preventing pregnancy and I loved how I didn't have to worry about it. What caused me to remove the Mirena was that it made me break out extremely badly and my boyfriend always felt the string (I even got it trimmed twice). I do have hormonal acne, so maybe that's why this made it so bad. Other than those two problems, the Mirena did do a very good job, but I think I'll stick to the pill.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Got skyla over Summer 2017 and now it is April 2018. Insertion was pretty painful but never been pregnant before, also told I have small uterus. Before I had very regular period with maybe a minor pimple a week before and tender breasts. Post insertion had bleeding for about 3 months, range of heaviness and minimal cramping. Then period stopped completely which was great. It did its job as "activities" resumed w/ partner and it definitely did it's job because I'm not pregnant. But during intercourse  both me and partner can hear clicking sound and feel it, can't feel string but if i angle my pelvis correctly the clicking goes away. Anyone experience this? also after a few months of no period, it came back full force. I'm talking breakouts, cramps, bloating, period lasts about 11 days, and my breasts are so tender I can't even touch them. Going in for an ultrasound within the next few weeks to see if it shifted. I don't really know if i'd recommend this to anyone yet.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Currently, 19 & got Kyleena for a couple reasons. One, a virgin who would rather get an IUD now instead of waiting. Two, I have heavy periods and wanted to see if it would help, I cannot say if it's helped with either yet, but I can share my process. I got it March 16, before the procedure -two pills to soften the cervix and took it 2 hrs before -ate food beforehand and took 3 ibuprofen. -the insertion hurt like anything, but it wasn't the worst pain ever- light-headed afterward-experienced the worst cramping the first day and slowly went away. also, I felt the left side of the t shape poking into my uterus,  I believe it was just adjusting, & it's gone away, For the first period with the IUD. I've been on it for 17 days, a light to medium flow with light cramping occasionally but pretty rare.I gained 10 pounds & honestly, I needed it. and I'm under a lot of stress study wise right now so my acne has flared up, but I don't believe it has to do with the IUD.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The insertion process wasn’t too bad. There were mild period-like cramping for about two days, however, I spotted for a little over a month after. I’ve never been on birth control before and I definitely experienced mood swings with Skyla and a lack of sex drive. I even started to break out in hives and rashes!!! My boyfriend felt the strings during sex - he described it as a needle-like sensation and was even cut a few times from the strings. If you feel the strings DO NOT CUT THEM!!!  This can make it worse and even make the removal process a nightmare. I it removed today and my gyno could not find the strings... it took her about 15 minutes and a sonogram to fish the IUD out. Luckily, she was able to catch them, or I would have needed surgery (this is something I was never warned about).  My skin definitely changed and I even started to breakout a bit on my back. Everyone’s body reacts differently to BC  but I personally wouldn’t recommend an IUD to anyone.
Skyla (levonorgestrel):Love it.  I wish they had this before I had kids too.  I have fewer mood swings and no real sign of a period.  It has super low estrogen.  I recommend it to everyone.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve been on Kyleena for 8 months. Insertion was painful but tolerable, right after insertion was horrible, I nearly literally passed out and had to lay on the floor in the bathroom to gather myself. (Would have been nice if the Dr said this feeling was a possibility..) I was crampy for the day but that was tolerable as well. What has not been tolerable is my crazy weight gain and bloating. I was 105 lbs when I got it, now 119 lbs. I look 6 months pregnant! If it weren’t for the weight gain I would stay on it no doubt. However, the bloated feeling and extra weight feels awful and I’m getting it removed next week :( So annoyed about it!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena put in December 1st 2017, it was very painful, but only to find out March 5th 2018 I was 6 weeks pregnant and had to have it removed, I honestly have nothing good to say about kyleena other than having it removed didn’t hurt one bit.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):If you're on the pill and thinking of switching to this, be prepared for some possible backlash from your body, since it is now accustomed to what you've been putting in it. I just wish this product had been covered by my insurance in Canada, but it was worth the 400$ and insertion/checkups are free. By next year our union said it will be covered under our insurance, but I didn't want to wait that long. Apparently if you get Mirena instead and your doc says the main reason is for reducing debilitating cramps, then my insurance would have covered it, but I like my Kyleena, and had to be honest that it was mainly for BC purposes though my cramps can be nasty. Overall, 10/10 for this product at this time. Hats off to the magnificent people who made this!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had 3 children in 4 years.  After the last child was born in December 2009 we decided that 3 was enough to handle.  So I had the Mirena put in around December 2010.  I don't ever remember any head aches or bleeding or irregular periods. I had it for 5 years and it was great. I didn't attributes any major weight gain to the IUD. Since the 5 years was up in 2015 I had it removed. Since I was over 42 the time, we decided to give my body a break from the hormones. I also thought it less likely would get pregnant due to my advanced maternal age. Well I got pregnant within a year and had a miscarriage. I got pregnant again and had another miscarriage.  At 45 I didn't think the pregnancies and DNC was good for me.  I got another IUD March 2018. So far, I'm experiencing heavier periods, spotting and cramps. I did not have this experience previously. I'm told to wait it out at least 4 months.  I'm waiting it out, but I'm hesitant and thing of having it removed. I don't like how I feel now.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):i never comment online about anything, but I do read a lot of comments to gain different perspectives.  i was 35 when I first got skyla in 2015. I had had normal periods but started getting painful periods a few months before I got on birth control. I was dating someone and wanted to get on birth control.  After getting it I spotted for about 4-6 weeks.  Not a lot, just off and on, with random cramping.  After that, I regularly got a period with a little cramping.  The period was extremely light, so light I didn't feel comfortable wearing tampons.  I just got the first IUD removed and another one inserted this week. I was scared I was going to have to go through a month of spotting and cramping, but it hasn't happened.  I really like skyla and recommend it if you are interested in getting an IUD.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Positives: sexual freedom and easy insert. Negatives: HORRIBLE acne, mood swings, periods lasting 10-20 days per cycle and spotting in between periods. I only lasted 6 and a half months on this IUD :( This is just my personal experience with this medication, other people experience it differently. The acne effected my self esteem and my mood swings made me feel vulnerable because I would be content one minute and the next minute I will feel sad, irritable or anxious. I've had the IUD removed for 2 weeks and my face is already clearing up (no new pimples) and my mood is stable. Thank God!  My doctor told me that the symptoms would get better in 6 months, unfortunately they consistently got worse over the months and I couldn't put up with it anymore. I hope other women's experiences are better than mine.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had the Kyleena placed exactly 1 month ago. I took 3 Ibuprofen as indicated by my physician before the insertion. I’d say that the worst part is when they are measuring to place the device. My hands were sweating and it was very painful. At the exact moment of the insertion it felt like a huge cramp and it went away shortly. I walked home and after 1hour of the insertion it was when the horrible cramping started. I couldn’t move or do anything for approximately 3 hours after. These cramps come and go, during my 3rd week cramps were pretty intense, but now I’m my almost 5th week these cramps are pretty much going away. I have been spotting ever since the insertion. I did got my period, it was a lot lighter and manageable  than what I usually get. I had sex a week after the placement, my boyfriend did feel the strings but just at certain positions. I hope that everything keeps getting better.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I love Skyla. I was on Seasonique (the pill) before getting this IUD and the effects were horrible. I had gained 30 pounds in 6 months, I had awful mood swings, it was just bad.  So I got off it and went to get Skyla. I’ve never had kids & have only been with one person sexually, so it was normal how much it hurt. I’ve heard it doesn’t hurt much for those who have been pregnant. But for me, I’ll be honest, it had to have been one of the worst pains in my life; comparable to my 4mm kidney stone. It was absolutely horrible. The pain was so bad I thought I was going to vomit or pass out, barely maintained my composure. I cried for about two weeks straight after that from how severe the cramps were. BUT I feel like it was so worth it, because it has otherwise been a dream. NO weight gain, no mood swings, nothing. I got lucky, my boyfriend never felt the strings.  Two weeks of pain is definitely worth 3 years of not worrying about being pregnant OR having awful side effects.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Lilletta is still pretty much new. Just to give a little history I had the mirena installed twice; meaning I maxed one out and got my second mirena installed and maxed that one out too. Since I was informed that the mirena no longer is being made the next best thing similar to the mirena was the lilletta. The lilletta was good for 3 years instead of the 5 years like the mirena. Anyhow when I got the mirena placed I had developed anxiety along with being irritable and angry but since having the lilletta placed, those symptoms has been 60x worse. The anxiety has shot through the roof, the anger is much worse, the agitation is much worse, and there seems to be this brain fog. The brain fog is so severe that trying to remember what I did the day before is very difficult. So I had it removed and awaiting my body to fully detox of years of hormones. Awaiting my next appointment to have paragard birth control placed.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I suffer from ovarian cysts which is why I started taking birth control. My cysts became so large my doctor was worried about my ovary collapsing. I had at least 3 cysts burst which is VERY painful.During the time I had the IUD, I was increasingly becoming more depressed, I had no interest in my friends or family and I just didn't feel right. My family doctor prescribed an anti-depressant and recommended follow up with a psychiatrist. After speaking with a nurse at the office she helped me realize it was the IUD that had changed my behavior. Like every medicine, every patient will be affected differently. If something doesn’t feel right. If you just feel off. Make sure you talk with your doctor, they might be able to help.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I had the Kyleena Insertion about 7 months ago and I absolutely love it!!! I have very little cramping, and my periods are regulated since the start. The only weird thing that has happened since getting the IUD is that I have lost a lot of weight ( about 30-35 pounds ), and also my breasts went from a size DDD to almost a C...It’s a weird thing to complain about, but I did want to leave this here in the case that it is happening to someone else!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I got Kyleena March 23, today is April 11. Today is the two week mark. The pain I experienced during insertion wasn’t nearly as bad as I had expected. Just felt like a really bad period cramp. I thought I was all good but I have been expelling a whole bunch of brown (old) blood from my downstairs for over a week, and let me tell you these cramps are ridiculous. Is this normal?? I checked my string and I mean I can feel it but, these cramps are something serious!! Someone help!!! Ibuprofen and Tylenol, any painkiller I try doesn’t work! It’s funny because the pain of getting it inserted is what these cramps feel like. The insertion, not too bad, but when I’m getting those pains frequently, heck no!! I don’t want! And it’s weird because these pains usually start kicking in around 7-8pm. The blood is never ending unfortunately. Anyone else?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena IUD for a little over 2 years now (since Feb 2016). The only problem I had was insertion, since I've had no children, which was more uncomfortable than painful, and takes about as long as a Pap Smear. Most of the pain was the cramping afterwards which lasted 3 days. 400-600 mg of Ibuprofen daily helped. I also got a small cyst on my ovary about a month after which bursted but healed on its own. My main reason for choosing this method was the hope of less painful and heavy periods. I do not have periods at all since having it inserted. Every few months I may have spotting but nothing else. It has not only been helpful in preventing terrible periods, but also is an effective form of birth control. My boyfriend and I were hesitant at first but became more comfortable when I, of course, didn't become pregnant. 2 years later and I'm still kid free and (hopefully) good for another 3 years. Definitely one of the best decisions I made and worth it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 23 years old and this is my second time with an IUD. I had Mirena in before hand but took it out after one year because of bad mood swings. I heard about Kyleena and how it has low dosage of hormones, so I thought it would be a better alternative. Well I am four months in and I am experiencing constant cramps that are becoming painful and very annoying. I also notice my acne has change into cyst acne. As well as my weight and mood has change too. I am honestly thinking about removing it and just going back to the pill. I know Kyleena doesn't work for everyone, but I am sad that it wasn't able to work for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I never leave reviews but I had to for my conscience sake. This was by far one of the most painful (and I mean Braveheart getting tortured painful) experiences I have ever had. And yes I’ve had a baby so this is pretty terrible. The insertion felt like I was getting speared through the middle. Cramping was so bad I couldn’t drive to work. I have been crying off and on for days and feel angry for no reason. Doctor talked me out of the Paragard and I got the Kyleena but maybe that was a mistake as these hormones are adding fuel to the fire. I’m miserable but am hoping that I get better soon.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):18yo, first IUD, no kids, average height and weight. Insertion was the worst pain of my life, but it only lasted a few minutes. I did not take any pain medication in preparation for this but looking back I should have. First couple hours I bled heavy with horrible cramps, just wanted to curl up into a ball and die but I have never really had a problem with cramps before so this may be normal to most. This is day 3 post insertion, every once and awhile I'll have some pain in what I'm assuming is my uterus, not bad at all though. Bleeding has slowed to just spotting. Will update soon

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So today I went to my Gyno’s office to get Kyleena put in. Well oh well the pain I felt while the procedure happened (even though it was quick) I was asking my doctor to stop because it hurt so bad. I also contemplated not going through with it anymore. I took two Tylenol extra strength before I arrived, I felt a sudden hot flash feeling come on and literally felt like I could pass out. My doctor said to pick up Motrin because it might be bettered for the cramping. As of right now I feel like I just have really bad cramps, I’m using a heating pad on and off and just trying to get my body comfortable. It feels like how I used to get cramps before I ever even went on birth control. My period flow definitely got heavier after the procedure which is normal. Hopefully this works for me and I’ll be feeling better in a few days and won’t experience any major side effects.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got Skyla for birth control and also because I was having irregular/long periods (usually 12-14 days of 28-32 day cycle that varied). In the first months after I got it, I did see an increase in acne (I am already prone to acne, but it did get worse). Throughout, I have had frequent spotting and irregular bleeding. I have had two "periods" that lasted 23 days with light bleeding/spotting and maybe 1-2 days of heavier bleeding. So basically since I have been on Skyla, more than half of my life I have spotting. It has been very frustrating. I am considering switching to Kyleena or to a different birth control completely because I pretty much always have spotting. I think 8 months is long enough to see that this is not a good fit for me. Has anyone else had similar experiences?

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had the skyla IUD for about 2 years now and it was great for about a year of it. Don’t get a period anymore and my mood and everything was great. I gained 25lbs in a matter of 2 months though after I got it which I have been running everyday to try and get rid of to no avail. The reason why I rate skyla so low is that it has caused me to become allergic to random things and food. I’m now deathly allergic to a couple different spices, as well as metals! I was freaking out getting tests done to find out what I’m allergic to and why when I’ve never had allergies before. I then thought that maybe it could be the IUD, did the research, and it 100% is. It has something in it that affects  your immune system and causes allergies in women who have the IUD. I am on vacation right now so I have to wait to get back home to have it removed and hopefully my life will go back to normal.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted about 4 months ago. I’m 20 years old and have not used any form of BC before this. I found the insertion to be extremely uncomfortable and way more painful than I anticipated. The cramping for the next few weeks were even more awful. I contemplated getting it removed due to the pain. Within two weeks of getting it I was very sexually active. I was spotting a lot of brown blood and cramped on occasion but nothing bad. In some positions my boyfriend said he could feel the string poking him. He had a cut from it so we stopped doing those positions. It hurt a bit in other positions I felt like it was being knocked around. A month after that the spotting stopped and the sex felt almost completely normal. I do feel like I’m more prone to getting acne now, I haven’t gained weight.I would say I’m a bit more moody and that my sex drive Is lower. I have now stopped getting my periods.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve been on Kyleena for about one month. The insertion was absolutely not as bad as I thought. I took three ibuprofen before I went and asked if I could play games on my phone while it was happening. I felt a little twinge but that was about it. The worst part is the cramping that you’ll experience after. I was barely able to work that night but I still managed to. The side effects that I’ve been experiencing through this past month have been most prominently bleeding.  Just spotting though nothing like an actual period. Secondly I’ve been experiencing cramping on and off and it’s been pretty brutal some days and some days I feel nothing. I’ve had two or three days where I have been pretty emotional but I’m not sure if that’s from the IUD or not. I’m curious to know when I will stop bleeding and cramping. Looking forward to that day. I will Keep you updated. So far no pregnancy though, which is the whole point.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):So my experience with liletta has been terrible. The insertion wasn't bad I can handle that honestly but the pain after is terrible. I've had it for almost a year and every time I have my period the cramps are 10000 times worse. They feel like damn contractions. I can barely stand with them. I hate it so much but it's a very effective way to have birth control. My period is lighter but this pain is really horrible so think twice before getting it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena 10 months. It was the most convenient birth control, but that IS ALL THAT I CAN SAY GOOD ABOUT IT. For 10 months, I have been in sooooooooooo much pain. Everyone's body is different. Kyleena did not agree with my body. Everyone told me to give it 4 months, 6 months, and at 10 months, I couldn't take the pain anymore. It was so severe that I could not walk or move. Excruciating!! I also would bloat so bad that I would gain 5-7 pounds in week. I finally got it removed TODAY and it was a little painful, but that went away with Advil and I am feeling amazing. No heavy bleeding, just spotting. Downside, I am going on a low dose of BC pills. Not the most convenient, but I sure do feel better and immediately the bloating went away. No more mood swings and my sex drive seems to be returning.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Like most of the other reviewers it was very painful.  I had no pain meds before hand and wasn’t expecting it to be as bad as it was. Brought tears and I was sick to my stomach. I was told to come in in three months to check the position. I had been having random craps and bleeding every day. If I was active or If I had a bowel movement I  cramped.  I have always had painful cramps and ovulation. Turns out I had a very thin lining to my uterus and two cysts on my left ovary. The cysts will just be a thing with me always has been apparently. I as put on a pain pill which made me nauseous, estrogen to holds my lining, and and antibiotic for good measure. I felt better through March, but I've started cramping again in April when I have been active again. I would not do it again. It has been nice not to worry about taking a pill every day but it’s been kind of a rough journey. I will keep it in, but may be going back to see if my lining has gotten too thin again.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD November 10, 2017. I am 28, no children. I have always had a a very heavy yet consistent menstrual cycle. I've known numerous people who love their IUD's so I decided to give it a try. It was painful, I'd say a 7/10 for me. I had pretty bad cramps daily for about 1 month and a regular period for the first few months. I got my one month check and he said that it looked good.... It is now April 5th, it has been Almost 6 months and I still have my period. It is lighter, but still requires a pad or a tampon 2-3 times a day. In the past 6 months, there was only 1 week that it had stopped. As for the birth control part.....I am satisfied. I saw my doctor today, who is sending me for a ultrasound next week. Once we know if there is anything wrong then I will have to decide if I want to keep it, remove it or replace it. Hopefully we find something out soon!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had minimal pain during insertion (took some pill they gave me the night before to soften the cervix and two ibuprofen right before the appointment -- also had it inserted on the second day of my period).I had some pretty severe cramps in the afternoon for the next four days (only in the afternoon/evening, it was weird).  But it's now been just over a week and I'm completely pain free and seemingly fine!  Still lightly spotting, but that sometimes happens after my periods anyway, so nothing crazy :-)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Post No. 2: I’ve had the Kyleena for 4 months now and I still think this is one of the best decisions I ever made. For 1st week, I’ve had a few cramps and felt gassy. On the 1st time I got my period after insertion, I bled for 3 weeks (light to medium flow). I still spot on and off between periods so I just wear a pantyliner on most days. My period has become more regular and flow is much lighter than usual (50-60% less vs before Kyleena). I have less acne (almost gone!) and no migraines. Sex drive is up. My only real complaint is the spotting but that’s nothing compared to the benefits of having Kyleena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had the kyleena for two months. PMS for the last two periods has been difficult. Breasts are really sensitive. My sex drive has taken quite a large dip. Also my husband and I have had to use lube for the first time. My skin is amazing, suffered for years from acne. No weight gain but bloating on and off. Cramping stopped after three week mark. Barely any bleeding on period days.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I usually don't post reviews on things, but I feel like this is one thing I will say a word about. I'm 23 and I got Kyleena about 6 months ago. Previously my boyfriend and I were just using the pull out method (risky), which always had me stressing out. He doesn't like condoms and frankly, neither do I. The insertion of Kyleena was painful, but only for a short while. Afterwards I had some cramping for about a week, which was very manageable with ibuprofen. I also had light spotting. After about a month, I was feeling a lot better. One thing that I experienced that I hadn't read on reviews was the complete lack of a period immediately. I haven't had a real period since I got it. I even called the doctor about it and took a pregnancy test. I don't cramp anymore. Also I don't get any pimples like I would occasionally get when on my period, so all the reviews about acne isn't always the case, because mine actually got better. I absolutely love Kyleena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had Kyleena for 8 months and I wanted to share a positive experience and tips! (Inserted in July)Insertion: ASK FOR NUMBING SHOTS AND/OR CREAM! I only felt a cramp when I had mine inserted, and it's because of the novacane shots!! I felt nauseous afterwards and had cramps for one day and then they were gone! I had long periods for 2-3 months post-insertion (2 weeks or more), which I was used to on the mini pill. I haven't had a period since October! I'm so so happy and think this was entirely worth it! I've had issues with lubrication as long as I've been on birth control (7 years), and now that problem has all gone. I no longer need estrogen cream or OTC vaginal moisturizers, which is the best part. You can't feel the strings during sexThe only downsides to Kyleena is that when I don't get my period, I still get PMS symptoms which I hadn't experienced prior on either the combo or mini pill - fatigue

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I HAD TRIED 3 DIFFERENT TYPES OF BIRTH CONTROL SINCE KYLEENA AND THEY WERE ALL TERRIBLE. I took the pill (many different brands), depo, and nexplanon (never get that btw) I’ve had Kyleena a since January 2017, I remember the insertion process vaguely but I know it hurt but no more than a bad cramp. So far I love it! I’ve always had acne but it doesn’t seem to have gotten much worse. I still have a monthly period but it does not last as long as it used to, and it’s not as heavy. Since dating my boyfriend we have only ever used a condom once, I have my scares due to paranoia but definitely no pregnancy! It doesn’t change my mood (unless on my period) and I haven’t gained a bit of weight! I would highly recommend it to anyone who does not want any babies but still wants to enjoy their sex life without the scare.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Started my period a day after insertion. I bled 5 days of "period" and another 6 of spotting due to iud insertion. Normal activities resumed with my partner within a day of insertion. NO negative effects. My O is as great as always!I have actually lost about 2 lb in just the 2 weeks I've had the iud. I think much of this is because I finally don't have birth control estrogen in my blood steam! So far so good! Works perfect for birth control and I highly recommend this form of b/c over any pill!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Previously I had wrote a review about the liletta, I've had a great experience still no weight gain or anything. At first I was nervous about getting an implanted because of some of the reviews but it wasn't bad, you just have to breathe when they put it in. I had one daughter that was planned me and her dad are separated now but it is very comfortable I've had no complications. I've had wonderful experience with this it works great and this is my first birth control ever and I've never gained any weight or anything if anything I think it helped me lose some weight so I've had a good experience with this birth control I'd recommend it to anyone

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted today. My OBGYN recommended it as I have been having headaches with auras, and she was concerned that birth control pills might increase my risk for stroke and heart attack. I am 22 with no kids.My pain threshold is pretty low, and it was the longest minute of my life. For the next 45 minutes I stayed in the room, laid down, tried to puke, drank water, and nearly passed out a couple times. I sweated through my shirt in a matter of 5 seconds, and told myself repeatedly that I didn’t I want this thing in me. I didn’t bleed much and haven’t spotted at all today besides immediately after insertion. I’ve been taking ibuprofen and using a heating pad, which works wonders! Cramps have subsided and are much like menstrual cramps now. I even hit the gym tonight! The few hours immediately after the insertion and those dreadful few minutes of the actual procedure will hopefully be worth it. safety first, right?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for over a year and it’s great! The initial procedure was very uncomfortable and it sucked for about a week afterwards, but otherwise no complaints! No weight gain, no acne (it might have even helped my existing acne!) I get a very light period about once every three months. My sex drive did go down a little bit, but it’s hard to tell if that’s with Kyleena or other personal factors. My boyfriend and I have unprotected sex at least once a week for at least the last year with no protection  and I’m still not pregnant! Great product!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So I hope some one can help me. I got my skyla in November 2017 after having one for 10 years. My old IUD was great, I had my cycle and was going great with my weight. So I got married and waited to have a child in about 2 years so my doctor recommend skyla. So hear is when my torture begins. I haven't got a period since then, I spot for days, maybe a week or more and sometimes none for a month. However every month I feel like I am pregnant, I get craving, my breast get tender, I am light headed, and mood is all over the place. Most month I take a pregnancy test just to make sure I am good. Then the crazy part is I am just blowing up like a balloon. My belly went for small to me looking like I am 6 months pregnant and it seems to get worst every month. I am trying to take it out but my doctor keeps telling me its just trying to adjust to my body. How much longer do I need to adjust? Ohh since this IUD, I have gained  30 pounds in 5 months. I am going crazy

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got Skyla about 3 months after I had my daughter. Insertion was really easy, no pain at all and was really quick. Over all it did what it was supposed to do. My periods stopped completely at about 3 months in. The negatives for me is that I gained about 30-40 lbs in a matter of months. Before long I was going to the gym about 5 days a week and ate  really good... didn’t lose but 5 lbs and I was strict about my regime for about 4 months with no change. I also feel it gave me depression, but it was slow going however, so it took me a long time to figure out that I was even depressed and to pin point why. I see a doc regularly for anxiety medicine... so I know my body pretty well and this was the reason for it. I will be trying the Paraguard next as it has no hormones. I feel I’m very sensitive to hormone issues because I’ve dealt with hormonal cystic acne for many years and still do today but it’s not nearly as bad as it was before I had my daughter. Hope this helps!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Honestly I have had mine in for 2 years and 3 months and it’s been the worse experience ever!! I’ve cramped the entire time and these are not just regular cramps these are contractions!! Every 3-5 minutes it’s sharp pain in my lower abdomen area. Not only that but I’ve had X-rays a while back on my abdomen and the Skyla is laying sideways now. And my doc office wants to charge me $116 to get it removed. Not too mention he had a hard time getting it in and I never had kids.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This IUD caused me soooo much acne! I hadn't had much acne since high school and once on this I was getting them on my face, chest and back! And although my period was lighter on this, I would spot for 2 weeks after each period so had very little time where I actually didn't have to wear a tampon or panty liner! Absolutely terrible experience!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m here to leave a GOOD review on Kyleena. The day I had my IUD put in was not the most comfortable. It was a super quick procedure but I had a lot of cramping and it made me slightly lightheaded. I had blocked that evening off and took ibuprofen, put a heating pad on and took a nap. Woke up and felt 100 times better. I bled of course but it was completely over 3 days later. The cramps were mostly gone the day after insertion. I am normally a happy person, but with this I was EXTRA happy and in a good mood the whole day and everyday since. I can honestly say I haven’t had a bad day as far as moodiness since the insertion. If it matters, my sex life is also 10/10 since getting Kyleena because 1) I don’t have to worry and 2) everything feels so much better. Every woman’s body is different. The pill is not good for me because it makes me depressed and crazy, but this most certainly has restored my faith in BC. I highly highly recommend this!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am 23 years old with no children. I originally had the Skyla IUD inserted in October 2013, The insertion was not the worst part for me like many other reviews are stating having my uterus measured was horrible especially when The measuring device reaches the walls of your uterus it is instant horrible cramps.  After the insertion I had too sit in the lobby and wait for an ultrasound, it hurt too sit I was sweating horribly and nauseous. Eventually the cramping stopped but I was left with very abnormal periods . Second time October 2017. The pain was still just as bad but not as much cramping soo thats a plus. I have somewhat noticed a lower sex drive and horrible mood swings, my fiance can feel the strings sometimes during intercourse, also sex has become very painful for me.  Around November I started getting very sharp abdominal pain, nausea, lower back pain, and couldn't go #2. I've seen my gyno a week ago, an ultrasound revealed ovarian cysts caused by skyla so I may have Skyla removed

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD a few days ago now, so far I'm in a lot of pain! Getting the IUD inserted was extremely painful! The cramping I have experienced the last few days have been horrendous.Kyleena is kinda my last hope, I have tried many different forms of birth control and the last one I was on (seasonale) was amazing until it started to mess up my hormones. I was on seasonale birth control for 10 years and all of a sudden I got the worst pains, I was in and out of the hospital for 8 weeks with no answers, the abdominal pain back pain cramping and continuous bleeding went on for a little over 8 weeks. Until they finally told me my hormones are messed up from the birth control that I was on so I had to stop taking it and now I'm on kyleena,.  I have had no spotting since the insertion and I'm hoping it stays that way. I have a rapid thickening of my walls and I have been told this will help so fingers crossed! Hoping the cramping goes away soon and I'm back to myself.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):20 years old, sexually active. Was on Tri-sprintec (oral contraceptive) for 4 years prior to Kyleena. My body was regular, periods were fine, etc. Got some occasional cystic acne and had some mood swings, so I decided to switch it up. Looked into IUDs and talked to my doctor. Discovered that Kyleena was best for me. **When I tell you Kyleena was one of the BEST decisions I've ever made... girl I mean it!!** I've had it for about 5 weeks now. The insertion pain was pretty sharp, not going to lie. To me, 15 seconds of serious pain is TOTALLY worth 5 years of peace of mind. Only downfall is the irregular light spotting I've had. Nothing major. May not even have a period I guess. My emotions are 10x more stable now, I don't have to remember to take that pill every day, and I've lost 7 pounds!! Kyleena was a blessing to say the least!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had my Liletta inserted Feb 2017. It's now March 2018 and I never feel it and hardly have periods anymore. Insertion was very uncomfortable for me, but I also didn't eat anything before so my blood sugar was crashing. The next three days I had horrible cramps, one month later I needed to have it readjusted (it had shifted to the left). After that, my period drastically mellowed out and now I have a new cycle every 30-50 days. It never lasts very long and usually is mostly spotting. I used to have very painful periods that made me sick and now I have little to no period symptoms and can work through it. It took a little time for my body to get used to it, but now that I'm 11 months in, I feel that Liletta was ABSOLUTELY the right choice for me.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had liletta placed of November 2017 after getting a blood clot w/bc pill. The insertion was really extremely painful for me . I am 39 never had children and took the dilation pills for this and some acetaminophen prior. It is about 3 steps for insertion one being worse that the other and at the last one I even screamed a little (completely out of character). First month was terrible cramping, no period, after that there was spotting for several weeks and some heavy cramping on/off during those 6 weeks (very unpleasant). Now I get cramping around the time I get my period (which can happen twice a month), cramping is much less although unpleasant, period much much lighter, however, longe it can last 10 days. A couple of months ago I got acne on my back and chest and not on face, something I relate to the IUD...not fond of the string issue, but it does the job and you do need to remember a daily pill. I am not sure if I would have it done again or maybe would try a different brand.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Liletta for about 7 months, getting it removed. My boyfriend & I together for 4 years. It was just time to take out my Mirena (6yrs). My doctor suggested Liletta as the exact same. 3 months in, I had severe pain in my breasts, to the point where I could not even touch them in the shower. Lasted about 2 wks. 5 months in I noticed weight increase. Good diet and exercise. Nothing different. My normal sex drive is high. I’m currently going on forcing myself to mentally get there about once every few weeks. But the worst part is my daily mood swings. I can wake up and start the day by being rude and continue the day barely wanting to talk to him or make eye contact. He makes me angry. And that’s not normal. He is always looking out for my well being. It breaks my rational heart. I hope your experience is better. But if you experience anything like I have, please know you’re not alone. This sucks. And I look forward to being my normal happy self once again!
Liletta (levonorgestrel):Gained some weight & had a lot of spotting & pain in ovaries.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I have Mirena for about 1 year and few months it was painful when it was inserted and I had heavy bleeding for along time. I was desperate so I went back to have it removed but the doctor talked me out of it  and told me to wait that all the heavy bleeding and spotting will go away. So I waited for about 3 months and it did go away - no more heavy bleeding I hardly get a period and no bad cramps. I did gain a little more weight and I do get headache sometimes but not often.  So my experience with mirena  was bad in the beginning but then it was fine hopefully this review can help you

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 21 and recently became sexually active and have never had kids. Previous experiences with combination birth control pills informed me that I was already sensitive to the side effects of hormones, so I stopped them 4 years ago. In light of this, I was looking for a fail proof BC with less side effects. I have a medium-high pain tolerance and terrible heavy, crampy periods. I took a hydrocodone and 1 mg ativan 30 minutes prior to my scheduled IUD insertion. Slightly crampy during the measuring procedure. Following insertion, ibuprofen helped tremendously, especially around the 15 day mark. It's been 35 days since insertion and a light period with spontaneous cramps has persisted. My significant other does not feel the strings during intercourse. No weight gain and small, but manageable increase in acne (mostly on chest) and oiliness. Would suggest painkillers before insertion. Waiting for the bleeding to stop and hoping the other side effects dissipate with natural acclimation to additional hormones!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion was the worst pain of my life. Being young and never had kids, they said it was normal. The doctor was very understanding and gave me more Motrin to ease the pain. When my heart rate and oxygen levels were back to normal, I went home. The cramps continued for three days but after that I have never been happier. My periods are nearly nonexistant, I’m not pregnant, and I never have to remember to take a pill. I definitely recommend Skyla and the pain is worth it!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Just got home from having Liletta placed at planned parenthood. I'm 29  with 2 kids- a few lbs overweight & otherwise healthy. The clinician was awesome & helped me relax. I was anticipating torture & it truly wasn't that bad. 5/10 on the pain scale. No spotting or anything else so far. Just some slight cramping. Hoping it works out longterm!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m 18 and got kyleena about two months ago. I was so nervous to get it put in and was expecting a lot of pain but honestly wasn’t bad at all. Probably a 2/10 for pain. It’s just an uncomfortable cramping sensation that I have never experienced before. I have never even gotten a Pap smear so the whole experience at the gyno was new. I spotted for about a month, not enough for me to even use a tampon tho. I’ve noticed my boobs have gotten more tender but that’s about it. I have yet to experience any side effects. So far it was a great decision!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've had my IUD for a year and I love it! It did hurt to get put in, worse than period cramps.  But that only lasted a few hours, and my period was immediately a lot lighter. After a few months it went away completely.  Overall this is a great method of birth control because I don't have to deal with the hormonal side effects of bc pills and remembering to take it every day.  I will definitely be getting a new one in 3 years!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):After reading multiple horrible and scary reviews in the waiting room of my OBGYN, I was terrified of getting the mirena. But alas, I convinced myself that was "just all those horror stories and none of that would happen to me." Well it has been almost two years of the Mirena and it is me. I have gained 35+ pounds, have severe anxiety attacks (never have I had experience with this), depression, no libido, and crippling cramps/bloating. Sure the no period thing is sort of nice.....but I would rather just have a period than be experiencing all of the nonsense I am now. My only advice is that you know your limits. I had promised myself I would *stick it out* and see if anything got better with the side effects but they just kept getting worse. I am getting this taken out in 2 weeks and I COULD NOT be more excited. Also ask for options on birth control, because some of these doctors are very pushy with what they choose to recommend and not.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Got it 12/19/17Very negative experienceI had a v heavy flow and v painful cramps so went for LilettaInsertion was SO painful. I continued to have cramps all day and for the next few days. Still have random cramps and spot EVERYDAY. Got BV + spotting isn't always light can be v heavyUsed to have high libido: 3 weeks in I LOST my sex drive. I RARELY get slithers of sexual desire but they subside very quickly. Am in new relationship and I'm SO attracted to him but still NO sex drive and I used to orgasm very easily and it's harder now and for the 1st time: vaginal drynessextreme mood swings and depression, break down 3 weeks in. Everything overwhelming + most emotional I have ever been.  I have a mass increase in anxiety. Beware if you are prone to mental health issuesConstant headaches + 1st time I got my period on the IUD could NOT move = cramp painGained 10 lb the 1st month, caused stretch marks for 1st time Tomorrow I am finally getting it out. Will update y'allPros: Not pregnant

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’m 23 and I have never had children. Before procedure: I was prescribed a medication to help soften and open up my cervix so that insertion would be easier. I went in Feb 2017 to have my procedure done. I was also on the 3rd day of my period at the time. The pain was a 4 on a scale from 1-10. She was trying to insert the iud for almost 1-2 minutes and advised that she was unable to because my cervix was not open enough. My doctor doubled the dose of the medication and advised me to come back in a month to retry. Come March 2017, the insertion went smooth! Right after procedure:I was able to walk out of the office fine and the drive home was just fine as well. The cramps started to get A LOT WORSE around the 3rd week up until the 3rd month from cyst development.~March 2018: My periods have been extremely extremely light and regulated. Pain is gone.Side effects:lower sex drive, swollen/tender breasts, lower back pain, frequent bloating & gas, BV development

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted around September of 2017. The pain I felt when I had my cervix dilated and having the IUD inserted was like nothing I’d ever had before. I began sweating profusely from every area of my body, the room was cold and I was wearing close to nothing. I laid on the table after it and just focused on breathing for about 15 minutes. I got up to put my jeans on and I passed out on the floor. I am not exaggerating, this is 100% what happened. I’m so thankful that my mom took me because I wouldn’t have been able to drive home I was in such pain. I’ve noticed about a 20 lb weight gain and moderate acne. I would never get an IUD after this, I’m still debating if I should just keep it in or get it removed. Sure I don’t have to worry about my period at all really and I don’t have to worry about unexpected pregnancies, but I want my self confidence back.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena Inserted 4 days ago , I read lots of posts about spotting ? I haven’t seen anything like that. The measuring did hurt me the most but not the worst pain. I feel like I have cramps on and off but hopefully that will go away ! I am super happy I feel like its very beneficial for me and I’ll be watching for the side effects closely ! My doctor was amazing and she said her three daughters even have an IUD as I was super nervous reading all the horror stories I almost chickened out haha. Going through with it was one of the best decisions ever ! So far

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Mother of 3 and decided to have an IUD for the 1st time to be able to control if/when there should be baby #4. It was inserted 4 months after having baby #3 (Nov 17). During insertion I only felt pain for a few seconds while it was placed but after that I was okay, my doctor told me to cough while placing the IUD. 20 minutes after, I had very intense cramping while driving home, it took me completely by surprise, it was the worst few minutes of driving. Then just like it came it went away. I started with a medium flow period for about 2 weeks then it was light for about 4 weeks, after that spotting for another 4-6 weeks. Now I don't have any bleeding at all, nothing. Glad to be over the first 3 months and not worry about getting a period or becoming pregnant. I have noticed that I have gained about 10 pounds without major changes to my eating habits or lifestyle now (Mar 18). Overall I do recommend this and encourage others to stick with it for more than 3 months to see it work.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’m getting this removed on Tues - which will be 4 wks of having the IUD. Insertion did not hurt at all but it’s been nonstop bleeding/cramping/headaches and nausea. I think I had 3 days where I didn’t spot. My husband and I have had sex two times bc of this. The website said the constant bleeding can last 3-6 months which I cannot deal with -or the other symptoms. I’d rather just track my cycles and use condoms. In my experience, this IUD is soooo not worth it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had kyleena for a full week now, I will say the insertion is the worse pain I’ve ever felt. I’d get my tonsils out again over insertion. No numbing and no warning; I went in without taking any meds. I’ve never had a kid and having my cervix measured and dilated made me scream and slam my legs together. I could hardly walk after and wished I brought my husband with me to drive and help me get around. Even if this works out, I will never get it inserted again in 5 years. My body just now adjusted and stopped feeling strange and crampy throughout the day. I have probably had under 10 pimples in my entire life and as of tonight I noticed 8 on my right cheek after taking my make up off and am so worried that it’s from my IUD. I’m going to give it some more time but, if acne stays long term I will have it removed. Will update review in 3 months to see how things go! Hoping I won’t have to get on the pill again and this turns out positive for me!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the Skyla inserted Aug 28,2017. I am now counting down the days to get this thing removed. So I had some light bleeding for roughly two months after insertion as well as some crazy mood swings. Not a big deal, as it was to be expected, and I was okay with dealing with that for a few months because I do not want another child anytime soon if ever. Then one day the bleeding stopped and my mood swings followed suit. Everything was great and I was happy with my decision. Then I got my period, it lasted roughly 2 wks. My back started breaking out, I started gaining weight, and my cramps got worse. I’m now 7 months in and I hate this thing. Basically I bleed for 3 wks and don’t for 2 wks, and my cramps are so bad they remind me of my pre labor cramps, I’m still gaining weight, my back is so broken out I’m too embarrassed to wear a lot of my clothes.  The only reason I gave it a 3/10 is because I didn’t get pregnant the one time a guy came inside of me.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The Skyla for me has been for the most part a good experience. I’m 22 , it’s been a year and some change now since my skyla insertion . The insertion was the most painful thing I’ve ever had to endure ! I had a male doctor and he couldn’t fit the skyla through my cervix and told me I had a small uterus but I’d never been pregnant before so I can imagine. Here I am over a year later and I’m experiencing weird symptoms. I experience random pelvic pains that feel like they’re ripping through my vagina. When I'm just relaxing, it becomes a little uncomfortable in my pelvic region. The amount of discharge I have really annoys me, no smell or discoloration though . Also I’m a recent college graduate so I went on campus for health care the last two times I went the doctors couldn’t find my strings . I’m just worried for bad news . The pros of the skyla for me are that my periods are lighter , but they are longer and I haven’t been pregnant yet .

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Picking out the right birthcontrol was hard for me. I had an EXTREMELY heavy flow for an athlete (girls, I'm talking changing a super plus tampon every 2hrs for 4-5 days) Not only has my period almost ceased completely (maybe 2 regular tampons a day for 2 days), but I'm also not pregnant!Some things to expect are:-Cramping. The first month was brutal for cramping, but it got better and gives me no issues now. -Bleeding. For the first 2 month I had to wear either a tampon or pads everyday because I kept bleeding. -Spotting. After the first 2 months I spotted for the next 2 months intermittently-Discharge changes. I always had discharge that was clear/white, but now (8months later) I still have reddish/brown discharge. -Period cessation. Most people stop having periods around month 3, but mine didn't stop until about month 8What I DIDN'T experience:-Weight gain-Emotional changed-Acne

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm sharing my experiences with Kyleena almost two weeks after insertion. For those who had minimal pain, I envy you. My insertion was brutally painful and I almost fainted. I spent about 40 minutes in the room trying to collect myself to take an uber home. Once home, I had a horrible cramp that lasted a few hours and went away after. I had zero spotting for the first week, light spotting going into the second week. However, my biggest complaint with it so far is the massive cramps I've been experiencing that give me nausea and dizziness and the incredible bloating. I look like I'm about 3-4 months pregnant every day. My sex drive has completely gone down and I feel more emotional throughout the day. I'm assuming there definitely is an adjustment period to it, but I'm hoping it's over sooner rather than later.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Id rather be on the pill but I'm forced to have Kyleena. I started getting migraines more frequently last year and that meant no more pill birth control. I had been on the same birth control from 12 years old  to 20 (I have PCOS so they used birth control to help me). I loved the pill I was on, but I also didn't want a stroke. I went a few months without birth control and after a pregnancy scare I decided to try something new. I originally wanted paraguard because its hormone free. It was too big for my uterus so they recommended kyleena. Here are some great things I've learned:-you have the potential to spot/bleed for 6 months-if you have a history of bad acne then you will have a new flare up. I am now starting accutane again. -you may not bleed every month BUT you will cramp. I get a cyst every month instead and it can create cramps worse than I ever used to have. -weight gain! the first couple months I began gaining weight. Luckily I'm starting to lose it again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted yesterday. I had taken 1600 mg of ibuprofen before hand due to all the comments and advice from my gynecologist. Not going to lie, the insertion was very, very painful. But it was so short that it makes up for it.  I suffered with cramps for most of the night, but I am feeling much better today. Started some light bleeding this morning, so I will write an update in the future. So far, so good. I hope it is effective. I gave it an eight because of how painful the four minutes really was.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):So I got the Skyla inserted yesterday 3/21/18 and it was the most horrible terrible pain I have ever experienced. I’m 29 years old and have never been pregnant so the doctor said my cervix is tiny that’s what caused me to have more pain than most women. It started off fine like a Pap smear so I was calm then the insertion started but my body automatically tensed up. Like I said I’ve never been pregnant so I don’t know what giving birth feels like but...the doctor finally got the Skyla in after three tries and that last try was the worst cuz when she removed the some of the equipment I immediately passed out from the pain. I woke up dizzy and in sweats and then was nauseous so I threw up a bit but I finally got it together but my boyfriend had to come pick me up cuz I could not drive home. But like I said I have only had it for one day now and I don’t have any more pain. I had it inserted while on my cycle so we’ll see how it goes

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for 4 months now and I’m extremely happy I got this. The inserting will hurt like a really bad cramp but it goes away. I’ve always been irregular with my periods and with Skyla I don’t have periods anymore. I’m extremely happy my nurse recommended this to me. Would definitely recommend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena put in exactly a month ago (March 22nd 2018) and I really couldn't have asked for a better experience! When I first started researching IUDs, the reviews really scared me but I made sure to stay optimistic and let my body know what was coming to energetically and mentally prepare.When I got kyleena put in I would say that my pain level hit 5/10 for 25 seconds (I am 23 and never had kids). It was uncomfortable but completely bearable. I just counted down from 20, breathing deeply and let the pain release with every breath out. After that I had no cramps and no blood. I got a light period for 4 days and since then I've been barely spotting every other day.Based on my experience, I highly recommend:- You find a doctor that listens to your concerns and that you are truly comfortable with.- You check in with your body. Whenever I started to feel worry, I would put my hands over my uterus and let it know it would be housing a new guest but it will go smoothly.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Liletta inserted at PP in July of 2017. I’ve never been pregnant or used hormonal BC. Measuring and insertion was uncomfortable, but it was over quickly. I was on my period and took ibuprofen, both of which I assume helped. I was crampy the rest of the day and several days afterwards, and bled lightly for about a week. I spotted on and off for the first 2-3mos, and have had two mini periods in the last 6 mos. The only side effects I’ve had are painful breasts for a week or so every month, and occasional cramping on my left side around my ovary; my dr thinks these things could be related to ovulation. I’ve struggled with hormonal acne my whole adult life, and it hasn’t gotten better or worse since getting Liletta. I think acne flare ups happen when people come off combo methods and start using progestin only methods like IUDS). I haven’t gained any inexplicable weight, or had pain during sex. It’s possible that my sex drive and lubrication has decreased very slightly.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had a complicated pregnancy and was recommended to not get pregnant again. Mirena placed at 7 weeks post partum after csection. I had bleeding basically for 4 months but if you do your research it says that it can take up to 6 months for your body to adjust to hormones. I've had it for 10 months and haven't had a period in 6 months. I have weight gain (approx 10lb) but it also happened when I stopped breast feeding so that's my fault. No symptoms of depression, sex drive is still kicking  and not pregnant. I'm not prone to depression or anxiety.  I LOVE the mirena. I recommend it to everyone I know for birth control or vaginal bleeding. Hope this helps! Give your body 6 months then if you hate it get it out. But give it a chance- you are changing your body's chemistry

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm regretting my decision to get an IUD.  I only got it last Friday and it's only Wednesday.  I'm going to ride it out a month or so, but if I continue to have bleeding for up to 6 months, that's a deal breaker for me.  My doctor recommended alternative birth control because I'm 40 and had been on the pill since I was 18   I really don't have any problem remembering to take the pill and really like knowing when I'll have a period. Now I know I should have just stuck with that for the next 10 years.IUD insertion was very painful and as someone else mentioned, I started sweating a lot.  It was incredibly intense cramping.  I was not prepared for the pain.  Then there is all the bleeding, which I hope will subside, but if it doesn't I'm going to have the IUD removed and go back to the pill.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion review:Just had my Skyla inserted 3 hours ago. I'm a 33yo who has had 1 pregnancy. Found out I had a retroverted (tilted) uterus--something that comes with age and childbirth! Took ibuprofen 800mg 1 hour prior to my appointment. DO THIS!My insertion went great. Felt like a pinch lasting only a few seconds. No cramping immediately afterward. I've had a few minor cramps since but nothing worse than lighter period cramps.I know the positioning of my uterus increases the likelihood of expulsion or perforation, so I'll be very cautious of what goes on down there. Since my Dr noted it, I know she was careful with the insertion. I am very into fitness and plan on going to the gym in a few hours to do my regular weightlifting & cardio.I will do another review after I've had the IUD for several months. So far so good and I'm excited I won't have to be concerned about pregnancy until 2021!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my kyleena inserted on December 27th. I had moderate bleeding(less than a period, more than just spotting) every day until February 14th. After a week or so of no blood, I thought I was in the clear. I started to have some PMS symptoms during that time, and on February 28th, I began bleeding moderately again. I assumed because of the PMS that it was just a regular period, but it is March 21st now and the bleeding is still continuing. I consulted with a doctor who told me to stick out the first six months and remove the device if the bleeding doesn’t stop by then. But the insertion was so painful and I would hate to bleed for 6 months only to have to give up in the end. At this point I would not get a second IUD or recommend it to anyone else. After the first week or two I haven’t had any pain or major complications, but I would rather take the pill and avoid the bleeding.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena IUD for free at age 26 as a member of the test group when it was still being tested at Johns Hopkins. I had it for almost 4 years, I had it removed because it had slipped down some and I GOT PREGNANT. When it was removed it initiated a painful miscarriage that ended in a surgery. I ALSO had multiple ovarian cysts throughout the time I had it that kept coming for the next 8 or so years including a painful cyst the size of a baseball that had to be removed in emergency surgery. When I began to try to get pregnant about 2 years after having it removed I couldn't and never did again. I was diagnosed me with unexplained infertility but the obgyn did suggest that my issues were probably due to all the complications I had from the Mirena.. I can't stress this enough to women out there considering this type of IUD, USE ANOTHER FORM OF BIRTH CONTROL!! The risks with using this IUD are not worth the benefits in my opinion.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I started Skyla after being on Enskyce for about a year and a half with no problems, I just didn't want to take a pill everyday. Without birth control I have fairly heavy periods, chronic migraines, and moderate acne; with Enskyce I had almost no acne, only migraines around my period, and mild-moderate periods. After a year with Skyla, I had to get it taken out because I became very depressed and anxious, my migraines were only around my period but became 100x worse, and my skin became terrible with hormonal acne all around my chin and cheeks. My sex drive also decreased a lot, which combined with my worsened mood, became a hinderance on my relationship with my boyfriend. I would also have random light cramps caused by the IUD even after a year and experienced constant spotting up until the 7th or 8th month. I finally got fed up and had it taken out about a week ago and I immediately started feeling better overall and have gone back onto Enskyce with no problems so far.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD placed back in February. Overall pain for insertion was about a 3/10. After insertion, I had on and off severe cramps. They went away in 20-30 seconds. I had mild spotting for a day or two. In March, one week before my follow up, I had sex. Towards the end, I felt some pain in my cervix. Something didn't feel right. So, I went home to check the IUD strings. They felt "lower" than when I last had checked. My Kyleena was partially expelled. I panicked. Next day I scheduled an appointment to make sure my IUD was actually expelling and not just hanging low. Turns out, it was, so they removed it. Expulsion is very rare so I felt bad for myself. My ob-gyn had told me that I could have a new one inserted. So, I did on March 15. But the chances of the IUD expelling AGAIN would be 20% higher! Re-insertion was a 5/10. I spotted a little more than the last. Cramps were more often/severe. I'll update you guys on April 16, 2018, to see how my follow up goes!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I just got Skyla inserted today and I was so nervous about the pain after reading reviews! Yes... it’s gonna hurt. It was definitely not as bad as I worked it up to be. It’s just like a period cramp but goes away quicker. I previously had the depo and decided to switch due to weight gain and mood swings so I’m hoping this is an improvement!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):They gave me 800 mg ibproufen before the procedure and yes the insertion hurt. Like a horrible cramp. But the cramping that followed the procedure (the first 20 minutes) was the worst pain I’ve ever felt. (Granted I’ve never had children) I made it to my car and started screaming. The pain was unbearable. I was crying. I couldn’t drive. I couldn’t think. I started throwing up. Then I think the ibuprofen kicked in and I was able to drive home. But no regrets. So far I’ve had skyla for a week and the cramps come and go. My period was normal now I’m just spotting. But loooooordy. Take some sort of pain killer before the procedure. The pain is no joke.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):28 years old no kids I got the kyleena on Jan 11th. It was the worst minute of my life to be honest,  it was  traumatic really.The first 3 days I had severe cramps to where I couldn't get out of bed, pain medicine didn't help, but a heating pad did. The next 1.5 months I had sporadic cramps and discharge/bleeding that went away and my period has gotten shorter/lighter.  Two weeks after insertion I started noticing severe anxiety/depression to the point that it was debilitating I gained about 15 pounds in 1 month (I'm 5'5 I was 130, got up to 145ish) my diet/activity did not drastically change.Just when I was ready to have it removed due to the side effects, month 3The anxiety and depression went away almost over night and I have started losing weight.Still have bad cramps a few days before my period starts but they are few and far between. Tylenol does help now.It was a REALLY bad 3 months, but I'm glad I stuck it out, it's worth not stressing about birth control for the next 5 years.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve only had Skyla in for a day. However I wanted to talk about having it put in. Before going I read all these reviews and got wicked scared. That being said I went and I survived. Take ibuprofen before going and make the appointment during your period. It takes 2 minutes. I got two big cramps when it was put in which made me say owww but it was nothing worse than period cramps. The cramps came and went for about 5 hours but now I haven’t felt anymore. It’s really not that bad don’t get too scared.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Be careful.  I thought this was would be a great decision.  Due to a heart condition, I could not longer take oral contraception.  My Mirena experience has been a nightmare. I am 8 months in and have scheduled to have it removed next week.  It was torture to have it placed and the cramping was awful for almost a week afterward.  I gained 5 pounds, had incessant bloating, depression, and hair growth on my face.  I am hopeful I will be freed from these horrible side effects.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had Mirena for 1.5 years. Insertion was uncomfortable but doable.The first few days I had cervical cramps which made me double over sometimes. Advil worked fine to ease the pain.The first five months I spotted constantly.I had a bit of trouble normalizing my emotions the first month or two.After the first 6 months no more periods or pain.Anytime I'm really stressed, or have a drastic change in activity, attitude, or emotions I will spot for up to two weeks.Overall Mirena is great. I would recommend it over any other birth control.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've only had it for a month but so far it's not bad. I took advil and a xanax before the insertion which helped. I had cramping but was mainly when it was first placed and a little for a few hours. I had slight headaches and nausea the first week. I'm bleeding very slightly but was told that could last a little while. My face and hormones seem fine and just hoping I don't gain weight and my period disappears as my main reason for trying this was extremely heavy periods. I'll update if any problems occur. So far, I think it is worth trying.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got this IUD inserted 3 weeks ago today. I was really nervous because I had done a bunch of research and had read that it would be super painful getting it but it wasn’t as bad as I was expecting. The cramps that I had the next 5 days were way worse than insertion. I woke up the next morning at 2am with such terrible cramps that I thought I was going to die. It felt like how I imagine contractions would feel to be honest. After day 5 it stopped being so intense but now I’m dealing with weird pressure type pain. It feels like something in or near my uterus is going to burst...like a super intense ovulation type pain. It hurts to sit when it’s like this and Advil doesn’t touch it. I started spotting a few days after insertion and have been bleeding fairly heavy ever since. Overall, I haven’t been super pleased with the experience but I’m going to try to stick it out for a few more months.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This review is for the insertion of my Kyleena IUD. I was extremely nervous leading up to my appointment because I, of course, read every single thing possible before getting it done. I psyched myself out so much, I was having nervous cramps leading up to it! DO NOT let the negative experiences scare you away! It starts out like a typical Pap smear, then you have your cervix measured (the most painful part to me—felt like a tiny pinch for about 2 seconds and then the pain was over)  Then before I even knew that she had put the IUD in it was over! I did not feel a thing. I have very very mild cramping right now, just feels like muted period cramps(I had my IUD out in an hour ago). I know everyone reacts differently to pain, but I would recommend this to anyone! I’ll update my review once I’ve had it for a few months!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Had my Liletta placed in August 2017. Most painful thing I have ever experienced. My Dr never ordered the medication to soften my cervix (called me the day of the procedure and said oops) so take that into account, mind you I have a very high pain tolerance. When this thing was placed it took my breath away, I became dizzy and immediately started cramping. For the first month I had bleeding non-stop (heavy period level of flow) and severe cramping. After the first month still had bleeding, pretty much every other day more than spotting but less than full menstrual flow and cramping until 4 months. Period now irregular, longer 7-10 days. My acne flares up now. I now have frequent headaches (never had that prior to Liletta). Benefits: I'm not pregnant.Cons: EVERYTHING ELSE! Cramping, irregular bleeding, longer period, heavier period, PMS, acne, boyfriend doesn't like it, and headaches.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kylenna March of 2017. The insertion was not painful to me at all(I have very high pain tolerance). After the fact I had bleeding for 25 days straight then had a break of 2 weeks and started again and lasted  8 days. After that it was 6 days every month for 5 months. Then I had the biggest pregnancy scare, I gained a lot of weight from all these cravings I got, I missed my period and had all pregnancy symptoms. Took every test possible and all NEG! Period came back a month and a half later. Had a regular period the month after and now my last period was Dec 29th, 2018 and now it’s been 74 days without a period. I had headaches, dizziness spells, and was a bit tired. Other than that I think it’s been a rough start but now that my period has stopped I feel like it’s a good birth control. It’s very new in the market so I thought I would let you know my experience since it was hard for me to find any. Hope it helps!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got my IUD inserted this morning and the reviews I read were pretty similar to my experience; the measuring of the cervix is DEFINITELY the worst part. The insertion itself wasn't too bad and I only had some occasional mild cramping throughout the day that felt like period cramps (although less painful than my usual menstrual cramps). Overall satisfied and I’m really glad that I got it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 21 and I chose Kyleena after being off an on Tri cyclen for two and a half years. I went into the clinic having taken two extra strength advils (800 mg). I was grateful for every mg of that medication during insertion. It was mainly just very uncomfortable but definitely up there on one of the most unpleasant experiences. I pictured being shackled to children throwing a tantrum to get through knowing this would prevent that from being a reality. I had some light nausea, dizziness and cramping right from the get go and I was in a lot of discomfort the next week but only had light spotting which continued until my period a week or two later. My first period was quite a bit heavier than I'm used to then after that period ended it's been almost two months and no period or spotting so far since... I do notice my breasts have shrunk about a cup size and I've been a little moodier and anxious than usual but it is also the middle of midterms...

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had this IUD put in July of 2017 at 6 weeks postpartum, so my cervix was still a little open. I barely had any pain at all during insertion. I went home and had moderate cramping, and I bled for 2 weeks. I haven’t had a period since which I love. I do get nauseous ALL the time and my sex drive is non existent. I have vaginal dryness and feel angry a lot of the time. Now recently I started getting back pains and cramping a lot more. I’m on the fence weather or not I want to get this IUD removed. I’m currently not sexually active, but I love not having a period.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had skyla inserted July 2016 and the insertion was not bad at all. Just some pressure. I was petrified because of all the reviews I read on here. I really hyped myself up for nothing. It wasn't fun but certainly not as bad as I thought it would be. Everybody is different. The first 9 months I spotted almost everyday. It became really annoying but I stuck with it because it made my terrible PMS and mood swings go away, which were so bad that it really affected my personal life and relationship. Finally after about 9 months the spotting stopped being so frequent, and then it completely stopped at about a year. I haven't had a period or any slight spotting since and I couldn't be happier! I've had no other side effects and will consider getting another one at the end of my 3 years.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I recently had my first IUD (skyla) removed because it was expiring and had it replaced with Kyleena.  Taking out the original felt like a big pinch but the discomfort only lasted for a second.  With this insertion, my pain was significantly reduced; my doctor explained she has been experimenting with different pain management methods to make the IUD process more manageable. She sprayed my cervix with a benzocaine spray  before starting and used some lidocaine once my cervix was dilated. This made my experience significantly less painful than my insertion of the skyla.
