So far, I'm having very light cramping and my spotting has started to taper off already; with my original I spotted for a full six weeks.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The insertion of the skyla IUD was the most painful experience of my life. My periods have gotten heavier, longer, and inconsistent over the past 7 months. I either bleed for two weeks, an entire month straight, or do not bleed AT ALL for a month. My cramps are unbelievable painful and painkillers do not help them. I have gained weight. I have acne for the first time ever and it gets really bad around menstruation.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have to say this has been the best birth control I have had. A couple of years ago after I had my first child, I chose to get the copper IUD and had a horrible experience (horrible cramping and heavy bleeding for 4 months) so I was nervous giving an IUD another try. Before the liletta, I was on a pill for about a year that was causing my acne to flare up and I was constantly bloated. After the liletta insertion, within a week my bloating had disappeared and within a month my acne was almost completely gone. The insertion was uncomfortable, but a couple of Advil helped ease the pain. There was spotting for the first two months but it wasn’t enough to warrant anything other than a panty liner. My breasts were very tender and sore for the first month, but subsided fairly quickly. I have had it in about 5 months and love it. My periods are super light and I have had no issues with weight gain or acne. Sex isn’t uncomfortable and my boyfriend hardly ever feels it.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Had Skyla inserted on Monday. 24, have never had kids. Took 2 Misoprostol orally beforehand. Never bothered by PAP smears or the transvaginal ultrasound I had during an egg donation. The manual dialation of the cervix & insertion was the most extreme pain EVER. WAY more painful than any cramp or tattoo; unimaginable pain. Took the doc 5 minutes. Pain didn’t stop. Had a vasovagal reaction; BP dropped, broke out in a sweat, was given cold compresses, told to stay lying down, super lightheaded & nauseous. Couldn’t focus on what staff was saying after. Pain was dibilitating & severe Mon-Wed (7 hrs, 6 hrs, 4 hrs); made me bawl all 3 days. Been taking Advil & Tylenol Mon-today, doesn’t do much. It’s Thursday. Had 4 hours of cramps, not as extreme. 1st day I haven’t cried from pain & could get out of the house. I don’t care how effective it is, no one should go through this. If pain level drops to a bearable point by Monday, I’ll keep it, but right now I can’t function

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my daughter almost 5 months ago, don't want any more so decided to get Kyleena. I took 2 aleeve an hour before my appt. The measuring of my cervix and the clamp on my cervix was the only two times I felt a horrible cramp, plus the Dr warned before it would occur. Not a bad experience at all! It was inserted on Day 2 of my menstrual cycle (last 7 days normally). Since the birth of my daughter, I no longer get horrible cramps so I took Aleeve to be safe. The appt was short and I felt fine after the appt and still feel fine. Waiting to see what the rest of the months bring.....

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Had the mirena for almost a year. I’d always suffered from mild anxiety, but while I was on it it increased to almost a crippling level. I was developing depression and I couldn’t shake the feelings. I also had absolutely no sex drive, so for me there was really no point in it. It was effective, of course, but it ruined just about everything else. I spotted constantly, was grumpy or nervous, and gained almost 20 pounds. I was at 118 and now I’m at 135. I got it out a week ago, I haven’t weighed myself but I can already see the difference. My clothes are starting to fit like normal again, my mood swings are almost non existent. I got it out while on my period so I haven’t had an experience with that just yet. But so far a few weights have been lifted off my shoulders

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am doing a review for insertion. I am 20 years old and have not had children.  Let me first say that I was so beyond scared for the insertion because I read and heard how painful it could be. I had myself so worked up before the process. IT WAS NOT THAT BAD!! Nor was it the worst pain I have ever had in my life. I can only explain this as being uncomfortable not extremely painful. The process took about 3 minutes total. I felt pretty bad cramping during the measuring of my uterus and then again during the actual kyleena insertion, but it was definitely tolerable. DO NOT let insertion stories scare you away like they almost did for me. Everyone is different and for a few seconds of being uncomfortable I think it’s worth it! Will review about side effects at a later date.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had 2 skylas now. I had my first put in just over 3 years ago, and had it replaced 2 months ago. The first time around, it was very painful for insertion and my blood pressure dropped. I cramped on and off for about 2-3 weeks, and had a bit of spotting. After the first 2-3 months, my periods got very irregular, and it was mostly just spotting. This happened until about 2 years in, then my period basically stopped completely. I had the Skyla replaced in January, and it went so much smoother. I knew what to expect, and I came prepared. But honestly, it was painful for about 15 minutes, then I got up and went to the grocery store. I spotted a little the first day, but I've had absolutely no cramping since the first day, and don't get a period anymore. Honestly, the only reasons I don't give it a 10 is its a bit painful when its gets put in, its not 100% accurate, and I get a little nervous when I don't get my period.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I suffered from dysmenorrhea and when I tell you calling out of work and missing 3 day of your life was a norm...I am not exaggerating. I’ve suffered from this since I was 8yrs old. Now at age 25, I decided something needed to change. I knew birth control can help regulate hormones and periods (if you remember to take them), but I needed something strong and reliable. Even Kyleena a was a PAIN to insert (I almost passed out ), it was definitely worth it. I am currently on my 6th month and have slight bleeding off and on. If I happen to cramp it literally last 2-3 mins and it’s so faint I don’t even need to sit down. I highly recommend this iud.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Hey, I spotted on the Lilletta for 6 months, I still spot after sex now and I think now my sex drive has gone way down. I feel dry and uncomfortable. My weight has also gone way up since May of 2016 when I had it placed and while my activity levels are a little less than usual, my food habits are the same (perhaps better) but I've gained 30 pounds and it's been impossible to lose that weight. I've been beating up myself about it but I think it's not me, because I've always exercised intermittently (2-3 times/week). I also feel depressed and have little to no drive. I find small tasks extremely difficult and have very low confidence. I'm taking the Lilletta out in a week or so and I'll update this if I see that this is what has been causing it. I hope it's not because of this I have not had periods for the last 1.5 years (I used to get very painful periods) and it's been a welcome relief.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion was the worst pain I have ever felt. The cervical measurement (trial run, as my dr said) was a preview of the pain- I nearly kicked myself off the table I was so caught off guard. "Just feels like an intense cramping," reviews had said online..the reviews were wrong & I felt murdered. IUD went in & I almost kicked myself into the next exam room. A nurse stayed with me for the next 45 minutes while I laid with a Sprite & pretzels to keep from passing out. The hours after insertion were horrible. I cried & spent that day & the day after on a heating pad (your BFF for the next several weeks after an IUD). A few weeks of on/off cramping (expected) & then occasional cramping for a few months.I have awful periods, & 9 months later I can say this was the best decision I've made for my body. The adjustment is trying but you have to give it time. 11/10 for the IUD

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had Mirena inserted in June 2017. My doctor suggested it since I suffer from really bad migraines (especially during my period). From June on I didn't get my period . Unfortunately I hated what it did to me - weight gain, acne on my face/neck and back, constantly feeling bloated, cravings/large appetite, and no sex drive. After 9 months I finally got it removed on Friday. I will say that it did help with my migraines  since I didn't have a drop in hormones like the pill . I went from 134 to my current weight 156.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Boy oh boy did I have the WORST experience with the insertion and the cramping after. The insertion hurt so bad, I got super dizzy and had the sweats. Then when I got home it was nonstop cramping. Threw up twice, had the chills. When I say cramping I could not lay down, I could not sit down. I had to walk back and forth to be able to even function. Best of luck to whomever decides to do an IUD.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):After my third child I decided on Mirena. Got it inserted 12/16. Bled for three months with horrible pains. I have had serious digestion problem. To date, I went from 145lbs to 165lbs (my heavest). I have had horrible mood swings, anxiety, hot flashes, back pains, joint pains, fatigue, constipation etc. Recently, I have started to feel like I'm having a heart attack. My bp is now 135/88. I have never had bp in this range. I'm getting it out this week. I can't take it anymore

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am on my last year of the 3 year long Skyla. First, like many women were told, the pain of insertion should just be a pinch. It was one of the worst pains I have ever felt, leaving me in pain for the rest of the day and cramping for the rest of the month. The side effects I have had include weight gain, loss of sex drive, and more emotional distress. After about 3-4 months of being on Skyla I gained more than 20 lbs and gradually started to notice all these changes. The only good things I can say is after the first couple months of random spotting I have not had a period at all. Here recently I have noticed spotting again, I assume because it is nearing the end. My doctor also told me was that my partner would not feel a difference during sex, which is not true. The wire string is pretty obvious, which is something I wish I knew. Overall it is not terrible, but for me it was too many changes.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I just got Mirena removed after about a year of having it and I couldn't be happier. It started out great: my periods were light to nonexistent, my hair grew faster, and of course I didn't need to worry about pregnancy. Fast forward to about month 5 and things took a turn for the worse. I had developed severe anxiety and moderate depression, struggled constantly with stomach/digestive issues, my acne went out of control, terrible mood swings...my list could go on and on. I finally did some research and found that plenty of women experienced the same as me, so I got it removed and have felt great since! No more skin issues, digestive problems or mental health issues. I just wish I had done a little more research before I got it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Went on this med because I was terrible at taking my pill on a regular basis and had one too many pregnancy scares! The insertion process was pretty terrible, the worst pain I've felt, but it was very quick. Just stay calm and breathe. The cramps that I had for the 24 hours following were worse. I called in sick to work the next day and stayed home with advil and a heating pad. For almost 1.5-2 months, I had a light period every single day. And I mean EVERY single day. It was frustrating not being able to be intimate with my boyfriend, but then about a week ago it stopped!! I recommend sticking it out, the first few months are terrible, but its so worth it to not have to take a pill every day!!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Ok so I got the liletta Oct 2016 procedure took maybe 10 min the pain was pretty bad. I bled 4 months straight and the strings were literally one inch from being outside of my body I had them trimmed. I was told after 6 months my period should stop well they are lighter but haven't stopped and last between 10-12 days. I have to wear panty liners all day everyday bc I have a constant clear watery discharge (no stds) my ob said it is my body getting rid of all the extra hormones. But it's so irritating. Sex is fine no pain but my husband says he gets poked sometimes. I haven't had it removed yet bc I haven't gotten pregnant thank god. But I have had a problem I'm not sure if its related to the BC or not but since about a month after getting it I have had severe neck pain and about 6 months ago every thing above my waist went numb and has been numb since. I see a neurologist next month so hopefully ill find out if it has anything to do with my liletta.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had Kyleena for about 3 months, and my experience with it has been life-changing. I was originally on the pill, but remembering to take it everyday took a toll on me. I got Kyleena inserted, and that was an interesting experience. My OBGYN numbed my cervix, so insertion wasn't terrible. After that, I bled/spotted for about 3 weeks. Now, I spot on and off, which is something that I can handle since I don't spot often. The luxury of not having to take a pill everyday is totally worth it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted a little over a week ago. I chose kyleena because of low hormones despite all the bad reviews I have read about consistent spotting. My doc pointed out that people that make the time to write about their experiences in these posts usually aren’t happy with it. So here I am haha. Whereas those that are happy are going on about there lives and don’t think about writing a review online, usually. I personally have not had any spotting so far. However, after 3 days of insertion, I noticed an overwhelming feeling of anxiousness and every day that has gone by since, I have been suffering with anxiety and mood swings, including crying for no reason and just an overall feeling of worry. With this, I’ve lost a lot of sleep which is not normal for me. Because it’s only been a week, I’m going to give it some time, but so far I’m not happy.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had mirena for about 8 months. I was told to use that one instead of the copper IUD, so I did. I was expecting the inconsistent bleeding because that happens to me whenever I try a new birth control. I honestly hated the mirena. I felt I was going crazy, until I started researching online and found so many others with the exact same symptoms and thoughts. I gained about 17 pounds on the mirena, something I was told was not going to happen. I had a fast metabolism before this and wasn’t too worried about what I was eating. Then I noticed the increase and of course when I got it removed they told me it increases your appetite. I also felt cramps so much worse than I used to, and the spotting was getting annoying because it lasted longer than my regular periods. I’ve had it out for about three days now and the bloated feeling I had is more minimal. I’m hoping my body goes back to its natural state fast and that I can work these pounds off. It definitely didn’t work for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm a 28 years old and have been on the pill for 10 years. Never been pregnant.  I choose the Kyleena over others because I have heavy periods and wanted a lower dosage of hormones. I got the Kyleena put in on Tuesday and so far I'm very happy. My doctor was very good at explaining every step and made me feel very comfortable. I had to get a PAP test and other tests before the IUD was placed, which was protocol to prevent infections. The measuring of the cervix was uncomfortable and crampy but bearable. The actual placement of the IUD didn't hurt but there was some cramping. I found the measuring of the cervix more uncomfortable then the placement. So far after 4 days the spotting has gone, minor cramping and slight bloating. Lets see how my first period goes.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Hello everyone, I just finished having my Liletta removed after two years in. I originally got this IUD to help with my heavy flow which consisted of 8-12 days long. After insertion, I bled/spotted for about 6months. After that my period would come for about 3 days and would only need to wear panty liners. However, my last year my period was all over the place and I began to feel some side effects. For example: lethargy, spotting, cramps, Breast swelling, nipple tenderness, vaginal dryness, mood swings, and weight gain. My period was also impossible to track, if I could guess I would say I had a period of 3-4 days twice a month at random times. I removed it this week and I feel better, I lost 3lbs so far, my sore breast and nipples are gone, and most importantly I feel happy.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):let me preface this by saying I have the LOWEST pain tolerance okay? I'm a WUSS. first the doctor inserted the speculum. Then he clamped my cervix. This feels like a dull constant pain. Its not pleasant but you get used to it. Then he measured my uterus. THIS HURTS LIKE HELL. I wanted to jump off the table. I started whispering "5 years" and my doctor reminded me to breathe. All of that lasted about 10 sec. I know 10 sec sounds short but count to 10 out loud and imagine being in sharp pain for that long. It feels like a lifetime. Then he inserted the IUD. I didn't feel it at all. He removed the speculum and it was over. The entire procedure was maybe a 1.5 min. afterwards I felt hot and teared up a bit. (I also tear up when getting my ears pierced I'm a wuss) I waited 5 minutes and drove home. Overall, it freaking sucks but 2 hours later I feel completely fine. I will also say that I was on my period, inserted 200 mcg misoprostol the night before and took 1000 mg ibuprofen.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I just got it inserted today. Many reviews said it would only feel like a pinch, but it hurt extremely bad for me. I must be sensitive to pain or something because the pain was probably 8.5/10 . I had to sit there for about 10 mins after it was over because I was in so much pain. The cramps afterwards are the worst I've ever felt but come in waves. I'm sitting in a hot bath right now hoping it will help the cramps.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted about 2 and a half weeks ago for birth control. I'm 23 and I have never been pregnant. The insertion was so much more painful than I had prepared myself for, and I did a ton of research before hand. I spent a half hour after the insertion rolling around on the floor of the exam room, and then another half hour in the waiting room trying to calm down enough to get myself home. Aside from the pain I'm pretty happy, I've had very minimal spotting, but I do get relatively intense cramping every day, usually morning and evening. I've got high hopes that this will be worth it because being on the pill was brutal, and I'm incredibly forgetful! Here's hoping!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Instead of reading all the reviews, I read my pamphlet and asked a few of my friends who had the Mirena/Skyla. I was nervous, but I didn't think it would be painful because my doctor said it was just pressure. I was on my period at the time of the insertion, and it was probably the most painful thing in my life. I have a really high pain tolerance, and this exceeded my limits. VERY uncomfortable and I bled a lot more than usual. I was shaking and sweating. The following day, I spent taking pain relievers and laying down, but was toooooo uncomfortable to even sleep..luckily it was my day off. It completely stopped my period, and my next period was 9 days long of extreme cramping, and heavy bleeding. BUT, after that its been easy sailing. I've had it for three months now, and everything is going well, a little spotting to no bleeding, and a few sharp pains due from cramping but nothing a little tylenol won't help.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):First of all: take birth control reviews with a grain of salt, EVERY woman is different and will react differently. Do your research, talk to your doctor and choose the birth control method that is right for you. On to my review: I have had Skyla for about 5 months now and I love it. I love not having to worry about a pill everyday or having to go to the pharmacy every month. Insertion was a bit uncomfortable but it is over quickly. I started spotting two weeks after insertion and it only lasted a week or so. My first period was a bit heavy and I had pinkish discharge for a few days after it was over. Since then my periods have been extremely light. I wear a panty liner. It’s more of a brown discharge. I haven’t had any adverse effects and I’m very happy with my decision to get it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I started looking into an IUD because my birth control pill was really acting up. I had been gaining weight, cramps were getting more painful, and mood swings were getting out of control. My doctor recommended Kyleena and I am SO thankful she did. The procedure was 100% covered by insurance. I won't lie, the insertion hurts and I experienced about three hours of intense cramping. There was light spotting for two months almost every day, which was annoying but manageable. 6 months into having Kyleena inserted, I've lost 20 pounds. I experience some light spotting maybe 1-2 days a month, but no resulting cramps or mood swings. If you can push through those beginning couple months, the benefits are so worth it, especially if you have been struggling with side effects to the level of hormone in pill contraceptive like I was.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena inserted this past Friday so 3 days ago. I'm 18 and was on my 3rd day of my period. I was nervous  and the whole time just tried to breath through it. When the Dr touched the cervix it wasn't too bad. But when she had to measure the uterus it did hurt a bit, nothing I couldn't handle but when she put the actual IUD in, it was a terrible pain. I jolted and teared up at it- had to also stay lying down for about 10 mins after to relax and deal with the cramping. When it was inserted I felt it scrape along the left side of my uterus and for some reason I am having pain on that side now and I'm gonna call the Dr in the morning.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I wanted to love Mirena! I had it inserted 8 weeks postpartum. My bleeding from having a baby had stopped a few weeks prior. As soon as I got Mirena, I started to bleed, and bled for 4 weeks straight, twice the amount I do on my normal periods. What made me decide to get it taken out was the fevers I was getting. I was getting 102 fevers randomly for a few days with no other other causes. Within 24 hours of getting it out, the fever immediately resolved. My body was definitely not a candidate for an IUD.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta almost 2 months ago. I do have 2 children already, early 30’s, obese. First experienced a really annoying spotting for about 1.5 months. Now it has stopped. I am hoping its not related to pregnancy. If I won’t get my period for another week, will probably take a pregnancy test. Its been a good experience once the  bad cramping stopped. A bit of a weight gain but I think its manageable. I just have a problem with eating right.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I hate this IUD. I had it inserted in June 2017 and  aside from the fact that I passed out during insertion (which I can take. That only lasted a few minutes). I bled for 3 months straight in the beginning. And I have had HORRIBLE cystic acne, I’ve tried MANY medications to calm it and nothing seems to be helping. Vitamin A helped but then it got worse again. My skin hurts and after an extremely formal event where I took pictures and SAW MY ACNE FROM 3 FEET AWAY. I will have this removed. I also have itching and burning in my vagina from the IUD and extreme pain during intercorse. I’ve been with the same partner for many years and we both have tested negative for any STDs, therefore I believe it to be the IUD as it’s a side effect. The only reason I didn’t give it a 0 is because I haven’t had my period in 4 months and no pregnancy. Don’t get it, I will be removing it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted this past Tuesday (it's now Sunday). The pain wasn't as bad as I expected, an intense twinge while the midwives were measuring my cervix, but the actual insertion hurt less than the measurement. I took two 200 mg acetaminophen about an hour before my appointment as well. I did have aggravated cramping for a few hours after insertion, and I was pretty tired, so I also took a 3-4 hour nap. Since then, there's been very mild, sporadic cramping that feels more like a random spasm than anything else. Vaginal discharge has been minimal, accompanied by very light bleeding (spotting). I did experience some pretty severe mood swings for the first 2 days post-insertion (Wednesday and Thursday). For me, it was sadness/depression, and I got easily overwhelmed. There were lots of tears, but I got through it. Thankfully, that has since subsided and I feel pretty good now!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had it inserted two days ago. My current condition is mild cramps and a little spotting. A little background: I usually am very on time with periods (30-31 day cycle), 5 day period, moderate to mild cramps on the first few days, On the day of my insertion I was day 31 of my cycle (my gyn almost wouldn't insert cause I wasn't on my period) I took a 400mg advil, and had a little bit of food. The insertion was a lot less painful than I expected (reference: I felt no pain after my wisdom teeth removal too, to each their own I suppose), It felt uncomfortable when she measured my cervix, and then she just inserted it. I was able to walk fine right after, cramps started maybe 2/3 hours after. I took pain killers just in case for the first day, and have been off of it since. Still waiting for my period, although my gynecologist said it might not comes.. who knows?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted 3 weeks ago. Honestly the insertion was not that bad! Maybe 30 seconds of a super bad cramp is what it felt like for me. I went to work right after and was fine although there were some really heavy cramps that night. I have been spotting for 3 weeks now all day every day

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I'm 18 I got the kyleena a month ago. Everyone's different I guess, but for me the insertion was absolutely painful. For the first 10 mins after I had to sit down because I felt dizzy like I was going to pass out, so my doctor gave me water & crackers. I also felt an uncomfortable pressure way up there. I walked it off and felt a lot better. Almost every other day I've been spotting, cramping, and boobs hurt. Hoping these side effects ware off soon..

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Mirena 2 yrsI had Mirena inserted 6 wks after my child was born. I was very fit & active before my pregnancy. I gained 30 lbs & lost 20 the 1st wk after giving birth. After Mirena was inserted, I gained back the 20 lbs & decided to get back to eating right & working out. I thought I couldn’t lose the weight bc of the stress on my body from work & not eating right.Fast forward-now, had Mirena since April 2016. I have HORRIBLE depression, anxiety attacks from nothing, blurry vision, dramatic weight gain, went from 140-170 pounds, the most I’ve Ever weighed in my life! the more balanced I try to eat, the worse it seems to effect my weight gain. Not to mention I have NO sex drive anymore & am always moody & feel bad for my bf. We used to have amazing sex before Mirena. I looked up reviews & side effects after crying about it 1 day, I finally decided maybe it is Mirena. I made an appt for next week, I just hope after it’s removed I get back to my fit & happy self. Hope this helps.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Horrible insertion , I had a baby so they are inserting it into your cervix, kinda like when a baby is trying to come out ! None the less I have been bleeding EVERY DAY for 2 months sometimes heavy with lots of clots sometimes light ! But there is always something coming out ! I’d honestly rather deal with a period and condoms than this ! I can’t even have sex anyway because I am always bleeding ! I’m getting this removed if the bleeding hasn’t let up by next month ! They need to fix this and stop issuing us as guinea pigs because they didn’t warm about this extreme bleeding AT ALL. Plus , I’m spending a fortune in pads and tampons - which is backwards in my opinion.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):About the only good thing it's done is kept me from getting pregnant. Mine was inserted Oct 1st, 2017. I had horrible periods before and they're even worse now with the IUD. Cramps that cause me to take time of work (midol, heat, nothing helps) my period went from being able to wear a super tampon 8 hours and never bleed through, now I'm lucky if I can even make it 4. I used to have my period for 5-7 days, now I have it for 7 days, with 5-6 days of heavy spotting afterwards. My skin in greasy, I have horrible acne which I've never had an issue with until now! I've gained 10lbs at least since October, mood swings like crazy. If I didn't have this stupid sensitivity to estrogen I'd just go back to being on the pill cause this is ridiculous.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had Kyleena for a year now and a couple weeks. It didn't hurt much when I got it, more like a cramp or a pinch. I did feel a bit uncomfortable the first few days (menstrual cramping and bloating) after that I was fine. The first 6 months my period would last about 2 weeks and it was heavy. The next 3 months it lasted about 2-3 days but I would get it twice a month and it was light. The following 3 months, which now mark my year with it I have not gotten my period at all. I do feel the "symptoms" but no flow.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted on February 1, 2018, so it’s only been about three weeks. The insertion of the kyleena was more uncomfortable than painful, it was similar to the feeling of a Papsmear with an extra step. After the insertion, I did have some pretty mild cramps the rest of the day as well as the day following, but that was really the only side effect I have experienced. I also spotted very lightly for about 2 weeks after. Other than that, this birth control has been delightful, and with a 99.8% effective rate, it couldn’t get any better! Hope this helps someone.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla inserted in December 2017. First of all, the insertion hurt for me, especially the part when she measured my cervix, so I'd definitely recommend requesting the day of insertion off from work, because I felt quite crampy and lightheaded afterwards. Unfortunately thus far the cons have been outweighing the pros in terms of having it. The pros are not having to worry about an unwanted pregnancy, which is nice! My boyfriend has never complained about the strings either. The cons are very long, heavy periods. I'm not talking spotting, but a decent amount of bleeding that leaves me feeling exhausted. I've also experienced a massive breakout before I got my period all over my forehead, chest, back, etc. Before I was on Skyla, I used to get an occasional breakout on my chin before I got my period, but nothing this bad. I'm hoping my periods will lighten and my hormones will balance out if I wait it out. But if things aren't improving in a few months, I think I'll take my Skyla out.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I experienced the worst cystic acne breakout along my jaw line and it eventually on my cheeks, chin, and breasts. The first few months I felt bloated all the time despite working out and not changing my diet. I have always been careful with my diet because I have Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and celiacs. It seemed that no matter what I ate or drank, my stomach was constantly bloated. Before insertion, I weighed 135 pounds. Now, after 7 months with it, I’m up to 160 pounds. I assumed this was because of the holidays and general life stress but I’ve been tracking my diet (1000-1300 calories a day) and exercising regularly and I have not been able to stop gaining weight nor have I been able to lose weight. I have no sex drive and began having vision problems (blurry vision/eye strain) and migraines. I have no history of migraines or blurry vision. I’ve experienced joint pain in my knees, ankles, shoulders and horrible back pain.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I just had my liletta inserted 2 weeks ago. Insertion was nothing really. I took Ibuprofen before like recommended and felt some slight to strong cramping as it was inserted but it lasted maybe 30 seconds. I did take meds again that night to avoid more cramping. I started spotting to lightly bleeding the next day and it hasn't stopped. It is very light - only need a panty liner but so ready for it to be done! Was on depo for 15 years prior to this with no periods so if bleeding doesn't stop I will go back to the shot only bc I hate my period.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I just had my Mirena removed yesterday after 3 months.  I hated it!  Cramps were awful, felt bloated, pressure after and during sex, face broke out, gained weight (so afraid to see how much, makes me so sad), what else?  Super moody and emotional all the time, bled almost every day since it was inserted.  BUT I wanted to go back to Nuvaring and my Dr said no since I am over 40.  So now what?   Anyone on here over 40 (43) and using any pills?

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):So I am 18 I have had kyleena for about 4 1/2 months and when it was inserted it hurt like anything  and the medication didn’t kick in till I got home.  I had cramping for 4 days afterwards but I didn’t bleed  I just had clear liquid coming out.  So far it has worked I would just talk to your doctor about all the pros and cons because everyone is different.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena inserted today and was surprised at how fast and non-painful it was! I cramped the night before from the Cytotec pill my Dr had me put in, but during the insertion procedure no pain, no cramping, no blood. I took 4 Aleve an hour before my appt. When I went in, I think I got local anesthesia (3 shots? Didn't hurt, less painful than the dentist), but I did feel the Dr measuring my cervix (little reasonable twinge - I've never had anything in my uterus before! I said "owww" but was more unfamiliar than painful) and barely felt anything when the Kyleena itself was put in. It was over in ~5 min and I could get up and drive myself home. Overall a 3/10 for discomfort. It's been 10+ hours since insertion and so far, no spotting at all and no cramps since before insertion! No painkillers since insertion either. Hoping things stay this way! I just wanted to share this positive experience--not all women have a painful or even unpleasant insertion! I'm very happy with my Kyleena so far :)

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I am 18, diagnosed with a small cervix, and I’m a virgin and I got the Liletta IUD 2 days ago. At first I was extremely nervous because all the reviews of the insertion seemed to be very negative, but so far my experience has only been positive! I  had the actual procedure done at Planned Parenthood and it only took about 7 minutes, it was painful for a few moments but it honestly wasn’t worse than getting my eye brows threaded. I had moderate cramps for about 3 hours after, but nothing that I couldn’t handle with some ibuprofen, I even went out the same night I got it and was able to go to the gym and work the next day. I continue to have light spotting, as expected, but overall I have loved it so far. I will update once I’ve had it longer.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my Skyla IUD inserted today. I was originally getting the Mirena, but it was out of stock, so I would be getting Kyleena instead. Let me first say, I'm 28 & I have 2 kids. I delivered both naturally. It felt like your average pap smear. The worst part was the Kyleena was not staying in. My Dr. tried 3 times & it was not working out. That's when I started cramping. My Dr. decided to ditch the Kylenna & used Skyla instead. So a procedure that should've been 5 minutes, took about 15 minutes. My Dr. said I was a trooper for having to put up with so many failed insertions. But finally Skyla stuck on the first try. I did have an internal ultrasound immediately after, just to make sure everything was ok. When I got home I took Motrin 800mg. So it took the cramps away pretty fast. I bled for only a few hours. Currently have a panty liner on just in case. I'm feeling much better. I drove myself home. Im hoping this works out. I've gotten pregnant while on the pill and depo.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Hello All! This IUD was inserted last month. To prepare for insertion I visited this blog and others like it and unfortunately was scared half to death by some of the reviews. I understand that everyone has a different experience, but my goodness I was definitely prepared for the worse. A reviewer suggested taking Ibuprofen beforehand and I heeded their advice. My OB and several staff members reassured me I would be fine, because they all have Liletta as well. During insertion there was discomfort, in the form of a major cramp. The entire process lasted about two minutes and I was done. I did experience cramping once the painkillers wore off. The next day I felt better. I have experienced light spotting and mild cramping occasionally. However, these symptoms  have not affected intercourse. Hope this helps those who may be nervous or uncertain. Always do your research. About Me: Under 30, No children, First IUD, and Obese.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got pregnant while still having the IUD inserted. The doctor said the IUD was still perfectly in place, but the little swimmer just swam right by and meet up with my egg and then implanted. Haha I would not recommend the skyla just because of my experience. All things happen for a reason tho, my daughter is the best thing that has ever happened to me. We actually named her Skyla. :)

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have been on this birth control for about 5 months now. Insertion was horrible! At first no noticeable side effects. However, now I have them all. I had always had extremely clear skin. Now I am constantly finding a new pimple on my face

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had experienced mood swings with birth control pills, and decided to follow my doctor's advice and get the Skyla IUD as a long term solution. The insertion occured in May 2017. I was on my cycle and only had a couple of Advil pills prior. The clamping of my cervix was horrible pain. I had a follow up appointment to check the placement, I stated to my doctor that I had terrible cramps and pelvic pain, but she dismissed, in addition the skyla was no where to be found. I then had to have a vaginal ultrasound, which resulted in it still in place, but the strings had shifted upward. Pelvic pain, severe cramps, periods lasting for nearly 2 weeks, spotting, and spotting after sex made for a miserable experience. I wanted it out, but my doctor insisted to keep in from 3-6 months. I went to remove in Jan and after 4 tries, she was unable to find, I had to have a hysteroscopy finally to remove, which revealed the strings in knots and one of the T shaped arms twisted around the device.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had Mirena for 6 years, I got it remove to get pregnant again, I had my baby June 25, 2017. My gyn put lilleta this time, she told me they weren't doing Mirena anymore unless you had a really bad health condition so I had to agreed to use lilleta. Both of my experiences when the doctor put it weren't bad, as it did not hurt at all or had any cramping.  But now I'm to the point of getting it removed because I been bleeding everyday since they place it and it has not stopped. My gyn said it's ok and normal that I have to give it a 6 month try but honestly it's just uncomfortable to be bleeding every single day you can not even be intimate..

I took it the day after having a condom split during sex. I was ovulating at the time and read reviews that it’s not affective during ovulation which caused unneeded panic!I had a week of bad cramps, sore breasts, tiredness etc and convinced myself it hadn’t worked and I was pregnant. Finally 4 days after my period was due, it started!My advice, don’t panic, don’t cause yourself unnecessary worry, it does what it’s supposed to and can make your period a little late that’s all.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve only had Skyla in 2 days now. This review is just on the implanting process. The reviews had me TERRIFIED to get this placed in. They take you in and just like getting a PAP done start the exam. The only uncomfortable part was they have to measure how far to place the Skyla.. but even that was just like a period cramp and was done in 2 minutes. Placing the device is actually smaller discomfort then them measuring it so it wasn’t a problem. So far so great with this, Hope it stays this way!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):It wasn’t great to to have inserted, but it was totally worth it.Discomfort for insert day day 5/10 during and then some cramping off and on for awhile after. I took aleve before and for a few days after. At first, it was awesome like two weeks of bliss!!! No bad or funky side effects, I was lovvving it! Then I started bleeding a lot, like every single day I had to wear pads, or liners. Then I got super clotty for a week or so I began hating it, and getting very bad headaches as well. Then my life went back to normal the blood kind of  tapered off, and my periods became sooo light and short!!! I still get headaches but not as bad or as frequent. I’m so glad I stuck with it!! All in all, I’d say it took about 8 weeks for my body to adjust to the iud! I recommend to friends and family who are with one partner and don’t want children yet to get this IUD!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just finish having kylenna  inserted a few mins ago and I personally have bad cramping right now. The inserting was painful to me for like 10 sec then I develop bad cramping right after. So I will keep posted after today to see how this will go

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted on Dec 27. I was bleeding already at the time of insertion, and bled every day until February 13. (48 days). I’ve been clear for 3 days now, so hopefully it’s over. A few moments of pain, a week of aching, and month and a half of spotting is a small price to pay for 5 years of birth control! After three pregnancies scares in 2017 I’m looking forward to it. (:

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla for about 6 months now.  My acne has never been worse in my whole life!!! I have cystic acne on my chin & red marks all over my face! I wish I would’ve known this before, I completely ruined my face. On the bright side, I haven’t gotten pregnant.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):As soon as this was inserted in me I walked out to my car and blood was all over my pants everywhere. I walked back in, they said it wasn't normal. They checked and it was inserted correct. I have a neurological condition that is autoimmune. They knew this. Since I have had it in and I'm having it removed all my symptoms were 20 times worse. Dizziness, heart racing, severe mood swings, spasms in uterus. I just lost my 6 week baby girl before so these spasms are emotionally messing with me. This IUD causes your uterus to be toxic to sperm...it also has barium and copper, a lot of bad things that should not be in your body. I recommend that nobody gets this.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Skyla IUD in since May 2017. After reading the many reviews about painful insertions I tricked myself out of getting an IUD many times in the past. This time I went for it after having terrible side effects from the pill and depo shot. It was surprising almost pain free except one slight pinch when my cervix was being measured. The cramps after weren’t so bad. Only mild if I moved or worked out during the first two weeks. It’s been smooth sailing ever since! One thing that is interesting is that I still get my period every month which doesn’t bother me one bit. Glad I made the decision to finally get it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted last Friday morning (it's now Monday night). I was bracing myself for some intense pain based on other reviews I read, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it not painful. Moderately uncomfortable for sure, but no pain for me. I was expecting an intense cramp during the insertion, but the most significant feeling for me was an intense twinge when they measured my cervix. Only a few minutes of discomfort, then I was done. I felt great after the procedure too. Any weird feelings were just mental - in my mind it felt like I had inserted something up there that needed to come out, like a tampon. But like I said, that was all mental - I couldn't actually feel it.I spotted for about three days with no cramping. Today I didn't spot at all, but I've noticed some minor cramps. Hopefully my smooth insertion continues to a smooth first few months with the Kyleena IUD. Will update this review with my experiences over the next few months.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I wish I could rate this negatively 10000 times, the IUD messed up my entire life. I never used to get pimples but now have SUCH bad acne. While I had it in I bled for literally for 4 MONTHS STRAIGHT (until I got it taken out), sometimes my cramps were so bad that I couldn’t even get out of bed. I was SO moody and I kept convincing myself that I needed to give it more time for my body to accept it. ALSO I could feel it during sex and it hurt so bad. I understand that it’s almost 100% effective that you won’t get pregnant but TBH I would’ve rather gotten pregnant than go through what I went through. NOT WORTH IT!!!!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Had my Mirena IUD inserted in 2007 right after my daughter was born. Had it removed and a new one reinserted once it had been 5 Years. I haven’t had a period for 10 years, so it works. I’ve pretty much had Mirena for my adult life and never really put it together. I’ve experience really bad UTIs and bacterial infections after the second one was put in. Excessive sweating and hot flashes, depression, joint pains, bloating, and weight gain. Again all of this never registered. I’m not much of a complainer and just assumed aging was the problem. I’m now at my heaviest, went down 60 pounds after pregnancy and have gained it all back since! It’s really hard to maintain or lose any weight! Exercise hasn’t helped! Went to get it removed and now the doctor can’t find it! Having to get and ultrasound to see where it is. Can’t wait to have it removed and see if that helps all my issues. I’m only posting this so other women don’t feel like they’re just crazy.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am 30, never been pregnant, wanted effective birth control that wouldn't potentially trigger depression. I had my Mirena inserted on January 20th, 2018. Six days later I started bleeding. It's now the 10th straight day of bleeding - started heavy like a normal period, and is now daily spotting, the sort I would usually get on the second-last day or so. I specifically sought out the Mirena because I wanted to decrease/eliminate my period, which would normally be 4 days long. I'm pretty disappointed with this outcome and I don't know how long I can stick with it to see if it'll get better. Time to go back to the doctor.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Let me start by saying I'm 23 and haven't had kids. Insertion was uncomfortable but it not the worst pain of my life. There was pinching a some slight cramping but it was over in less than 10 minutes and I drove my self home. I went in on my period so that could have helped. I spotted for the next two weeks and had no problems. I started to get cramps about 3 weeks post insertion. Not terrible or debilitating, just worse than I usually get. Then the day before my period started, I got more mild cramps. I started my period and it's the lightest thing ever. Panty liners are all I really need. So far, this birth control has been the best decision ever. I used to be on the pill and the ring and would get migraines during my period week from estrogen withdrawal. I gave up on any sort of hormonal bc for 2 years but got real tired of condoms so I did some research. So glad I decided to go with Skyla because the low dose of hormones doesn't give me any side effects.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD as a result of severe migraines (with aura) worsened by my period.  After trying numerous birth controls - experiencing a mini stroke - and speaking to my gynecologist I was quickly pulled off the pill. I had my IUD inserted 5 days ago - as well as cauterization. The inserting of the IUD was not as bad as the reviews I read.  Was it uncomfortable? Absolutely. Was I going to cry or pass out? No. Brace yourself for discomfort. I bled excessively for 24 hours.  Picking some heavy duty pads prior to going in - you will be happy you bought them.  There is some major cramping - and very minor spotting but if you suffer from migraines - cramping and spotting is nothing. So far - it’s been a dream.  Still very early in the process BUT my experience has not been like many of the reviews I have read. If you are thinking about getting an IUD - and if your doctor is on the same page - do it ! Don’t let other reviews spook you, worse comes to worse you take it out!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the Liletta inserted this morning. The procedure lasted about ten minutes. It wasn’t too bad. Of course there were cramps during the insertion but afterwards I had no cramps. I’m barely bleeding. I’m excited to begin my journey with this birth control method

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got my Skyla almost a year ago and I love it! I do still get my periods and my cramps are still pretty painful, but I have unprotected sex with my partner all the time. I’ve never gotten pregnant and he has never felt it either. When getting it inserted, it was extremely painful for me. My doctor, however, hit the Vega nerve so I threw up and pooped so much and had THE WORST cramps. It was awful, but went away within a couple hours. The couple hours of pain was definitely worth how well the IUD has been working! would totally recommend skyla to anyone!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my IUD inserted on 4-13-17 (so almost a year) insertion was actually pretty painful, I cried from the pain but the pain disappeared after a few hours. I do cramp a little more than usual when I’m on my period, nothing that I can’t handle though. Overall I’m happy with Kyleena every month my period gets lighter and shorter.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Horrible pain when inserted. Acne, weight gain, and constant PMS symptoms.  I am irritable and greasy all of the time.  It sounds like  people either love it or hate it.  I hate it.  To make matters worse my doctor did not warn me about any of these side effects.  She only told me that I would hardly have any period which I don't.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am almost 50 years old and recently married. I haven't had menopause and I didn't want a pregnancy at my age. I smoke so pills are not an option for me. I was using the Today sponge or the withdrawal method. My gyno told me about skyla and I got one. The procedure was nothing. Maybe a tiny bit more uncomfortable than a pap test. I did fine. Five days after the insertion I started bleeding and I bled for 8 weeks. Sometimes very heavy with large clots. It was scary. My doctor said hang in there it will be worth it. So I did. And the bleeding did eventually stop. My periods are lighter but they come about every 3 weeks now. And when I had my month check up he couldn't find the string and I had to have an ultrasound to make sure it was still in there. And it is. I have no idea how they will remove it when the time comes since the string isn't accessible. I recommend skyla. Be prepared. It's not a pleasant beginning.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I’m a young childless woman that first got Skyla put in around March of 2015. This is my personal experience and I cannot tell you if you’ll experience the same things. Positives: Did not get pregnant (had unprotected sex at least once a week with my husband), periods became much lighter compared to what they’re normally like, not having to worry about taking a pill. Negatives: I gained a good amount of weight while on this IUD due to increased appetite, increased moodiness especially before a period, I got severe out of nowhere cramps, tender breasts almost all of the time, and more cases of yeast infections and bacterial vaginosis. Overall, the IUD did its job but the side effects were not worth the benefits. I suggest if you’re one of the few who are suffering from more vaginal infections while on Skyla definitely tell your gyno about it. If I had known sooner that it was the cause of it, I would have removed it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am day 6 post-insertion. The day of insertion was day one of my menstrual cycle. I took 400mg of ibuprofen about thirty minutes before my appointment.My doctor decided to inject a numbing agent into my cervix which was a tiny pinch. The initial cramps felt like a wave of pain from my toes to my head. Side note: when I get blood drawn I get very dizzy and lightheaded and nauseous. So I kinda wondered could that happen with the IUD insertion. It did. I became very dizzy and I did vomit twice. Felt pretty nauseous for the next two hours. The cramping was bad the first day but a couple glasses of wine and my hot water bottle made it better. I have been bleeding very lightly since. Cramping comes and goes but has been painful at times. I am very bloated. Don't have much of an appetite either, I think that is just from the cramps though because I can get a little queasy with them.Hope this helps.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted in late July. I have now had it for 7 months and I love it. The insertion was more uncomfortable than pain. If you have had a Pap smear it kinda feels like that but a little more intense. The time after the insertion was what hurt the most for me. I didn’t want to move as it hurt so bad! I went to work about 4 hours after insertion and I do not recommend that. I did put a heating pad on and it helped wonders! I have not had a period since I had it inserted, but I do get cramps and a little moody when my period normally would be! All around I love it! I get my placement checked every 6-8 weeks!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):35 year old with 2 children. I've been on Mirena for 6 years now. I completely love it. I was on depo for 15+ years prior. When first had it inserted I had my normal (horrible bleeding/cramping) for 2 months straight. I have not had my period since nor do I have cramping, at all! I've experienced some cramping but it's from ovulating. Also, I've actually lost quite a bit of weight while being on mirena! ***** People need to realize that everyone's body is completely different. Something that doesn't work for you, may be perfect for someone else.*****

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):My insertion process was very painful. I took ibuprofen beforehand and have a pretty high pain tolerance, but was close to fainting when the process was over. I could barely walk to the car from the doctor's office. It has been 6 months and I am not satisfied with this option for birth control. I have developed painful acne on my chest and back, have body-halting cramps, and lower sex drive. I am considering getting the Kyleena IUD removed and switching back to the pill. This was not worth it for me.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Okay, I’m not gonna lie, it HURTS getting Skyla inserted. But it is sooo worth it. A couple days of cramping afterwards, but my period completely stopped after only a couple of months! I haven’t had a period or spotting in over a year! I had zero side effects, no weight gain, no acne, no headaches, nothing. This is by far the greatest birth control I have EVER been on!!!! I would recommend Skyla to any woman!! I love it!!!! :)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena was suggested by my obgyn because I was having very painful heavy periods that lasted about 5-7 days on Nuvaring. The insertion of the IUD was extremely painful for me even with taking ibuprofen before the procedure. Cramping lasted for a full day but I was back to normal the next. I spotted for 2 weeks then nothing. It’s been 5 months since insertion and it’s amazing that I don’t get a period BUT I now have painful cystic acne on my chin and hairline. I never had acne issues growing up so this is a first for me. The cystic acne flares up frequently and leaves scars when they disappear. I have not seen a dermatologist for this but plan on going back to Nuvaring. I already have very dry sensitive skin and don’t need cystic acne to add to my list. If it wasn’t for the cystic acne I’d be 100% happy with the IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Another update!My doctor prescribed me birth control to help with my cysts. So I’m better now but I experience less bloating. I still have weird pains when I am in the mood in my uterus, but that’s about it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got Kyleena inserted today. Wasn't as painful as my Paragard. I had the Paragard for a year and experienced nothing but painful periods and terribly heavy periods. Got it removed 5 days ago and I feel great. The insertion of Kyleena was not that painful. I took a nap when I got home was feeling a little weird but that may be due to the Dr telling me to take four Motrin before coming in. I don't usual take things I like to use essential oils or just deal with the pain. After my nap I feel like a new women I'm extra happy and honestly don't have that much cramping at all! After my paragard I was in a good deal of pain I had a hard time making it home. So far so good!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla inserted September 2016. I am 32 years old. BC pills started affecting my moods and sex drive so bad to the point where my fiance and I sat down to discuss alternate options. Since I had Skyla inserted I have lost about 20 lbs. Not saying this is a miracle weight loss device. But I do think the BC bills were keeping me very bloated and causing cravings.  No depression or crazy mood swings. No pregnancies.Cons:The insertion hurt like hell. Ovarian cyst pain is back. Some months I get my period at a light rate for the whole month. I start to PMS, have breast sensitivity and severe cramps 2 weeks prior to my period due date. Still low sex drive. The string from the IUD either fell off or the doc cut it too short and the IUD moved up a bit so that it is now just in my cervical canal or completely gone. When I do decide to have it removed, there is no waiting period to get pregnant. All in all I do not regret getting Skyla.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I haven’t had periods in years but the insertion process was no more painful than getting a pap. Afterwards I felt fine. Some minor cramping but it was totally tolerable. I don’t think I took ibuprofen at all during the whole process. BUT I have not stopped bleeding since the day it was put in. It has been more than two months. To go from never having periods to this has been miserable. I have seen reviews saying it can last for almost 6 months. I don’t think I can wait that long.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've always been on the pill. I have 3 kids and don't want anymore. I had Liletta put in..horrible pain..doctor even numbed cervix. I cried in pain, even though doctor was fast and very professional. The pain I experienced over next 5 days was terrible. It was like after having a child, the contracting of uterus. If I knew this was so painful I wouldn't have done it. I am scared to death when it comes out. Thank goodness I work at home or I would have had to miss a week of work. My eyes are still puffy and I don't feel good yet. It's day 6 now after insertion. This is first day I'm not in terrible pain - 6 days later that's ridiculous.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Don't get the Mirena!!!! I had it for 5 years and I liked it. The second one I got put in did not go like that. I started getting really bad panic attacks, no energy, bad mood swings, gaining weight, anxiety, headaches, body tingling etc. I went yesterday to get it taken out!!!!!! I feel better already!!!! Please be careful.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my Skyla inserted today- so this review will be about that. My doctor gave me 4 Misoprostol tabs to insert vaginally the night before my IUD placement. I was expecting severe cramping, but I noticed no difference than my regular cramping (day 1 of cycle). I took 3 Advil with it before bed. Before the procedure I took an anxiety pill and 3 Advil.. it felt like a slightly more painful Pap smear. It was not horrific but it was painful and uncomfortable. Deep breathing helped tremendously. It’s over in about 5 minutes. Every person is different, but I was terrified before hand, and I’m glad I went though with it. Don’t let fear of insertion scare you- could be easy peasy like mine.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Hi guys, I recently got my IUD(skyla) inserted in me (Jan31 @ 245pm) and I was super nervous. I’ve read many reviews positive and negative ones and that’s why it was really hard for me to make this decision. So I was like what the heck let me give it a shot. The procedure was a little painful, it had me a little jumpy. Only took 5 minutes and I had taken ibuprofen like an hour before I went in, so my cramps was not bad at all. Slight spotting and cramps here and there nothing too dramatic.Since it’s only day 1 I really don’t have any major changes. Just mild cramps. Hope this helps. ^^

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I was very hesitant to get the IUD inserted because many women my age (18) had no good things to say. However oral birth control was not working for me so I decided to get the mirena. The ONLY downside to my IUD  was the insertion itself. The cramping pain was very intense during the procedure and lingered for about 30 mins after. I've heard that some doctors can give you a numbing shot for the insertion and I would highly recommend this if, like me, you are a young woman who has never given birth or experienced horrible period cramps before. I spotted for about a month after getting the IUD, but after that month I no longer get my period! I also lost about 10 pounds with absolutely no lifestyle changes...just didn't have all of the hormones from oral birth control in my system anymore! The experience has been amazing, no period, not having to worry about contraception, and no more hormonal acne. I would 100% getting the IUD.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted Dec 21 2017, and it wasn’t nearly as terrible as I thought it was gonna be. I took 800mg of ibuprohen 1 hour before, I was on my period, I had no caffeine, no food, a lot of water. The insertion took 10 minutes and I felt great, but the horrible cramps started about a week later. I had the most debilitating cramps which extended down from my stomach to my butt and to my toes. Taking regular pain medication is what got me through all of the discomfort though. I did have discharge for about a monthish and it is just now starting to clear up. No break outs, my period did feel different this second time. I’ve also never been on medication or birth control before. No kids. As of now it’s been a little over a month and I don’t have cramping anymore, I barely have any discharge, and if I feel any kind of pain I take ibuprophen. Anyway, the body obviously has to adjust and it won’t always be a breeze but it has been 100% worth it to me!!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena IUD since May 2017 and so far it's been good for me. The insertion process was painless to me unlike what I've read in prior comments, I only felt a bit dizzy for a couple of minutes after the insertion. The recovery was not too bad just some minor cramping and grogginess. However I acknowledge I have a somewhat high pain tolerance so this may have just been me. My "phantom" periods have been pretty regular usually once a month I get cramping and sometimes light bleeding. I have noticed a bit of acne on my chin since starting Kyleena but it's not a concerning amount. Unlike Depo-Provera it has not had any negative side effects with my mental health. I however am giving it a 7/10 because I have not had sex since the insertion of the IUD so it would not be fair to give it a full rating when I have not attempted to use It for its main purpose.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I was on the pill for nearly 2 years after I got my first period at 16. I switched to skyla because I gained a lot of weight on the pill. The insertion was painful, it felt like fire had erupted across my lower abdomen. But for all the pain, it was worth it. I lost all of the weight I had gained on the pill in like 3 months. For the first 6 months I spotted every day. For the next 10 months I didn’t have a period. But now I’m coming up on 2 years and I have irregular bleeding all the time with ferocious cramps. I’m on the pill on top of skyla to try and regulate it. Hopefully it helps.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Well I've literally just had the mirena coil fitted and I'm not going to lie it did hurt but just like the worst period pain you could think of. I've tried everything before, pills, implants etc and I'm hoping this will be the best option. I've never had children and was pre-warned to take painkillers. I'm having really bad cramps and I am also bleeding but hopefully everything sorts itself out. It takes 10 minutes and it's over so don't be put off. I also suffer with panic attacks and still managed to get through it.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got the Liletta IUD inserted April 2017 Medicaid covered the cost. The procedure for me wasn't bad at all. I had stayed up the whole night before reading reviews and terrifying myself. My OBGYN measured my cervix & then inserted the IUD, It didn't hurt at all, but afterwards I felt extremely uncomfortable It also felt as if something was poking inside of me. I started to spot immediately & had mild cramps. For the first few months I had a normal period with slight cramping. My period came on the same day every month and lasted for about 10 days. After about 6 months my period lightened up, but still lasted around 10 days. It's been 9 months and my period has almost disappeared! This month my period lasted almost a week but was very light the entire time. I could have worn nothing but panyliners and been okay. Since getting the IUD I haven't had any bad side effects, only cramping and a few headaches nothing severe. I'm unsure if I can blame my weight gain on the BC or my bad habits.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I posted about the insertion when I first got it, but for those of you who are just reading: Its NOT as bad as some of these reviews. I get that everyone's body is different but personally for me it wasn't any more uncomfortable then getting a tattoo, with some cramping the whole day after insertion. I had light spotting for about 2 weeks after, and since that I have been perfectly fine! Also, I finally FEEL like having sex all the time! When I was on the pill I was just numb all the time. The boyfriend definitely appreciates this IUD!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got Kyleena in beginning of December 2017 and it is now the end of January, 2018... Have been on period/spotting every single day since then besides a 3 day span in the middle of January. Right when I think the spotting is over, it comes back. OBGYN says it can happen since everyone is different and it can take 3-5 months for bleeding to stop/slow down but it is definitely aggravating. Cramping after insertion was bad for about 5 days. Horrible the day of and day after insertion and then periodic cramping thereafter. Hope this helps!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Mirena does the job but the constant spotting/bleeding makes it not worth it. When I first got Mirena inserted, I bled for 3-4 weeks straight. My periods are now irregular and I can never plan anything around it because it comes unexpectedly and lasts for 1 week. After my period, I begin spotting for another 1-2 weeks. Light bleeding, nothing heavy, but enough bleeding to affect my sex life. The spotting is CONSTANT and I only get a few days of relief a month. 1-2 weeks of spotting, 1 week of light bleeding, a couple days to MAYBE week of nothing (if I'm lucky), which is the only time I'm able to have sex. And worse, sex seems to trigger more bleeding so I can only have intercourse like one time a month before the cycle starts again. I'm approaching the 1 year mark and I'm so frustrated! I thought it'd be better after 9 months but it's not. I'll stick it out for another 6 months or so, but if this keeps up, I'll just switch to pills. The never ending bleeding is too much of a hassle.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena IUD from 2010-2015 and let me tell you the insertion was the worst pain of my life and the doctor wasn't even sure she had placed it correctly! No one told me the Mirena was more geared towards women who had already had kids and I have not. I nearly passed out from the pain and wish they had told me to take painkillers 2 hours before the procedure instead of 20 minutes (takes over an hour for medication to filter my bloodstream). Overall, this IUD did its job and I had little acne and my periods went away almost completely in a short time. I did experience a little weight gain though, from 120 to 150 pounds so that might be a deal breaker do some people. Would I get another Mirena? Probably not, there's a lawsuit out right now for this.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I am 27, no children and intend to stay that way (afraid of the sterilization surgery). I've been on hormonal IUDs for 8 years now and have hardly had a period in 8 years, just occasionally spotting. My Skyla IUD insertion wasn't as bad as my first IUD, the Mirena, but it was still uncomfortable overall. My Skyla comes out in less than a month now and overall it's done it's job but the side effects are what's forcing me to switch to a non-hormonal method after this... I've had ovarian cysts, irregular spotting, vaginal discharge almost every day, ridiculous cramping, more acne than I've ever had in my life (never experienced acne before this) and weight gain (I went from 150 to 220).This is my second IUD and like most IUDs I've come to realize they work great but at a high price so I will not be re-upping, instead I'll try the Paragard next...

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I LOVE the mirena so much. I've had it for a little over 2 years now and it is amazing. I can't take birth control pills due to my epilepsy medication that would interfere with the pills, so my doctor recommend this (and also I am so forgetful I would probably forget to take the pill everyday too) so you never have to worry about it! For me, getting it inserted just felt like the strongest cramp I have ever felt but ended quick. My periods are much lighter which is a lifesaver, but I feel personally they can last a couple days more but I'd pick that over what kind of periods I used to have. Recommend to all!!!!!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Legit the best birth control I’ve ever been on. I’ve never had kids, tried the mirena 3 different times and the paragard and both were absolute nightmares. The skyla made my period a little unpredictable at first but that’s to be expected and had a lot of breakthrough bleeding during sex in the first 5 months or so. But now my periods are shorter and lighter and I have zero side effects! So freaking happy I finally found a birth control that works

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta a month ago. I took one ibuprofen for insertion and one after insertion. It was painful but definitely not the worst thing I've ever felt. Similar to getting my eyebrows threaded. So far I've experienced no other side effects, the spotting stopped a few days ago.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):First, I notice were how tender my breasts got. It lasted for about a month. I bled for the first month too.  I would wake up EVERY NIGHT for 7 months in a pool of sweat.  The 2nd week I had a golf balled sized cyst on my ovary. I had to take another birth control to calm it back down. I stopped that birth control after that was solved.  Also, I gained 8 pounds and I never did anything different. After stopping the second birth control, I had seriously painful acne. I had to use another birth control again to bring my skin back to normal. I finally took it out this week and kind of very excited about that. I’m fine with the pill. Overall, it sucked for me, but I did enjoy not having a period for about 6 months!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m updating after having the IUD for 3 months. I do get some spotting every so often but it’s very light. My first cycle was painful - the cramps were almost unbearable but since then they’ve calmed down. I still get my cycle the same time every month and kyleena has lightened it but the days I’m on my period went from 4 days to 7 days. So, the only qualm I have is that it extended my regular cycle by a few days. It’s easy to check to make sure you still feel the strings. It hasn’t caused any acne or crazy weight gain or headaches. So, sometimes the best thing to do is try it for yourself. Everyone’s body does work differently - but so far this has proven successful for me.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I've had the Liletta for over a year now, so far no babies. Insertion was painful for me and I felt like I was going to poo myself after. I drove home and cramped up some more for a few hours, had spotting a couple days. I still regularly get a period. Except now, there's this almost metallic smell that begins up to a week before my period starts. It's terrible and I find it off putting. My acne has gotten a bit worse. More cystic and around my mouth, jawline, shoulders, and chest.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I decided to get an IUD once I decided to go back to grad school. I usually take pain like a champ. Insertion was painful, I had a vagal response and almost passes out on the table. I had some cramping the next few days, but what really got me were the mood swings. I felt angry all the time and had the urge to call my ex and scream at him, which isn't me at all. My gyno told me to give it 6 months. The mood swings have since subsided, but right now I'm struggling with hormonal acne around my chin and back. I'm hoping it gets better or I plan to have it removed and go back to the pill.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Have had mostly bad experiences. Gained 20 pounds, am largest I've ever been, and I'm only 5'3. Breast are quite large. Breast tenderness for 8 months.Depression, fatigue, moodiness for first 8-9 months. Cramps for 7 months, crippling at times. Spotting for 7 months, only bleeding once a month now. Had an unpleasant vaginal smell for months.Body hair growth and some light back acne. Libido was really high for a while, has tapered off but am still sexually active. I can feel the device occasionallyOnly + are less to no face acne anymore, no periods, convenient, and no pregnancies so far.Looking for smaller and lower dosage IUD's

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got Mirena inserted 09/17, 26 years old, never had children. Nearly fainted on insertion, had intense pain for about 6 weeks with constant bleeding which fully subsided at about the 8 week mark. I'm now over 4 months in, periods are very very light, I get some bursts of pain every now and then but nothing like I experience at the beginning, and its constantly getting better. I had a really rough experience at the start but definitely worth it to stick through in my opinion

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted almost 9 months ago. After months of irregular and near-continuous bleeding, I still have *10-day periods* every month (light to medium bleeding), plus hormonal acne most of the month. I recently had an ultrasound to verify that it’s placed correctly, and it is, so these are just effects from the hormones. I’m frustrated and miserable and ready to give up.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had it in for 5 months now. The initial insert was the worst pain ever. But after a couple days it got better and cramping went away. My periods are like clock work but a lot shorter which I love. And I don't get cramps anymore.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had my son 9/25 and got skyla 11/8. I had a c section, so was pretty afraid to get the insertion. DON'T BE SCARED!!!! Take a Xanax or ativan and get it over with. It’s about 4-5 minutes of uncomfortably, nothing major. Then three years of no worry! It’s totally worth it. I had cramps for the first 2 days & bled the first 3-4 days. Then nothing. No spotting no bleeding, it’s awesome not having a period. And not pregnant. I highly recommend skyla to everyone who wants to prevent pregnancy and have no periods.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I get very painful ovulations and was on Depo for 7 years because estrogen raises my BP. So Kyleena was suggested to me. Haven't had a period in those 7 years so insertion was VERY painful for me and I was cramping, bloating, spotting for 2-3 days. I had EXTREMELY sore, heavy, tender breasts for the first 3 months. Now they only get sore 1 week from when I used to get my period. Skin was uneven for the 3 month but now my breakouts are minimal. I hate the sore breasts but it beats any other BC for me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got my kyleena I inserted almost 6 months ago and barely experience even cramps before my period. A couple months ago I would get contraction like cramps that would make me nauseated- it gets better!! Every BC comes with side effects and every person will experience it differently. No breakouts, no mood swings, and no spotting for me. The 9 stars only goes to insertion because it was very painful for me. Would definitely recommend if you are considering! The 99.8% effective rate is worth the pain.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena in March of 2017. Insertion wasn't bad. It was a single minor sharp poke, then pressure and a pinch.100% bearable. I had taken some Tylenol beforehand in preparation. The next 3-4 weeks I was bleeding on and off. Also cramps for the first week or so but I was on my feet at work during that time and Tylenol came in handy.After the initial month, I got an actual period. It took about 2 more cycles for my period to almost disappear. Basically just 3-4 days of spotting, zero cramps. I've recommended to all my girlfriends!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the IUD put in about 4 months ago and overall, I love it. Insertion was pretty bad for me but it is different for everyone and I didn’t take ibuprofen before which I highly recommend!!! I get really bad cramps when I’m about to get my period still but overall it is very effective. I had bad period cramps before I got in inserted and it takes about a year for the period to be significantly lighter.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for one year. Extremely effective as a contraceptive and very little complaints, though I did experience a great deal of pain (bad cramping, feeling weak) for about three weeks after insertion. My period was very light spotting for one or two days out of the month. About a year after having it, I started having vaginal dryness--something I've never had a problem with before.
