My husband and I decided we were ready to try for a baby, so I had it removed, and we got pregnant the very next day! Had the Skyla removed in September, and our little girl will be here in June. This birth control worked for me, with few side effects.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got mine placed in November 16 2017.  Never had kids, 27, and not a virgin. I got an IUD bc my periods are out of whack. My gyno (at that time) sucked. She didn't like how I called her out on a few things so she took at least 15 mins placing it. They ordered the wrong IUD but I really wanted "that time of the month" to not be so horrible. Everyone is going to get different effects.  I now have severe cramping ( pain tolerance is high) for 10 plus seconds that come and go and hurt like heck! I'm now getting my period. I spot for a few months then back to same old rhythm. I did and next day I bled like I wasn't on IUD at all.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Inserted 1/18/18 (2nd day of period) and went much better than I thought! I am 24, never been on any hormonal birth control, never been pregnant. I took 660 mg of Aleve 30 minutes before. My Dr. told me that because I was on my period she did not have to use the clamping device to open my cervix. The measuring and insertion hurt, but it was not the worst pain I've ever been in, and truly only lasted 30 seconds or less! It didn't feel like a period cramp to me, it felt more invasive, like a sharp pinching in my uterus. The whole procedure was 4 minutes. I felt fine after, I was shocked as I was expecting the worst. I had cramps throughout the day, felt like normal period cramps but sharper and localized to my uterus. So far so good!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got Skyla about a year ago. The pain was pretty intense when inserted, but settled down over the next few months. I never had any issues with it until I found out I was pregnant with the IUD still in place. I guess I was that .03% category. Turns out I also had an ectopic pregnancy because of it. It was a lot of hassles and headaches and Dr appointments to have to deal with because of the outcome. I will definitely be getting a different IUD once I am able to put a new one back in.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):It seems like in my case it is a love hate relationship. I have had mine in for about 10 months. The insertion was easy for me. The first 2 weeks I spotted and the first 2 months I had spotted maybe 1 to 2 weeks out of the month after that no more. There is things I like about it. I love not having a period and not thinking about it . My libido has gone up some as well and no acne. The cons : at first my boyfriend could feel the strings and it would scratch him. I had went from 145 lbto 164lb and can’t seem to get the weight off especially in stomach area. Last , I keep getting BV infections. ..other than those couple things I actually like it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):DO NOT USE THIS! If I could give a zero I would. This is awful stuff.  My 15 yr old had it inserted after laparoscopy. Woke in incredible pain. Removed it less than 2 wks later because the cramping and back pain was so severe. Started bleeding two days after removal and hasn't stopped. Let me point out she never went off sprintec.  They now have her doubled down on sprintec to try to control her bleeding - which is at day 18 as I write this. Her migraines have also picked back up. STAY AWAY!!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am 21 years old with no kids. I have had Kyleena for a little over a month now and for me the insertion was pretty painful. Like some of the reviews I read most women say their pain stopped afterwards but mine did linger. In the beginning there was no bleeding whatsoever for about a week 1/2 then after that I had a pretty heavy period for about 2 weeks straight. Now I am just spotting on and off but the cramps are constant and pretty painful to the point where I am taking prescribed naproxen on a daily basis. I will continue to let my body adjust though because i know it will be beneficial in the long run.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Yet another update..I had a cyst that bursted. I have had kyleena since Mid-October of 2017. I started developing this big cysts not long after insertion. I have not had many problems with the IUD at all. I’ve never had children, either. To put it in perspective, I’m almost 21 and I’ve never had cysts before. The pain was awful when it burst but as fate would have it, I have another one on my right side. My symptoms are nausea, bloating, and intestinal pain due to the cysts. Be aware you can develop cysts.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got skyla in Jan 2017, & I loved it at first. The pain was tolerable for the insertion, no pregnancy scares, lighter periods & occasional cramping. I loved it, but after about 5 months, I started getting really bad mood swings, weight gain, & horrible acne on my neck & shoulders. I don't do well with birth control, so I thought this would be the ideal one with the hormones being so low. I did like it because it did what it was suppose to do, but the side effects were too much for me. I was at 150lb when I got it inserted & went all the way to 166lb. I removed it & within 2 weeks I dropped below 160lb. Overall, I would recommend it for not getting pregnant, just hope that you don't have the same side effects as I did.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Hi All, I have been reading reviews like crazy when I had to get it done, I was all scared and not comfortable before the insertions. However, I still got it done because I was having really heavy periods before (I inserted the Copper coil before) because of that I started to get anemic and depressed. Hated Copper coil!! Now I got Mirena and happy with the results but the only really bad side effect of Mirena is that my belly is gone bigger (understandable because I don't get periods anymore) also acne issue on my forehead! Bu good contraceptive method.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got the insert a week ago today, it was very painful since I haven’t been pregnant before so my cervix is small. It was painful for about 7-10 minutes while I was getting the initial insert but 7-10 minutes of pain for the comfort of knowing you’re set for 5 years is worth it in the long run. I’ve been in pain for about a week. Bleeding became lighter after day 3. Spotting may occur time to time. I’m still in a lot of pain, coming from my right side where the insert is. Very crampy. I will update you guys once it sets in a little more!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the nexplanon for a year and some change but the prolonged bleeding was too much for me. I switched to the skyla last June and the insertion hurt but nothing too bad. I spotted for three weeks then had a regular but long period for two months. Months four and five were perfect my period was always on time and pretty short and light. Then came December of last year and to my surprise I was pregnant with the IUD still in place. I ended up having a miscarriage two weeks after finding out I was pregnant.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've had my mirena in for nearly a year and I love it. I'm only 23 and have no children. Inserting it was a bit painful but it's over in 2 seconds and my periods stopped straight away. Did get really bad cramps but that was one of the main reasons having the coil was to help with unbearably painful cramps and heavy bleeding. Once you get past 2 months you will start loving it. No more heavy periods and no more pain. Do not always listen to the reviews on here. Especially the bad ones. The reviews put me off having it done and I was petrified lying on the bed but I'm a big baby and cry at any type of pain. And I got through it. Was walking around within minutes of having it inserted.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena almost one year ago. The only reason I did not give a 10 was because there is some discomfort when it was inserted. I took some ibuprofen and went back to work the same day though. I have not had any issues with it. I was on the pill before and got pregnant so I wanted to try something different. I get a light period every three months that lasts about 3 days. I haven’t gotten any cramps but I do get sore breasts the week before my period which I didn’t have before. Overall I really like it and would recommend it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've been bleeding for 3 weeks straight . There's only been about 3 weeks total in the past 3 months since I've had this inserted that I haven't been bleeding . I really hope it stops soon. I never knew you could bleed this much and this long .

Liletta (levonorgestrel):The insertion was probably the most uncomfortable part because I have scarring on my cervix so putting the IUD in was more difficult but it felt like bad cramps that would come and go but once it was in I felt fine, only thing I don’t love is the on and off spotting I had normal periods but now it’s more spotting pretty randomly so I try be prepared constantly which has made sex a little more stressful because I’m always worried there will be blood, and I’ve had nipple tenderness that last about a week plus, but it’s a good birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had it for 3 weeks now. Initial procedure was pretty painful, but the worst pain was only a few seconds long. I was on my back with sweats and nausea and trembling for about an hour afterward until I got dragged home. I have a similar response to a routine Pap smear too though. I would leave your insertion day free, as the cramps were too intense to get out of bed. But after about six hours they were pretty much gone. I had sharp cramps in my abdomen, back, and thighs for the first week, but a dose of ibuprofen generally took care of that. If you have no big plans you’ll be fine. Then there was virtually no pain at all by week 2. BUT I have been bleeding constantly since insertion with no relief. It’s light and painless but very inconvenient.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I loved this form of birth control until I GOT PREGNANT WITH THE IUD STILL IN PLACE. I miscarried when they removed it. I was almost 5 weeks when I miscarried which the doctor said was common when getting it removed.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I recently got the Skylar 12/20/2017 and so far everything is good! My period is kinda still in it's on and off phase. I just get back pains but maybe because I'm still at the beginning. I have the 3 year but the lowest dosage of BC cause my body doesn't do well with a high dosage of any kind of bc. I would definitely recommend the Skylar!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had the Skyla inserted in April 2017 a month after giving birth to my son. The insert was not that bad for me just a little cramping, but by the time I left the office it had stopped. Now I have never had acne in my life but since having it inserted my face is horrible!! Also I have always had regular periods but now have random periods some to last 5 days some last one day. Other than that my experience with Skyla has been ok so far.
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Was inserted on Tuesday, feel out on Friday of the same week. Spotted all week. Expensive treatment for no return.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Placed Mirena several weeks after a c-section. I had it for 4.5 years & zero issues. It stopped my period + I never had cramps. Took Mirena out, had a failed pregnancy & decided I was not ready to try again. I went to my Dr. who recommended the Liletta saying "it's the same thing"  Seconds after insertion I was extremely nauseated and in incredible pain, cramping/bleeding immediately and had the shakes for roughly 2 hours. Fast forward 3 months, using panty liners EVERY DAY due to constant spotting. It wasn't even bright fresh pink/red spotting. It looked like old dried period blood spotting. Cramps off & on 4-5 days a week, with weekly occurrences where it physically hurt to sit up straight.  Pro: Did not get pregnant Con: EVERYTHING ELSE.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is my third day on the Kyleena and so far it’s not bad. Today I’ve had a few mild cramps but nothing unbearable. Insertion was more uncomfortable than painful. I took two acetaminophen pills an hour before and my doctor did freeze my cervix. All in all I felt a few moderate cramps but was not painful. If you are afraid of insertion I’d say take some pain meds and ask for freezing and you will be okay :) so far I’ve spotted on and off since insertion. Hoping this works well for me in the long run.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Getting Kyleena was the best decision I've made in a long time. Previously I was on the pill: my libido was low, my period was extremely heavy and long, I had a lack of energy, etc. So I decided to try something new. The placement wasn't painful for me at all. The week or so after, I had a funny feeling below my belly but nothing too uncomfortable. I did have spotting for about a month after it being placed, BUT now we're 4 months in and my period has completely disappeared. My libido has increased significantly, I don't have to think about taking a pill every day, it's super safe, I could go on and on. I recommend it to everyone, it has really increased the quality of my life.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):So I just got the mirena placed about 3 days ago so I’m not exactly sure how my body is going to react to it BUT you all have to stop reading reviews you see online and just do it. I got so worked up about getting it done and it was no where near as bad as the reviews I read. I’m 22 years old and I’ve never given birth, the insertion literally felt like period cramps. Afterwards the cramping did get a lot worse but subsided after a few hours. I will update my review after a few months but please stop reading bad reviews and just go for it!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):DO NOT TAKE THESE REVIEWS TOO SERIOUSLY! Every woman's body is different and you won't know what to expect until you're lying there. For me the most uncomfortable process was the opening of my cervix, but it was just that, uncomfortable. I don't want to call what I experienced pain because it was more pressure than pain. I had some mild cramping but felt normal after a couple of days. I went in on the last day of my period, which was Monday, today is now Wednesday and I have some spotting but that's about it. I will keep you guys updated on the spotting and how/if my period changes. As of right now I would definitely recommend.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena inserted almost exactly 2 months ago. The insertion itself was painful for me, I felt very dizzy and almost fainted - however I went back to normal within about 30 minutes and had minor cramping the rest of the day. The only major issue I've had is the constant spotting/bleeding. I understand it could take up to 4-5 months for my period to get much lighter/shorter or even go away, however these first few months is just a hassle. This month, I'm on my 11th day of bleeding - I've been going through panty liners like crazy so I don't ruin my underwear, and it's frustrating having to tell my partner that I'm STILL spotting. I'm going to give it another 2-3 months in the hopes that my period will go away - will update then.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have had the Skyla for a little over a year and I would recommend it!  I had terrible reactions to the pills and didn’t want something in my arm, so I went with the IUD. The most popular type is the mirena; but I went with the skyla. It’s smaller meaning less cramping and easier on women who haven’t had any children! Like majority of people, the first 3 months SUCKED. I had the worst cramps in my life for 2 months and bled consistently until almost 6 months. After those 6 months, it’s beyond nice! I still get a period, unlike other IUDs. Mine are irregular sometimes I skip months, so if you aren’t a fan of that, I wouldn’t recommend this. I now rarely ever have cramps, periods are light and shorter!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla for about 10 months. For the first 6 months I bled every other week. Before Skyla my normal period would last 3-4 days. With Skyla after the 6 months passed I stopped bleeding every other week but my periods were long  9-10. Also my skin was the type that I would get acne once a year (not kidding). I’m 25 btw. And with Skyla my face got terrible. I have so many acne scars now. + I gained 17 pounds. I come from a very small framed family. (My mom had 5 kids and weighs 103). I went from weighing 110 to 127. I had it removed 2 weeks ago and already lost 6 pounds.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had one kid and had 2 previous Paragard IUDs. The insertion process was MUCH easier for the Kyleena than the two Paragards.  My periods on the Paragard were heavier than before the IUD but I tolerated them for many years because of the effectiveness & not to have to remember to take anything.  After the Kyleena I had some spotting for a few days, and some cramps that were less than what I'd experience on a normal period.  Way less than what I had with the Paragard. I haven't noticed any changes with my skin or other side effects so far. Overall, I'm thrilled that the Kyleena seems to be lightening my periods and drastically reducing the cramping/poking sensations I had with the Paragard.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Stage 3 endo.  Several pregnancies, no births. High pain tolerance.  Had 500mg Naproxen just prior to Skyla insertion.  Most painful procedure ever!  Was dizzy and faint.  If I had to do this again, I would not do it unless under anesthesia.  *A LOT* of bleeding both during the procedure and for months after.  Pain and bleeding lessened over time but did not subside until several months later.  Finally,  bleeding and cramping stopped . Less migraines.Suspect obgyn may have messed up the insertion. Gained at least 10lbs.Would I have had this done this knowing what I know now?  Probably not.  But, even with all the difficulties, not having to deal with horrible menstrual pain and migraines made it worth it.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Hello, I been having liletta for 7 months now I had no trouble at all everything was perfect normal periods every months no pain , but recently I started to notice a lot of painful acne on my back shoulders and neck I would like to know if this has happened to one of y’all too please help  .

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena put in about 3 months ago. The insertion was painful but nothing I couldn’t handle, cramps that only lasted for a minute. After it was over I felt fine until I stood up. I was extremely light headed and felt like I was going to throw up. I was out of there probably 20 minutes after the insertion and experienced about 5-8 legit contractions. I bled for about 2 days and now my periods are light and I have noticed the spotting isn’t as bad as it was in the beginning. Overall, it was worth all of that pain. Not to mention I feel as if most of my water weight has disappeared post pill, and I don't have any mood swings or acne which is a plus too. And no babies for 5 Years!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had my kyleena inserted yesterday and I would just like to point out that IF YOU ARE GETTING AN IUD DO NOT READ ANYTHING ABOUT HOW PAINFUL IT IS TO GET IN! I made the mistake of researching it and all that comes up is horror stories! On a scale of 1-10 this procedure was about a 5 or 6. Just moderates painful I wouldn't say I ever felt like passing out or puking or all of that. It was about the same amount of discomfort as getting a wrist tattoo (I have 2) - the pain is  just in a different place.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have had the liletta for almost a year now! I love it so much I was so scared to get it  because of the reviews I read about how painful it is. But I didn't experience any pain at all when they put it in I didn't even get the cramps afterwards. I spotted for a couple days and that was it. I have 1 child had her in September and got the IUD in March.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had kyleena inserted in the beginning of September of 2017. The insertion was uncomfortable, but short lived.Here are some of the side effects I experienced and the time frame which I experienced them in:0-2 weeks after insertion:- cramping, spotting, oily skin, extremely sensitive nipples.2 weeks to 1 month:- occasional cramping and spotting. Oily skin turned into pimples, mostly on my chin. Nipples no longer sensitive.1 month - 2 months :- occasional cramping and spotting, usually about once a month (could be my "period"). Some cramping during strenuous exercise. Pimples. Extreme mood swings and issues controlling my appetite and weight .3 months - present:- occasional cramping. Pimples. Weight/appetite under control again.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I'm eighteen and I got my Liletta IUD in this morning. My doctor was very efficient and experienced. She advised me to take deep breathes and do my very best not to tense up. The measurement and insertion were painful, like an extremely bad cramp. I found myself biting my lip with tears flowing. Though it only lasted a minute. It’s not too bad as long as you breathe. I didn’t even take Tylenol before my appointment (we were all out) but make sure you eat before you go as advised. When it was done I was left to rest and get up and dress on my own when I pleased. The process wasn’t too bad I’ll update in a few months. If I can do it so can anyone else, us women are strong. It’s only a minute and lasts for years.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion review: I’m 23, no kids, and first IUD experience. I had the Skyla inserted 12 hours earlier, been on the pill until now. Like most others, I read the reviews for how horrible the insertion was, but for me, it wasn’t bad. My doctor prescribed generic Xanax, a hydrocodone, and 500mg of naproxen to be taken before my visit. Really the insertion was on a 7/10 pain, but the harsh pain only lasted 30 seconds for me. I’ve broken bones, gotten tattoos, and honestly that 30 seconds was on par with the worst of those. But broken bones and such don’t last for just 30 seconds. I cramped badly for about 2 hours, but then it died down to normal period cramps. Just wanted to share my experience for others, it wasn’t bad and I’d do it again.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Kyleena for almost a month now and overall I think its wonderful! My insertion experience was definitely uncomfortable but went by so quick. The same day I just felt a lot of intense cramping and needed rest and some Advil. Following that, all went well! No bleeding or spotting until about a week before my period was supposed to start. Right before my period arrived I did get on-and-off intense cramps for 2/3 days but once I started bleeding the pain surprisingly stopped. 1st period is very light but lasting maybe a little longer then normal. Sex with kyleena doesn't feel different at all either! I love not having to take a pill every day. Besides the cramps (which is expected) this has been great And I highly recommend trying it out!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had my Kyleena inserted about an hour ago! After reading many responses I was slightly worried about the pain. Some reactions I read said that it was close to labor pains or the worst pain they have ever felt in their life! Each person has a different body and pain tolerance but in my case, it didn't hurt at all. My doctor told me that some people experience more pain because doctor's are not inserting it carefully or even correctly. I went to planned parenthood and I couldn't have been happier with my insertion experience. I had some bleeding after but didn't feel lightheaded at all. I took 3 ibuprofen an hour before and brought a pad with me for spotting afterwards. I was shocked at how easy and fast the procedure was.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I was 9wks Postpartum when getting Liletta. I opted to not get any cervical dilating meds because my cervix should’ve still been a little open and soft. I didn’t have a period after baby because I was breastfeeding exclusively and bleeding stopped a week after giving birth. The day of procedure I got up ate breakfast to prevent nausea and took a pain pill 30mins before procedure. I still however had cramping but it was light and so was spotting. The measuring of uterus took the longest because mines is a bit tilted. Procedure took 10mins total even with ultra sound to make sure it was placed correctly. I was good to go and able to continue my regular activities. Year later still haven’t had bleeding. So far everything is going well.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):For starters I'm 28 and I've given birth twice, one Csection and one vaginal. Reading the negative reviews on the insertion made me so nervous that I literally worried myself into migraines. The process lasted  for about 5 minutes and what I experienced was that discomfort of a pap smear with a quick pinch. When my doctor told me she was done I thought she was joking. I went in expecting this excruciating pain but walked out so relieved. Super light spotting and very mild cramps. I will update in a month. Don't let the bad reviews scare you off!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Kyleena inserted 12/4/17. Been almost an entire month. The insertion process was uncomfortable & very painful  (although pain lasts for 2 seconds, the uncomfortable from cranking cervix open & swabbing everything clean). I gasped & let a single tear roll down but other than that, just cramping for the rest of the day (5/10 scale). I worked out like normal for the 3 days after  & started slightly spotting. And then bam. Worst 3 weeks ever. The bleeding was so heavy & constant, I could barely keep up with changing my pads (no tampons the first month w IUD!). My cramps ranged from uncomfortable bloating with sharp pains if I used my abdomen muscles, I had literal contractions writhing in pain. I contemplated going to the ER multiple times. Sitting (the motion of rising or coming onto the chair) was so painful for my ab muscles that I opted to stand a lot more. Intercourse was so extremely painful, my breasts became tender and dropped a cup size. I gained some stomach pudge, and lost some tone to my legs (because I couldn't work out + holiday eating?). Horrendous break outs on my chest and back. And then just as quickly as it all came, it's disappeared. Entering 4th week, after what I'm guessing was an early period, the blood loss is actually "spotting" amounts, I have no pain at all (regular life, intercourse, sitting etc.) except my lower ab muscles still cannot be used due to sharp pain. I hope this helps people! Stick with it! (I am 22 years old and cannot take systemic hormonal birth control pills due to side effects).

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena on 12-14-2017. I was previously on Mirena then the pill. I chose kyleena bc it was smaller than the mirena and barely hurt during insertion. But the constant bloody discharge I've been getting are becoming a problem. Also, out of nowhere, I started getting the worst cramps that I cannot handle. My period cramps hurt way less. The cramps I have after getting kyleena are so bad that I feel like I am being stabbed. They come every five minutes at full strength and die down super slow. I like the mirena better.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had my Liletta birth control placed on Dec. 5th, 2017 it did hurt while being placed in. So far in those first 2 weeks had to return to my doctors  because my partner felt the string during intercourse. The doctors had to cut the string to make it shorter and we are still having issues.  I never knew what breast tenderness felt like, and I'm not of fan of it. It's very uncomfortable. So far I had an excessive acne recently and noticing weight gain and my breast gotten huge. I have to workout out twice as hard now to maintain my weight which isn't easy. I'm following up with the doctor this week check in later with the updates.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla put in a year and a half ago. Prior to this I had the five year one. I’m 27. After removing the five year one she tried to put another one in. It was extremely painful. And I had taken a pain pill prior to my appointment. There was a complication so she decided to put Skyla in. It went in right away, it was still painful but all the pain was worth not having to worry about anything. It hurts. Pain sucks. But worth it.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Ladies - take all of these reviews with a grain of salt, including mine. Every woman is different and will react to different forms of birth control differently, as well. There is no magical form of birth control, every single one has its own pros and cons. I’ve tried 4 different kinds and my experience with each was very different. With that said, I made the decision to switch from the pill to an IUD (Skyla) 5 months ago and I’m very happy I did. Getting the IUD inserted was not fun, but I have noticed a big change in my moods (less mood swings) and my period is extremely light/short at this point. Sex is awesome & my boyfriend can’t feel anything. No weight gain or bloating (in fact I’ve lost some weight) and it’s so nice not worrying.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had skyla inserted on November 2014 and had skyla removed on December 28, 2017. The insertion was very quick and the only pain I had was when I was given local anesthesia which felt like a quick pinch. I do recommend taking a pain reliever before insertion.  I spotted for 3-6 months and it was accompanied with  cramping and relieved with ibuprofen. My periods became less heavy over time and after a year they stopped. My skin became very oily but I find this to be a minor side effect. The removal was the most painful part of this experience but it was very brief. I definitely recommend having skyla.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I was so afraid of getting the Skyla-- I have ZERO pain tolerance, and have been known to faint with simple medical procedures (i.e. bloodwork).Well, getting the IUD was tough, but manageable. I administered cytotec the night before, and took extra strength tylenol 45 mins prior to procedure. I was on the brink of pass out after insertion (tunnel vision, weakness, general faintness) but I overcame the spell.Within about 3 hours, I was feeling much better. By the next day, I was back to my normal self. No periods, no spotting, no side effects for me. It's been great thus far! About 7 weeks with Skyla now.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I've had my skyla in for about 3 weeks now. The insertion was uncomfortable, but not unbearable. The following day after insertion was a little difficult however. The cramping lasted all day to the point where I felt like I could pass out from the pain (I have a high tolerance for pain). Remember though, foreign object that your body is trying to get out.. I haven't cramped since that first week, until today. Today I've experienced light cramps and spotting, but according to my calender I should be ovulating this week, so maybe they're it's related? Sex is still pleasurable for me, and I still want to all the time. I've not noticed any adverse side effects, the only down fall is the boyfriend can feel the string.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I was VERY conflicted on the idea of getting an IUD. Got Liletta yesterday. I'm in my early 20s, virgin. I literally was undecided until the hours leading up to my appointment whether or not I'd go for it. Well, insertion was a 7.5/10 on the pain scale for me, but you know what? Eh, I lived. Broke out into a cold sweat during the procedure & took a solid hour to feel normal again, but the worst of it was 1) measuring the uterus and 2) the cramping in the ~10 minutes immediately after insertion. The actual insertion I barely felt. Took 660mg naproxen for the cramping, it promptly went away and has not returned. Some spotting yesterday & today, but was able to go about normal activities that same night. Even exercised this morning.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have no idea now why my gynecologist recommended this to me when I have endometriosis and I wanted something to make my already awful cramps better; now they’re just ten times worse. I’ve gone to the ER twice since the insertion, less than a week ago, practically begging for them to take it out to no avail. I can’t work when my cramps get this bad and that means I can’t pay my bills. They gave me Vicodin and it didn’t touch the pain at all, they gave me Toradol and that didn’t work either. Now they’re giving me Percocet but I doubt that will work. On top of this, I’m nauseous and having diarrhea constantly and am constantly bloated. I feel like I’m losing my mind and I’m scared they won’t take it out so I’ll have to do it myself

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have had 2 Mirenas that went horribly! Had them both removed due to the pain and non stop bleeding for a year. 1st one shifted and wasn't in the right place. Ever since then I had bad periods that wouldn’t stop. I went through so many birth controls nothing worked. Fast forward to now I went in on the 27th of Dec to get the Kyleena inserted. 3rd times a charm because the insertion was almost painless. Took a cervix softner Which didn’t help too much. I did have the worst cramps hours after the insertion! So bad they went down my legs. So far no bleeding. I had a guided procedure which also took longer due to having a very small and tilted cervix/uterus. Since the Kyleena is smaller it worked out better than the Mirena ! I’m so happy I did it

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have not had a baby and that's not in my life plan right now. Getting the Kayleena I was really worried and afraid as all I had heard were horror stories about getting an IUD. Here is my experience, I took 3 days of meds to get my insides ready for the IUD and I followed my Dr. instructions on this. I got my mother in law to drive me. I undressed and got into the table/chair and up went my legs. The lady doing the ultrasound told me everything that was going to happen before it happened and yes it did hurt I would say 9 out of 10 for maybe 3 seconds! I did spot! NOT bleed for about 2 weeks. My partner hasn't felt it while we are having "our time" and I feel so much better being off the pill! Try it and if you don't like it you can always take it out.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I really researched this IUD, talked to my doctor, and decided that Skyla was right for me. It was SO painful during insertion, but I liked not having to worry about taking the pill each day after the pain subsided. After a year and a half, I reflected and noted severe bloating and weight gain that I had never experienced previously. My breast were so swollen and painful sometimes that I could barely button my shirts. I was also fatigued and experiencing breakouts of acne and hair thinning that I had never experienced in my life. In addition, I spotted and had a light period sometimes twice a month. My husband even noticed the changes and made the connection of the IUD. I had it removed after almost two years, and I feel like I have my life back.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The first 6 months was bad because I was on my period like every other week that bad but it became better and now after 2 yrs it stopped and it's almost 3 years I'm ready for a baby so I'm taking it out.  Best decision ever. Didn't pay anything for Skyla

Liletta (levonorgestrel):My review is on the insertion of liletta IUD. I'm a big chicken and I flinch getting a pap smear so the idea of getting an IUD put inside of my closed cervix sounded painful. I read many reviews and was scared of the pain but when I was reminded of the pain of child birth that fear was over came because I don't want any more children at this time. I am six weeks postpartum from having my 3 rd child which was delivered by c section this time around. My experience was good the most uncomfortable part was the tool used to open my vagina. Other than the mild discomfort from the tool to open me up I felt a pinch like the dr said and a little pressure and viola it was done. I was surprised at the fact that I didn't experience any pain.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I am 27. I have had mirena for four years now and I’m going to get it removed. I have been having hot flashes every day for years now. I never put two and two together, until I recently saw my endocrine specialist who told me to get it removed. I have terrible back pain, right ovary pain, acne, can’t loose weight, extreme excessive sweating, pain with sex, and headaches. I just learned to deal with it until recently I started sweating more and got longer hot flashes. I can’t wait to feel better. I really think it can work for some people but just be careful. I’m upset I went this long without even thinking this could be the mirena.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):4th UPDATE: I haven’t bled any. I’ll feel a little discomfort around the time I’m supposed to start my period and I bloat a lot, but it’s not a big deal. I’ve only spotted twice since early November for less than 30 seconds and the blood was so light you could barely even tell. I still use two contraceptives. But I feel fine. I swear more than normal and my face is more oily than before but overall, it’s been great not taking birth control every day. For those who plan to take softeners before insertion, it can make you feel sick btw. I’ve also never had a kid so my doc told me this was best for me.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had Liletta for 9 months now, and personally I love it! No more periods, I don’t have to worry about getting pregnant, taking pills every day, or getting a shot. I am 22 (was 21 when I got it) and do not have any children. However I would STRONGLY recommend taking some ibuprofen or some kind of pain meds before going to get it inserted. Not sure If it was because my Cervix is tilted? or if it’s because I’ve never had children before... but I cried from the pain. After insertion I had slight cramps and a little bleeding for a few days. But since then, no more periods!! Since about a week after getting it inserted I can’t feel it, it’s like I don’t even have it! I have and will recommend this product!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena put in Dec of 2016. I have now had it for 1 year. The whole year has been terrible. I get my period most of the month with the most horrifying cramps. I literally don't bleed maybe 7 days per month. It's caused me to get irritable and emotional most of the time. Plus I get infections a lot. It's embarrassing telling my partner I'm still bleeding all the time. The worst thing is the intensity of the cramps. These aren't normal cramps. Definitely the most pain I have felt. My doctor had convinced me to stick with it for 6 months, and I did 1 year. I'm down with Kyleena. Terrible experience

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Reviews scared me so much. My doctor has liletta and so does most of the people in the office so she very understanding why I was nervous. She did it before I even finished my story about why I could take my medicine the night before and she walked me through the process. I believe within five minutes. Two cramps through the whole process and it was over. The cramps weren't too bad the last one was worse then the other but nothing too insane. She even twisted the end of the string up so my partner won't be poked. So my strings are more like a hoop. I didn't even bleed or have many cramps afterwards the next day I went on doing my same old stuff not even realizing it is there. Highly recommended.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Mirena for two years and had it removed in January. Getting that hurt so bad I almost fainted! I had it removed and got pregnant just a month later. Me and my doctor were talking about birth control options at my two week post-partum appointment and I told him how terrified I was to get the IUD but he recommended Kyleena because of less hormones and it’s a bit smaller. Maybe because I had a baby, it didn’t hurt at all! But I’ve had no bleeding and no complaints:)

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I've been using skyla for over 2 years. This is the best birth control ever! The insertion was a little painful but lasted only seconds. The pain was not bad at all unlike some comments I've seen on the internet and youtube. Please don't let that scare you away! I don't have to worry about taking the pill the same time every day and I don't feel it at all! This is an effective birth control as I have used no other birth control products and have not gotten pregnant.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I have only had Skyla for 2 months but so far it has been a blessing. The actual insertion of Skyla was not too painful. It was definitely uncomfortable and the pinching sensation in my cervix and uterus was not fun, but I had both taken 800 mg of ibuprofen before the procedure and had a numbing shot near my cervix to help with the pain. After the procedure, I experienced some cramping and pain for about 3 hours and then I was fine. My menstrual cycle during the last two months has been about 7-8 days instead of my usual 5 days, but much lighter bleeding and with less cramping than a typical period. Only complaint was that my boyfriend didn’t like feeling the threads during sex in the first month until they bent and curled slightly.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion hurt quite a bit, but the worst of it was over quick. I felt fine the next day and had some cramping while exercising over the next week or so. I love not having to think about my birth control! I plan on getting it replaced when this one expires. Next time, I think I will bring someone with me and have someone drive me.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I have nothing good to say about this IUD. After insertion, I walked to my car and had blood all down my pants. Afterwards, sexual intercourse is painful, I never know when I'm on a period. The ingredients are terrible. I'm constantly fighting and acting crazy. Do not get this contraceptive. They don't even know all the ingredients. All birth control are terrible for the body. I recommend no one to get this contraceptive.
Skyla (levonorgestrel):Skyla is 100% worth it. My periods are incredibly lighter and the 3 days of cramps before I got my period has gone down to about 1/2 a day. Highly recommend!!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):First of all, before you get mirena, know your body. My body always reacted strongly to toxins and different changes. Like bloating, constipation or acne after eating to much sugar/salt/lipids... you will know of that is your case.So the first month with Mirena was really painful. Uterine cramps at every end of the day and some spotting. From the first month I completely lost my period. I also completely lost my libido, which has never been so strong as I had always took hormones as birth control (previously on pills) For the past 2 years I had mild acne like 3-4 pimples every month. But with Mirena, my face was covered with it. Mostly around my mouth and on my forehead (but then it spread to my cheeks) I lost all my self confidence. I removed mirena after 6 months and my doctor gave me minocycline 500mg 2x a day + topical/acid cream. I am now on IUD Mona Lisa (copper IUD) and I didn't have a single cramp after its insertion + my libido has never been this strong ​​it's 100% natural, no hormones, and cost pennies comparatevly to Mirena!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):27 years old and never had children. I was deciding between the kyleena and mirena and decided to go with the mirena based on my providers recommendation. I’ve tried all different types of birth control pills and all have given me bad side effects (weight gain, depression, low libido, acne, etc.). I was so nervous about my upcoming IUD insertion and after reading so many HORROR stories, including here on this site. However, so far, I have had the BEST experience! The pinching of the cervix during the insertion hurt a little but afterwards, I felt fine. Barely had cramps the rest of the day. And I have low pain tolerance too! So happy I got the IUD! Will update in a few months about my progression with it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):For the women asking how it feels, it was not the worst pain I have ever experienced but it wasn't pain-free either.What I personally felt was a combination of what you feel during a pap smear and deep/moderate menstrual cramps for no longer than 30-35 seconds. I do recall feeling a sensation similar to stinging but nothing I couldn't handle with breathing it out!REMEMBER, the key is to eat something light, drink some water & take 2-3 ibuprofen  an hour before the procedure. Afterwards, take medicine if needed, use a heating pad and relax in bed. You should be feeling alright in a day or so. A little pain for 5 years of no babies is good enough for me! Good luck <3

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Love the MIrena! Yes inserting it was like 3 seconds of hell if you’ve never had a child before and it caused a month-long monster period and 3 moths of excessive cramping, but almost 3 years down the road now, it’s easily one of the best decisions I ever made. I no longer fear pregnancy scares like my other young twenties friends and has saved me a small fortune on period products. I have super light periods only lasting a few days every 3-5 months which are very tolerable. I was unable to continue BC pills because even on the lowest dose I was experiencing eye-blinding migraines. (While driving, yikes!) so my doctor recommended and IUD and my parents insurance covered it too so it didn’t cost me a dime! Overall, very happy with my mirena

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got Kyleena inserted yesterday. As far as that process went, yes it is uncomfortable and painful, anything going through your cervix will hurt... but it lasts 30 seconds and it’s done. I’d still recommend getting it to my friends. Take medicine before hand, bring something to squeeze. I’ve had normal period cramps ever since (also started my period a couple hours before my insertion). So the pain since hasn’t been anything worse than my normal cramps. If you want to try a different birth control like an IUD, don’t let just the pain scare you away cause it’s done and over with before you know it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had my Kyleena inserted about 3 1/2 weeks ago, insertions was most definitely the worst pain I have ever felt. They had problems inserting the IUD because I have a small cervix. I have had light spotting since insertion and I have cramps quite a bit, so cramps aren’t too horrible and other ones put me in a lot of pain. Other than the cramping and the spotting I love the Kyleena and would definitely recommend it to someone.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Painful insertion but over quickly.  My first period since started Nov 30th it’s now Dec 20 and I'm still bleeding, the color changed and is goes from light to moderate. I’m pretty sure I now have BV

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Okay so I am one of the lucky few who had to get my IUD removed after 1 month. The IUD was apparently coming out. I'm 19 and had never had sex. I wanted an IUD because my cramps on my period were so horendous. The first time I got the IUD placed the pain was pretty bad. I recommend taking an ibrophen before hand, maybe two.Then one or two after. Have someone hold your hand during, and drink plenty of water before hand and eat something. My friend said she could only get her IUD on her period, and I've read on websites there is a cervix softner. The second time I got my IUD it was less painful. It hurt worse getting the IUD out then getting it in both times. But the second time I was sweating and dizzy and felt like I was going to throw up.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Let me just start by saying I do not recommend IUDs for anyone with a low pain tolerance or who has not given birth. I went to an OBGYN to get a IUD because I do not plan on having children anytime soon. I have not had a child so I knew there were only about 2 or 3 options for me. The doctor explained to me that I would experience some pain consistent with period cramps, so I thought okay no big deal, piece of cake. this pain was like no other I have ever experienced. My procedure took 15+ mins and I was in horrible pain the entire time. It's been about 10 hours since my insertion, and I'm experiencing a lot of pain and heavy bleeding. I only read the handout the Dr gave me, but reading these reviews are more realistic to what you experience

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Every time I see a positive reveiw... I swear it just breaks my heart a little more, and nearly makes me sick. So I'm the unlucky two percent. And now skyla not only made me sick, but also the very thing growing inside me. They say its not a baby yet when its that young. Well, when they remove it from inside you... You still see what should of been your baby. Skyla failed me. Skyla and I failed the kid that should of been. I failed, for being stupid enough to rely on this. I beg you to save yourself from a lifetime of regret and guilt, and just stick to the pill. Its a damn shame you can vote lower than one.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):ONE MONTH UPDATE: I spotted for 3 weeks straight ranging in heaviness. The worst part for me has been the severe cramps (they are more like sharp pains if you ask me). These have come and gone but generally we’re worse at night. I’m hoping those go away altogether. They now come further and further apart. Overall, I’d still recommend this. On the days where there is no cramping/bleeding, this is great!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I have 2 kids almost 5 years apart I had the mirena after the first baby and had the mirena after 2nd. My mirena dies so I went to my local health department and had the liletta put it OMG it took FOREVER for them to place it one went wrong had to throw it away so they opened a second got it placed in about an hour. I have had it since October 2016 and I had no problems no period until about 6months ago it has caused major cramps, I now have insomnia, and just feel horrible... I never had any pain with my mirena. I go Friday to get on a different bc to get this removed ASAP. I’m tired of these horrible cramps without a period... I have no period and still have major cramps... Pros: I’m not pregnant (so it did it’s job); no period...

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I got Liletta 9 months ago now and feel compelled to leave a positive review. My periods and all associated symptoms stopped immediately. I was taking birth control pills with estrogen before and had mad depression that actually ended when I got Liletta. Who knew!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had Kyleena inserted about 3 hours ago. I know that I have small cervix and uterus and was expecting some pain. I agree that it was not ideal, however, the intense pain only lasts a few seconds. It seemed my doctor had to try a few times to get it placed because I was flinching. Now, I’ve just had some bad cramps but the terrible pain only occurred during insertion. I am not on my period so I took the cervix softener last night. That pill didn’t make me feel bad at all.  Also, my doctor immediately ordered an ultrasound to make sure it was placed properly. As long as the cramping stays at its current level I am experiencing now for a few days, it will all be fine. I will update my post if I have a bad experience.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted a few days before my period. Pain during procedure was mostly very uncomfortable than painful, just a really sharp pinch and pretty bad cramping when it is actually inserted.  I would rate it a 6/10 for pain. The cramping after was the worst part for me.  I got my period 3 days after insertion, so I’m still bleeding but fairly light. Just wondering how long did everybody else’s spotting or bleeding last for? Also don’t let these reviews put you off - getting it in really isn’t that bad. I would definitely recommend eating something light before you go, and bringing something to squeeze with your hand like a squishy ball or something.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had a history of very heavy periods and a coworker suggested an IUD as birth control because it helped her periods (she didn't have one at all!). Insertion was very painful for a short period of time. I delivered 2 babies without pain medication and I'd say it was equivalent to a very strong contraction for about 1 minute.  After insertion, I had irregular spotting for a month or so. I was hoping for a lighter period since mine was making me anemic. My period stayed the same!! The IUD strings poked my husband during sex too. They trimmed them, but it still happens. In one year, I've gained 15 lbs, have worse anxiety and depression and my skin is terrible. I'm getting it out soon and getting a uterine ablation and my tubes tied .

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):UPDATE: probably my 3rd one..But anyways, I’ve had kyleena since early October. The first day was pretty bad, I got dizzy and I had cramps but was fine the next day. Up until mid-late November, I bled everyday. The first couple of days, I bled terribly. After that, I’d bleed every now and then. Some days, I’d see no blood, wouldn’t wear a pad, and BOOM. It eventually stopped and one day recently, I bled for one minute and it was gone, but it actually hurt that time. Overall, it has been good. I use double protection (condoms, kyleena) just in case. Sex after kyleena was rough. I was so sore for a while and had PTSD about sticking anything near that area. Ok great now. It’s been over two months but it has seemed like it’s been forever.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I am calling my OB/GYN on MONDAY!!!!! I had my IUD inserted May 2017. Insertion was fine - uncomfortable, but not painful. I was on my last few days of my period and I had no cramping after the procedure and my period basically stopped immediately. I was super excited as I have always had HEAVY periods. Once my first period started after having the IUD, it just wont stop! Basically I'm on my period 3 out of 4 weeks I'll have a break for a day or 2 and then it starts right back up. I have called my doctor so many times, I'm pretty sure they are tired of me. They have tried to put me on additional birth control pills several times on top of the IUD to try to regulate it, but it doesn't. My only solution seem to be to REMOVE IT! I'm so over it!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):This review is mainly on the insertion. I actually got skyla put in a few days ago. I knew it was going to hurt a little bit but I have a high pain tolerance so I figured I would be okay. This has to be one of the most painful things I have ever experienced. I have not had a child so mind you my cervix was very very tight. The process of measuring and getting an IUD in you should only take 3 or 4 minutes but this took well close to 10 minutes and incredibly painful. I had work right after (how wise of me to get this done before work) and I work as a server so a lot of bending and hustling around is required. Every time iIbent my torso I had a really bad pain. Muscle relaxers and ibuprofen do help quite a bit.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Insertion for me was awful. I have a very high pain tolerance, but this was by far the worst. There was quite a bit of difficulty with the insertion (I am 36, no children), another doctor had to be called in and an ultrasound done in order to get it in. Bleeding after was heavy and lasted about 3 weeks. I have had moderately heavy, long lasting periods ever since. My biggest complaint is that my skin and hair are super oily now. I can wash my face and 10 min later it is just as oily as before. I used to be able to wash my hair every 3 days, but it needs it daily now and I just cannot do that. I have also started to break out badly on my chest and the back of my neck. May have it removed if things don't improve soon.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla placed in June of 2016, the insertion was not a problem. I was told getting it placed while your on your period it would not be painful. I went back to my normal routine when I left the office. I have no weird reactions or crazy long periods. Everything was normal for me until thanksgiving of 2017. I had just had a period two weeks before, but the day of thanksgiving I had heavy bleeding for about two hours, then it was gone. No cramping. No other symptoms. I googled it, so I took a pregnancy test just to rule it out. To my surprise it was positive. My OBGYN pulled my IUD out a few days later and it had not moved, it was in place and I was 5 weeks pregnant. We went from 0% of a full pregnancy to now 95% of full pregnancy.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Very disappointed in my experience. I chose kyleena after much research and for the lesser effects it has on depression. Insertion was uncomfortable but nothing horrendous. My problem was the spotting. I understand this is a normal side effect for many but tell me what the point of birth control is, if you can't have sex because you're continuously spotting?! I even had a blow-out experience during sex where a huge amount of bright red blood exploded all over my husband. I insisted on having it removed at my one month check. I am not one to wait 3 to 6 months, possibly forever, for the bleeding to stop. 2.5 weeks after it was removed and I'm still spotting off and on! I'm horrified at the lasting bleeding. Waiting for my doc to call me back
Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had terrible cyst after having this IUD the cyst would rupture which is extremely painful I had it removed today and replace with a different one. Don't get this IUD !!

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got an IUD in because I didn't want to have to worry about my birth control anymore. The first few months (3-6) weren't great and I had light bleeding on and off. My acne did get a little worse and has stayed like that until getting it treated.  So I did have side effects but I would still 100% do it all over again and will once my 5 years are up. Now, I will either not have a period or it will be very light for just a few days. Getting it in was uncomfortable but after that you don't notice it at all. When I was on the pill, I was still so worried about getting pregnant that we still used condoms. I can finally have sex without constantly worrying since it is one of the most effective forms of birth control.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just had this inserted today. Reading other reviews will NOT help you predict your procedure experience. Everyone’s body is unique. For me, I would rate the camping pain a 9/10 upon insertion. An hour after the procedure I feel like a 3/10 normal cramp pain. Here’s are the tips I gave my friend for her insertion:  1) if you’re given a cervix softener take an NSAID with it (the softener can cause cramps and kept me up all night) 2) take more that 400mg ibuprofen (this was what was recommended but I could of used 600mg)3) eat something bland before you go (I didn’t eat lunch and I got the shakes. Definitely have something bland in your stomach)4) have someone hold your hand or bring a stuffed animal to squeeze

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had Kyleena inserted 21/11/17, 3 weeks ago. On the day of the insertion no analgesia, and no lidocaine or cervical dilator was used therefore insertion was painful. I felt a mild cramp then a 2 sharp stabbing pains in my cervix. The pain lasted all of 30secs so it is manageable. After I did feel lightheaded, nauseous and became sweaty all of which passed in about 10 mins. For the next 2 days I had moderate cramps. Since insertion I have had occasional mild-moderate cramps few and far between. My only complaint right now is I have bleed every day since insertion more so then just spotting. More similar to a light period. hopefully over the next 2 months things settle down.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I've been using this birth control for over 10 years and I love it!  I've had zero issues and zero blood since I've been using the Mirena.  I will admit it's not fun getting it inserted if you haven't had a baby come through your cervix but it is definitely worth it!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I had the liletta inserted a year after giving birth my second child. I was terrified to get it, but I hate birth control pill which alway have me so many side effects.  I would research online about IUDs and all I read was horrible painful experiences. I asked some people as well some had good experience others had to remove after a year or so with other IUDs. I finally decided for the sake of not having anymore children to have it inserted.  I read it was so painful some women would pass out usually those were girls that have never gave birth . When I had it inserted it didn't not hurt at all! I Bleed on and off for two months I felt a bit weak but my body accepted it and now I forget I even have it! It's amazing.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):This review is merely on the insertion that I just had today.  I took 800 mg of ibuprofen beforehand and am on the heaviest most painful day of my period. I have no children and my doctor told me my cervix was very tight so it hurt A LOT. The measuring and opening of the cervix was the most painful and uncomfortable thing for me. When she actually inserted the IUD I immediately felt cramps but they weren’t unbearable. You just have to remember to take deep breaths so you don’t pass out and try to relax. If it’s painful for you please rest for at least 20 minutes before sitting up and going about your day.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the kyleena inserted in September 2017 and my Mirena removed the same day. I had a terribly painful experience with the Mirena insertion and Kyleena was no different despite being smaller. I took ibuprofen before and had it inserted during my period. My MD didn’t give me the cervix softer this time bc he says it can actually make cramping worse. Cramping was bad the first day, I felt the need to buy a heating pad. So far I have been having two spotty periods a month with bad cramping but it is getting better, using the heating pad less. The cramping I can honestly deal with the worst part is the acne that I have developed! I’ve never had acne, now it is constant and I have scarring, seeing derm. Hopefully I won’t need to remove it.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got kyleena on 6/16/17. My doctor recommended that I switch from the pill. The insertion wasn't as bad as everyone said but it wasn't pleasant. My doctor gave me a shot of lidocaine in my cervix so I hardly felt anything just 2 cramps the whole time. I bled for about a month after. Minor break outs that I didn't experience before and mild cramping for a week or so after. I lost weight on this and had minimal side effects in the beginning. Then I got BV and YI symptoms for months, but after many tests I got all negative results for everything under the sun. It started to bother me and I would become swollen after sex. Doctor said to take it out so I did today 6 months later. I really wish it worked for me!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got Kyleena put in September (2017), so I've had it for  3 months now. The procedure was simple and quick. I was on the last few days of my period when I saw the OBGYN. The appointment started off just like a annual one. She told me all about it and asked if I had questions. I did a lot of research before, so I felt good and knowledgeable. My OBGYN is fantastic. She explained everything as she did it and told me when I would feel the pinch/pain from the placement. I would describe it as a 6, but it was quick pain. I had a little spotting after and some cramping. I did half a day at work, so I relaxed with a heated blanket, napped and was fine by the next day. Side effects: acne first month (gone now) and some spotting (third month).

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got my Kyleena IUD inserted about 4 months ago. I heard very mixed experiences on whether or not insertion hurt - and for me it was extremely painful. I had pretty bad cramping and had to avoid exercise for about 3-4 days after insertion, which wasn't too bad. For the past 2 months I have been experiencing the worst cramps EVER that come at very random times. I have never given birth before, but I often think that these cramps must be what contractions feel like. I've had ultrasounds and I have been told that the IUD has not shifted or anything, so the cause of the cramps is unknown. I'm hoping they go away because I don't know how long I can take it!!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I was terrified after reading numerous reviews and horror stories about insertion, I almost cancelled my appointment. I am so glad I went through with it!! The insertion was no doubt one of the most painful experiences I've ever gone through but I have a very small uterus and cervix so that is to be expected. I got mine put in on the 3rd day of my period so my muscles were looser. After I was expecting major pain but minus being sore and cramping (nothing more than period cramps) I felt great. I have bleed everyday since insertion (about a week) but the bleeding has been so light I don't need anything more than a liner. Everyone is different but you won't know how it works for you unless try it. I'll update if anything changes. <3

Skyla (levonorgestrel):Insertion was painful, damn, I will never forget it lol.  For the next 3-4 months, each time I had my period, my cramps were extremely painful. I also gained 15lbs in the first 3 months. Months 5-8 have been better, less painful cramps & my periods were getting lighter. This is my 9th month being on Skyla. I love it, it's very effective as a birth control. The bf has finished in me multiple times & I'm still baby free. However I'm hating the weight gain. I started working out, watched what I ate, & still gained another 5lbs. I am planning on getting it removed due to the weight gain or else I would keep it for the full 3 years. In 9 months, I've gained 20lbs.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Since June 2017! I was scared after reading these painful insertion stories, but the actual insertion didn't end up hurting. Took two Motrin 40 min before and it was just a slight pressure for ~2 min. I had some spotting that day and mild cramping, but felt fine. I started spotting about a week after insertion; for a few months I spotted for a week every other week. By September, I was back to regular light periods. I've had no side effects besides feeling slightly emotional around my period. My biggest comment is to remember that everyone will have a different insertion experience depending on pain tolerance, OBGYN, and your individual body. Talk to an OBGYN you trust and follow up if you're having excess pain or side effects. :)

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I've had the Kyleena for 4 days! Insertion was not terrible just uncomfortable do not let these post scare you. I also had my IUD inserted while on my period. Maybe you should schedule insertion appointment around your menstrual cycle if it comes on time each month.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Got Liletta IUD inserted about 9 months after having my 1st child it has been 2 years that I've had the IUD. When getting it inserted it only felt like a strong period cramp for less then a minute. My doctor made me wait 10 minutes to sit up. I was in the room for less than 25 minutes! Love my OB and only had a few minor issues with ovarian cysts for about 2 months.  Ovarian cysts went away and all is well haven't had any since. My annual came back fine and I have 2-3 days of very very very light bleeding each month. The discharge is weird but it's normal. This IUD was perfect for me. My first form of birth control depo shot this IUD it much better and low maintenance. My husband says he can sometimes feel the string.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I’m 27, no kids and had kyleena inserted in early July (5 months ago) on the second day of my period. Insertion wasn’t as bad as I expected, it was uncomfortable but only lasted a few minutes. Since then I’ve been spotting about 90% of all days and it’s hard to predict. It’s usually very light spotting that a thin liner or light tampon can handle, but it’s definitely put a damper on my sex life. I know that it can take 6 months for your body to adjust, but the spotting hasn’t improved at all since kyleena was inserted. I plan to give it another month or two in hopes that it will get better.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I just got the Kyleena inserted today and it wasn’t bad at all! Yes it did hurt only during the actual insertion but it really felt like a pinch. I was, however, given Cytotec to take both nights before and took ibuprofen an hour before my procedure. I definitely recommend taking those if you’re getting the IUD. I was able to drive myself home and the pain after is just some cramping similar to period cramps. Don’t believe the horror stories this is totally worth it thus far.

Liletta (levonorgestrel):I’ve had for about 3 months now and love it. Insertion was pretty painful and the worst of the cramps lasted about 6 hours afterwards, so I would probably get it on a day you can lay at home with a heating pad. The next day I barely had cramping and was back to normal. I lightly bled (I would notice about every 3 days) for about a month, then it stopped, then two weeks later it came back, and that lasted about 2 weeks. I haven’t had any bleeding since. I still get my normal period symptoms without the blood. Overall, super worth it.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):I got the Mirena 3 days ago and am very pleased with it.  Previously I had Paragard Copper IUD and it was so horrendously irritating with uncomfortable acidic brown copper smelling discharge for the three months I had it in, and brought on severe panic attacks, anxiety, depression, and mood swings. I had my boyfriend take it out for me  because it was so horrible I couldn't wait for the dr office to open Monday. My emotional symptoms were gone almost immediately and the stinging acidic copper odor brown discharge went away within a few days. Awful experience having gross copper coils rust away in you're uterus. I just got Mirena & no pain during procedure, no cramping after, barely a brown tinge in clear mucous after...heavenly!!

Liletta (levonorgestrel):Well this is my second review I have downgraded my experience due to the 5cm cyst that is giving me pain oh and I lost my job due to the pain and being put on weight restrictions

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I just had my Skyla IUD placed today, and I found the insertion to not be as painful as I’ve read. I have pretty moderate menstral cramps, so I found the insertion to be a mild version of what I’m used to. I took 800mg of Ibuprofen about an hour before my procedure, which I’m assuming helped. My doctor walked me through the whole procedure, the insertion process lasting less than a minute. After my procedure, I had off and on cramps throughout the day, but nothing too unbearable. Just wanted to add my 2 cents for women who read too much before their procedure!

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I got the Skyla IUD put in on November 7th, 2017. The pain of getting it in was a 9/10. I have had on and off cramping and bad back pain since then. In just a month, I have experience weight gain, acne, facial hair growth, severely oily skin, severe anxiety, vertigo, nausea, depressed mood, irritability, and more. It has been a month and I was in the hospital last night with extreme pain in my abdomen and pelvic region, nausea, and dizziness. I have never experience pain worse than this. Although it is nice not having to worry about pregnancy, I am having it removed next week.

Mirena (levonorgestrel):Okay this is strictly based on my IUD experiences till date.I'm an almost 28 year old, quite active with normal pain threshold female. Exactly 16 days ago, I went to my gyno's for an IUD and ended up getting the paragard inserted because It was my first ever birth control, and I really did not want hormones because of an incident I had with plan B the one and only time I took it. I went during my lunch break, and honestly, didn't feel much pain just little cramping during the insertion BUT my doctor used numbing medicine so I guess that helped. Fast forward 14 days later still bleeding, I had paragard removed during my period to be replaced by mirena, and insertion was more painful than with the numbing medicine. So ask to be numbed!!
username: Just looking to stop my period

review: Mirena (levonorgestrel):35 yo w/1 child. Mirena was inserted 2.5 y ago. Procedure was not a big deal, cramping & bleeding wasn't an issue. No regular periods but do have spotting here and there. Nice to not have periods, seems to be effective as birth control. Issues: My always clear skin (I've never had acne) is oily and dry at same time & breaking out non stop. Face, hair line, neck, back. They leave scars. I've always been optimistic, easygoing, up to anything and happy and now I am extremely depressed, unhappy & moody. Sad commercials make me cry. I don't want to do anything, go anywhere, no matter how I motivate myself. Constant tiredness. Weight gain in belly, looks like a pouch. Pain in joints. Only recently put 2+2 together to figure out it started after Mirena. Removing!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the Kyleena inserted on 11-19, The worst part was insertion, it is an uncomfortable feeling but is over in under 5 minutes. I had some cramping the rest of the day, a heating pad and alternating Advil and Tylenol worked wonders. I would get random cramps throughout the week, but nothing like the first day. I had my period when it was inserted and spotted for a few days more than normal. Sex Drive has seemed to increase compared to being on TRI ORTHO LO since I was 15, I am now 25 (no kids). No getting pumped full of hormones or remembering a pill. I tortured myself with hours of internet research DON'T DO THAT. I will write another review after my month checkup in a couple weeks!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Got this inserted today. First I want to say don't be scared of what you read on here. Myself I like to know about everything with this IUD. Pain felt nothing like period cramps worse but durable. Took corplex before getting the IUD inserted which helped a lot got cramping and bleeding because of that pill. Will update after a month or so but so far 10/10 haven't had any cramps either so far some bleeding but nothing I can't handle.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I had the Kyleena inserted on August 1st this year. I'm 28, no children so my doctor suggested Kylenna since its smaller then other IUD's.  I was previously on the pill for 10 years, with my periods being extremely light and only lasting for 3 or 4 days and no cramps.  I took Motrin before the insertion. The insertion definitely wasn't the most pleasant experience I've been thru, but it was quick. The cramping started right after and lasted for about a week the worst being  on the first and second days.  I finished my oral birth control for the month as my doctor told me too.  My first period was normal and my second was light, lasting a week.  I haven't had a period since, no cramping, no spotting and no problems during sex. Happy so far!

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I got the kyleena IUD at the end of June 2017. The procedure was pretty unbearable and I had very bad cramping for about 6 hours after. I bled lightly-moderately for about a month straight afterwards until my next period came (I could tell because I was VERY crampy and had very heavy bleeding). I currently get my period every month and it lasts about 15 days each time. I get waves of very bad cramps the week before and throughout the period. I then go maybe a week or two if I'm lucky without bleeding. I wanted to give it a chance, but it's now been almost 6 months and my body is clearly not adjusted. I plan to get it removed within the next month or two.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):There are some bad reviews about Kyleena - so I wanted to share my experience. This IUD is for women that have not yet had children as the IUD is smaller than the Mirena. I expected pressure during the insertion process but I felt pain. On a scale from 1 to 10 it was a strong 6. I may have a high pain tolerance because my doctor laughed & said when she got hers she started cursing at the ceiling. Right after I felt fine & the nurse looked at me funnily. A couple of hours later I knew why. She expected me to have some severe cramping immediately after - but it took my uterus an hour to deliver those. They lasted through the night. It’s been almost a week and everything is okay! Using condoms until my OB is sure the IUD is in the right place.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):The  insertion process hurt so bad. I’ve never had a kid but when they clinch my uterus I think it feel something like that. That first day I had cramping, which you have to expect because it’s a foreign object in your body. The first month with a period hurt the cramps were a little more intense.  But as birth control goes this birth-control hasn’t failed me. No change in weight or acne and my boyfriend has finished inside of me and I’m not pregnant this birth-control is great I recommend it to everybody. With my insurance I only paid 20% which for me was $200 and something

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Had Kyleena in for 4 months and I am getting it taken out in 2 days. I have constant cramps and my bleeding is random, long, and heavy. I will get sharp pain to the point where I can't move or stand up. I can't have sex because it hurts so bad. My boyfriend says that he can feel the strings. Insertion hurt but that was expected and it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The first month and a half was great but now it is just getting worse instead of better. I really wanted this to work because I hate taking the pill and I am sensitive to estrogen but I have to say I like the pill better.

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):I am SO happy I went through with getting Kyleena even after reading all of the "horror stories" of the insertion process. Boy did those reviews get me worked up!  Literally, my doctor asked me what classes I was taking and BOOM it was done. I didn't even know she inserted it! All I felt was pressure, not pain. However, before the IUD, I was the girl who never experienced cramping at all. The ONLY down fall I have experienced after having an IUD for 6+ months is the cramping. It's very intense and painful, nothing I ever had gone through before. I always know when my period is coming because I have a day of serious cramping before it starts. I still have a period for now, but I don't regret it one bit. Better than taking a pill every day!
Kyleena (levonorgestrel):This is horrible ! Bleeding non stop . Cramps non stop

Kyleena (levonorgestrel):Everybody is different... I’ve had mine over a week now. I was previously on depo for four years. I was given a cervix softner for night before and morning of and ibuprofen an hour before. Insertion was super quick and not awful but the second she was done I was in intense pain( and I have a high pain tolerance). Rolled around thinking I would die for 45 minutes until a friend could pick me up. After the first hour pain lessened but still horrible cramps, couldn’t leave the heating pad for even a second. This pain had continued on and off. No bleeding at all yet. I developed aseptic meningitis and was hospitalized 4 days after insertion (don’t know if it’s related but seems suspicious). Still cramping so bad can’t see straight.

Skyla (levonorgestrel):I had Skyla inserted 9/18/15. Never have I ever been pregnant.  I was 26 at the time of insertion. Insertion was VERY painful.  While the insertion was painful it lasted only 2-3 mins. I had slight pain for 3 days with MAJOR bloating.  I spotted every day for 8 months. It was enough I had to wear a panty liner. Eventually spotting stopped. My periods are irregular, when I did get one I would bleed for 15-20 days. It was always dark, thick tissue that I bled.
